Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Senior Data Analyst - Amsterdam | 40 hours




Urban Gym Group is an industry pioneer within the European wellness and fitness community, with over 40 clubs and studios in major cities across the Netherlands and The United Kingdom. You might know us from brands such as Trainmore, ClubSportive, Renessence, BTY CLB, TRIB3, PILAT3S and Gymbox. Our ambitious domestic and international growth plans require an expansion of our Business Intelligence team.




We are looking for a highly motivated and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our team. In this role, you will play a key part in driving our data-driven decision-making, making a significant impact on our continued success. Working closely with our Finance, Marketing, and Analytics teams, you will extract valuable insights from our data, helping us optimise operations, enhance member experiences, and support our ambitious growth plans.




Key responsibilities:

Conduct market research and analyses to identify new club locations.
Develop business cases for club expansion, including new builds, mergers, and acquisitions.
Build ETL processes to structure data from various sources for business use.
Create data views, tables, and reports supporting daily operations and strategic goals.
Design dashboards that enable informed, data-driven decisions.
Analyze growth to identify high-performing areas and new opportunities.
Query databases for insights on key metrics like revenue and member retention.
Use data to boost member retention, inform marketing strategies, and support revenue growth.




You:

3 to 5 years of experience in a data-focused role (e.g., Data Analyst, Data Engineer, or BI Specialist).
Proven expertise in data pipeline creation, data visualization, and analytics.
Advanced proficiency in SQL with a strong understanding of Azure SQL.
Hands-on experience building ETL pipelines, ideally using Python or Azure Synapse Analytics.
Proficient in Power BI, with a track record of designing impactful dashboards and reports.
Strong attention to detail and problem-solving abilities.
Industry experience in fitness/wellness or retail is preferred, with insights into customer retention, revenue optimization, and business expansion.
Experience in consulting or retail is an asset, especially in roles focused on addressing business challenges.
Able to communicate complex data insights in a clear, actionable format for non-technical audiences.




We offer:

A competitive salary plus 8% holiday pay
Hybrid way of working
26 holidays per year (based on full-time employment) and the option to exchange public holidays
Unlimited access to all our high-end fitness locations for you and a +1
Unlimited access to well-being services for you and your family via OpenUp
An inspiring head office, a short 10-minute walk from Amsterdam Central Station
A diverse and energetic team of 500 colleagues pushing boundaries and supporting one another

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you passionate about leveraging to drive meaningful insights and business decisions? Do you want to contribute to a company that helps individuals achieve their professional goals? If so, this role could be the perfect fit for you!




Your Role as a

As a , you will play a key role in shaping -driven strategies by analyzing complex sets and delivering actionable insights. Your work will directly impact product development, marketing strategies, and overall business performance. Additionally, you will help optimize internal processes and enhance platform efficiency through -driven solutions.




Key Responsibilities

base Optimization: Design and maintain scalable base structures for analytics and insights.
ETL Processes: Develop and manage ETL pipelines to integrate and transform from multiple sources.
Visualization: Create interactive dashboards and reports using tools like Studio to support business decision-making.
User Behavior Analysis: Analyze user engagement, cohort behaviors, and platform performance to improve the user experience.
Payment Analysis: Work with payment gateway (e.g., Stripe, PayPal) to monitor subscription trends and revenue performance.
Collaboration: Partner with cross-functional teams, including development, marketing, finance, and product, to meet needs.
Compliance: Ensure handling aligns with GDPR and other relevant regulations.




Who You Are

You are an analytical thinker with a keen eye for detail, capable of translating raw into meaningful insights. You enjoy working collaboratively but can also drive independent projects to completion. Adaptable and curious, you’re always eager to enhance your skills and contribute to a -driven culture.




Your Skills and Qualifications

Technical Skills:

Strong proficiency in and .
Experience with Studio, BigQuery, and other visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Hands-on experience with ETL tools like Apache Airflow, dbt, or Fivetran.
Familiarity with analytics platforms such as Google Analytics, Mixpanel, or Amplitude.
Experience in a SaaS environment




Education & Experience:

Bachelor's degree in Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
3–5 years of experience in analysis, preferably within a SaaS or tech-driven environment.

Bonus Skills:

Experience with machine learning, predictive analytics, or API integrations.
Understanding of career platforms and job seeker behavior analytics.




What’s Offered

A competitive salary based on experience.
25 annual leave days, including your birthday off.
A modern office space with on-site amenities such as a gym, game room, and social areas.
Comprehensive benefits, including meal provisions and transportation support.
A wellness budget to support gym memberships or personal hobbies.
Regular team activities, outings, and networking events.
Opportunities for professional development, including certifications in tools like Studio and BigQuery.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Stokke – Here We Grow:

With over eight decades of history, Stokke was founded on Norway’s west coast in 1932. Deeply rooted in Scandinavian heritage, our brand is built on principles of quality, craftsmanship, and family connection. For more than 40 years, Stokke has delivered iconic and innovative solutions for children—products that are not only beautifully designed but made to nurture family bonding and support child development.

With global offices in Norway, The Netherlands, the U.S., Germany, France, and Asia, Stokke offers a truly international work environment, committed to shaping a better world through confident kids.







Take Responsibility – The Position:

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our Global E-Commerce team. This role is key to unlocking the power of data across our e-commerce operations. You will analyze and interpret data from multiple sources, design and maintain interactive dashboards using Power BI, and generate insights that support data-driven decision-making

.You will also play a central role in data governance and drive the continuous improvement of data usage and visualization across teams. With a digital-first focus, you will help track and analyze website user behavior, contributing to optimizations that enhance the online customer experience and drive growth.




Key Responsibilities:

Data Analysis & Visualization

Analyze large datasets from various digital and business sources to derive strategic and operational insights
Design, develop, and maintain Power BI dashboards for internal stakeholders
Create reporting frameworks and data models that support business decision-making




Digital Analytics & Web Tracking

Collaborate with eCommerce and digital marketing teams to track and interpret website and user behavior
Provide recommendations for website optimization based on behavioral and performance data
Support tagging and tracking implementation across digital platforms




Data Governance & Quality Assurance

Support the implementation and enforcement of data governance standards
Conduct data quality checks to ensure the accuracy and reliability of insights
Troubleshoot data issues in collaboration with IT and development teams




Cross-Functional Collaboration

Partner with global and regional teams in eCommerce, Marketing, and IT to support data needs
Present findings in a clear, concise manner to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Help build a data-driven culture through education and knowledge sharing




Better Together: The Ideal Profile:

Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Data Science, Business Analytics, Economics, Business Administration, Mathematics, IT, or a related field
3–4 years of relevant experience, preferably in the eCommerce industry
Proficiency in Power BI and the ability to create engaging, insight-driven dashboards
Strong understanding of statistical analysis, business modeling, and economics
Excellent communication skills in English (written and spoken)
Experience working in interdisciplinary and international teams is an advantage
Analytical mindset with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights
Strong sense of ownership and autonomy in problem-solving
A passion for continuous improvement and cross-functional collaboration
Ability to manage multiple data sources and ensure consistency and accuracy in reporting




Keep Growing – What We Offer:

A chance to work with a globally recognized premium brand with a strong mission and purpose
A dynamic, hybrid international work environment located in Amsterdam
Exposure to cutting-edge digital analytics platforms and tools
The opportunity to help shape the future of Stokke’s eCommerce and digital performance strategy
A collaborative culture that supports continuous learning, development, and innovation

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Do you want to contribute to a more inclusive society through meaningful technology? Are you excited to use data to accelerate social impact? Will you help ensure that Welcome app becomes a smarter, more insight-driven organisation? Keep reading!




What is Welcome app?

Imagine trying to build a new life in a foreign country – from scratch. Where do you start? Information isn't easily accessible, you don’t yet speak the language, and you don’t know how to meet new people. Many newcomers in the Netherlands face this exact challenge.




Welcome app makes building a new life easier. We do this by making relevant information, activities, services and local organisations accessible in one place: the Welcome app. In doing so, we support municipalities in effectively carrying out their responsibilities, and offer civic organisations a platform to reach newcomers. Our technology fosters integration, participation, self-reliance, and equal access to opportunities.




We are growing, and to strengthen our data-driven way of working, we’re now looking for a Data Analyst.


Who are we looking for?

As a Data Analyst, you’ll support the team in collecting, managing, and analysing data from multiple sources – such as our platform, Power BI CRM (Hubspot), marketing channels and impact and SROI evaluations . You play a key role in structuring this data and translating it into actionable insights to support better decision-making across product, sales and marketing, and our efforts to scale our social impact.




You will work closely with our Go-to-Market Manager, product team, and CEO, and contribute to the development of dashboards, reports and analyses that help move the organisation forward. You’ll have plenty of space to learn, experiment and take ownership of your domain.




What will you be doing?
Mapping and managing available and needed data sources (product, CRM, market, users)
Creating, maintaining, and improving internal datasets and dashboards
Analysing user behaviour, retention, adoption and conversion on our platform
Supporting the design and delivery of impact measurement and reports for municipalities and other stakeholders
Contributing to A/B testing, KPI tracking and experiments within product and marketing
Supporting the team with ad hoc analyses and insight-driven decision-making
Helping to strengthen a data-informed working culture within Welcome app




What are we looking for?Required:
2+ years of experience in a role focused on data, analysis or research
Familiarity with tools like Power BI, Google Analytics, Tableau or other data visualisation tools
Affinity with social challenges, impact measurement or digital products
Accuracy, independence, and curiosity – you see patterns and ask questions
Strong analytical skills and the ability to explain complex information in simple terms
Good command of English, written and spoken, knowledge or command of Dutch is advantageous but not necessary




Preferred:
Familiarity with a range of tools for data analysis and visualisation in a tech or start-up environment
Experience with developing dashboards, impact reporting, or working with public/open data
Shared or lived experience with migration, integration or social inclusion is a plus




What do we offer?
Start date: preferably june 2024
A parttime or fulltime position
Salary between €2,500 – €2,900 gross per month (based on full-time, depending on experience)
Free lunch at our centrally located office in Amsterdam
Flexible, hybrid and remote working options
A multidisciplinary, mission-driven team within a growing start-up
Lots of room for growth, initiative and professional development




Ready to make a difference with data?

Send your CV and a short motivation to hr@welcomeapp.nl. Questions? Feel free to reach out – we’re happy to help you think this through!




We review applications on a rolling basis. Applications without a motivation letter will not be considered.

Show more

Title: Data & AI Governance Operations Analyst I
Description:
About Us: At Booking.com, data drives our decisions. Technology is at our core. And innovation is everywhere. But our company is more than datasets, lines of code or A/B tests. We’re the thrill of the first night in a new place. The excitement of the next morning. The friends you encounter. The journeys you take. The sights you see. And the memories you make. Through our products, partners and people, we make it easier for everyone to experience the world.

Leadership/Team Quote:

The Data & AI Governance department enables extending the governance theme of policies, standards, processes and technology for governing data and AI to driving excellence in our approach to leveraging secure, trusted, accessible data for data driven decision making through:


An overarching Data & AI Policy to include associated standards
Data & AI Governance including meta and master data management
Data & AI Delivery Governance
Data & AI Quality including both technical and business quality measures



This enables the maturity of Data and AI capabilities across Booking.com, unlocking innovation and business value through leveraging Data and AI.

Role Description: The Data & AI Governance Operations Analyst I is responsible for the governance and project management initiatives within the respective department. The Project Manager role will partner with the various teams within the Department to support, and proactively work with them, to facilitate the work occurring between them and the business units and centralized functions. They will help the teams to scope and plan the projects by helping to document the project goal, KPIs, roadmap and main deliverables.

Data & AI Governance Operations Analyst I will ensure that the projects of the respective department teams are managed in a consistent manner, whilst working with the business units & central functions within Booking.com to build engagement and where needed governance over decisions needed for work to be signed off. In some cases, the role requires dealing with external vendors and managing external stakeholders. The

Data & AI Governance Operations Analyst I will also help the different teams to mitigate the project risks and dependencies to make sure there is progress towards the project's milestones. First and foremost, the Data & AI Governance Operations Analyst I will ensure the team's roadmaps/plans focus on agreed business priorities, dependencies and strategies - designed based on data and business needs, and deliver against the shared objectives & goals.

Key Job Responsibilities and Duties:


Contribute to the definition, review, update and own roll-out of the Data & AI Governance framework and related standards and guidelines across the business units.
Collaborating with Risk and Compliance to understand Data Governance Risk position and appetite, to communicate, lead and measure mitigation activities and how Data & AI Governance can support the implementation and compliance for Data and AI across Booking.
Ensure alignment between Data & AI governance methodology, Data Privacy procedures and requirements, the IT Information Security strategy and any new regulatory compliance such as DMA/ DSA and EU AI Act by working closely with Legal teams.



Role Qualifications and Requirements:

Data and AI Governance:


Data Stewardship: Assist in defining Data Ownership and Stewardship structures, helping ensure clear accountability and supporting the onboarding process for data stewards.
Data & AI Governance Principles: Support the application and implementation of Data & AI Governance principles, processes, and standards to help maintain consistent governance practices.
Regulatory Compliance: Help ensure compliance with Data & AI regulatory policies, such as GDPR, DMA, SOx, and the EU AI Act, by staying informed about updates and assisting with incorporating them into governance practices.
Data & AI Governance Practices: Assist with tasks related to data cataloging, profiling, metadata management, data classification, data lineage, and workflows, helping ensure proper governance of key data elements.



Project Management:


Craft Methodology and Standards: Apply structured methodology to and lead project/change management activities.
E2E Project Management: Lead independently End-to-end (E2E) low/medium [Project/Workstream] and/or support high complexity [Project] from scoping to execution, analysis, recommendation and implementation.
Project Initiation and Planning: With limited supervision, drives the program scoping and planning working with different teams and creating associated documentation.
Project Implementation and Completion:Drive project plan execution, ensuring project objectives are met on agreed timelines, track and report progress and ensure a project closing and correct handover to Business as usual.
Project Governance: With limited supervision design and implement project governance and delivery structure to ensure efficient delivery, communication and decision making
Delivery/Impact:Drive the progress and successful delivery or initiatives that bring value to the business.
Stakeholder Management: Primary point of contact for Project(s) related queries. Ability to work and productively interact with different stakeholders up to Director level.
Success Metrics:Define and measure the success metrics of the Project(s) in scope.
Facilitator:Lead independent workshops to support the delivery of the Project(s)
Project Management Tooling: Knowledge of Atlassian Jira and Confluence.



Experience Requirements:


1+ years of experience around Data Governance, or, alternatively, 2+ years of experience in working with Data, coming from Data Analysis, Business Analysis, Analytical background
2-3 years or relevant project management experience



Benefits & Perks - Global Impact, Personal Relevance:

Booking.com’s Total Rewards Philosophy is not only about compensation but also about benefits. We offer a competitive compensation and benefits package, as well unique-to-Booking.com benefits which include:


Annual paid time off and generous paid leave scheme including: parent, grandparent, bereavement, and care leave
Hybrid working including flexible working arrangements, and up to 20 days per year working from abroad (home country)
Industry leading product discounts - up to 1400 per year - for yourself, including automatic Genius Level 3 status and Booking.com wallet credit
Living and working in Amsterdam, one of the most cosmopolitan cities in Europe
Contributing to a high scale, complex, world renowned product and seeing real-time impact of your work on millions of travelers worldwide
Working in a fast-paced and performance driven culture
Opportunity to utilize technical expertise, leadership capabilities and entrepreneurial spirit
Promote and drive impactful and innovative engineering solutions
Technical, behavioral and interpersonal competence advancement via on-the-job opportunities, experimental projects, hackathons, conferences and active community participation
Competitive compensation and benefits package and some great added perks of working in the home city of Booking.com



Diversity, Equity and Inclusion (DEI) at Booking.com:

Diversity, Equity & Inclusion have been a core part of our company culture since day one. This ongoing journey starts with our very own employees, who represent over 140 nationalities and a wide range of ethnic and social backgrounds, genders and sexual orientations.

Take it from our Chief People Officer, Paulo Pisano: “At Booking.com, the diversity of our people doesn’t just build an outstanding workplace, it also creates a better and more inclusive travel experience for everyone. Inclusion is at the heart of everything we do. It’s a place where you can make your mark and have a real impact in travel and tech.”

We ensure that colleagues with disabilities are provided the adjustments and tools they need to participate in the job application and interview process, to perform crucial job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment.

Application Process:

This section should provide:


Let’s go places together: How we Hire
This role does not come with relocation assistance.



Booking.com is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. We strive to move well beyond traditional equal opportunity and work to create an environment that allows

Pre-Employment Screening

If your application is successful, your personal data may be used for a pre-employment screening check by a third party as permitted by applicable law. Depending on the vacancy and applicable law, a pre-employment screening may include employment history, education and other information (such as media information) that may be necessary for determining your qualifications and suitability for the position.

This enables the maturity of Data and AI capabilities across Booking.com, unlocking innovation and business value through leveraging Data and AI.

Role Description: The Data & AI Governance Operations Analyst I is responsible for the governance and project management initiatives within the respective department. The Project Manager role will partner with the various teams within the Department to support, and proactively work with them, to facilitate the work occurring between them and the business units and centralized functions. They will help the teams to scope and plan the projects by helping to document the project goal, KPIs, roadmap and main deliverables.

Data & AI Governance Operations Analyst I will ensure that the projects of the respective department teams are managed in a consistent manner, whilst working with the business units & central functions within Booking.com to build engagement and where needed governance over decisions needed for work to be signed off. In some cases, the role requires dealing with external vendors and managing external stakeholders. The

Data & AI Governance Operations Analyst I will also help the different teams to mitigate the project risks and dependencies to make sure there is progress towards the project's milestones. First and foremost, the Data & AI Governance Operations Analyst I will ensure the team's roadmaps/plans focus on agreed business priorities, dependencies and strategies - designed based on data and business needs, and deliver against the shared objectives & goals.

Key Job Responsibilities and Duties:

  • Contribute to the definition, review, update and own roll-out of the Data & AI Governance framework and related standards and guidelines across the business units.
  • Collaborating with Risk and Compliance to understand Data Governance Risk position and appetite, to communicate, lead and measure mitigation activities and how Data & AI Governance can support the implementation and compliance for Data and AI across Booking.
  • Ensure alignment between Data & AI governance methodology, Data Privacy procedures and requirements, the IT Information Security strategy and any new regulatory compliance such as DMA/ DSA and EU AI Act by working closely with Legal teams.


Role Qualifications and Requirements:

Data and AI Governance:

  • Data Stewardship: Assist in defining Data Ownership and Stewardship structures, helping ensure clear accountability and supporting the onboarding process for data stewards.
  • Data & AI Governance Principles: Support the application and implementation of Data & AI Governance principles, processes, and standards to help maintain consistent governance practices.
  • Regulatory Compliance: Help ensure compliance with Data & AI regulatory policies, such as GDPR, DMA, SOx, and the EU AI Act, by staying informed about updates and assisting with incorporating them into governance practices.
  • Data & AI Governance Practices: Assist with tasks related to data cataloging, profiling, metadata management, data classification, data lineage, and workflows, helping ensure proper governance of key data elements.


Project Management:

  • Craft Methodology and Standards: Apply structured methodology to and lead project/change management activities.
  • E2E Project Management: Lead independently End-to-end (E2E) low/medium [Project/Workstream] and/or support high complexity [Project] from scoping to execution, analysis, recommendation and implementation.
  • Project Initiation and Planning: With limited supervision, drives the program scoping and planning working with different teams and creating associated documentation.
  • Project Implementation and Completion:Drive project plan execution, ensuring project objectives are met on agreed timelines, track and report progress and ensure a project closing and correct handover to Business as usual.
  • Project Governance: With limited supervision design and implement project governance and delivery structure to ensure efficient delivery, communication and decision making
  • Delivery/Impact:Drive the progress and successful delivery or initiatives that bring value to the business.
  • Stakeholder Management: Primary point of contact for Project(s) related queries. Ability to work and productively interact with different stakeholders up to Director level.
  • Success Metrics:Define and measure the success metrics of the Project(s) in scope.
  • Facilitator:Lead independent workshops to support the delivery of the Project(s)
  • Project Management Tooling: Knowledge of Atlassian Jira and Confluence.


Experience Requirements:

  • 1+ years of experience around Data Governance, or, alternatively, 2+ years of experience in working with Data, coming from Data Analysis, Business Analysis, Analytical background
  • 2-3 years or relevant project management experience


Benefits & Perks - Global Impact, Personal Relevance:

Booking.com’s Total Rewards Philosophy is not only about compensation but also about benefits. We offer a competitive compensation and benefits package, as well unique-to-Booking.com benefits which include:

  • Annual paid time off and generous paid leave scheme including: parent, grandparent, bereavement, and care leave
  • Hybrid working including flexible working arrangements, and up to 20 days per year working from abroad (home country)
  • Industry leading product discounts - up to 1400 per year - for yourself, including automatic Genius Level 3 status and Booking.com wallet credit
  • Living and working in Amsterdam, one of the most cosmopolitan cities in Europe
  • Contributing to a high scale, complex, world renowned product and seeing real-time impact of your work on millions of travelers worldwide
  • Working in a fast-paced and performance driven culture
  • Opportunity to utilize technical expertise, leadership capabilities and entrepreneurial spirit
  • Promote and drive impactful and innovative engineering solutions
  • Technical, behavioral and interpersonal competence advancement via on-the-job opportunities, experimental projects, hackathons, conferences and active community participation
  • Competitive compensation and benefits package and some great added perks of working in the home city of Booking.com


Diversity, Equity and Inclusion (DEI) at Booking.com:

Diversity, Equity & Inclusion have been a core part of our company culture since day one. This ongoing journey starts with our very own employees, who represent over 140 nationalities and a wide range of ethnic and social backgrounds, genders and sexual orientations.

Take it from our Chief People Officer, Paulo Pisano: “At Booking.com, the diversity of our people doesn’t just build an outstanding workplace, it also creates a better and more inclusive travel experience for everyone. Inclusion is at the heart of everything we do. It’s a place where you can make your mark and have a real impact in travel and tech.”

We ensure that colleagues with disabilities are provided the adjustments and tools they need to participate in the job application and interview process, to perform crucial job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment.

Application Process:

This section should provide:

  • Let’s go places together: How we Hire
  • This role does not come with relocation assistance.


Booking.com is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. We strive to move well beyond traditional equal opportunity and work to create an environment that allows

Pre-Employment Screening

If your application is successful, your personal data may be used for a pre-employment screening check by a third party as permitted by applicable law. Depending on the vacancy and applicable law, a pre-employment screening may include employment history, education and other information (such as media information) that may be necessary for determining your qualifications and suitability for the position.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Onze missie bij Qwello is om een revolutie teweeg te brengen in de oplaad-industrie, we zetten ons in om de mobiliteit van verbrandingsmotoren naar elektrische aandrijving te veranderen. We ontwerpen, bouwen en beheren oplaadinfrastructuur voor de openbare ruimte. We blinken uit in eenvoud, gebruikersgerichtheid en koesteren een cultuur van saamhorigheid. We begrijpen dat de beste producten worden gemaakt door uitstekende teams in plaats van individuele supersterren. Maak deel uit van het vormgeven van de E-mobiliteit van de toekomst!




Qwello heeft Park & Charge in 2024 overgenomen en we opereren nu in Nederland onder de naam Park & Charge (kijk voor meer info op www.parkncharge.nl). Om ons doel te bereiken zijn we op zoek naar een Data Analist die ons helpt gegevens te analyseren om operationele verbeteringen te stimuleren en strategische beslissingen te ondersteunen.




Als junior data analyst werk je met gegevens om inzichten te verschaffen die onze laad activiteiten optimaliseren, de vraag voorspellen en processen verbeteren. Je speelt een belangrijke rol bij het waarborgen van de integriteit van gegevens, de samenwerking tussen teams en de ondersteuning van bedrijfsgroei door middel van data gestuurde oplossingen.




Only candidates with Fluent Dutch will be considered for this position. Please refrain from applying if you do not meet this requirement.




Jouw verantwoordelijkheden 🚀
Ondersteun het team bij het leveren van data-analyses en datavisualisaties om de ontwikkeling van relevante statistieken en de ontdekking van zakelijke kansen te sturen.
Datamodelleringstechnieken gebruiken om vraag en klantgedrag te voorspellen.
Dashboards en rapporten ontwerpen en onderhouden die inzicht geven in belangrijke prestatie-indicatoren en bedrijfsprestaties.
Samenwerken met cross-functionele teams om bedrijfsbehoeften te begrijpen, relevante gegevens te identificeren en data gestuurde oplossingen te implementeren.
Bijdragen aan de ontwikkeling van bestaande ETL's om de betrouwbaarheid en winstgevendheid van onze groeiende vloot te optimaliseren.





Jouw profiel ✨
Bachelor- of masterdiploma in data analytics, statistiek, wiskunde, computerwetenschappen, sociaal-wetenschappelijk onderzoek of een vergelijkbaar vakgebied.
Goede kennis van tools voor gegevensanalyse (Excel, SQL, Power BI, Tableau, Looker) en vertrouwd met Python-scripting.
In staat zijn om inzichten te halen uit ruwe gegevens en databasearchitectuur, datalandschappen en warehouses begrijpen.
Sterke analytische vaardigheden om problemen te identificeren, gegevens te analyseren en waardevolle inzichten te verschaffen binnen de context van de organisatie en de sector.
Proactieve benadering van probleemoplossing met een resultaatgerichte houding.
Het vermogen om te werken in een snelle en zeer samenwerkingsgerichte omgeving.
De bereidheid om initiatief te nemen en hoge kwaliteitsnormen te garanderen.
Vloeiend in zowel geschreven als gesproken Nederlandse en Engelse taal.





Jouw voordelen 🪴
Platte organisatiestructuur met efficiënte besluitvormingsprocessen zonder bureaucratie.
De kans om een sleutelrol te spelen in het vormgeven van de mobiliteitsrevolutie.
Deel uitmaken van een internationaal en dynamisch team met meer dan 30 nationaliteiten.
Geniet van fijne werkomgeving  met flexibele opties, je kiest of je volledig vanuit huis werkt, in een van onze kantoren of een mix die bij je past en je hebt de mogelijkheid om binnen de EU te werken, plus 30 vakantiedagen.
Regelmatige bedrijfs- en teamevenementen buiten kantoor om je los te koppelen van onze computers en opnieuw contact te maken met collega's tijdens wandeltochten, e-biketochten in de bergen, offsites en meer.
Persoonlijke en professionele ontwikkeling door middel van in-house lunch & learn sessies, coderingsuitdagingen maar ook externe trainingen, cursussen en conferenties.








Gelijke kansen:

We streven ernaar discriminatie uit te bannen, barrières te verwijderen en gelijke kansen te garanderen door middel van een transparant wervingsproces. We zetten ons volledig in voor een inclusieve en respectvolle werkomgeving waar iedereen succesvol kan zijn. Bij Park & Charge is iedereen welkom, ongeacht culturele achtergrond, geloof, ras, seksuele geaardheid, huidskleur of genderexpressie.

  • Persoonlijke en professionele ontwikkeling door middel van in-house lunch & learn sessies, coderingsuitdagingen maar ook externe trainingen, cursussen en conferenties.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Bij Alten zetten we ons in om organisaties te helpen bij het realiseren van digitale transformatie door middel van Data Analytics, AI en Performance Management-oplossingen. We stellen bedrijven in staat een datagestuurde cultuur te bevorderen, zodat ze weloverwogen beslissingen kunnen nemen door middel van innovatieve analysemogelijkheden.




We zijn op zoek naar een Data Analytics - Analyst om ons team te versterken. Dit is een geweldige kans voor een ambitieuze junior professional om sterke technische expertise te ontwikkelen en ervaring op te doen met end-to-end data-analyseprojecten.




Belangrijkste Verantwoordelijkheden




Data Analytics & Modeling: Ontwikkelen en optimaliseren van datamodellen met behulp van dimensionale modelleringstechnieken ter ondersteuning van analytische besluitvorming.
Data Pipeline Ontwikkeling & Automatisering: Ondersteunen bij het ontwerp, de implementatie en automatisering van datastromen voor efficiënte gegevensextractie, transformatie en het laden (ETL/ELT) proces.
Dashboard Ontwikkeling: Ontwerpen en ontwikkelen van interactieve datavisualisaties en dashboards met behulp van business intelligence-tools.
Samenwerking & Klantbetrokkenheid: Werken met stakeholders om bedrijfsvereisten te verzamelen en deze om te zetten in technische analysemogelijkheden.
Ondersteuning van Digitale Transformatie: Helpen bij het identificeren en implementeren van datagestuurde oplossingen om bedrijfsprocessen te verbeteren.
Projectbetrokkenheid: Ondersteunen van de end-to-end implementatiecyclus, inclusief het verzamelen van vereisten, testen en uitrollen.




Kwalificaties & Ervaring




3-5 jaar ervaring in Data Analytics, Business Intelligence of gerelateerde gebieden.
Sterke SQL-vaardigheden en een goed begrip van dimensionale modellering.
Ervaring met datavisualisatietools zoals Tableau, Power BI, SAP Analytics Cloud of vergelijkbare platforms.
Bekendheid met data pipeline ontwikkeling, automatisering en optimalisatie.
Zeer goede beheersing van zowel Engels als Nederlands (vereist).
Sterke communicatie- en presentatievaardigheden (vereist).
In staat om te werken in een snel veranderende, innovatieve omgeving met een leermindset.




Wat bieden wij?

Je krijgt een vast contract
Een leaseauto met tankkaart
Mogelijkheid tot hybride werken
Maandelijkse netto onkostenvergoeding
27 vakantiedagen met de mogelijkheid tot het aankopen van 10 extra vakantiedagen
Pensioenregeling zonder eigen bijdrage

Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a data-driven professional who's excited to transform business questions into actionable insights that drive decisions. In this role, you’ll collaborate with commercial teams, to influence strategic planning and elevate business performance. You will work alongside talented and driven data peers in a dynamic environment to create real impact in HousingAnywhere's growth.

Excited for the challenge? We are excited to hear from you!



Your role & Impact

The purpose of this role is to empower commercial teams with insights and recommendations to grow our marketplace and get the most of our team.


Collaborate closely with the commercial teams to translate business questions into analyses, synthesise insights and develop recommendations to drive business results.
Define, develop and monitor the key metrics to measure operational performance and business outcomes, and identify drivers for changes in these metrics
Ensure business questions are addressed in the most effective format (ad-hoc deep-dive, recurring analysis, dashboards, self-serving functional tools)
Empower stakeholders to independently leverage data for business insights via dashboards and self-serving tools, in close collaboration with the Analytics Engineering and Business Intelligence teams.
Develop dashboards and reports that support operational business processes.
Support commercial team OKR planning and measurement.
Identify and implement opportunities to enhance existing analytical processes and methodologies




Your team

Our Commercial Analytics and Business Intelligence team is formed by 4 analysts from diverse backgrounds and experience levels. We collaborate closely with data engineers, analytics engineers, and data scientists to extract insights and drive informed decision-making.



Your profile

Required:


4+ years experience as a Data Analyst, or equivalent role with a strong data/analytics component.
Analytical mindset, combined with good business sense and orientation.
A good communicator who can present insights and recommendations clearly and persuasively to different audiences
Self-starter with strong project and time management skills.
Proficient in SQL and Google Sheets, and experience with at least one dashboarding tool (Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, etc.)


Preferred


Advanced knowledge of at least one statistical programming language (Python, R, etc.) is a plus
Previous experience in a high-growth, fast-paced tech company is a big plus.
Experience creating interactive dashboards in Tableau


What’s in it for you


Unlimited paid holidays, minimum-based not maximum!
Hybrid working policy with 2 days working from the office.
Flexibility to work remotely for up to 2 months per year!
1,000 EUR personal development budget.
Complete coverage for commuting.
30% ruling application assistance.
Personal equipment, including laptop and ergonomic setup.
Gym membership discount with GoVital or OneFit.
Dutch/English classes budget.
Variable pension scheme.
Diverse international community (46+ nationalities).
Pet-friendly office in Rotterdam city centre.
Fun team-building and after-work drinks every Friday.


About HousingAnywhere Group

HousingAnywhere is Europe’s largest mid-term rental platform, covering over 125 cities across Europe and several in the US. With Kamernet and Studapart under its umbrella, HousingAnywhere empowers people to live wherever and however they choose. Through our advanced online platforms, which together attract over 30 million users annually, we connect young professionals and students directly with accommodation providers. Our team of 250 professionals is dedicated to helping tenants find comfort and peace of mind in their rental search, whether they're looking for a home across the globe or just across town.

Our mission

Rent Easy, Live Free.

Our Values


Ownership
We are Enablers
We are Changemakers
We are Connectors


If you have further questions, please email Yamuna at y.kaboorappan@housinganywhere.com

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Iets moois van A naar B brengen, daar draait álles om bij DHL eCommerce. En als Verloning Specialist draag jij daar direct aan bij. Zo ben jij ervoor verantwoordelijk dat onze bezorgers op tijd en correct worden uitbetaald. Dus kies je voor knalgeel met een vleugje rood? Dan maak jij binnenkort het verschil voor duizenden verzenders en ontvangers over de hele wereld.


Dit ga je doen

Dagelijks brengen ruim 8.000 bezorgers de pakketten van klanten rond in onze herkenbare gele busjes. Deze bezorgers zijn een cruciaal onderdeel van ons logistieke proces. Het is dus van groot belang dat hun salarisbetaling op tijd komt en kloppend is. In jouw rol als Verloning Specialist draag jij hier zorg voor.


Jouw werk bestaat uit twee hoofdtaken, namelijk:

  • Continuïteit: het uitvoeren van de bestaande dagelijkse werkzaamheden (uitvoeren mutaties en beantwoorden complexe vragen) en maandelijkse processen (uitvoeren verloning) om ons verloningsproces op tijd en correct te laten verlopen
  • Verbeteren huidige processen: samen met collega’s en experts kijk jij hoe processen slimmer opgezet kunnen worden.


Jouw werkplek

De standplaats van ons hoofdkantoor is Utrecht. Je komt te werken in het team van Operations Strategy & Performance en werk je met verschillende collega’s nauw samen. Je rapporteert aan de Manager Performance & Quality. In ieder geval, waar je ook werkt: we luisteren áltijd naar wat je te zeggen hebt. Hoe meer perspectieven en meningen we horen, hoe beter we daar allemaal van worden. Zo hebben we als organisatie dit jaar de certificaat Great Place to Work gekregen. Deze certificering is 100% gebaseerd op feedback van medewerkers.


Dit ben jij

Dankzij jouw ervaring met projecten weet jij het overzicht te bewaren en denk jij probleemoplossend. Jij weet om te gaan met bulkdata en kun jij deze data vertalen naar bruikbare informatie voor jouw collega’s. Jouw communicatieve vaardigheden zorgen ervoor dat je prettig samenwerkt met diverse collega’s van verschillende teams in de organisatie. Daarnaast ben jij punctueel, kun je onder tijdsdruk werken en houd jij tijdsplanningen en andere doelstellingen scherp in de gaten en stuurt bij waar nodig.


Verder heb jij:

  • Hbo werk- en denkniveau;
  • Flexibele houding t.a.v. werktijden en werkdagen – je vindt het niet erg om soms voor 09.00 of na 17.00 te werken;
  • Affiniteit met HR processen en verloning;
  • Kennis van wet- en regelgeving betreffende cao beleid is een pre, heb je dit nog niet dan leren wij het je graag;
  • Uitgebreide Excel vaardigheden.


Dit krijg jij

Een zelfstandige en uitdagende baan in een gedreven team van professionele collega’s met een no-nonsense cultuur. Daarbij:

  • Een salaris tussen de €3.500 tot maximaal €4.000 o.b.v 40 uur;
  • Bonusregeling van 5%;
  • Flexibele werktijden en de mogelijkheid om thuis te werken 32-40 uur;
  • Standaard 23 vakantiedagen;
  • Cao à la carte; wij bieden jou de mogelijkheid te kiezen voor 4,5 extra vrije dagen op jaarbasis óf te kiezen voor uitbetaling;
  • Een goede pensioenregeling;
  • Opleidings- en trainingsmogelijkheden vanaf dag één;
  • Mooie doorgroeikansen binnen de organisatie;
  • De mogelijkheid tot hybride werken.


De toekomst van bezorgen is geel-rood

DHL eCommerce is het meest toonaangevende logistiekbedrijf ter wereld. Dat klinkt misschien opschepperig, maar zo bedoelen we het niet: we zien het namelijk niet als een verdienste, maar als een verantwoordelijkheid. Dankzij onze positie kunnen we het verschil maken voor onze mensen, het milieu en de maatschappij. En dat blijkt: we zijn een Great Place to Work, Top Employer 2025 en helpen via DHL Cares ontzettend veel mensen die dat hard kunnen gebruiken – daar zijn we trots op!


Solliciteren?

Solliciteer dan nu met je cv en eventueel een motivatiebrief. Heb je vragen over de vacature of wil je meer informatie? Aarzel dan niet om contact op te nemen met Eva Hazes, Corporate Recruiter, via eva.hazes@dhl.com. We kijken ernaar uit om van je te horen!


Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Role: Data Analyst




Job Type: 6 Month Contract




Location: Den Bosch, Netherlands




Work Pattern: Hybrid Working. 2 Days On-Site / 3 Days Working From Home




Languages: Fluency in Dutch and English




Summary

A brand new role has opened up for a Data Analyst to join a energy company, in their Netherlands office on a 6 month contract basis.




You will be joining an international team to support the smooth operations and transformation of their data processes. You would be required to have a solid understanding of data flows and programming to assist with the automation and improvement of these processes.




The company are undergoing a large-scale transformation project across their global teams, and your contribution will add huge value to their customers and operational teams.




The role is being offered on a 6 month contract basis, with a work pattern of 2-3 days on-site from their Dutch Office




The Company

The company work within the energy sector with the aim to deliver sustainable and cost-effective solutions to their loyal client-base. They have decades of expertise and have become a leading supplier for consumers across Europe.




In addition to upholding excellence to their customer base, they are committed to their creation of a work environment with an emphasis on personal, skill and experience development opportunities. This is a company that will value your contributions by providing an exciting and supportive workplace.




The Role

We are looking for an individual with strong communication skills in both Dutch and English to work alongside senior data stakeholders to analyse and optimize the data processes of different departments for their international teams.




Your responsibilities will include:

Analyse data flows to document and create opportunities
Design, implement and optimize complex data flow systems
Manage and organize large datasets
Manage and improve the Data Warehouse
Performance analysis and financial reporting.
Ensure the automation of Python data processes apps and pipelines
Migrate systems from on-prem to cloud environments




Requirements

Fluency in Dutch and English
Python
SQL
PowerBI




Next Steps:

If you are a Data Analyst based in the Netherlands and you are looking work for a company fantastic approach to work, in an exciting and innovative environment, then look no further – this is the role for you!




Interviews for this role will be held imminently. To be considered, please send your CV in English to me now to avoid disappointment.




Referrals:

If this role isn’t right for you, do you know someone that might be interested? You could earn £1,000 of retail vouchers if you refer a successful candidate to Oscar. Email: rebecca.myers@oscar-tech.com to recommend someone for this role.

Work Pattern: Hybrid Working. 2 Days On-Site / 3 Days Working From Home




Languages: Fluency in Dutch and English

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst – Credit Risk | Amsterdam | Deta-Vast




Alleen Nederlandssprekende kandidaten die openstaan voor deta-vast worden in overweging genomen voor deze positie.




Data-analyse, SQL, Excel, BI-tools, Finance, Credit Risk, Python




Amoria Bond is momenteel op zoek naar een medior Data Analyst voor een finance klant, gevestigd in Amsterdam.




In deze rol focus je op het extracten van data uit databases en het werken met deze data. Je werkt met Credit Risk datasets die gekwantificeerd moeten worden en ingezet worden voor reporting, monitoring en modelling.




Vaardigheden en Ervaring:




3+ jaar relevante werkervaring op het gebied van data analyse
Ervaring met Credit Risk
SQL & Excel
BI-tools & Python zijn een pré
Stakeholdermanagement
Vloeiend Nederlands (vereist)




Over de Rol:




12 maanden initieel contract
Contract to hire / Deta-vast
Hybride werken




Ben jij de Credit Risk Data Analyst die wij zoeken? Stuur dan je CV en contactgegevens naar Kieran.Hyde@amoriabond.com, en ik neem zo snel mogelijk contact met je op!




Data-analyse, SQL, Excel, BI-tools, Finance, Credit Risk, Python




We will endeavour to respond to your application ASAP. However, there may be times when it is not possible to reply to all applications, due to high volumes of enquiries. This is sometimes the case for unsuccessful applications to one of our vacancies. We apologise for this and can reassure you that we will keep your details and contact you in the future should any suitable positions arise.




Amoria Bond operates as an employment agency and employment business. No terminology in this advert is intended to discriminate on the grounds of age or experience, and we confirm that we are happy to accept applications from persons of any age or experience for this role.

Title: BI Consultant
Description:
Company Description

A positive future for everyone — that’s what we’re working towards at Sopra Steria. With over 56,000 colleagues in 30 countries, we are Europe’s leading provider of digital solutions. We believe that it’s not just technology that drives transformation, but that people are at the heart of change. That’s why people are central to everything we do, both individually and as teams.

The world is shaped by how we choose to shape it. Let’s shape it together.

Job Description

We are seeking an innovative and analytical BI Consultant to join our team in Nieuwegein, Netherlands. As a BI Consultant, you will play a crucial role in helping our clients solve complex data challenges and make informed decisions through actionable insights.


Collect and analyse data from various sources to develop comprehensive business intelligence solutions
Design, develop, and optimise user-friendly dashboards and reports using cutting-edge BI tools
Collaborate with clients to understand their business needs and translate them into effective data visualisations
Implement best practices in data modelling and visual design to enhance the quality of reports and visualisations
Optimise datasets and improve dashboard performance for efficient data processing
Provide expert guidance and coaching to colleagues and clients on BI best practices and methodologies
Contribute to the strategic vision and development of our BI practice and unit
Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and innovations in business intelligence and data visualisation


Qualifications


HBO or WO degree in Information Technology or a related field
Minimum of 3 years' experience with at least one of the following BI tools: Power BI, Tableau, Qlik, or D3.js
Proven track record in optimising dashboard performance and implementing visual design principles
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data and present insights clearly
Proficiency in data warehousing concepts and SQL
Experience with programming languages such as JavaScript, Python, or C# is advantageous
Knowledge of UX design principles is a plus
Excellent communication skills in both Dutch (required) and English
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and coach colleagues and clients
Creative problem-solving skills with a pragmatic approach and keen attention to detail
Experience in various industries and ability to understand diverse business contexts
Willingness to push boundaries in digital transformation and technology consulting


Additional Information

You’ll be part of a major name in the tech world, known for its consulting, digital services, and software development. You’ll work alongside high-level professionals who are bold in their approach and committed to delivering exceptional results. In addition, you’ll become part of our Data area.

Within the Data area, we create long-term value for our clients through data. We help companies stay agile during transitions by making data and technology a key part of both daily operations and strategic decision-making. In doing so, we help our clients stay ahead of change through the power of data. Our ambition is to help organizations excel with data. You’ll work in a high-tech environment focused on knowledge and innovation, with an open, no-nonsense culture that encourages initiative. The area consists of five practices: Data Governance & Data Management, Data Visualization, Data Science & AI, Data Engineering & Data Migrations, and Spatial Intelligence — each with a clear identity and focus on content and corresponding solutions. Over 170 professionals work in this area, each in the practice that best suits their expertise and interests.

Ready for the next step in your career? We’re happy to guide you in the right direction — with offices in nearly 30 countries, we can take you places you’ve never been before. Prefer to grow internally? That’s possible too. We encourage you to keep challenging yourself and become the best version of who you are.

At Sopra Steria, we ensure you can do your job with joy and balance. That’s why we offer an attractive and flexible employment benefits package:


A permanent contract and a gross monthly salary between €3,000 and €6,000 (based on 40 hours per week). The exact amount depends on your experience and the role;
8% holiday allowance;
A generous mobility budget, including options such as an electric lease car with an NS Business Card, a lease bike, or alternative transportation that best suits your travel needs;
8% profit sharing on target (or a fixed OTB amount, depending on the role);
27 paid vacation days;
A flex benefits budget of €1,800 per year, plus an additional percentage of your salary. This can be used for things like purchasing extra vacation days or contributing more to your pension;
A home office setup with a laptop, phone, and a monthly internet allowance;
Hybrid working: from home or at the office, depending on what works best for you;
Development opportunities through training, knowledge-sharing sessions, and inspiring (networking) events;
Social activities with colleagues — from casual drinks to sports and content-driven outings;
A flexible pension scheme with customizable contributions tailored to your needs;
Option to participate in a collective health insurance plan.


Does this job sound like a match for you? Ready to help shape the world with us? Fantastic! We’re already looking forward to receiving your application.

______

Sopra Steria is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to age, ancestry, nationality, color, family or medical leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, gender (including pregnancy), sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. We foster a work environment that is inclusive and respectful of all differences.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Our client is undergoing a migration from SAP R/3 to SAP S/4HANA. This includes migrating the SRP platform and moving all relevant data, processes, reports, and tools to the new S/4HANA environment. We are currently looking for freelance data analyst to come an aid our client with this project.

The project aims to build a live connection to the new platform using SQL or Alteryx, and integrate data into visualization tools such as Tableau and SAP Analysis for Office (AFO). The project covers various domains, including Supply Chain and HR.

Responsibilities:

Hands-on development
Designing and building data solutions
Creating and managing databases
Establishing connections between legacy systems and the new SAP platform
Supporting the migration of data and business logic
Translating requirements into actionable data models and visualizations
Supporting project management tasks

Requirements:

A few years of experience as a data analyst or similar role
Strong skills in SQL, Snowflake, dbt, and Tableau/AFO
Good communication skills; fluent in English, Dutch is an advantage

Nice to have - Experience with SAP migrations, particularly to S/4HANA

Nice to have - Experience with data pipelines, data modeling, and visualization

Logistics

Contract type: Freelance
Location: Limburg, Netherlands
Start Date: ASAP
Duration: 6 months
Language: English (Dutch is a plus)
Working Schedule: 4–5 days onsite

If you are interested in this role, please feel free to respond to this email with your up to date CV and we can schedule a call.

https://www.linkedin.com/in/will-r-707538257/

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Fulltime: 38 hours per week

Translate data into value! Does that sound interesting to you, then this might be the right opportunity for you. With your work we enable our stakeholders to act on data.

Your Daily Actions

In your job you will work on a wide variety of tasks, ranging from ad-hoc questions raised by a diverse group of stakeholders, to tasks related to cross-functional projects where you will actively participate in. Next to that, you will work on topics initiated by our own team in order to explore or challenge the status quo! This is important for Action, our team, but also yourself in order to keep growing.

Your work will consist of:


analyzing the enormous datasets we have and transform them into digestible output. You will be responsible for all steps in the analysis process from gathering the right data, processing it in an efficient and effective way, to creating a compelling report out. With a strong customer focus, your goal will be to create digestible reports that match the needs and knowledge of our stakeholders.
developing new reports and dashboards that support our stakeholders to steer on the right information. These reports/dashboards might serve a temporary purpose for example linked to a project, or will become part of our standard reports & dashboards after a pilot phase. Your job is not only to gather the data, model the data, and build the visualizations, but also to act as an expert in the field with a strong customer focus. You should be able to challenge requirements in a positive constructive way, to make sure we support our stakeholders in the best way we can while keeping a close eye on simplicity and focus.
performing complex analysis to track relationships, understand effects of changes and find areas for improvement. You could think of cases such as ‘What is the impact of a certain way of working on the article availability in our stores?
Work together with the data scientists to support them in the analyses they need for the creation of their models. Also you might use the models they created and use or analyse the output for your own tasks.


Meet Your Team

Working in Action means working in a dynamic and highly motivated environment that is constantly looking for improvements. As a team we support a wide variety of stakeholders and our mission is to transform Action’s data into value for them. Since there are more data- scientists and analysts working in the team you can team up with experience and knowledge to achieve the best results for Action and learn from each other.

This Is You

What We Offer


24 vacation days with the option to purchase 5 additional days (based on 38 hours per week).
A comprehensive pension plan, collective health insurance, and travel expense reimbursement.
A wide range of courses and training through our Action Academy.
A 15% employee discount at Action stores.
Flexible working hours.
The opportunity to work in a fast-paced, international environment with plenty of room to grow.


How We Contribute to Society

If you only know Action from the stores, a world will open up for you when you come and work with us. We work hard to make a positive impact on society and the environment. Did you know, for example, that we sponsor more than 2,500 children worldwide who grow up in an SOS Children's Village? That our team reflects the diversity of our customers, including 155 different nationalities? That we purchase 94% of our wood products and 100% of our cotton sustainably? And that almost all our stores only use energy-efficient LED lighting? Yes, that is also Action. Curious about what other initiatives we’re facilitating? Join our team and find out for yourself

Interested?

We are proud to be an inclusive employer, and we warmly invite anyone who recognises themselves in the vacancy to apply. So take action and respond to this vacancy now!

What happens next:


Response to your application within 14 days (and usually earlier)
First meeting with the manager and a colleague
Online assessment to get to know you better
Second interview with your recruiter, among others
Welcome to Action

With a strong customer focus, your goal will be to create digestible reports that match the needs and knowledge of our stakeholders.
  • developing new reports and dashboards that support our stakeholders to steer on the right information. These reports/dashboards might serve a temporary purpose for example linked to a project, or will become part of our standard reports & dashboards after a pilot phase. Your job is not only to gather the data, model the data, and build the visualizations, but also to act as an expert in the field with a strong customer focus. You should be able to challenge requirements in a positive constructive way, to make sure we support our stakeholders in the best way we can while keeping a close eye on simplicity and focus.
  • performing complex analysis to track relationships, understand effects of changes and find areas for improvement. You could think of cases such as ‘What is the impact of a certain way of working on the article availability in our stores?
  • Work together with the data scientists to support them in the analyses they need for the creation of their models. Also you might use the models they created and use or analyse the output for your own tasks.

Meet Your Team

Working in Action means working in a dynamic and highly motivated environment that is constantly looking for improvements. As a team we support a wide variety of stakeholders and our mission is to transform Action’s data into value for them. Since there are more data- scientists and analysts working in the team you can team up with experience and knowledge to achieve the best results for Action and learn from each other.

This Is You

What We Offer

  • 24 vacation days with the option to purchase 5 additional days (based on 38 hours per week).
  • A comprehensive pension plan, collective health insurance, and travel expense reimbursement.
  • A wide range of courses and training through our Action Academy.
  • A 15% employee discount at Action stores.
  • Flexible working hours.
  • The opportunity to work in a fast-paced, international environment with plenty of room to grow.

How We Contribute to Society

If you only know Action from the stores, a world will open up for you when you come and work with us. We work hard to make a positive impact on society and the environment. Did you know, for example, that we sponsor more than 2,500 children worldwide who grow up in an SOS Children's Village? That our team reflects the diversity of our customers, including 155 different nationalities? That we purchase 94% of our wood products and 100% of our cotton sustainably? And that almost all our stores only use energy-efficient LED lighting? Yes, that is also Action. Curious about what other initiatives we’re facilitating? Join our team and find out for yourself

Interested?

We are proud to be an inclusive employer, and we warmly invite anyone who recognises themselves in the vacancy to apply. So take action and respond to this vacancy now!

What happens next:

  • Response to your application within 14 days (and usually earlier)
  • First meeting with the manager and a colleague
  • Online assessment to get to know you better
  • Second interview with your recruiter, among others
  • Welcome to Action

Title: Data Analyst I - Finance
Description:
About Us: At Booking.com, data drives our decisions. Technology is at our core. And innovation is everywhere. But our company is more than datasets, lines of code or A/B tests. We’re the thrill of the first night in a new place. The excitement of the next morning. The friends you encounter. The journeys you take. The sights you see. And the memories you make. Through our products, partners and people, we make it easier for everyone to experience the world.

Role Description:

Data Analysts I work on analytics tasks such as reporting, visualization and analysis within the scope of their team. They consult with stakeholders in problem-definition, setting success metrics and shaping the way forward through data insights and effective communication with their audience. Data Analysts I have experience managing stakeholders and can do this largely autonomously (seeking for help in complex scenarios). They prioritize their work for business impact, efficiently adapt to business needs, and manage expectations accordingly. They combine their understanding of the business with the knowledge of data, workflows, methods and tooling to largely autonomously drive analysis and reporting within the scope of their team. They can adapt existing tooling and approaches based on business and user needs. They collaborate with peers in their craft and follow best practices ensuring data quality and stability.

The successful candidate will be a key member of the Global Finance Analytics team. They will be responsible for supporting, reporting on and analyzing the operational performance of the Order 2 Cash department within Finance, ensuring that data is leveraged with maximum impact. They will be a dynamic and flexible partner to our stakeholders - able to build and maintain meaningful and insightful reports that will help steer the business and facilitate decision-making, as well as take the lead on projects as needed.

Key Job Responsibilities and Duties:


Responsible for owning the design and delivery of parts of Data Analytics solutions based on business requirements, contributing to bringing them from the initial idea-generation phase to implementation with some supervision.
Responsible for working independently on consuming data, preparing it for analytical use and translating business problems to data stories. Can ask for guidance on more complex tasks.
Responsible for working within the scope of their team and delivering work that informs business decisions for the product / business topic they currently work on.
Responsible for leveraging foundational skills in data analysis and data visualization to answer business questions. They incorporate stakeholder requirements when creating intuitive and insightful visualizations that translate data into actionable insights.
Responsible for connecting and collaborating with stakeholders in operational and project-based roles under the guidance of a manager. Uses effective communication to address their needs and presents data insights in an accessible, business-friendly manner.
Responsible for being flexible in adopting existing internal Data Analytics approaches and expanding their technical competencies when a more efficient way presents itself.
Responsible for growing their own craft skills while leveraging Data Analytics for impact on well defined business problems.
Responsible for supporting junior peers when opportunity presents itself through knowledge sharing and setting a good example.
Responsible for networking and proactively connecting with craft peers beyond the team's scope.
Must be familiar with the larger data ecosystem at Booking and how it relates to the work they do.
Responsible for connecting with peers in related crafts (ie. Data Engineering) as needed on specific projects to ensure successful outcomes.
Must have high level knowledge about the goals of their area (ie. track / vertical).
Responsible for ensuring quality of their own work by validating it through peer review.



Qualifications & Skills:


Experience in data management, data visualization and quality
Knowledge and experience using data analysis and visualization tools (e.g.: tableau, data studio, powerbi, mixpanel, etc.)
Knowledge and experience with Python/R. Experience with at least one data analysis language (e.g.: R, SQL, Python, etc.)
Advanced knowledge of SQL
Strong knowledge and experience on data analysis
Ability to define business problems with stakeholders and identify analytics solutions to them
Driven and results oriented personality
Open to feedback and always looking for ways to improve own performance
Able to understand details while keeping an eye on the bigger picture
Analytical and curious mindset
Strong interpersonal skills
Open and friendly attitude
Comfortable with ambiguity
Ability to work and problem solve independently
Experience with SAP HANA is a plus



Benefits & Perks - Global Impact, Personal Relevance:

Booking.com’s Total Rewards Philosophy is not only about compensation but also about benefits. We offer a competitive compensation and benefits package, as well unique-to-Booking.com benefits which include:


Annual paid time off and generous paid leave scheme including: parent, grandparent, bereavement, and care leave
Hybrid working including flexible working arrangements, and up to 20 days per year working from abroad (home country)
Industry leading product discounts - up to 1400 per year - for yourself, including automatic Genius Level 3 status and Booking.com wallet credit



Diversity, Equity and Inclusion (DEI) at Booking.com:

Diversity, Equity & Inclusion have been a core part of our company culture since day one. This ongoing journey starts with our very own employees, who represent over 140 nationalities and a wide range of ethnic and social backgrounds, genders and sexual orientations.

Take it from our Chief People Officer, Paulo Pisano: “At Booking.com, the diversity of our people doesn’t just build an outstanding workplace, it also creates a better and more inclusive travel experience for everyone. Inclusion is at the heart of everything we do. It’s a place where you can make your mark and have a real impact in travel and tech.”

We ensure that colleagues with disabilities are provided the adjustments and tools they need to participate in the job application and interview process, to perform crucial job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment.

Application Process:


Let’s go places together: How we Hire
Detailed instructions on post-application requirements including any required application materials, deadlines, portfolios, coding challenges, or other assessments as defined by BU or department.



This role does not come with relocation assistance.

Booking.com is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. We strive to move well beyond traditional equal opportunity and work to create an environment that allows everyone to thrive.

Pre-Employment Screening

If your application is successful, your personal data may be used for a pre-employment screening check by a third party as permitted by applicable law. Depending on the vacancy and applicable law, a pre-employment screening may include employment history, education and other information (such as media information) that may be necessary for determining your qualifications and suitability for the position.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
About Mira

Mira is a San Francisco-based hormonal health company providing integrative care and hormonal testing for over 92,000 customers. In 2023, they were recognized by Inc. 5000 as America's fastest-growing femtech company. We started our company to help women and individuals reach their parenthood dreams and make their fertility journey smoother.

Mira’s most important breakthrough was inventing the market's only FDA-compliant at-home fertility monitor with quantitative technology. Since the beginning, they have been on a mission to develop data-driven hormonal health solutions to help women make confident health decisions during every stage of their lives—from the menstrual stage to menopause. Mira offers solutions to test, boost, and navigate fertility—starting from comprehensive hormone testing and supplements to fertility coaching and online courses.

We are committed to helping our customers achieve the highest possible success rates and outcomes; that is why our focus is on personalized care, the use of the most cutting-edge technology, and science-backed data.

About The Position

We are looking for a part-time Marketing Data Analyst **to enhance Mira’s decision-making processes through advanced data analysis and actionable insights. The ideal candidate is experienced in marketing analytics, e-commerce sector, and data visualization through Looker.

The role is a remote position, with a 20-hour workweek, flexible working hours and occasional overlap with the US team. There is potential for the role to evolve into a full-time position based on performance and company needs in 2-3 months.

If want to challenge yourself at a high-growth startup and make a difference for women's health please join us!

Responsibilities


Leverage Looker to create interactive dashboards, reports, and visualizations that provide a holistic view of performance marketing and e-commerce metrics.
Provide actionable insights to drive marketing strategy, optimize campaign performance, and improve customer acquisition and retention.
Collaborate with marketing & retention teams to understand their data needs, own and prioritize the roadmap, and deliver tailored insights and recommendations.
Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies in both performance marketing and e-commerce metrics.
Data Governance - ensure the data is flowing seamlessly between the website and third party tools, troubleshoot is necessary.


Requirements


Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Mathematics, Business, or similar). Master's degree is a plus.
2+ years in a Marketing Data & Insights role.
High proficiency with Looker and GA4.
High proficiency with Excel and Big Query.
Experience in e-commerce or consumer brands with a strong emphasis on customer acquisition and digital marketing.
Knowledge of DTC Marketing Analytics, A/B testing; familiarity with Python or SQL is a plus.
Strong data storytelling abilities, as well as the ability to articulate technical information to a non-technical audience.
Inherent curiosity and analytical follow-through - you can’t help but ask “why?” and love using data and logic to explore potential solutions.


What We Offer


You will work with a dedicated, highly-engaged, international team of professionals who are passionate about helping couples and individuals start their families
We have a fast paced and collaborative work environment where we encourage open communication, ownership and independence
In addition to competitive salary we offer performance-based bonus system based on OKR
We provide professional development opportunities - training courses, workshops and seminars


Recruiting process

Step 1 ‘Screening call with HR’ - Step 2 ‘Assessment task’ - Step 3 ‘Interview with the Head of Growth’ - Step 4 ‘Final interview with CMO’
Show more
