Since the beginning, they have been on a mission to develop data-driven hormonal health solutions to help women make confident health decisions during every stage of their lives—from the menstrual stage to menopause. Mira offers solutions to test, boost, and navigate fertility—starting from comprehensive hormone testing and supplements to fertility coaching and online courses.

We are committed to helping our customers achieve the highest possible success rates and outcomes; that is why our focus is on personalized care, the use of the most cutting-edge technology, and science-backed data.

About The Position

We are looking for a part-time Marketing Data Analyst **to enhance Mira’s decision-making processes through advanced data analysis and actionable insights. The ideal candidate is experienced in marketing analytics, e-commerce sector, and data visualization through Looker.

The role is a remote position, with a 20-hour workweek, flexible working hours and occasional overlap with the US team. There is potential for the role to evolve into a full-time position based on performance and company needs in 2-3 months.

If want to challenge yourself at a high-growth startup and make a difference for women's health please join us!

Responsibilities

  • Leverage Looker to create interactive dashboards, reports, and visualizations that provide a holistic view of performance marketing and e-commerce metrics.
  • Provide actionable insights to drive marketing strategy, optimize campaign performance, and improve customer acquisition and retention.
  • Collaborate with marketing & retention teams to understand their data needs, own and prioritize the roadmap, and deliver tailored insights and recommendations.
  • Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies in both performance marketing and e-commerce metrics.
  • Data Governance - ensure the data is flowing seamlessly between the website and third party tools, troubleshoot is necessary.

Requirements

  • Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Mathematics, Business, or similar). Master's degree is a plus.
  • 2+ years in a Marketing Data & Insights role.
  • High proficiency with Looker and GA4.
  • High proficiency with Excel and Big Query.
  • Experience in e-commerce or consumer brands with a strong emphasis on customer acquisition and digital marketing.
  • Knowledge of DTC Marketing Analytics, A/B testing; familiarity with Python or SQL is a plus.
  • Strong data storytelling abilities, as well as the ability to articulate technical information to a non-technical audience.
  • Inherent curiosity and analytical follow-through - you can’t help but ask “why?” and love using data and logic to explore potential solutions.

What We Offer

  • You will work with a dedicated, highly-engaged, international team of professionals who are passionate about helping couples and individuals start their families
  • We have a fast paced and collaborative work environment where we encourage open communication, ownership and independence
  • In addition to competitive salary we offer performance-based bonus system based on OKR
  • We provide professional development opportunities - training courses, workshops and seminars

Recruiting process

Step 1 ‘Screening call with HR’ - Step 2 ‘Assessment task’ - Step 3 ‘Interview with the Head of Growth’ - Step 4 ‘Final interview with CMO’

Title: Data Analyst (Media)
Description:
We are looking for a talented Data Analyst that has affinity with media, data, and Fashion. As a analyst, you will provide in-depth media analysis reports and automated dashboards to support both the Marketing & E-commerce Media team. The insights are used to improve the effectiveness of the campaigns (including long-term brand building and short-term commercial targets) and to gain knowledge about trends and the quality of our media buying. We are looking for someone with exceptional communications skills and strong analytical abilities.

Given the existing data engineering support, this role will focus on translating business requirements into actionable insights and measurement strategies. The ideal candidate will possess a strong understanding of marketing KPIs and the ability to derive meaningful conclusions from complex datasets, with a technical understanding to collaborate effectively with the Data Engineer.

Main Responsibilities


Manage complex quantitative and qualitative media analysis projects to provide the teams with high-level insights and reporting on their (full-funnel) media performance, both on- and offline.
Analyze and interpret mainstream, social media, and market research data sets to provide meaningful insights and trends.
Develop KPI frameworks and digital analytics tagging recommendations to support the collection of the data needed for KPI reporting.
Monitor day-to-day campaign performance and maintain in-depth understanding of our overall business and marketing objectives.
Analyze large data sets to uncover trends and areas for campaign optimization.
Set up measurement frameworks to measure and prove incremental value created from marketing activities (attributed).
Build automated reports to track campaign (full funnel) performance and reflect on the progress towards objectives.
Collaborate with the Data Engineer to ensure data pipelines meet the needs of marketing analysis and reporting.
Take part in our Media Mix Modeling projects.
Focus on interpreting model outputs and translating them into actionable marketing strategies.
Work with stakeholders to define business questions and measurement objectives for the MMM.
Organize training sessions for the business teams to understand the results, build trust, and drive adoption.

Requirements


Exhibit strong analytic, technical, troubleshooting, and problem-solving skills.
Experience with business intelligence software like Looker, Tableau, or similar tools.
Ability to work in a team-oriented, fast-paced environment managing multiple priorities.
Project management and organizational skills.
Ability to communicate results of complex analytic findings to both technical and non-technical audiences.


Fluent in English, both written and spoken.

It Is a Bonus If You Have


Familiarity with marketing attribution models.
Experience in Looker Enterprise
Experience in Google Cloud Platform including BigQuery
Experience with incrementality testing frameworks.
Familiar with database concepts, SQL & DBT.
Knowledge of machine learning techniques.


Benefits


25 Days of Annual Leave: As a full-time employee, you will receive 25 days of paid holiday each year, with the flexibility to buy or sell up to 4 additional days to meet personal needs.
Hybrid Work Model: We offer a flexible hybrid work environment, enabling you to seamlessly balance office and remote work to enhance productivity and work-life balance.
Work From Abroad: Take advantage of the opportunity to work remotely from abroad for up to 2 weeks annually.
International Work Environment: Join a dynamic, global team that fosters collaboration and cultural diversity, providing you with a rich and inclusive professional experience.
Partial Travel Allowance: Benefit from a partial travel allowance to support your commuting costs, ensuring your journey to and from work is more affordable.
Hunkemöller Academy: Gain access to our Hunkemöller Academy, offering a wide range of professional development programs to support your career growth and skill enhancement.
Employee Discounts: Enjoy a 25% discount on all company products, allowing you to access our offerings at a reduced price


Apply now with your CV or LinkedIn!

We are not looking to work with recruitment agencies! Any unsolicited sharing of profiles will be considered a NO FEE applicant!

Title: Data Analyst (Amsterdam)
Description:
Do you want to empower organizations to build smarter compensation strategies while ensuring fair pay for all employees?

Syndio is a Series C technology company leveraging advanced technology and responsible AI to accelerate decision-making, streamline compliance, and democratize insights for consistent, equitable compensation practices at scale. Backed by $83M in investments from Bessemer Venture Partners, Voyager Capital, and Emerson Collective, we are expanding our team and products to help companies align their rewards strategies with their business goals.

Our customers are our greatest asset. Syndio partners with many of the world’s most recognized and respected enterprises, helping them implement leading-edge compensation solutions with expert guidance. We analyze pay for over 10 million employees across dozens of countries, ensuring fair, defensible rewards that drive better business outcomes.

Join us in our mission to eradicate workplace inequities and help companies create workplaces where every employee is valued for who they are and the impact they make.

About The Role

Syndio licenses software to companies to help them find and fix pay equity issues and stay in compliance over time. We’re looking for someone who brings a combination of analytics and customer service skills to tap insights that will help guide customers as they build a comprehensive workplace fairness strategy.

Why this job is exciting


Conduct project-based and ad hoc data analyses customized to customer questions about pay equity and other workplace fairness metrics.
Analyze data from our data lake and public data sets, and conduct online research to support our sales and marketing teams.
Support domain experts and customer success managers in building templates, documenting processes, and organizing information.
Develop reports and templates in compliance with the EU Pay Transparency Directive and country-specific pay gap reporting regulations
Extract reports from database systems to assist with internal and customer needs.
Participate in comprehensive ongoing training to gain in-depth knowledge about the nuances of pay equity, including statistics, analytics methods, and pay equity laws.


About You


You are passionate about our mission to close pay gaps and create fairness in the workplace.
You are a self-starter who thrives working independently, with minimal supervision, in a collaborative, kind, and supportive environment.
You are deeply curious, willing to explore all aspects of the product to understand and identify new opportunities to meet customer needs.
You are comfortable manipulating data in Excel and can collaborate with team members to solve tough analytical problems.
You’re comfortable conducting online research, particularly quantitative research.
You are willing to ask questions and turn to others for support and expertise.
You’re excited to own and drive initiatives within Syndio that leverage and build your skills and interests.
This is a remote first role, but you must live and work from the Netherlands


Extra Credit


Data visualization skills (e.g. Tableau)
Statistical skills like conducting multivariate regression analysis, chi-squared tests, and other statistical tests
Experience with R or Python
Experience presenting quantitative findings to customers
Experience in analytics supporting compliance with the EU Pay Transparency Directive or country-specific pay gap reporting
Background in at least one of the following areas: compensation; diversity, equity & inclusion (DE&I); economics; or employment law


Role progression


Within 1 month, you’ll have completed a comprehensive and supportive onboarding process to help you understand the product, the business, and the pay equity space.
Within 3 months, you’ll be fully ramped and supporting internal team members with statistical analysis and research to meet customer needs.
Within 6 months, you’ll be working independently on analytics and research projects as a partner to internal team members and customers.


Why You'll Love It Here


Check out our Employee Experience page for more information on our Mission & Values, Work-Life Balance, Pay Transparency, Diversity, Culture, and Benefits.
💰 Competitive Compensation.The compensation range for this position is €51,000 - €60,000 per year. This includes holiday allowance. Final offer amounts are determined by factors such as experience and expertise.
🏆 Syndio Equity. So you can share in Syndio’s success.
🏝 25 days annually. We encourage our team to recharge when they need to, plus paid sick & safe time, compassion leave, and voting leave.
🏦 Pension Contribution
Fully remote model -


The Interview Overview

Below you'll find an outline of the interview plan for our Data Analyst position. Please note that this is what we expect the process to look like; we may ask you for supplemental information or require an additional step before making a final decision.


30 min interview with a member of our Talent Team
45 minute zoom interview with the Hiring Manager
Take home assignment
Three video interviews with several team members (Domain Expert, Analyst, Product) - 2 hours total


At Syndio, we're building a diverse team that values candor, curiosity, and community. If you share these values and are interested in joining us, we'd love to talk with you even if you don't 100% meet the "about you" listed here. We don't expect anyone to have all the answers, as long as you're willing to learn and grow with us.

Employees joining the Syndio team at this early stage of growth will impact this critical social issue and support a growing customer base (including Nordstrom, General Mills, Match Group, and others) to take tangible action on workplace fairness.

Syndio is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are building an inclusive and collaborative workplace as we grow, and we welcome team members regardless of gender/identity, sexual orientation, race or cultural background, religion, physical disability and age.


Show more

Title: Data Analyst, Eindhoven
HTML:
Are you passionate about using data to drive meaningful insights and business decisions? We are looking for a Data Analyst who can turn complex data into clear, actionable information to support our organization’s growth and strategy.

Data Analyst

Fulltime

Eindhoven

As a Data Analyst, you will work closely with cross-functional teams, leveraging data to create impactful analyses, reports, and dashboards that empower our stakeholders to make informed decisions.

In this role you work closely with our business stakeholders to interpret data and translate this into actionable recommendations.

What will you do?

  • Collect, clean, and analyze data to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for business improvement;
  • Develop and maintain dynamic dashboards and reports to provide real-time insights into performance metrics;
  • Work closely with business units to interpret data findings and translate them into actionable recommendations;
  • Develop and utilize predictive models to identify trends, forecast outcomes, and support data-driven decision-making;
  • Ensure data accuracy and completeness across all datasets, implementing checks and troubleshooting any discrepancies;
  • Collaborate with the data platform team (engineers) to improve data collection and storage processes;
  • Adhere to best practices in data governance, ensuring all stakeholders have access to reliable, quality data;
  • Collaborate with business to realize value out of their data;
  • Present findings in a clear, concise manner that resonates with both technical and non-technical audiences.

What do we ask of you?

  • Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field or equivalent work experience;
  • Minimum of 2 years of experience in a data analytics or similar role;
  • Proficient in SQL and data visualization tools (E.g., PowerBI, Tableau);
  • Familiarity with Python or R is a plus;
  • Strong problem-solving abilities with an eye for detail and data accuracy;
  • Able to translate complex data into insights that stakeholders can understand and act upon;
  • Experience and/ or affinity with Agile way of working;
  • You are proficient in communication in English and preferably also Dutch.

What do we offer you?

  • Competitive salary between €4.800,00 and €6.400,00 + 8% holiday allowance.
  • 27,5 Vacation days + excellent pension plan.
  • Phone + Laptop.
  • Hybrid work model – 50% from home for a great work-life balance.
  • Be part of a purpose-driven company that turns waste into new resources. A high-performing, close-knit Treasury team where your ideas matter.

Interested?

Please use the button to apply!

Do you have any questions? Please contact our recruiter, Michiel Deinema at via de button "Solliciteer nu" op deze pagina.

Did you know...

  • We encourage internal growth? Currently, 1 in 5 vacancies is filled internally.
  • We give new life to various waste streams for more than 150,000 customers and 2 million households?

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Dit bieden we jou


€ 3.869 tot € 6.449 bruto per maand (schaal 08 - 09) bij 36 uur
Een 13e maand en 8% vakantiegeld
10% Employee Benefit Budget
€ 1.400 ontwikkelbudget per jaar
Hybride werken: balans tussen thuiswerken en werken op kantoor (bij de meeste functies mogelijk)
Pensioen, met keuze voor de hoogte van je eigen bijdrage


Bekijk al onze arbeidsvoorwaarden.

Wil jij samen met de Data Analisten van het team Data & Insights (D&I) binnen SVP Business Clients inzichten creëren in klantreizen, de effectiviteit van proposities en op het gebied van pricing? Ons doel is om met die inzichten onze klantbediening te verbeteren en de doelen van Business Clients te realiseren. Kom jij ons team versterken als Senior Data Analyst?

Jij & jouw functie

Je bent onderdeel van het team Data & Insights van SVP Business Clients. Het team bestaat uit 8 Data Analisten en een Lead. SVP Business Clients is verantwoordelijk voor de proposities, klantreizen, pricing en portfolio management van het segment Business Clients in Nederland. Samen met je collega’s uit D&I zorg je ervoor dat we op basis van data relevante inzichten genereren om continue te kunnen verbeteren. Jij geeft gevraagd en ongevraagd fact based inzichten en bruikbare adviezen aan de stakeholders binnen Business Clients over hoe de totale klantbeleving en klanttevredenheid te verbeteren en de proposities voor onze klanten te verbeteren. Je werkt ook aan analyses om pricing en portfolio management te optimaliseren.

Het is een afwisselende functie waarbij je het ene moment code schrijft om klantinzichten uit de data te halen en het andere moment een model bouwt om bijvoorbeeld klanten te clusteren en de klantbediening meer op maat te maken. Soms bouw je een dashboard om de ontwikkeling van een bepaalde analyse door de tijd voor anderen inzichtelijk te maken. Je werkt nauw samen met de collega’s uit de andere SVP teams, denkt over databehoeftes en maakt een pakkende presentatie over je recentste data-analyse. Je combineert je passie voor klantbeleving, kennis van zakelijke bancaire processen met je analytische en technische vaardigheden om zo de juiste inzichten te generen en data gedreven advies te geven. In deze functie krijg je veel ruimte om te kijken welke invulling bij jou past.

Top 3 verantwoordelijkheden


Uitvoeren van data analyses om tot inzichten en adviezen te komen die jijzelf presenteert aan de stakeholders.
Inzetten van Analytics om de klantervaring inzichtelijk te maken en ervoor te zorgen dat diensten en producten continue verbeterd kunnen worden.
Het inspireren van je directe collega’s om hen te inspireren Analytics in te zetten om tot betere keuzes te komen.


Samen bereiken we meer dan alleen

We geloven in de kracht van verschillen. Juist door de verschillen van mensen te combineren worden we een nog betere bank. We zijn dan ook benieuwd naar wat jij toevoegt aan ons team.

Samenwerken is hierbij onze werkwijze; als één resultaatgericht binnen Rabobank. Over Rabobank gesproken: we zijn een Nederlandse bank, actief in 38 landen voor onze ruim 800.000 zakelijke klanten en ruim 8.000.000 particulieren klanten. Met deze klanten, onze leden en partners werken we zij aan zij aan een wereld waarin iedereen genoeg en gezond te eten heeft. Dichter bij huis werken we aan een land waarin gelukkige mensen wonen, werken en ondernemen.

Jij & jouw talent

Dat creativiteit, resultaatgerichtheid, impact, storytelling en een goed ontwikkeld analytisch vermogen onmisbaar zijn voor deze functie is logisch. Tevens is het belangrijk dat je jezelf in onderstaande checklist herkent:


Bachelor- of Masterdiploma
Bewezen ervaring met Power BI, DAX, SQL, Databricks
Resultaatgericht, een 'can-do' mentaliteit en proactief
Sterke analytische vaardigheden, in staat om snel te leren en complexe onderwerpen te begrijpen
Teamspeler: je kunt goed samenwerken met anderen om samen waarde te leveren aan onze organisatie
In staat om vooruit te denken en initiatief te nemen om te verbeteren en te optimaliseren
Kennis van en/of affiniteit met het zakelijke segment
Vloeiend communiceren in het Nederlands én Engels
Afhankelijk van je werkervaring als Data Analyst zal de inschaling worden bepaald


Jij & het sollicitatieproces


Solliciteer voor de vacature van Junior Data Analyst voor 28 mei 2025
Vragen over de functie? Robert-Frank Hofland, Lead Data, Insights & Portfolio Management via robert-frank.hofland@rabobank.nl
Informatie over de procedure? Daphny Gaal, Recruiter via daphny.gaal@rabobank.nl
Gesprekken vinden live plaats in Utrecht
De antwoorden op veel gestelde vragen vind je op rabobank.jobs/nl/veelgestelde-vragen.
Een beoordeling van de betrouwbaarheid behoort tot de procedure
We respecteren jouw privacy.
Show more

  • € 3.869 tot € 6.449 bruto per maand (schaal 08 - 09) bij 36 uur

  • € 1.400 ontwikkelbudget per jaar

Je combineert je passie voor klantbeleving, kennis van zakelijke bancaire processen met je analytische en technische vaardigheden om zo de juiste inzichten te generen en data gedreven advies te geven. In deze functie krijg je veel ruimte om te kijken welke invulling bij jou past.

Top 3 verantwoordelijkheden

  • Uitvoeren van data analyses om tot inzichten en adviezen te komen die jijzelf presenteert aan de stakeholders.
  • Inzetten van Analytics om de klantervaring inzichtelijk te maken en ervoor te zorgen dat diensten en producten continue verbeterd kunnen worden.
  • Het inspireren van je directe collega’s om hen te inspireren Analytics in te zetten om tot betere keuzes te komen.

Samen bereiken we meer dan alleen

We geloven in de kracht van verschillen. Juist door de verschillen van mensen te combineren worden we een nog betere bank. We zijn dan ook benieuwd naar wat jij toevoegt aan ons team.

Samenwerken is hierbij onze werkwijze; als één resultaatgericht binnen Rabobank. Over Rabobank gesproken: we zijn een Nederlandse bank, actief in 38 landen voor onze ruim 800.000 zakelijke klanten en ruim 8.000.000 particulieren klanten. Met deze klanten, onze leden en partners werken we zij aan zij aan een wereld waarin iedereen genoeg en gezond te eten heeft. Dichter bij huis werken we aan een land waarin gelukkige mensen wonen, werken en ondernemen.

Jij & jouw talent

Dat creativiteit, resultaatgerichtheid, impact, storytelling en een goed ontwikkeld analytisch vermogen onmisbaar zijn voor deze functie is logisch. Tevens is het belangrijk dat je jezelf in onderstaande checklist herkent:

  • Bachelor- of Masterdiploma
  • Bewezen ervaring met Power BI, DAX, SQL, Databricks
  • Resultaatgericht, een 'can-do' mentaliteit en proactief
  • Sterke analytische vaardigheden, in staat om snel te leren en complexe onderwerpen te begrijpen
  • Teamspeler: je kunt goed samenwerken met anderen om samen waarde te leveren aan onze organisatie
  • In staat om vooruit te denken en initiatief te nemen om te verbeteren en te optimaliseren
  • Kennis van en/of affiniteit met het zakelijke segment
  • Vloeiend communiceren in het Nederlands én Engels
  • Afhankelijk van je werkervaring als Data Analyst zal de inschaling worden bepaald

Jij & het sollicitatieproces

  • Solliciteer voor de vacature van Junior Data Analyst voor 28 mei 2025
  • Vragen over de functie? Robert-Frank Hofland, Lead Data, Insights & Portfolio Management via robert-frank.hofland@rabobank.nl
  • Informatie over de procedure? Daphny Gaal, Recruiter via daphny.gaal@rabobank.nl
  • Gesprekken vinden live plaats in Utrecht
  • De antwoorden op veel gestelde vragen vind je op rabobank.jobs/nl/veelgestelde-vragen.
  • Een beoordeling van de betrouwbaarheid behoort tot de procedure
  • We respecteren jouw privacy.

Title: Data Analist
Description:
Data Analist at Weheat

Contact

View Website

Description

Are you passionate about turning data into insights that drive innovation and better user experiences? As a Data Analyst within our multidisciplinary development team, you’ll help unlock the full potential of our connected air-to-water heat pumps. Thanks to our built-in 4G connectivity, we collect extensive performance and usage data from thousands of units in the field. Your role is to analyze this data and translate it into actionable insights for internal teams, B2B partners, and end-users.

From spotting product improvement opportunities to helping customers reduce energy usage and increase comfort—you’ll be at the heart of data-driven innovation. You'll collaborate closely with software developers, system architects, and service teams to design dashboards, monitor system behavior, and support predictive feature development.

This is a role for someone who enjoys diving deep into real-world datasets, making sense of complex systems, and seeing their work directly impact both business strategy and sustainable living. If you're curious, collaborative, and want to work with purpose, this job is for you.

‍

Requirements


A bachelor’s or master’s degree—this could be in data science, math, physics, computer science, engineering, or a similar field
Some experience working with data—this could be through studies, internships, or personal projects
Analytical mindset with a strong attention to detail
Familiarity with tools like Excel, Python, or SQL to work with and analyze data
Basic understanding of data visualization (e.g., using Power BI)
Willingness to learn and take initiative
Comfortable working in a team with people from different disciplines
Able to communicate your insights in a clear and practical way
Interest in energy systems, heat pumps, or IoT devices
Experience with real-world datasets or time-series data
Exposure to cloud platforms or dashboarding tools


‍

What do we offer you?


Join an adventure to redefine sustainable heating and make your mark on the tech industry's future.
Collaborate with elite engineers in an environment that pushes you to exceed your own limits every day.
Access to cutting-edge technology and machinery, ensuring our human talent always leads innovation.
The tools you need for success, including a laptop and iPhone, for work and personal use.
If you make overtime hours, these will be compensated either financially or as extra holidays – you decide.
Competitive benefits and a yearly bonus, recognizing your integral role in our success.
A total of 33 vacation days including public holidays, with the option to use overtime to obtain extra days.
Show more

Title: Internship Business Intelligence Reporting Analyst
Description:
Support the production of timely management information and reports as required by the Sales & Operational and Finance teams. Further analysis of information requirements and the creation of the necessary scripts required to produce the information in an accurate and effective manner. Optimizing existing queries in as efficient as possible manner as well as maintaining, a detailed reporting inventory and list of procedures linked to producing all current and future management information. Involvement and active participation in further developments regarding the PFNL data environment & landscape.




Responsibilities:

1: Reporting

Responsible for delivery of the regular Sales and Operations reports and Finance reports
Delivery of all current reports in-line with the reporting frequency & business needs
For new reports, define together with stakeholders the requirement and needs
Prioritize urgency and develop new reporting requirements without duplication of current reports
Implement agreed changes and push to the production environment
Communicate outcome to stakeholders




2: Governance and Control

Maintain the relevant processes including general governance (i.e. reporting inventory, documentation & up to date production environment)
Strict adherence to internal processes, principles and guidelines in use within BNP Paribas
Update script & process descriptions continuously
Update reporting inventory and working instruction required to produce after approval of manager
Adjust documentation after process and procedural changes




3: Projects & Innovation

Involvement in projects that affect the reporting landscape
Pro-actively identify opportunities to optimize the existing environment, specifically script optimization & end-user requirement validation for existing reports where possible to reduce run-time and data replication
Implementation of tools to assist reporting requirements




4: Other activities

Execution of ad hoc requests of head of planning & control
Back up for colleagues and execution of tasks on temporary basis
Communication within the team and other stakeholders to finalize the tasks







Job requirements:

Minimum bachelor degree
Work experience in SAS programming, SQL programming, Microsoft SQL Server 2000 databases
Demonstrated proficiency in using standard office software applications
Able to communicate fluently in English (mandatory) and Dutch (optional)
Project management experience a big plus
Knowledge and/or working experience with other programming languages a plus
Work experience in the banking/financial sector and/or international environment is a plus




Competences:

Result oriented
Analytical
Accurate
Pragmatic
Good communicator
Pro-active
Team player

Show more

Title: Data Analysts (DA)
Description:
Background

The primary objective of the Force Availability and Inventory Data Curation Support Service is to

organize, clean, and standardize NATO military force and availability data to enhance its quality and usability for military exploitation.

The service will facilitate a campaign of recurring data curation sprints in support of NCIA

Operational Analysis personnel.These data curation sprints will establish accessible, consistent and reliable forces and inventory datasets for exploitation by existing NATO Operations and Defence Planning software tools. These datasets will be exploited for a range of military-analytic purposes.Goal is to ensure that raw Force Availability and Inventory data reported by nations to NATO is cleaned and processed efficiently.This will maximise accuracy, completeness, and standardisation of format.

The Data Curation Support Service should deliver innovative and tailored techniques and tools

emerging from on-going Artificial Intelligence/Big Data revolution.Intent is to support NCIA Operational Analysis to work smarter, not harder, as a force multiplier to significantly enhance the quality of NATO military forces and availability data.

The Data Curation Support Service solution will tailor established data curation techniques to clean,

transform, and validate data declared to NATO by the nations.The Data Curation Support Service will select the appropriate tools and techniques for data curation. The proposed service solution should offer robust capabilities for cleaning and standardizing data, along with facilitating complex data transformations. Data validation is a critical process in data curation that ensures the accuracy, consistency, and reliability of data. It involves checking data against predefined rules, constraints, or formats to identify and rectify errors. The Data Curation Support Service must apply validation techniques such as data profiling, schema validation, and rule-based validation to ensure data quality, and deliver integration tools to streamline the process of combining data from multiple sources. By leveraging these tools and techniques, the Data Curation Support Service will significantly enhance the quality and usability of the NATO forces and inventories datasets, supporting better decision-making and analytical outcomes.

Duties/Role


Perform initial data assessment, data cleaning, and transformation; document findings and processes, perform domain or service data validation, statistical analysis, and ensure the analytic quality and integrity of the data
Effort Estimate: 119 person-days (7 DAs, full-time with travel to NCIA The Hague (NLD), 1 per domain/service (Land, Air, SBAMD, Maritime, Land Combat Service Support (CSS), Joint/Enabling (J/E), Special Operations Forces (SOF))
Duration: 3 Weeks (15 working days) for sprint execution. Additional up-front preparation time


Deliverables


A cleaned and standardized Forces & Inventory dataset ready for analysis and exploitation
Documentation detailing the data curation process, methodologies used, and decisions made
A report highlighting key findings and any issues encountered during the curation process


Outline Plan


Week 1: Planning and Initial Assessment
Day 1: FORCES & INVENTORY Data Curation Sprint Kick-off


ü Introduce team members and their roles

ü Outline Forces & Inventory Data Curation Sprint objectives, scope, and deliverables

ü Establish communication channels and tools for collaboration


Day 2-3: Data Assessment and Inventory


ü Collect and inventorise the dataset to be curated

ü Perform an initial assessment to identify data quality issues such as missing values, duplicates, and inconsistencies

ü Document the findings and develop a preliminary plan for data curation


Day 4-5: Strategy Development


ü Develop a detailed data curation approach based on the initial assessment

ü Define data quality criteria and standards to be achieved

ü Select tools and techniques for data cleaning, transformation, and validation


Week 2: Data Cleaning and Transformation
Day 6-8: Data Cleaning


ü Begin the data cleaning process by addressing the most critical issues identified in the assessment phase

ü Remove duplicates, correct errors, and handle missing values

ü Ensure consistency in data formats and values


Day 9-10: Data Transformation


ü Standardize data formats, such as date and time formats, numerical values, and categorical variables

ü Normalize data where necessary to ensure consistency across the dataset

ü Apply any necessary data enrichment processes, such as adding derived variables or external data


Day 10: Mid-Sprint Review


ü Conduct a mid-sprint review to assess progress

ü Discuss any challenges encountered and adjust the strategy as needed

ü Ensure alignment with Forces & Inventory Data Curation Sprint objectives and timelines


Week 3: Validation, Documentation, and Reporting
Day 11-13: Data Validation


ü Validate the curated data against the defined quality criteria

ü Perform checks for accuracy, completeness, and consistency

ü Conduct peer reviews to ensure the data meets the required standards


Day 14: Documentation


ü Document the data curation process, including methodologies used, issues encountered, and resolutions implemented

ü Create a data dictionary and metadata documentation for the curated dataset


Day 15: Final Review and Reporting


ü Conduct a final review of the curated dataset

ü Prepare a comprehensive report summarizing the data curation process, key findings, and any recommendations for future data management

ü Present the curated dataset and documentation to stakeholders for feedback and approval

Title: HD- HR Data Analyst
Description:
Hunter Douglas is the world’s leading manufacturer of window coverings and a major manufacturer of architectural products. We are a brand that you know and trust. With more than 100 years of innovation, we’ve defined our industry with proprietary products that deliver revolutionary style and functionality and can be found in millions of homes and commercial buildings globally.




We are searching for candidates that are driven, intelligent, creative, and entrepreneurial. By offering challenging and accelerated opportunities for growth, powered by a shared hunger for success, we create a space for your career to thrive. In return for your expertise, we are committed to providing competitive and robust total compensation and benefit packages to ensure you feel valued. Our dream is to become the fastest growing, most loved, window covering company in the world. What’s yours?

Hunter Douglas is seeking a ZBB People Specialist who will play a pivotal role in managing, analysing, and enhancing the visibility of people-related costs across the EMEA region, supporting the Zero-Based Budgeting (ZBB) transformation at Hunter Douglas.




In this role you will ensure alignment of actuals, budgets, and forecasts while partnering closely with HRBPs to create consistent routines, dashboards, and data-driven insights. This position identifies risks and opportunities, recommends KPIs, and seeks automation opportunities, including AI, for scalable and sustainable people cost management.  




Key responsibilities:





Analyse and report on ZBB People performance across EMEA, including key cost drivers (e.g., inflation, merit increases, one-off payments, accruals, new hires, exits and others)


Update the People Forecast through regular meetings with HR Business Partners and Division Heads of Finance


Ensure consistency and compliance of payroll-related policies across EMEA


Support the annual EMEA People Budget process


Provide analytical support for compensation reviews and planning with HRBPs


Develop visibility tools and dashboards to improve people cost management across functions


Identify and implement automation opportunities (e.g., dashboards, AI applications)


Contribute to the expansion of the ZBB People cost model from SG&A into COGS areas (e.g., direct labour, overheads).





Interested in this role? Here’s what we’re looking for:





Degree educated, preferably in Finance, HR, Business, Economics, or a related field.


Strong analytical background with advanced Excel skills and a continuous learning mindset.


Preferred experience with compensation programs, payroll systems, and MBO/bonus/ performance frameworks


Exposure to dashboard development tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau) is advantageous.


Experience or interest in automation and AI is a strong plus.


Excellent communication skills and ability to collaborate across matrix structures.


Resilient, hands-on, and eager to grow in a fast-paced, performance-driven culture





If this sounds like you, we would love to hear from you. Please apply by submitting your resume/CV.




At Hunter Douglas, you’ll be part of a forward-thinking team committed to excellence. We offer a supportive environment for professional growth, competitive compensation, and the opportunity to make a real difference.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst Marketplace
Description:
About The Role

At MediaMarkt, we’re shaping the future of commerce by placing data at the heart of every decision. As part of our fast-growing Marketplace team, you'll play a key role in driving the performance of our third-party sellers and improving the overall customer experience. This role offers a unique opportunity to work in a dynamic, entrepreneurial setting within a large organization, with real impact from day one.

As a Data Analyst in the Marketplace team, your responsibilities include:


Analyzing Marketplace performance: Dive into complex datasets to identify opportunities for growth and optimization across product assortment, pricing, fulfillment, and seller performance.
Providing actionable insights: Collaborate with category managers, partner onboarding teams, and business development to turn data into strategies that improve seller success and customer satisfaction.
Optimizing Marketplace operations: Build and implement reporting tools that enhance visibility on KPIs like GMV, take rate, delivery speed, and return rates. Support automation of operational processes using data-driven approaches.
Building dashboards: Create and maintain Power BI dashboards to track seller performance, product trends, and customer behavior across the Marketplace.
Partnering cross-functionally: Work closely with the central Data & Analytics team, Marketplace Business Development, and Tech teams to align data needs and drive scalable solutions.
Contributing to innovation: Support experiments and A/B tests to validate new Marketplace features and improvements.


Your Profile

You thrive in a fast-paced environment and are eager to make a measurable impact. You are both analytically sharp and business-minded. You love transforming data into real business value—especially when it helps a growing ecosystem of partners and customers.

We Also Expect


Master’s degree in Economics, Econometrics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or a related field;
2-3 years’ experience as a data analyst (preferably in e-commerce or marketplace environment);
Proficiency in SQL and Python or R;
Experience with Power BI or Looker;
Understanding of cloud data platforms (GCP/BigQuery preferred);
Excellent English (Dutch is a plus);
Experience in managing data projects, with strong communication skills to influence stakeholders.


About Us

For us"Let's Go!" is not just a slogan, it is an attitude. We love technology and we want to excite. We have fun and want to inspire. We are number one in Benelux and Europe. We influence how people experience and use technology. We make the difference and are there for our customers, through all channels. Together with our 50.000 employees across Europe, we create the shopping experience of the future.

Our best solutions arise when diverse perspectives come together. Diversity is key to achieving our vision of becoming the Experience Champion in Consumer Electronics. We value diversity, promote equal opportunities, and foster inclusion—join our team!

What's in it for you?


A fantastic workplace in the heart of Rotterdam.
Flexible work environment: Choose between working from home, the office, or elsewhere.
Attractive benefits and plenty of opportunities for development and growth.
Freedom and responsibility to shape your role and bring innovative ideas to life.
At MediaMarkt, we value boldness—as entrepreneurs within the company, we offer you the chance to develop quickly and in various areas.
Enjoy not only an amazing work environment but also:
30 vacation days
Attractive employee discounts
A collective health insurance plan
Corporate fitness benefits
Discounts on various insurance products
Show more

  • Optimizing Marketplace operations: Build and implement reporting tools that enhance visibility on KPIs like GMV, take rate, delivery speed, and return rates. Support automation of operational processes using data-driven approaches.
  • Building dashboards: Create and maintain Power BI dashboards to track seller performance, product trends, and customer behavior across the Marketplace.
  • Partnering cross-functionally: Work closely with the central Data & Analytics team, Marketplace Business Development, and Tech teams to align data needs and drive scalable solutions.
  • Contributing to innovation: Support experiments and A/B tests to validate new Marketplace features and improvements.

Your Profile

You thrive in a fast-paced environment and are eager to make a measurable impact. You are both analytically sharp and business-minded. You love transforming data into real business value—especially when it helps a growing ecosystem of partners and customers.

We Also Expect

  • Master’s degree in Economics, Econometrics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or a related field;
  • 2-3 years’ experience as a data analyst (preferably in e-commerce or marketplace environment);
  • Proficiency in SQL and Python or R;
  • Experience with Power BI or Looker;
  • Understanding of cloud data platforms (GCP/BigQuery preferred);
  • Excellent English (Dutch is a plus);
  • Experience in managing data projects, with strong communication skills to influence stakeholders.

About Us

For us"Let's Go!" is not just a slogan, it is an attitude. We love technology and we want to excite. We have fun and want to inspire. We are number one in Benelux and Europe. We influence how people experience and use technology. We make the difference and are there for our customers, through all channels. Together with our 50.000 employees across Europe, we create the shopping experience of the future.

Our best solutions arise when diverse perspectives come together. Diversity is key to achieving our vision of becoming the Experience Champion in Consumer Electronics. We value diversity, promote equal opportunities, and foster inclusion—join our team!

What's in it for you?

  • A fantastic workplace in the heart of Rotterdam.
  • Flexible work environment: Choose between working from home, the office, or elsewhere.
  • Attractive benefits and plenty of opportunities for development and growth.
  • Freedom and responsibility to shape your role and bring innovative ideas to life.
  • At MediaMarkt, we value boldness—as entrepreneurs within the company, we offer you the chance to develop quickly and in various areas.
  • Enjoy not only an amazing work environment but also:
    • 30 vacation days
    • Attractive employee discounts
    • A collective health insurance plan
    • Corporate fitness benefits
    • Discounts on various insurance products

Title: Data Analyst
Company: SDG Group in the Netherlands – A Division of Alten NL
Description:
Vacature: Ervaren Data Analyst – SDG Groep | ALTEN Nederland (Groningen)

📍 Locatie: Groningen, Nederland

📅 Dienstverband: Fulltime

🏢 Organisatie: ALTEN Nederland – SDG (Software Development & Data Group)

📊 Ervaringsniveau: Medior / Senior




Geef richting aan data-gedreven innovatie bij ALTEN Nederland

Ben jij een ervaren Data Analyst op zoek naar een nieuwe uitdaging binnen een dynamische en kennisgedreven omgeving? De SDG-groep van ALTEN Nederland groeit, en daarom zijn wij op zoek naar versterking voor ons team in Groningen.




Bij ALTEN werk je aan uitdagende projecten voor toonaangevende opdrachtgevers in onder andere de hightech, energie, zorg en financiële sector. Als Data Analyst binnen de SDG-groep speel je een sleutelrol in het vertalen van data naar waardevolle inzichten en strategische beslissingen.




Wat ga je doen?

Analyseren, interpreteren en visualiseren van complexe datasets
Meedenken met klanten over data-gedreven verbeteringen en oplossingen
Ontwerpen van dashboards en rapportages met tools zoals Power BI of Tableau
Vertalen van businessvraagstukken naar concrete data-analyses (SQL, Python, R)
Samenwerken met multidisciplinaire teams (developers, engineers, consultants)
Bijdragen aan projecten van data-acquisitie tot presentatie en advies




Wat neem je mee?

Minimaal 3 jaar ervaring als Data Analyst, BI Consultant of vergelijkbare functie
Sterk analytisch denkvermogen en probleemoplossend vermogen
Ervaring met SQL en datavisualisatietools (bijv. Power BI, Tableau)
Kennis van Python, R of vergelijkbare data-analysetalen
Bekendheid met werken in agile teams en consultancy-omgevingen
Goede beheersing van de Engelse en Nederlandse taal




Wat bieden wij jou?

Werken aan innovatieve projecten bij topbedrijven in Nederland
Een professionele, collegiale werkomgeving binnen een internationale organisatie
Volop ruimte voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling
Aantrekkelijke arbeidsvoorwaarden en flexibele (hybride) werkmogelijkheden
Een open, no-nonsense cultuur met focus op kennisdeling en samenwerking




Klaar voor de volgende stap in jouw data-carrière?




Ben jij nieuwsgierig, resultaatgericht en wil je écht impact maken met data? Sluit je aan bij het SDG-team van ALTEN Nederland in Groningen.




👉 Solliciteer direct via LinkedIn of neem contact met ons op voor meer informatie!

Title: BI Consultant
Description:
Over Cegeka

Cegeka Business Solutions is een toonaangevend ICT-bedrijf dat zich richt op het leveren van hoogwaardige, klantgerichte oplossingen. We combineren diepgaande branchekennis met een sterke expertise in Microsoft Dynamics 365. Onze no-nonsense aanpak en betrouwbaarheid maken ons tot een vertrouwde partner voor veel organisaties.




We zijn op zoek naar een (Junior) BI Consultant die zich graag verder wil ontwikkelen op het gebied van Business Intelligence, specifiek in de combinatie met Microsoft Dynamics 365 F&O, Power BI en andere tools binnen het Microsoft landschap.




Wat ga je doen als BI Consultant?

Als BI Consultant maak je deel uit van een ervaren BI-team waarbij de nadruk ligt op Power BI en klantgerichte consultancy. Je ondersteunt bij het opzetten, beheren en optimaliseren van BI-oplossingen voor onze klanten. Je krijgt de kans om hands-on ervaring op te doen en tegelijkertijd krijg je volop ruimte om veel te leren en je vaardigheden verder te ontwikkelen binnen een professionele en ondersteunende omgeving.




Jouw taken:

Modelleren van data en het bouwen van datavisualisaties met Power BI;
Ondersteunen bij het verzamelen, analyseren en structureren van data;
Onder begeleiding van ervaren collega's meewerken aan de ontwikkeling van BI-rapportages en dashboards;
Ondersteunen bij het testen van datamodellen, datasets en rapportages op kwaliteit en performance.
Documenteren van processen, datastromen en oplossingsrichtingen.
Bijdragen aan interne kennisdeling en leren van best practices.







Wat breng jij mee?

Je hebt een afgeronde HBO- of WO-opleiding in de richting van Informatica, Data Science, Business Intelligence, Bedrijfskunde of vergelijkbaar.
Je hebt interesse in data, BI en het Microsoft-ecosysteem (Dynamics 365, Power BI, Azure).
Je bent leergierig, analytisch en werkt gestructureerd.
Je kunt goed samenwerken en communiceert helder
Kennis van Excel, Power BI, SQL, DAX, Fabric of Microsoft Azure is een pré, maar geen vereiste – we helpen je graag om dit te leren.
Je spreekt en schrijft vloeiend Nederlands en hebt een goede beheersing van de Engelse taal.










Wat hebben wij jou te bieden?

Samen met gemotiveerde en deskundige collega’s werken aan digitale oplossingen die jouw klanten daadwerkelijk helpen bij het bereiken van hun doelen;
Een salaris dat past bij jouw kennis en kunde;
Uitstekende secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden, waaronder 26 vakantiedagen en de mogelijkheid bij te kopen, beleggingspension, een leaseauto en bonus;
Interessant en leerzaam werk bij een TOP Employer met veel ruimte voor eigen initiatief;
Aandacht voor jouw werk-privé balans, flexibele werktijden en hybride werken vanuit huis, bij de klant of op een van onze kantoren;
Veel gelegenheid om aan je persoonlijke ontwikkeling te werken met opleidingen, cursussen, trainingen én met werk dat jou helpt om je grenzen te verleggen.

Title: Data-analist
Description:
Zie jij het als een uitdaging om data om te zetten in waardevolle inzichten? Wil jij jouw analytische talent inzetten om processen slimmer,efficiënter en toekomstgericht te maken? Dan zijn wij op zoek naar jou! Solliciteer direct en maak het verschil met jouw data-gedreven aanpak.




Hier ga je werken

Het bedrijf is een toonaangevende dienstverlener actief in heel Nederland. De organisatie is volop in beweging en hecht veel waarde aan digitalisering en datagedreven werken. Met 5000 medewerkers en 650 partners is het één van de grootste dienstverleners van Nederland.




De organisatie werkt met verschillende technologieën die de werkzaamheden van hun werknemers efficiënter maken. Deze technologieën creëren een stroom aan data die zeer nuttig is voor de organisatie. Voor het data-team zijn we op zoek naar een enthousiaste Data Analist die graag meedenkt aan een moderne, toekomstbestendige data-infrastructuur.




Als Data Analist speel je een sleutelrol in het omzetten van data naar waardevolle inzichten die direct bijdragen aan het verbeteren van de dienstverlening. Je werkt samen met collega's uit het data-team aan innovatieve projecten rondom sensoren, robotica, machine learning en process mining. Met jouw analyses help je processen slimmer, sneller en efficiënter te maken. Je analyseert data uit verschillende bronnen, bouwt dashboards en rapportages, en geeft advies op basis van jouw bevindingen. Je zorgt ervoor dat data begrijpelijk wordt gepresenteerd en dat de organisatie hierop kan sturen.




Klaar om met jouw inzichten echte impact te maken? Solliciteer dan direct en versterk dit innovatieve team! Heb je vragen of wil je meer weten over de rol? Neem dan gerust contact op met Eva Pelle van Experis via 06-38685915 of eva.pelle@experis.nl!




Dit ga je doen

Verzamelen, combineren en analyseren van data uit verschillende bronnen.
Ontwikkelen en onderhouden van dashboards, rapportages en datavisualisaties.
Signaleren van trends, knelpunten en kansen ter ondersteuning van bedrijfsbeslissingen.
Meewerken aan projecten rondom procesoptimalisatie, sensordata, machine learning en process mining.
Presenteren van analyses en aanbevelingen aan interne stakeholders.
Bewaken van de datakwaliteit en zorgen voor heldere, betrouwbare datasets.




Dit neem je mee

Aantoonbaar HBO-WO werk- en denkniveau;
Sterk analytisch denkvermogen en oog voor detail.
Vaardig in het vertalen van data naar begrijpelijke inzichten voor de organisatie.
Ervaring met Power BI en basiskennis van SQL is een pré.
Proactieve houding en de vaardigheid om zelfstandig te werken.




Dit krijg je

Een bruto maandsalaris tussen €2.500,- en €4.000,- o.b.v. 40 uur.
€50,- tegemoetkoming in je ziektekosten (bovenop je brutosalaris).
8,33% vakantiegeld en 25 tot 27 vakantiedagen.
Laptop, tablet en telefoon van de zaak.
Goede studiemogelijkheden en opleidingsbudget.
Reiskostenvergoeding van €0,23/km of volledige OV-vergoeding.
Uitstekende pensioenregeling.
Flexibiliteit: één vaste kantoordag (maandag) en een tweede dag naar keuze.
Werken in een omgeving waar jouw analyses écht impact hebben en waar je wordt gestimuleerd om je verder te ontwikkelen.

Title: Intern Data Analyst
Description:
Intern Data Analyst bij Exelerating




Functie-eisen:

WO-opleiding, in de richting van bedrijfseconomie, bedrijfskunde, wiskunde of econometrie.
Je bevindt je in de eindfase van je bachelor of bent net begonnen met een master.
Affiniteit met data en vermogensbeheer.
Beheersing van SQL is een pre.
Analytisch denkvermogen.
Beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal.




Wat bieden wij?

Unieke mogelijkheid om de institutionele sector te leren kennen en begrijpen.
Mogelijkheid om je te ontwikkelen in data-analytics.
Fulltime stage (5 dagen per week).
Duur van de stage: 4 tot 6 maanden.
25 vakantiedagen (op fulltime basis).
Flexibele werklocatie.
Startdatum in overleg, mogelijk vanaf mei 2025.




Activiteiten:

Data verzamelen.
Data verwerken.
Nieuws bijhouden.
Analyses voor gebruikers maken.




Onze uitdaging

Onze uitdaging is om inzicht te krijgen in €9.500+ miljard aan Europees institutioneel belegd vermogen. We willen weten in welke beleggingscategorieën dit vermogen is belegd en welke investment managers hierbij betrokken zijn. Dit doen we door openbare data over de Europese institutionele markt te verzamelen en te analyseren. Met zelf ontwikkelde software zetten we deze data om in analyses. Dagelijks scrapen wij duizenden websites en documenten om de nodige informatie te verzamelen.




Vervolgens analyseren we de beleggingsportefeuilles van institutionele beleggers zoals pensioenfondsen en verzekeraars. We onderzoeken in welke categorieën zij beleggen, hoeveel zij investeren, en welke investment managers deze assets beheren. Deze data is via het Exelerating platform beschikbaar voor onze gebruikers. Onze gebruikers, waaronder de grootste investment managers en consultants in Europa, gebruiken dagelijks het Exelerating platform om op de hoogte te blijven van ontwikkelingen in de institutionele markt.




Functieomschrijving

Als Intern Data Analyst ben je nauw betrokken bij het volledige dataproces, van begin tot eind. De nadruk van je werkzaamheden ligt op het verzamelen en verwerken van zowel kwalitatieve als kwantitatieve data. Daarnaast ondersteun je onze gebruikers bij het maken van analyses over de institutionele markt. Gebruikers willen bijvoorbeeld weten wie er in een bepaalde beleggingscategorie investeert, hoeveel er belegd is, en wat de beleggingsresultaten zijn geweest. Tijdens je werkzaamheden verwachten wij dat je kritisch naar ons platform kijkt en voorstellen doet om dit te optimaliseren.




Wat bieden wij nog meer?

Op ons expertisegebied zijn wij marktleider in Nederland. Wij werken samen met meer dan zestig van de grootste investment managers en consultants actief in de Europese institutionele sector. Onze klanten zitten niet alleen in Nederland, maar ook in het Verenigd Koninkrijk, Duitsland, Scandinavië en Zwitserland. Wij bieden jou een unieke mogelijkheid om de institutionele wereld te leren kennen en begrijpen. Je leert alle ins en outs van de Europese institutionele markt (€ 9.500+ miljard). Wij leren je alles wat je moet weten over hoe Europese institutionele beleggers investeren en hoe zij onderling verbonden zijn. Aan het einde van je stage weet je precies wat investment managers en institutionele beleggers zijn en hoe zij opereren.




Sollicitatieprocedure:

Ben jij enthousiast over deze functie en wil je deel uitmaken van ons team? We zien je motivatiebrief en cv graag tegemoet via info@exelerating.com. Na ontvangst van je sollicitatie nodigen we je uit voor een kennismakingsgesprek bij ons op kantoor aan de Herengracht 162 in Amsterdam. Tijdens dit gesprek leren we je beter kennen en bespreken we jouw vaardigheden en ervaring. Na een succesvol eerste gesprek volgt een tweede gesprek waarin we dieper ingaan op je achtergrond en jouw match met ons team. Als alles goed verloopt, nemen we snel contact met je op om je te feliciteren en de startdatum te bespreken.

Show more

Dagelijks scrapen wij duizenden websites en documenten om de nodige informatie te verzamelen.


Vervolgens analyseren we de beleggingsportefeuilles van institutionele beleggers zoals pensioenfondsen en verzekeraars. We onderzoeken in welke categorieën zij beleggen, hoeveel zij investeren, en welke investment managers deze assets beheren. Deze data is via het Exelerating platform beschikbaar voor onze gebruikers. Onze gebruikers, waaronder de grootste investment managers en consultants in Europa, gebruiken dagelijks het Exelerating platform om op de hoogte te blijven van ontwikkelingen in de institutionele markt.


Functieomschrijving

Als Intern Data Analyst ben je nauw betrokken bij het volledige dataproces, van begin tot eind. De nadruk van je werkzaamheden ligt op het verzamelen en verwerken van zowel kwalitatieve als kwantitatieve data. Daarnaast ondersteun je onze gebruikers bij het maken van analyses over de institutionele markt. Gebruikers willen bijvoorbeeld weten wie er in een bepaalde beleggingscategorie investeert, hoeveel er belegd is, en wat de beleggingsresultaten zijn geweest. Tijdens je werkzaamheden verwachten wij dat je kritisch naar ons platform kijkt en voorstellen doet om dit te optimaliseren.


Wat bieden wij nog meer?

Op ons expertisegebied zijn wij marktleider in Nederland. Wij werken samen met meer dan zestig van de grootste investment managers en consultants actief in de Europese institutionele sector. Onze klanten zitten niet alleen in Nederland, maar ook in het Verenigd Koninkrijk, Duitsland, Scandinavië en Zwitserland. Wij bieden jou een unieke mogelijkheid om de institutionele wereld te leren kennen en begrijpen. Je leert alle ins en outs van de Europese institutionele markt (€ 9.500+ miljard). Wij leren je alles wat je moet weten over hoe Europese institutionele beleggers investeren en hoe zij onderling verbonden zijn. Aan het einde van je stage weet je precies wat investment managers en institutionele beleggers zijn en hoe zij opereren.


Sollicitatieprocedure:

Ben jij enthousiast over deze functie en wil je deel uitmaken van ons team? We zien je motivatiebrief en cv graag tegemoet via info@exelerating.com. Na ontvangst van je sollicitatie nodigen we je uit voor een kennismakingsgesprek bij ons op kantoor aan de Herengracht 162 in Amsterdam. Tijdens dit gesprek leren we je beter kennen en bespreken we jouw vaardigheden en ervaring. Na een succesvol eerste gesprek volgt een tweede gesprek waarin we dieper ingaan op je achtergrond en jouw match met ons team. Als alles goed verloopt, nemen we snel contact met je op om je te feliciteren en de startdatum te bespreken.

Title: Power BI Consultant
HTML:
Your role as a Power BI Consultant


As a Power BI Consultant, you advise our customers on data & analytics ambitions and challenges. During the exploratory discussions with our (potential) customers, you will recognise their goals, bottlenecks, and needs. You translate them into a tangible solution using Power BI. You do much more than just creating dashboards.


In your role as a Power BI Consultant, you develop data models and analytics solutions on which our customers can make intelligent data-driven decisions. Of course, your solutions are beautiful, they work intuitively, and they provide the correct information. In addition to your technical skills, you also have an eye for the business that enables you to operate as a true advisor. You do not simply create what your customers ask for, but what they need. After all, it is your profession!


Your most important tasks as a Power BI Consultant:


  • You analyse the ambitions and challenges of our customers;
  • You develop good management information for your customers based on your analysis;
  • You develop robust data models and create effective visual appealing dashboards in Power BI;
  • You work with Microsoft Azure Technology and Power BI.


What does Rockfeather have to offer?


Rockfeather gives you the complete freedom to continue your development as a Power BI specialist or become a more all-around Data & Analytics Consultant. You want to give your experience an extra boost by using the latest technologies and not getting stuck in existing technology and with the same customers. The variety of ambitious customers and the latest technology are more the rule than the exception for us. Together we are passionate about the possibilities of data-driven working and offering the best solution for our customers. Our teams with Data Analytics, Data Integration, Data Science, and Low-code colleagues share their knowledge and network so that together we can realise impactful projects and unique solutions. We understand that the quality of your life determines the quality of your work. That is why we offer a complete package to take good care of yourself and your loved ones.

Just like every other company, we think we are unique, and we are 'the place to be.' The truth is that we are not 'the place to be' for a lot of people. If you are looking for a place to build a career in our 'management' or if you like everything clean and crisp between 9:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m., then look somewhere else.


At Rockfeather, we put craftsmanship first. We are passionate about what we do; embracing technology to empower ambitious people. If you want all the freedom and support to develop your skills to become the next ‘data guru’, then Rockfeather is the place for you. We also offer the opportunity to buy shares of the team you work in, the ultimate way to bring your entrepreneurship to the next level!


Job requirements


What do you bring to the table?


  • You preferably have a completed Bachelor's degree. But in the end, your skills and attitude make the real difference.
  • You have a minimum of one year of experience with Power BI, and preferably also DAX and SQL;
  • You have proven experience with having helped to translate needs into robust data models;
  • You have knowledge of information analysis, KPI development and Data modelling;
  • Of course, you have good communication skills and a high level of customer and quality awareness;
  • You have the flexibility to work and maintain focus in an evolving environment;
  • You like to share knowledge with others, and you're a team player and networker;
  • You are result-driven and customer-oriented because you own the process and consistently deliver top-notch quality;
  • You like to roll up your sleeves, and you have a talent for spotting new opportunities.
  • You live in the Netherlands. We need you to be local. So NL Based only!

Title: Data Analytics internship: Business Intelligence Analyst
HTML:
Introduction

The project that our operational excellence work stream of the DUV machines, works on has as a main goal to work with DoA (Dead on Arrival) process and support root cause analysis for DoAs. For this the team is working with different stakeholders from different sectors (Development & Engineering, Supply Chain, Customer Support etc.) within ASML.

Your assignment

As an intern you will be working with the Reporting and Data analysts in the below domains:

  • Data validation and feasibility studies for improvement of data quality;
  • Connecting with stakeholders to increase automation and live data visibility;
  • Data analysis for internal stakeholders for data obtained via SAP, Spotfire;
  • Investigate and improve consistency of data and Interface across Reports and Spotfire dashboards.

This is an (bachelor/master) apprentice internship, for the duration of 6 months, 4-5 days a week. The starting is in Seotember 2025.

Your profile

To be the perfect match for this internship you:

  • Have background in engineering or data analytics (or similar);
  • Have knowledge of MS Excel and basic data analysis principles;
  • Are capable of translating requirements to potential solutions;
  • Are analytical and think logically;
  • Knowledge of Spotfire, SAP is a bonus.

Other requirements you need to meet

  • You are enrolled at an educational institute for the entire duration of the internship;
  • If you are a non-EU citizen, studying in the Netherlands, your university is willing to sign the documents relevant for doing an internship (i.e., Nuffic agreement).
  • You need to be located in the Netherlands to be perform your internship. In case you ‘re currently living/studying outside of the Netherlands, your CV/motivation letter includes the willingness to relocate.

This position requires access to controlled technology, as defined in the United States Export Administration Regulations (15 C.F.R.

  • 730, et seq.). Qualified candidates must be legally authorized to access such controlled technology prior to beginning work. Business demands may require ASML to proceed with candidates who are immediately eligible to access controlled technology.

Diversity and inclusion

ASML is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values and respects the importance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. It is the policy of the company to recruit, hire, train and promote persons in all job titles without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, or gender identity. We recognize that diversity and inclusion is a driving force in the success of our company.

Need to know more about applying for a job at ASML? Read our frequently asked questions.

Title: Analytics Expert
Description:
Are you our new colleague?

We’re looking for a Analytics Expert at Randstad Global

Diemen - Netherlands, hybrid, fulltime




BR&AF

The business risk and audit function (BR&AF) provides assurance and recommendations to the Executive Board and the Audit Committee on Randstad Group’s (risk) management, control and governance practices. Therefore the department facilitates in setting governance standards. It provides advice on internal control improvements, it conducts audits, special investigations and assignments worldwide on request of the Executive Board and Audit Committee. BR&AF’s responsibility includes the quarterly reporting based on: the risk and internal control self assessments, audit results, discussions on internal control weaknesses and analysis of the key risks reported throughout the company's management structure. This also substantiates the Group’s in-control statements.




The global function consists of team members operating through hubs spread over 4 continents. The team is organized in a matrix consisting of control & audit focus teams on business and functional areas (e.g. digital, talent, client, back office & shared service centers and fraud & forensics) and partners that are the linking pin to operating units (business risk & audit partners) with a global view. A support group is set up for professional practice, learning & development, quality improvement & methods, analytics and PMO.




Representatives of the different groups (Focus teams, BR&A Partners and support group) form the BR&AF core management team that reports to the Managing Director BR&AF.




how you will contribute

You are part of the Business Risk & Audit Function (BR&AF) that covers all business operations related to Clients, Talents and our (shared) Back-, Mid- and Front offices, as well as our Accounting & Reporting and other specialist functions like HR. With your data analytics experience you enhance BR&AF's delivery to management bringing insight on Randstad's in-control situation.




As analytics expert you:

support building and rolling out the BR&AF analytics roadmap.
perform technical data analytics, including data visualization, data reports, data cleansing scripts, and data validation as part audits, risk management, internal controls support and combined assurance projects and activities.
assist in taking the audit projects in Randstad to the next level through researching and evaluating new analytics concepts and technologies (e.g. generative AI/machine learning) in support of BR&F practices.
collaborate as an integrated part of audits teams in the definition and execution of analytics.
support non analytics professionals within the function growing their capabilities enabling them to leverage analytics more effectively.
are willing to travel. As the standard office locations for the BR&AF team are organized in hubs, like in the country mentioned, travelling is estimated to be about 20% to 30% of the job.




what you will be doing

as co-creator support the analytics lead in the development and roll out the data analytics roadmap
lead the build out of the control structures to ensure sustainable analytics technology including data retention and clean up logic
participate in risk assessments, periodic sampling, and data-driven root cause analysis.
perform data analysis procedures, including data profiling, data mining, trend analysis, and predictive modeling. Apply statistical techniques and visualization tools to analyze large volumes of data and identify patterns, anomalies, and potential audit risks.
perform data collection, clean, analyze and report processes from various internal and external applications and databases, as well as other data sources when necessary.
interpret the results of data analysis and provide meaningful insights to audit teams and BR&AF management.
review and validate data analytics work performed by audit teams.
identify areas for improvement and implement corrective actions as needed.
act as a resource for colleagues with less expertise.




who will you work with

business risk & audit partners
partners/communities within applications operations and data management both at randstad global as well as in our operating companies
external co-source partners
IT security, data protection, information security and business continuity communities within the Randstad organization.
BR&AF stakeholders/clients within the business including local MT's, process and control owners




what you will bring

You bring a hands-on and in depth understanding of data science and analytics concepts and structures combined with a drive to develop and roll out impactful analytics. With your drive for results you are able to balance short term delivery needs with mid term needs for standardization and sustainability of solutions. You understand the people, process, and technology dilemma's that go into building out analytics and are able to translate this into practical business cases both within the risk & audit function as well as over other functions.




As an Analytics Expert you:

have minimum 8 years of relevant experience
have minimum a master degree in business information management, computer science, or Mathematics and related accreditation (e.g. CAP/CDMP/CISA/CISSP)
have level BEC B1/B2 or higher Business English preferably combined with proficiency in one of the following languages: Dutch, Spanish, French, Italian and /or German
have a strong independent mindset
are experienced in international stakeholder management & change
are an innovative thinker that challenges the status quo
have an agile and flexible working style and passion for on the job coaching and development
have a pragmatic, realistic yet ambitious vision on analytics
deliver on the roll out of analytics through the 3 pillars of people, process and technology.
integrate technological developments into practices (e.g. generative AI)
effectively connect and take people with different backgrounds allowing non analytics experts to take ownership of initiatives and results




your competencies

Within Randstad we defined the following Human Forward Leadership competencies:

delighting people: connect people (client, talent, employee, society), building strong client relationships and delivering client-centric solutions.
performing today: resourcefulness securing and developing resources effectively and efficiently.
leading change: manages ambiguity operating effectively, even when things are not certain or the way forward is not clear.
securing the future: drives vision and purpose painting a compelling picture of the vision and strategy that motivates others into action.
creating clarity: showing line of sight: making sense of complex, high quantity and sometimes contradictory information to effectively solve problems and provides direction, is delegating and removing obstacles to get work done
courage to challenge: shows courage and confidence to speak up skillfully, challenging others even when they are confronted with resistance or unfamiliar circumstances
collaborates, reaches out, you excel in organizational sensitivity: manoeuvering comfortably through complex policy, process and people-related organizational dynamics recognizing the value that different perspectives and cultures bring to an organization




what’s in it for you

We put people at the heart of everything we do. Our employment conditions reflect this and are in accordance with the applicable (local) Randstad employment policies and related personnel guide.

We want our teams and talent to reflect the rich diversity of the societies we serve. We thrive for an environment of belonging, safety and confidence. So everyone can bring their whole selves to work and flourish. Learn more about equity, diversity, inclusion and belonging at randstad here.




people at the heart of everything we do

Working at Randstad is unlike working at any organization. Because at Randstad we put people at the heart of everything we do. This goes for our clients, our talent, our employees and society. We combine our passion for people with the power of today’s technologies. This helps us support people and organizations in realizing their true potential. We call this human forward.

Learn more about our mission, history and values on our website: www.randstad.com




If you recognize yourself in the profile above, we invite you to apply for this role. For more information you can reach out to our recruitment business partner: jennifer.roberts@randstadsourceright.co.uk




The recruitment procedure consists of a screening and at least two interviews. Later in the process, an (online) assessment and a job offer conversation take place.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Ben jij die proactieve data-expert die het grotere plaatje ziet? Wil jij werken in een dynamische omgeving waar data écht het verschil maakt? Dan hebben wij de perfecte uitdaging voor jou!




Als Senior Data Analyst / Data Lead ga je niet alleen aan de slag met data-analyse en rapportages, maar ook met het verbeteren van de hele datastructuur. Jij bent degene die het datateam inspireert om slimmer te werken en helpt de business met waardevolle inzichten. Je weet hoe je data vertaalt naar begrijpelijke rapportages en hebt de skills om de brug te slaan tussen techniek en business.




Wat ga je doen?

Je zet jouw analytische skills in om databehoeften te inventariseren en om te zetten in heldere rapportages.
Je bouwt mee aan de standaardisatie van rapportages binnen Power BI, zodat data snel en betrouwbaar beschikbaar is.
Jij zorgt voor de structurering van dataflows en denkt actief mee over data-architectuur.
Je coacht collega’s binnen het datateam, stimuleert proactief denken en pakt een leadership rol zonder directe managementverantwoordelijkheden.
Je bent het aanspreekpunt voor business stakeholders: je verzamelt wensen, maakt de vertaalslag naar technische oplossingen en zorgt voor heldere communicatie.
Samen met het team til je de datakwaliteit naar een hoger niveau, zodat rapportages/analyses echt impact maken.




Wie ben jij?

Je hebt minimaal 4 jaar ervaring in een vergelijkbare rol, zoals Data Analyst/ Lead, of BI Specialist.
Je bent bedreven in Power BI en hebt ervaring met SQL voor data-extractie en -transformatie.
Je hebt sterke communicatieve vaardigheden en weet mensen te enthousiasmeren.
Je denkt proactief en weet complexe datastructuren simpel uit te leggen.
Je bent analytisch, pragmatisch en houdt ervan om data écht te laten leven binnen een organisatie.




Wat maakt deze rol uniek?

Impact: Jouw analyses en rapportages vormen de basis voor strategische beslissingen.
Leiderschap zonder hiërarchie: Jij bent de expert waar het team op vertrouwt.
Ontwikkeling: Krijg de ruimte om processen en structuren te optimaliseren.
Dynamiek: Werk in een compacte organisatie waar je écht het verschil maakt.
Flexibiliteit: Denk mee over de toekomst van data en krijg vrijheid om nieuwe ideeën te ontwikkelen.




Wat bieden zij?

Een salaris tussen de €5.000 en €6.500 per maand, afhankelijk van ervaring.
Een inspirerende werkomgeving in de Randstad.
Grote impact binnen een groeiend en ambitieus datateam.
Professionele en persoonlijke groei door uitdagende projecten en teamwork.
Een omgeving waarin jouw initiatief en visie écht gewaardeerd worden.

Show more
