Job ID: 315953

Posted On: 2025-05-15

Location: Stockholm, Sweden

Title: Data Analyst, GIobal Insights
Place: Billund, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Are you passionate about turning data into decisions that matter?

At the heart of our strategy lies a deep belief data and insights are not just supportive, they're transformative! We’re looking for a Data Analyst to join our Global Insight (GI) team and help shape smarter decisions across the business.


Core Responsibilities





Data Analysis & Interpretation - Transform raw data into meaningful insights that address business challenges and questions.
Collaboration with Business Partners - Work closely with all Business Partners to understand their analytical needs and provide tailored support in navigating the available data and insights
Report Generation - Craft comprehensive reports and visualizations that communicate findings clearly, enabling partners to make informed decisions & synthesize existing material
Data Management - Maintain and manage datasets to ensure accuracy, consistency, and accessibility for all relevant partners
Training & Support - Provide training and support to Business Partners on data utilization and analytical tools to enhance their analytical capabilities
Find opportunities for process improvements in data analysis and reporting, promoting standard methodologies within the team




Play your part in our team succeeding

Global Insights (GI) plays a significant role in supporting the success of The LEGO Group. We work with different business areas to ensure data-driven decision-making, encouraging a culture that brings to bear a single source of truth to drive commercial impact in understanding consumers and shoppers, and we strive to deliver relevant insights that enhance demand creation, drive commercial success, and support future innovation.

This Data Analyst role sits within the Enablers group, as part of the Data Platforms Team. This team is responsible for powering our consumer- and shopper-focused insight platforms. These platforms help uncover barriers and opportunities in consumer behavior and shopper journeys—driving smarter strategic actions and performance reviews across the business.

Do you have what it takes?





Educational Background Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in data science, Statistics, Business Analytics, or a related field
Technical Skills Proficiency in data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, PowerPoint) and the ability to apply SQL for raw data extraction
Analytical Approach Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex datasets and derive actionable insights
Communication Skills Excellent verbal & written communication skills, with the ability to present data findings to both technical / non-technical audiences
Great Teammate Collaborative approach, work effectively in a fast-paced, cross-functional team environment
Problem-Solving Skills Strong critical thinking and problem-solving abilities, with a focus on addressing business challenges through data-driven insights
We will require some flexibility in working hours




This position is based in Billund, and we do not offer relocation assistance.

Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What’s in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount – We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.

Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO® team today.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst (Marketing Insights)
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Too Good To Go, we have an ambitious goal: to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together.

40% of all food produced in the world is wasted. And that has a huge impact on the health of our planet, with 10% of greenhouse gas emissions coming from food waste.

We’re more than an app: we are a certified B Corporation with a mission to empower everyone to take action against food waste, so alongside our marketplace app, we create educational tools, explore new business solutions - such as our Retail Technologies offering, and influence legislation to help reduce food waste.

We’re growing fast: Our community of 118 million registered users and 246,000 active partners across 19 countries, have together already prevented 443+ million meals from going to waste - avoiding over 1.198.000 tonnes of CO2e!

Your mission

We are seeking a talented and driven Data Analyst to join us in shaping the future of our newly established Demand Analytics team. The successful candidate will play a pivotal role in enhancing our team's capabilities around Marketing analytics while benefiting from a robust support structure designed to foster growth and innovation.

As a Marketplace, Marketing is one of Too Good To Go’s most powerful levers for driving demand. Consequently, a strong foundation in marketing metrics is essential for this role. The models and methodologies you will help develop are largely marketing-focused, emphasizing the importance of experience with causal impact modeling and econometric modeling.

That said, Demand Analytics at Too Good To Go extends beyond marketing. We are looking for someone who can also contribute to broader analytical initiatives, such as demand forecasting and other data-driven projects.

If you’re passionate about leveraging analytics to make a real-world impact and thrive in a dynamic, collaborative environment, we’d love to hear from you.

Your role


Support business leaders in identifying the right KPIs to drive business performance
Provide data-driven guidance to business leaders on key strategic decisions
Design and deliver self-service tools to various functional groups for operational excellence
Collaborate with marketing teams to optimize campaign strategies and resource allocation based on data-driven insights
Conduct in-depth analyses to identify the drivers of demand and measure marketing impact
Utilize marketing insights to inform and enhance demand forecasting models


Requirements


You’ve previously worked in a marketing analytics role where you translated data into actionable insights for stakeholders across teams.
You have an understanding of Marketing Data and KPIs, or an appetite to learn this space.
Having experience in analyzing and interpreting marketing performance metrics would be a clear advantage.
You have hands-on experience working closely with senior stakeholders, ideally within Marketing, to deliver data-driven insights.
You are a great communicator and storyteller - someone who enjoys helping non-technical audiences see what you see in the numbers!
You are skilled in designing, executing, and interpreting A/B tests, as well as applying causal inference and impact modeling techniques.
You are proficient in SQL for data extraction, manipulation, and transformation
You have some Python experience for data preprocessing, statistical analysis. R is a plus.
You are passionate about data literacy, continuously striving to improve your own skills and those of your team.


Our values


We win together: Food waste is a big beast to fight. We believe in a #oneteam.
We raise the bar: We always push for more. We work smart, smash barriers and elevate one another.
We keep it simple: Our ambitions are bold but our solutions are simple.
We build a legacy: We’re proud of the change we’re driving.
We care: We always look out for each other. Caring is also about the way we do business. We do the right thing.


What We Have To Offer


An opportunity to work in a global social-impact company and certified B Corporation! where you can see a real and tangible impact in your role.
To be an integral part of our Data & Analytics team. We are eager for you to make an impact and contribute to the role of analytics across key decisions and our solution processes. Your insights are valuable, and we are here to listen.
Work-life balance is important to us! Focus on the job to be done, not the hours spent, there is no need for overtime.
We trust in our employees and encourage an autonomous environment that provides several opportunities for employees to contribute, develop and take ownership of their work in a way that works for them.
To be part of an international company, with over 1,300+ colleagues across 19 countries that are on the same important mission.
An informal environment, working alongside 170+ passionate people within Tech & Product
We celebrate our differences and our successes and have a strong values-driven team culture.
We work in a hybrid set-up and value in office work weekly.
We may be able to support you with a working visa in Copenhagen, please be prepared to discuss this topic further as your first stage interview.


How To Apply


We take recruitment very seriously, so please carefully read everything we have written above. Please also check our website and international media in order to get a good overview of Too Good To Go.
Submit your CV and Cover letter in English.
Please note that we only accept applications coming through our platform. No CV or Cover Letter will be accepted by email or LinkedIn direct messaging.


Job Ref

A Movement for Everyone

We want to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together. With that mission, it’s only natural that we want to build a diverse and inclusive team of highly capable individuals who are passionate about doing things in a better way. We strongly believe we all excel and are more creative when we’re allowed to be ourselves, and we’re committed to a culture where all of us belong.

We are an equal opportunity employer and all employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need. If you need reasonable accommodation at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.


Show more

  • To be part of an international company, with over 1,300+ colleagues across 19 countries that are on the same important mission.
  • An informal environment, working alongside 170+ passionate people within Tech & Product
  • We celebrate our differences and our successes and have a strong values-driven team culture.
  • We work in a hybrid set-up and value in office work weekly.
  • We may be able to support you with a working visa in Copenhagen, please be prepared to discuss this topic further as your first stage interview.

How To Apply

  • We take recruitment very seriously, so please carefully read everything we have written above. Please also check our website and international media in order to get a good overview of Too Good To Go.
  • Submit your CV and Cover letter in English.
  • Please note that we only accept applications coming through our platform. No CV or Cover Letter will be accepted by email or LinkedIn direct messaging.

Job Ref

A Movement for Everyone

We want to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together. With that mission, it’s only natural that we want to build a diverse and inclusive team of highly capable individuals who are passionate about doing things in a better way. We strongly believe we all excel and are more creative when we’re allowed to be ourselves, and we’re committed to a culture where all of us belong.

We are an equal opportunity employer and all employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need. If you need reasonable accommodation at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job ID

211928

Posted

30-Apr-2025

Service line

Advisory Segment

Role type

Part-time

Areas of Interest

Data & Analytics

Location(s)

Copenhagen - Hovedstaden - Denmark

Are you looking for a student job in data analytics and do you have an interest for the real estate market? Then this is a unique opportunity to combine your analytical skills with a substantive function in a commercial environment!

What will you be doing?

The real estate market is undergoing a significant and exciting change – driven by data and technology. The main focus of this position will be to support the team in leveraging our product portfolio and developing new data driven solutions to address new business challenges of our clients. The role will establish a profound relationship with the regional and EMEA research teams.

Your Key Responsibilities


Support the automation of manual tasks and reports by making intelligent use of available analytics and data visualization
Review and evaluate collected data and secure data quality, consistency, accuracy and comprehensiveness
Liaise with EMEA and Local CBRE research team to collaborate and implement new solutions
Contribute to the broader rollout of the Core Enablement Platform in collaboration with the Digital & Technology and Customer Success teams


Who are you?

We are looking for a committed, ambitious and independent student who has a great sense of responsibility for tasks and deadlines. You should be detail oriented with strong analytical skills and have a positive, innovative and opportunistic mindset. You must thrive in an international environment and an informal tone, where it is crucial that you speak and write English at a high level.

Preferably you are studying a bachelor’s degree in economics, finance, data analytics, business intelligence or related disciplines.

Qualifications

Other qualifications we are looking for (you do not have to tick all the boxes to be the right match for the position):


You have experience in an analytically oriented, data, or quantitative role
You have programming experience in Python or R and respective data analysis libraries
You have basic knowledge of some of the following technologies: Alteryx, SQL and relational database concepts, and an intrinsic motivation to develop these skills
You have basic knowledge of reporting tools such as Tableau and Power BI and enjoy converting data into valuable insights
You have strong numerical skills including the ability to handle and manipulate large amounts of numerical data into clearly defined outputs based on a project driven approach.
You'll take ownership of data quality, including performing manual data entry tasks as needed to ensure our end users have reliable information. You recognize that consistent data maintenance is key to driving successful data analysis
You have an excellent understanding of the English language but can also communicate in Danish


About Us

CBRE is the world’s largest commercial real estate services with more than 100,000 employees worldwide. We are present in more than 100+ countries in more than 500 offices and work with every corner of the real estate market. CBRE's international angle, specialization and more than 100 years of experience guarantee a market insight with the highest standards.

We have a flexible working environment with excellent development opportunities in a dynamic and diverse organization.

What Can We Offer


A team consisting of both young ambitious and experienced employees
Assignments with great variety and a steep learning curve with challenges and growing responsibilities
Flexible working hours 15-25 hours per week
A good work and student environment
Attractive employee benefits


Next Step

We will be reviewing applications on an ongoing basis and please note that virtual interviews are part of this recruiting process. We are looking forward to hearing from you.

If you have any questions regarding the position, please contact Senior Analyst, D&T Lead, Htet Aung, on email: htet.aung@cbre.com.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
You will be bridging the business with technology, driving strategic programs together with your team and contributing to business optimization and growth by acting as the voice of the customer.

The team you will be joining consists of a Data Analyst, a Business Analyst and a Product Manager, belonging to the Data and Analytics department. We have 2 streams, one heavily engaged with back-end data engineering, and one heavily engaged with Web Analytics, called Tracking. You will mainly drive the Tracking stream.

We work in an agile SAFe set-up with daily Scrum ceremonies, where we together with the engineers discuss progress, hick-ups, blockers etc. It is a very mature, high performing team.

You will be gathering business requirements and shaping them into actionable insights. Together with the Global Ecommerce Team and the Digital Squads you will be advising, guiding and consulting the business on most optimal Ecommerce product solutions and optimizations. Combining your technical Web Analytics background with your strong skills in stakeholder management you will not hesitate to challenge status quo. You will be owning Adobe Analytics, and with your technical skills you will be able to manage the back-end and the front-end.

In addition, you'll be accountable for improving site conversion and customer satisfaction by performing analyzes and consolidating analytical and customer insights, using different tools (Adobe Analytics, Data Layer, Medallia, ContentSquare, Monetate…). Your findings will help to identify customer "pain-points" and improvement opportunities, as well as helping to size potential, actionable opportunities.

Key Responsibilities


Manage Adobe Analytics from a back-end and front-end perspective.
Translate and document comprehensive functional and non-functional eCommerce requirements and specifications to drive solution design and delivery .
Map current and future state processes, ensuring holistic understanding and optimization, identifying operational pain points and improvements.
Champion effective communication and stakeholder engagement throughout projects.
Create test conditions, drive and participate in testing activities to validate requirements and ensure quality assurance and solution integrity.
Provide hands-on support during project go-live and transition phases.
Work closely with main CX, Digital, eCommerce, Global Marketing, Markets colleagues



Requirements


3-5 years of relevant experience in for instance: Web Analytics, Digital Customer Experience, Customer Behaviour, A/B testing, Personalization and/or similar.
3-5 years of experience with Adobe Analytics from a technical angle.
Strong analytical skills and data-driven approach with solid commercial experience.
Stakeholder management skills and clear communication.
Familiar with the agile SAFe set-up, working with a back-log and user stories.
Experience with driving strategic programs is preferred.
Understanding of the following tools: Datalayer Strategy, Adobe Analytics, Tealium iQ and Tealium Event Stream is a must.
Be experienced in Web Optimization and Personalization via Monetate or a similar tool, and in Voice Of Customer via Medallia or similar tool.
Understanding basic Javascript coding and tracking management is a plus.
Understanding of key elements that impact digital retail e.g. customer journey management, website personalisation, online merchandising, A/B and multivariate testing, customer segmentation, basket abandonment analysis and competitors benchmarking.



Did we get your attention?

We process applications on a continuous basis, which is why we encourage you to send your application as soon as possible. You can also read more about Pandora on our corporate site www.pandoragroup.com.

Icing on the cake

You will be working out of our beautiful Head Office in Copenhagen V, established in 2016 and designed to unite and inspire our teams. Besides our beautiful interior design, we are also proud of our LEED Gold Certification for Energy and Environmental Design. This means that we use as few natural resources as possible and that we use them with respect. The result is a professional and dynamic space that is unique, comfortable and inspirational – and delivers a true Pandora experience to anyone who works here or comes to visit.

About Pandora

Pandora is the world's largest jewellery brand, specialising in the design, crafting and marketing of accessible luxury jewellery made from high-quality materials. Each piece is created to inspire self-expression, allowing people to share their stories and passions through meaningful jewellery. Pandora jewellery is sold in more than 100 countries through 6,800 points of sale, including more than 2,700 concept stores.

Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs 37,000 people worldwide and crafts its jewellery using only recycled silver and gold. Pandora is committed to leadership in sustainability and has set out to halve greenhouse gas emissions across its value chain by 2030. Pandora is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and generated revenue of DKK 31.7 billion (EUR 4.2 billion) in 2024.

At Pandora, we believe that creating an inclusive and diverse workplace and reflecting societal diversity in our customer engagement is essential to delivering on our company purpose: to give a voice to people’s loves. We dedicate ourselves to fostering, cultivating and preserving a culture of inclusion and diversity where everyone feels respected and valued. So, if you think you have what it takes, but don't necessarily meet every single point on the job description, please still get in touch.

Title: Senior Analytics Consultant
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Company Description

Experian is a global data and technology company, powering opportunities for people and businesses around the world. We help to redefine lending practices, uncover and prevent fraud, simplify healthcare, create marketing solutions, and gain deeper insights into the automotive market, all using our unique combination of data, analytics and software. We also assist millions of people to realise their financial goals and help them save time and money.

We operate across a range of markets, from financial services to healthcare, automotive, agribusiness, insurance, and many more industry segments.

We invest in people and new advanced technologies to unlock the power of data. As a FTSE 100 Index company listed on the London Stock Exchange (EXPN), we have a team of 22,500 people across 32 countries. Our corporate headquarters are in Dublin, Ireland. Learn more at experianplc.com

Job Description

We are looking for a dynamic Senior Analytics Consultant to join our Northern Europe analytics team, specializing in credit risk management with a strong focus on client engagement and innovative solutions. The ideal candidate will have 4 to 8 years of experience in the banking and finance sector or management consulting, with a deep understanding of credit risk management and EU/local regulations such as IRB, IFRS 9, NPL management and ESG standards.

You will be responsible for building and maintaining client relationships, leading and managing analytics projects, and delivering analytics solutions to the benefit of our clients and their customers. Proficiency in Python, PySpark, and SQL is preferred, along with excellent communication skills and the ability to present complex information clearly. You will also play a key role in developing new scores and attributes, new analytics products and use cases of analytics platforms, staying updated on industry trends. If you are passionate about leveraging data to drive business decisions and have a keen interest in fintech development, we would love to hear from you.

Key Responsibilities


Build client relationships, and identify and drive client opportunities, being a trusted advisor for our clients.
Participate in pre-sales and sales meetings with clients and prospects to describe and position Experian's analytics projects, determine the client requirements across the full range of Experian Decision Analytics solutions ensuring the relationship with the client is productive and professional.
Engage in a consultative way with the clients to identify problems and define, design and deliver solutions and identify new opportunities. Create and present proposals and recommendations to clients for solutions.
Lead and manage project teams, ensure successful delivery of analytics projects, delivery of value-driven recommendations, knowledge transfer and effective advisory.
Lead innovation analytics driven projects, playing an active role in developing new analytics products and solutions for our clients.
Act as a Project Manager for projects involving statistical modelling, analytics platforms, sandbox use or regulatory analytics, assessing project scope, duration, resources and cost to define the project plan.
Review the project deliveries to ensure that all analysis is thorough and established, quality procedures are followed to help guarantee the robustness of the solution and that all critical business issues are identified through data analysis.
Stay on top of industry trends and engage and collaborate with cross-functional teams such as Sales, Pre-Sales, Product, Operations, Data and Platforms as well as international teams to ensure scaling Experian Analytics presence & capabilities across financial services.
Lead workshops and knowledge sharing sessions with our clients, joining Experian events as a speaker to provide expertise and insights to our clients.
Analyze and identify value creation and improvement opportunities at the intersection of business, data and technology.
Mentor and coach junior colleagues in the team.


Qualifications


Master’s degree in quantitative fields such as Data Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, Business Science, Economics, Management or a related field.
4 to 8 years of proven experience in credit risk management within the banking and finance sector or in any management consulting or analytics and data driven industry.
Strong understanding of credit risk management and analytics areas. Knowhow with EU and local credit risk regulations, including IRB, IFRS 9, NPL Management and ESG standards.
Strong understanding of analytical products, data and analytics. Proficiency in Python, PySpark, SQL and Databricks knowledge is a plus and familiarity with advanced analytics techniques and tools such as machine learning and AI.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to present complex information clearly to clients and bridge the gap between technical and non-technical teams
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, ability to analyze large datasets and develop predictive models, innovative thinking and the ability to translate data and analytics into business outcomes.
In-depth knowledge of market trends, financial products including strong market knowledge and experience in the Nordic financial sector.
Experience in managing projects and leading teams.
Fluency in Danish or Norwegian and English is a must.


What we offer?


Great compensation package and bonus plan.
Core benefits including health insurance, Experian shares discount, pension and wellbeing benefits.
Flexible work environment, hybrid work.
Flexible work hours including volunteer time off and 6 weeks holidays.


Additional Information

Proud to be a Worlds Best Workplace 2024

Our uniqueness is that we celebrate yours. Experian's culture and people are main differentiators. We take our people agenda very seriously and focus on what truly matters; DEI, work/life balance, development, authenticity, engagement, collaboration, wellness, reward & recognition, volunteering... the list goes on. Experian's people first approach is award-winning; Great Place To Work™ in 24 countries, FORTUNE Best Companies to work and Glassdoor Best Places to Work (globally 4.4 Stars) to name a few. Check out Experian Life on social or our Careers Site to understand why.

Experian is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. Innovation is a critical part of Experian's DNA and practices, and our diverse workforce drives our success. Everyone can succeed at Experian and bring their whole self to work, irrespective of their gender, ethnicity, religion, colour, sexuality, physical ability or age. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know at the earliest opportunity.

Experian Careers - Creating a better tomorrow together

Find out what its like to work for Experian by clicking here

HTML:
Copenhagen - Hovedstaden - Denmark

Are you looking for a student job in data analytics and do you have an interest for the real estate market? Then this is a unique opportunity to combine your analytical skills with a substantive function in a commercial environment!

What will you be doing?


The real estate market is undergoing a significant and exciting change – driven by data and technology. The main focus of this position will be to support the team in leveraging our product portfolio and developing new data driven solutions to address new business challenges of our clients. The role will establish a profound relationship with the regional and EMEA research teams.

Your Key Responsibilities


  • Support the automation of manual tasks and reports by making intelligent use of available analytics and data visualization
  • Review and evaluate collected data and secure data quality, consistency, accuracy and comprehensiveness
  • Liaise with EMEA and Local CBRE research team to collaborate and implement new solutions
  • Contribute to the broader rollout of the Core Enablement Platform in collaboration with the Digital & Technology and Customer Success teams

Who are you?


We are looking for a committed, ambitious and independent student who has a great sense of responsibility for tasks and deadlines. You should be detail oriented with strong analytical skills and have a positive, innovative and opportunistic mindset. You must thrive in an international environment and an informal tone, where it is crucial that you speak and write English at a high level.

Preferably you are studying a bachelor’s degree in economics, finance, data analytics, business intelligence or related disciplines.

Qualifications


Other qualifications we are looking for (you do not have to tick all the boxes to be the right match for the position):

  • You have experience in an analytically oriented, data, or quantitative role
  • You have programming experience in Python or R and respective data analysis libraries
  • You have basic knowledge of some of the following technologies: Alteryx, SQL and relational database concepts, and an intrinsic motivation to develop these skills
  • You have basic knowledge of reporting tools such as Tableau and Power BI and enjoy converting data into valuable insights
  • You have strong numerical skills including the ability to handle and manipulate large amounts of numerical data into clearly defined outputs based on a project driven approach.
  • You'll take ownership of data quality, including performing manual data entry tasks as needed to ensure our end users have reliable information. You recognize that consistent data maintenance is key to driving successful data analysis
  • You have an excellent understanding of the English language but can also communicate in Danish

About Us


CBRE is the world’s largest commercial real estate services with more than 100,000 employees worldwide. We are present in more than 100+ countries in more than 500 offices and work with every corner of the real estate market. CBRE's international angle, specialization and more than 100 years of experience guarantee a market insight with the highest standards.

We have a flexible working environment with excellent development opportunities in a dynamic and diverse organization.

What Can We Offer


  • A team consisting of both young ambitious and experienced employees
  • Assignments with great variety and a steep learning curve with challenges and growing responsibilities
  • Flexible working hours 15-25 hours per week
  • A good work and student environment
  • Attractive employee benefits

Next Step


We will be reviewing applications on an ongoing basis and please note that virtual interviews are part of this recruiting process. We are looking forward to hearing from you.

If you have any questions regarding the position, please contact Senior Analyst, D&T Lead, Htet Aung, on email: htet.aung@cbre.com.

Service line: Advisory Segment

Title: Data & Systems specialist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About Agreena

Agreena is an exciting, dynamic, and purpose-oriented organisation united in a mission to mobilise farmers and corporations to unlock the value of nature and help restore the planet. While we’re rooted in agriculture, finance, and technology, our team of experts range from soil carbon scientists and software developers to market strategists and regulatory affairs experts. Over 160 employees across more than 30 nationalities are gathered under the common Agreena flag – either working from our headquarters in Copenhagen, offices in London, or remotely across Europe.

As a rapidly scaling climate agtech, Agreena provides solutions that drive both environmental and financial sustainability in farming. We have helped farmers across 20 countries in their journey from conventional agriculture to regenerative farming practices to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and remove CO2 from the atmosphere, storing it in soil. Our company offers a supportive and positive work environment with opportunities for learning, leading and growth no matter where you are in your professional journey. We believe in giving our employees a lot of responsibility, and we encourage new thinking, innovation and fun.

Overview

We are looking to hire a Data Handling Expert on a 12-month full-time contract to support internal operations across multiple teams. This role will help us build and maintain robust internal data flows and dashboards that make backend data more accessible and useful for our internal operations and customer support teams. They will also use their data handling skills to create and streamline processes which can be run without a platform based UI.

There is potential for this role to become a permanent position based on performance and evolving business needs.

How Will You Make An Impact


Collaborating with engineering teams to understand backend data structures, performing data transformations, and modelling data into efficient and user-friendly tables for reporting and analysis.
Developing and implementing solutions for data delivery to end-users, potentially utilizing tools like Google Sheets and automation scripts (e.g., Google Apps Script) or proposing alternative, scalable solutions to streamline data accessibility.
Designing, building, and maintaining dashboards using AWS QuickSight, based on backend operational data.
Working closely with internal teams, such Operations, Customer Success, and Product to understand data visibility needs and develop processes which are easy to understand and scalable.
Structuring dashboards and systems to support team workflows, enabling non-technical users to access actionable insights and understand the status of key processes.
Documenting dashboard logic and support handovers to internal users.


Who We’re Looking For


Proficiency with SQL, and experience working with structured datasets from cloud-based backends (e.g. Athena, S3, RDS, or Redshift).
Experience with data transformation, including cleaning, reshaping, and preparing data for analysis and reporting
Ability to translate technical backend structures into user-friendly visual dashboards.
Experience with dashboarding tools such as AWS QuickSight, including dashboard setup, filters, calculated fields, and visual customization.
Strong communication skills and a user-centric mindset- able to gather requirements and iterate based on team feedback.
Being able to handle different internal teams access to the same core dataset but each requires slightly different views or formats. You should be able to design a data flow and delivery mechanism to efficiently meet these varied needs
Comfortable working independently in a fast-paced, evolving environment.


Bonus Points If You Have


Familiarity with agricultural, environmental, or geospatial datasets.
Prior experience working in a startup or scale-up with internal tooling gaps.
Experience with other BI tools (e.g. Tableau, Power BI) is a bonus but not required.
Experience with other script languages such as Python, Google Apps, VBA.


What's In It For You


A unique opportunity to join and help shape a fast-growing tech scale up with the determination and ambitious mission to reverse climate change;
A truly global environment where you can collaborate and socialise with diverse and passionate colleagues;
Competitive compensation package and holidays;
Centrally located modern office in Copenhagen or London and the option to work from home a couple days a week;
Team events throughout the year;
An exciting purpose-led culture and mission;
Open communication and supportive feedback culture.


🌱 Not quite what you're looking for?

Stay connected with us by following our Agreena LinkedIn page. It's the best way to stay updated on our latest content, articles, and exciting new opportunities.

Plus, if you want to be the first to know about job openings in the departments you're interested in, you can subscribe to our job alerts talent pool.

🌍 Be your best self every day at Agreena

At Agreena, we are devoted to building an environment that promotes equality, inclusion, and diversity. As we embark on our journey of expansion and growth, we recognise the value of celebrating and embracing everyone's uniqueness. This diversity is crucial to our success and innovation. We aspire to build a product that is loved by our customers and we want the same to be reflected in our teams.

With this in mind, we're dedicated to ensuring that Agreena remains a welcoming and diverse environment for all.
Show more

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you thrive at the intersection of data and strategy? Are you excited about turning complex analytics into impactful marketing insights? Then you might be our new Marketing Data Analyst, ready to join our dynamic and international marketing team!

First, who on earth is Dalux?

Dalux is an innovative Contech company committed to push the boundaries of how technology can secure a smarter and more efficient construction and real estate industry. Today we provide our user-friendly digital tools and BIM Technology (3D information models) to leading contractors and advisors in more than 147 countries. And we are not slowing down our expansion journey anytime soon, so this is a great time to join us and directly influence the future of Dalux! Today we are present in 24 countries and counting, and therefore this is a great time to join us, and directly influence the future of Dalux!

Awesome! But what will my new role be?

In this role, you’ll work at the intersection of data and marketing, analyzing and interpreting data from a wide variety of marketing channels such as ads, social media, website performance, webinars, events, and more. Your insights will drive decision-making, shape marketing strategies, and optimize performance across the organization.

Your responsibilities will include:


Collecting, analyzing, and interpreting data from various marketing sources (e.g., Google Analytics, Google Ads, social platforms, events, webinars).
Developing and maintaining dashboards and reports using tools like Power BI, SQL, and Access.
Providing actionable insights to optimize campaign performance and achieve marketing goals.
Collaborating with Performance Marketing and other teams (Content, Events, Commercial Revenue Operations) to align on data-driven strategies.
Monitoring and reporting on KPIs, campaign ROI, and trends to guide both short-term and long-term planning.
Identifying areas of opportunity and proposing data-informed strategies for growth and efficiency.


Sure, sounds exciting! How can I be considered for this role?

You have experience in marketing data analysis or a related field, with proficiency in Power BI, SQL, and Microsoft Access. Strong knowledge of Google Analytics and Google Ads dashboards, as well as analytical and problem-solving skills, are essential. Experience visualizing data for non-technical stakeholders and strong collaboration skills are also key.

Preferred qualifications include experience in performance marketing or commercial revenue operations, familiarity with A/B testing, and additional data visualization tools.

If you’re collaborative, curious, and eager to learn, you’ll thrive in our supportive and creative environment.

Why Choose Dalux?

At Dalux, we care—not just about our work and customers but about each other. We believe in creating a work environment that is light-hearted, informal, and welcoming, with room for everyone. Forget fancy titles and rigid dress codes; we’re here to make your work life both rewarding and enjoyable.

At our HQ in Østerbro, you’ll join a team of 17 skilled colleagues dedicated to driving high customer engagement. Networking with our users is our passion, and we deliver great content, engaging events, and cutting-edge ConTech insights.

Being part of a social company, you’ll also enjoy activities like wine tasting, running club, knitting club, and more. At Dalux, your personal and professional growth is important to us.

Application deadline:

As soon as possible
Show more

Title: Business Intelligence, Internship, Lystrup
Place: Aarhus Municipality, Central Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to kickstart your career in an international high-tech company that operates within specialized areas like aerospace, defence, security, and space? Our Business Intelligence Team within the Finance Systems & Business Intelligence department offers a unique opportunity for a passionate student who wants to be part of our internal talent pipeline.

We are facing an exciting future with considerable growth and demanding changes, as we deliver advanced technologies and mission critical solutions for the defense and aerospace industry. Our systems provide security for people on land, at sea and in the air. Therefore, we are looking for a Business Intelligence (BI) Intern to become part of this journey and contribute to our overall purpose – securing people through advanced technology.

Your role in our team

We are currently facing an exciting future with considerable growth and demanding changes. We are looking for a highly motivated BI Intern to become part of this journey and to join our Finance Systems & Business Intelligence department in Lystrup, which has a variety of responsibilities.

We offer an exciting position where you can start building your dream career. We will focus on your professional and personal development, and you will have the opportunity to make your mark in a dynamic company. You will experience a variety of tasks and the opportunity to apply your theoretical skills in practice. We pride ourselves on maintaining an open working environment where we support each other to stay focused, committed, and motivated to deliver value to our colleagues throughout Terma.

As a BI Intern at Terma, you will be part of a company with many engaged and knowledgeable employees, where technology, innovation, strategy, and continuous improvements drive everything we do. You will work closely with skilled colleagues and on exciting projects.

How you will make a meaningful contribution

Your Key Responsibilities Include


Assist in the development and maintenance of BI reports and dashboards
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their data requirements
Ensure data accuracy and integrity in our BI solutions
Contribute to the continuous improvement of our BI processes
Participate in data analysis and visualization projects
Support the team in ad-hoc data requests and troubleshooting


Bring your world class expertise into play

You are fluent in English both in writing and verbal at a professional level. Danish is an advantage but not a requirement


We are looking for an Intern studying at the Bachelor’s or Master’s level within Business Intelligence, Data Science, Finance, or a similar field of study
Familiarity with BI tools such as MS Power BI, SQL, or DAX is a plus


As a person, you bring a positive, can-do attitude and you thrive on turning theory into action. You are self-driven, detail-oriented, and not afraid to juggle multiple tasks at once. Collaboration comes naturally to you, and you take pride in delivering high-quality work on time.

The key points to success in our team are to show commitment, work with passion both in groups and independently, have an outgoing and proactive personality, curiosity, and show initiative in the daily work. You solve your tasks within set deadlines and with a strong focus on quality and detail, of course in close cooperation with your colleagues. You work in a structured manner, make things happen, and identify and deal with issues proactively. You are a good communicator and understand the importance of cross-functional cooperation.

We are an international company representing world class expertise, delivering complex and high-tech products. We value our colleagues and our meaningful contributions to securing people through advanced technology. You will also experience that we have a strong focus on your development, teaching you useful new competences and further strengthening current ones, both professionally and personally. Our company culture is autonomous and engaging, and we acknowledge the importance of flexibility in a great working environment.

When joining Terma, we promise that you will experience: Great people, challenging tasks, world-class expertise, and meaningful contribution in your daily work.

___________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

We encourage all individuals to apply for our job openings, as we are dedicated to fostering a diverse, equitable, inclusive, and welcoming workplace. Our commitment to these DEIB principles means we value and celebrate the unique backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences of each team member. We strive to ensure that every employee has equal opportunities to succeed, feels respected and valued, and experiences a strong sense of belonging within our organization.

We encourage you to leave out photo, age, and name.

If you would like to take on the challenge of working in an innovative company, we look forward to receiving your application. A resume is required, while a cover letter is optional. To ensure that your application will reach us and is properly processed, we only accept applications via www.terma.com. Applications will be processed continuously.

Do you have any questions regarding the position?

Feel free to contact Hiring Manager on this e-mail: osp@terma.com

___________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

Bear in mind that both candidates and the candidate’s adult household members, for this position must be able to obtain a security clearance by the Danish Defense Intelligence Service. This entails among other issues:


Full household as a minimum have stayed within NATO/EU countries for the last 7 years only interrupted by short stays abroad, and
None of the full household have committed serious criminal offences.


Terma group has headquarters in Denmark and is a high-tech company developing products and systems for defense and non-defense security applications, including command and control systems, radar systems, self-protection systems for aircraft, space technology, and aerostructures for the aircraft industry. TERMA | Allies in innovation.

The high-tech and innovative Terma Group develops products and systems for defense, non-defense and security applications, including command and control systems, radar systems, self-protection systems for aircraft and vessels, space technology, and aerostructures for the aircraft industry.

Headquartered in Aarhus, Denmark, Terma has subsidiaries and operations across Europe, in the Middle East, in Asia Pacific as well as a wholly-owned U.S. subsidiary, Terma Inc., with offices in Washington D.C., Georgia and Texas.

Application deadline:

Ongoing

Title: Senior Data Analyst (Copenhagen)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Ageras, we are redefining how entrepreneurs—freelancers, self-employed professionals, and SMEs—manage their banking, and administrative tasks. Through seamless tools and innovative accounting & banking solutions, we help them focus on what matters most: growing their businesses.

Our vision is to become the best friend of every small entrepreneur across Europe. 💚

Over the years, Ageras has grown through the merging of top European FinTechs like Shine (🇫🇷), Kontist (🇩🇪), Tellow (🇳🇱), and more. Today, we’re a team of nearly 500 people, including 150 talented engineers, working together from Paris, Amsterdam, Copenhagen, and Berlin.

👀 Data at Ageras

At Ageras, we're revolutionizing the way entrepreneurs—freelancers, self-employed professionals, and SMEs—manage their banking and administrative tasks. Operating in the ever-evolving FinTech space, we face one of the industry's most intricate challenges: building a robust, reliable architecture to enable seamless data collection, analysis, and visualization. Unsurprisingly, our Data team plays a pivotal role in driving Ageras' success!

Our Data department is organized into three specialized squads: Data Analytics, Data Modeling, and Data Platform, ensuring optimal efficiency and focus.

We are now seeking a skilled Data Analyst to join our Data Analytics team, currently composed of 4 data analyst and 1 lead data analyst.

As for our tech stack, we work with Python, AWS, Snowflake, Big Query, Meltano, Terraform, Dagster, and dbt for data modeling. If you're passionate about leveraging these tools to shape the future of FinTech, we'd love to hear from you!

📋 Your Role as a Senior Data Analyst

Data analysis at Ageras means working with a large volume of data across diverse domains (payment transactions, user behavior and conversion, product usage, ticket volume, revenue, marketing...), and and draw business insights from it to support or impact the company strategy 💥

Your Responsibilities Will Include


Data Analysis & Visualization
Build and optimize analytical data models using dbt.
Develop and maintain dashboards on Looker Studio and Metabase to empower teams with actionable insights.
Analyze complex datasets to solve business challenges and provide recommendations.
Collaboration & Strategy
Work closely with Business, Tech, and Data teams to align on priorities and insights.
Translate stakeholder needs into effective data solutions.
Deliver clear, data-driven insights to support strategic decision-making.
You will work closely with Product team on the product roadmap and help them on applying analysis like A/B test
Team Development & Best Practices
Help grow and structure the Data Analytics team by sharing knowledge and mentoring junior members.
Advocate for and implement best practices in data analysis, visualization, and architecture.
Stay on top of emerging tools and methodologies to optimize our processes.

🔎 About you


You have 5+ years of experience as a Data Analyst with advanced skills in SQL and data visualization tools (e.g., Looker Studio, Metabase, Tableau).
You have significant experience with modern data stacks (BigQuery, dbt) and a strong focus on detail and precision.
You simplify complex findings into clear, actionable insights for diverse stakeholders and decision-makers.
You demonstrate adaptability and proactivity, enabling you to thrive in dynamic and challenging work environments.
Teamwork is key for you: you enjoy mentoring others while continuing to grow and learn.
You are fluent in English and excited to work in an international team.


🎉 Our Perks


Remote Work Culture: Located in Paris with possibility of two remote working days per week but also you can you can work in all Ageras offices: Berlin, Amsterdam, Copenhagen, Poland
Office Perks: Complimentary tea, coffee, refreshments, fruits, and snacks available daily.
Career Growth Opportunities: Build a successful career with ample opportunities for professional growth within the firm.
Team Building and Events: Participate in biannual team-building activities and summer/winter corporate events.


💚 Our recruitment process

1️⃣ A 45’ introductory call with Annaïg (Talent Acquisition Specialist) to learn more about each other and give you an overview of Ageras.

2️⃣ A 90’ interview with Saghar (Lead Data Analyst) to discuss your experience, dive into the role, and evaluate your SQL skills.

3️⃣ A 30' business case presentation, where you’ll showcase your technical expertise and problem-solving abilities.
Show more
HTML:
At Ageras, we are redefining how entrepreneurs—freelancers, self-employed professionals, and SMEs—manage their banking, and administrative tasks. Through seamless tools and innovative accounting & banking solutions, we help them focus on what matters most: growing their businesses.

Our vision is to become the best friend of every small entrepreneur across Europe. 💚

Over the years, Ageras has grown through the merging of top European FinTechs like Shine (🇫🇷), Kontist (🇩🇪), Tellow (🇳🇱), and more. Today, we’re a team of nearly 500 people, including 150 talented engineers, working together from Paris, Amsterdam, Copenhagen, and Berlin.

👀 Data at Ageras

At Ageras, we're revolutionizing the way entrepreneurs—freelancers, self-employed professionals, and SMEs—manage their banking and administrative tasks. Operating in the ever-evolving FinTech space, we face one of the industry's most intricate challenges: building a robust, reliable architecture to enable seamless data collection, analysis, and visualization. Unsurprisingly, our Data team plays a pivotal role in driving Ageras' success!

Our Data department is organized into three specialized squads: Data Analytics, Data Modeling, and Data Platform, ensuring optimal efficiency and focus.

We are now seeking a skilled Data Analyst to join our Data Analytics team, currently composed of 4 data analyst and 1 lead data analyst.

As for our tech stack, we work with Python, AWS, Snowflake, Big Query, Meltano, Terraform, Dagster, and dbt for data modeling. If you're passionate about leveraging these tools to shape the future of FinTech, we'd love to hear from you!

📋 Your Role as a Senior Data Analyst

Data analysis at Ageras means working with a large volume of data across diverse domains (payment transactions, user behavior and conversion, product usage, ticket volume, revenue, marketing...), and and draw business insights from it to support or impact the company strategy 💥

Your Responsibilities Will Include

  • Data Analysis & Visualization
    • Build and optimize analytical data models using dbt.
    • Develop and maintain dashboards on Looker Studio and Metabase to empower teams with actionable insights.
    • Analyze complex datasets to solve business challenges and provide recommendations.
  • Collaboration & Strategy
    • Work closely with Business, Tech, and Data teams to align on priorities and insights.
    • Translate stakeholder needs into effective data solutions.
    • Deliver clear, data-driven insights to support strategic decision-making.
    • You will work closely with Product team on the product roadmap and help them on applying analysis like A/B test
  • Team Development & Best Practices
    • Help grow and structure the Data Analytics team by sharing knowledge and mentoring junior members.
    • Advocate for and implement best practices in data analysis, visualization, and architecture.
    • Stay on top of emerging tools and methodologies to optimize our processes.
🔎 About you

  • You have 5+ years of experience as a Data Analyst with advanced skills in SQL and data visualization tools (e.g., Looker Studio, Metabase, Tableau).
  • You have significant experience with modern data stacks (BigQuery, dbt) and a strong focus on detail and precision.
  • You simplify complex findings into clear, actionable insights for diverse stakeholders and decision-makers.
  • You demonstrate adaptability and proactivity, enabling you to thrive in dynamic and challenging work environments.
  • Teamwork is key for you: you enjoy mentoring others while continuing to grow and learn.
  • You are fluent in English and excited to work in an international team.

🎉 Our Perks

  • Remote Work Culture: Located in Paris with possibility of two remote working days per week but also you can you can work in all Ageras offices: Berlin, Amsterdam, Copenhagen, Poland
  • Office Perks: Complimentary tea, coffee, refreshments, fruits, and snacks available daily.
  • Career Growth Opportunities: Build a successful career with ample opportunities for professional growth within the firm.
  • Team Building and Events: Participate in biannual team-building activities and summer/winter corporate events.

💚 Our recruitment process

1️⃣ A 45’ introductory call with Annaïg (Talent Acquisition Specialist) to learn more about each other and give you an overview of Ageras.

2️⃣ A 90’ interview with Saghar (Lead Data Analyst) to discuss your experience, dive into the role, and evaluate your SQL skills.

3️⃣ A 30' business case presentation, where you’ll showcase your technical expertise and problem-solving abilities.

Title: Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Quantitative Analysts (Junior to Senior)




📍 Aarhus, Denmark / 🧠 Quantitative Modelling / ⚡ Energy Trading / 💼 Multiple Openings




Are you driven by solving complex, real-world problems with data, math, and code? We’re looking for several Quantitative Analysts, from junior to senior level, to join a fast-growing, dynamic energy trading team based in Aarhus.




Responsibilities

Design and refine algorithmic trading strategies and forecasting models using real-time and historical data
Build or extend custom trading and forecasting frameworks in Python
Collaborate closely with traders, developers, and data scientists to improve performance and infrastructure




What We're Looking For

Proficiency in Python (or similar languages) and solid software development practices (clean code, OOP, version control)
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills
A collaborative mindset and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment
A Master’s degree in Mathematics, Physics, Economics, or a related quantitative field




What They Offer

The chance to make an impact in a growing energy trading start-up
Flexibility to shape your role and pursue your interests
A collaborative and innovative environment where your contributions have real influence
Ongoing professional growth and the opportunity to work on high-impact forecasting and trading challenges




A great opportunity to join a fantastic energy trading team!

Title: Data Analytics Business Partner (North)
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Too Good To Go, we dream of a planet with no food waste

Imagine if there was something we could all change today that would reduce global warming by 10%. That’s how much food waste contributes to the climate crisis, and yet we continue to waste edible food all over the world.

As the world’s largest food waste-fighting app, we connect stores that have unsold, surplus food with consumers who buy and enjoy it. But we’re more than an app: we are a certified B Corporation and our mission is to inspire and empower everyone to take action against food waste.

We’re growing fast: Our community of 118 million registered users and 246,000 active partners across 19 countries, have together already prevented 443+ million meals from going to waste - avoiding over 1.198.000 tonnes of CO2e!

This role is based in Amsterdam OR Copenhagen.

Your mission

We are looking for a Data Analytics Business Partner to strengthen our knowledge around how to drive excellence in Operations.

While you will report directly to the Director of Analytics, you will be embedded in the Operational Leadership team for our Cluster North European markets. Your mission will be to work as a trusted advisor to our Vice President of Operations in driving key strategic decisions with a data-driven approach, mapping strategy to data-driven ways of working, and championing data literacy across your operational area. You will be 1 of 6 in a similar role, each dedicated to an Operational Leadership team, working together to share cross-country insights in an efficient and scalable way.

Your role


Provide deep analytical insights to inform timely Cluster North European Operations leadership team decisions - either proactively, on a regular cadence (QBRs, MBRs), or through ad hoc projects
Generate new ideas for how to leverage the data we have to drive operational excellence in our Cluster North European markets
Opportunity size and prioritise analytics ideas and questions in our Cluster North European markets, with the support of your Vice President of Operations
Proactively bring relevant & actionable insights from the rest of the Analytics team (embedded in other areas of the organisation) to the Cluster North European Operations leadership team;
Elevate the data literacy across the Cluster North European Operational leadership team
Identify, advocate, and build opportunities for scale and automation across the team
Elevate our Global Analytics specialisation by sharing best practices and learnings and offering ad-hoc guidance to other team members on their projects


Requirements


You demonstrate business acumen through significant experience in an analytical role supporting 2 or more of the following functions: Sales, Marketing, Operations, Finance, Strategy, Business Operations, Leadership; or relevant work experience in Consulting
You are proficient in SQL, comfortable with Python or R, and proficient in manipulating data efficiently for ad-hoc analysis
You are experienced with Data Visualization tools like Looker, Tableau, PowerBI or similar
You are focused on business outcomes by framing insights in a way that inspires action
You are comfortable describing statistical uncertainty and educating non-technical audiences on how best to interpret and action off of new insights
You have proven experience in stakeholder management, with the ability to manage a high influx of requests in a structured way
You are driven by the “why” behind the work that you do, always eager to ask an extra question to make sure you’re solving for the right thing
You have a proactive mindset and work well in a team environment
You have the ability to communicate effectively and convincingly in an English-speaking organisation
Previous experience in a hyper growth start-up environment will be valued


Our values


We win together: Food waste is a big beast to fight. We believe in a #oneteam.
We raise the bar: We always push for more. We work smart, smash barriers and elevate one another.
We keep it simple: Our ambitions are bold but our solutions are simple.
We build a legacy: We’re proud of the change we’re driving.
We care: We always look out for each other. Caring is also about the way we do business. We do the right thing.


What We Offer


A rare opportunity to work in a social impact company (and certified B Corp) where you can see real and tangible impact in your role.
Working alongside an international community of users, partners and 1,300+ colleagues across 19 countries that are on the same important mission.
Personal and professional development opportunities in a fast-paced scale-up environment.
An inclusive company culture where you can bring your authentic self to work
A strong, values-driven team culture where we celebrate successes and socialize with colleagues that care to offer


How To Apply


We take recruitment very seriously, so please carefully read everything we have written above.
Please also check our website and international media in order to get a good overview of Too Good To Go.
Please submit your CV and Cover letter in English.
Please note that we only accept applications coming through our platform. No CV or Cover Letter will be accepted by email or LinkedIn direct messaging.


Job Ref

A Movement for Everyone

We want to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together. With that mission, it’s only natural that we want to build a diverse and inclusive team of highly capable individuals who are passionate about doing things in a better way. We strongly believe we all excel and are more creative when we’re allowed to be ourselves, and we’re committed to a culture where all of us belong.

We are an equal opportunity employer and all employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need. If you need reasonable accommodation at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.


Show more

  • A strong, values-driven team culture where we celebrate successes and socialize with colleagues that care to offer

Title: Impact Analyzer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Nissan, we're not just building cars, we're revolutionizing mobility. We believe that every individual possesses a unique set of skills and passions that can be harnessed to drive innovation and shape the future of the automotive industry. Our global impact is fuelled by a force of over 160,000 dedicated minds, crafting and delivering innovation since 1933. For over 90 years, our core belief in doing what others don't has driven innovation and excitement for our customers, shaping Nissan into the business it is today. We are not just a company - we're a movement, pushing boundaries and embracing the spirit of "Defy Ordinary".

We are now looking for an Impact Analyser to join our newly created RBU. In this role, you will join the Analytics & Innovation team and report to the Analytics & Innovation Director.

How you can contribute and have an impact?


Follow and measure the impact of the incubators work and ensure the sustainability aspect within the projects and activities and to record/share learnings.
Impact Measurement: Develop and implement metrics and methodologies to measure the impact of incubator projects and activities.
Sustainability Assurance: Ensure that all projects and activities within the incubator are designed and executed with sustainability in mind.
Data Collection and Analysis: Collect, analyze, and interpret data to assess the effectiveness and sustainability of incubator initiatives.
Reporting: Prepare detailed reports on the impact and sustainability of projects, providing insights and recommendations for improvement.
Knowledge Sharing: Record and share learnings from incubator projects with internal teams and external stakeholders to promote best practices and continuous improvement.
Stakeholder Engagement: Work closely with project teams, mentors, and external partners to gather feedback and ensure alignment with sustainability goals.
Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities for enhancing the impact and sustainability of incubator activities and implement necessary changes.


What we look for:


Proven experience in impact measurement, sustainability management, or a related role.
Bachelor's degree in Business, Sustainability, Innovation Management, or a related field. A Master's degree is preferred.
Fluency in English, other local languages are considered as an advantage.
Business viability mindset.
New business model experience
Customer journey understanding.
Lifecycle management.
New business model design, Pricing, Market sizing.
Workshop animation.
Strong analytical, project management, and communication skills.
Ability to work with diverse stakeholders and drive continuous improvement.
Detail-oriented, proactive, and passionate about sustainability and innovation.


Nissan believes the power comes from the inside, the diversity and well-being of its employees is key to success. People are our most valuable assets, and diversity and inclusion are the key to maximizing the power of each individual member of our team. Nissan is committed to be a truly diverse, equitable, and inclusive company that empowers everyone to bring their best, most authentic selves to work. Respecting each person, their opinions and value is when we can drive innovations that make a difference.

Our future vision and ambition is "Together We Empower Mobility and Beyond" for a cleaner, safer and more inclusive world.

Amsterdam Netherlands

Title: Quantitative analyst
Description:
Are you skilled in valuation, Python & SQL? Eager to learn power markets & take responsibility? Join us as a Quantitative Analyst in a leading tech-driven energy trading company.

Here’s what the job entails
In the role, your primary function will be to analyse the European power markets and specific contracts linked to renewable assets. You will be compiling and analysing available data to build a solid foundation for our investment decisions. In addition, you will gain valuable experience of the European energy market and its price dynamics

Concretely, your responsibilities will include:

collaborating with portfolio managers, traders and analysts to perform valuation of financial products linked to energy generation
designing valuation frameworks and automating processes
maintaining and improving existing valuation and hedging tools
undertaking ad-hoc analysis tasks
proactively seeking to consolidate repetitive workflows and tasks



Meet the team
The power market analysis team supports the trading teams with thorough analysis, providing a solid foundation for investment decisions. Our primary area of responsibility is modelling the long-term evolution of the power market and prices within the European price zones.

We are a team of 10 specialists with backgrounds in engineering, physics and economics. We are a curious and innovative team, always seeking the information hidden in the data. We perform analysis with high integrity communicate the results to our stakeholders in a way that is easy to understand. We have an informal and humorous culture, where open communication and mutual respect are highly valued.

But enough about us… over to you!
As you will be working with a variety of stakeholders, we imagine that you are a great collaborator and are motivated to succeed as part of a team. We are also looking for someone who is able to work with complex tasks and can find efficient solutions while maintaining high standards of accuracy and integrity.

We also imagine that you:

hold a relevant educational background in engineering, physics, mathematics or economics
have a minimum of 2 years’ experience in a similar position where you have built things
are experienced in coding in Python and SQL
are proficient in English - both written and spoken
are great at stakeholder management



We’ll take good care of you
At Danske Commodities, we take great care of our people. Joining us means you’ll get a lot of great perks – including social events, cultural experiences, tasty food and benefits to better your health, your life and your future.

Here are some of the benefits we offer our employees:

Flexible working hours including the option to work from home up to two days per week

Fuel Fridays a monthly Friday off with pay, except for July and December, to fuel your energy

Vast development opportunities with the help of your own individual development plan, access to our DC University with 50+ courses as well as remote courses through Harvard Learning

Global career prospects as part of the Equinor group with +20,000 colleagues across the world

10% paid pension as well as a beneficial health care and insurance package

Great parental leave conditions including 26 weeks of paid maternity leave, 16 weeks of paid paternity/co-parent leave, paid pension while on leave and the opportunity to join ‘Inspired Beyond Babies’

Unlimited paid children’s sick days no limit on paid absence days in relation to child sickness

Extra days off five to be exact, every year – adding to the standard five weeks off each year

Senior days if you’re over 55 years old

Compensation for working night and weekend shifts
Bonus scheme
Share savings meaning you have the opportunity to participate in our parent company Equinor’s attractive share savings programme

Paid at home internet and equipment including a mobile phone with paid subscription and IT equipment for when working from home

100+ yearly social and professional events including DC Sports and DC Talks events, gatherings in our book club, bicycle club, student network, wine club, CS:GO team and more

Various free tickets to family-friendly and cultural attractions

Discounts at hotels, restaurants, sports clubs and more

Organic food including a light breakfast, lunch buffet and snacks throughout the day

An office in the heart of Aarhus right next to the central train station

…. and much more

Recruitment process and relocation
You can read more about our recruitment process here. Please note that if you are an international candidate, we will reimburse travel expenses in connection with potential interviews and support you with the relocation process.

What we’re about
We're a tech-driven energy trading company present in +40 markets across five continents. Our +600 people are driven by a need to constantly better things. If you are too, we could very well be the right place for you. You'll join a collective of thinkers and doers. Aspiring chefs, runners, parents, beekeepers, gamers – the list goes on. We're highly specialised experts within our fields. But it’s actually our diversity of ideas we’re most proud of, which is why we continuously work on strengthening an inclusive culture where diverse teams thrive.

Our organisation is flat with an open-door policy. We expect you to care. About your work. About your own and your colleagues’ collective successes. And about the difference we make at Danske Commodities. Together with our parent company Equinor, we have the vision and strength to accelerate the energy transition and make an impact. Like no other.

In summer 2025, we'll be moving to our brand-new headquarters in Aarhus. Our future home, Akson, will be located in Sydhavnskvarteret – a vibrant district where business meets culture. On top of being in this urban oasis, we’ll enjoy state-of-the-art facilities – including our own barista coffee shop, modern fitness facilities and breathtaking views that will make every day at the office even sweeter. We can't wait.
Show more
