Global career prospects as part of the Equinor group with +20,000 colleagues across the world

10% paid pension as well as a beneficial health care and insurance package

Great parental leave conditions including 26 weeks of paid maternity leave, 16 weeks of paid paternity/co-parent leave, paid pension while on leave and the opportunity to join ‘Inspired Beyond Babies’

Unlimited paid children’s sick days no limit on paid absence days in relation to child sickness

Extra days off five to be exact, every year – adding to the standard five weeks off each year

Senior days if you’re over 55 years old

Compensation for working night and weekend shifts
Bonus scheme
Share savings meaning you have the opportunity to participate in our parent company Equinor’s attractive share savings programme

Paid at home internet and equipment including a mobile phone with paid subscription and IT equipment for when working from home

100+ yearly social and professional events including DC Sports and DC Talks events, gatherings in our book club, bicycle club, student network, wine club, CS:GO team and more

Various free tickets to family-friendly and cultural attractions

Discounts at hotels, restaurants, sports clubs and more

Organic food including a light breakfast, lunch buffet and snacks throughout the day

An office in the heart of Aarhus right next to the central train station

…. and much more

Recruitment process and relocation
You can read more about our recruitment process here. Please note that if you are an international candidate, we will reimburse travel expenses in connection with potential interviews and support you with the relocation process.

What we’re about
We're a tech-driven energy trading company present in +40 markets across five continents. Our +600 people are driven by a need to constantly better things. If you are too, we could very well be the right place for you. You'll join a collective of thinkers and doers. Aspiring chefs, runners, parents, beekeepers, gamers – the list goes on. We're highly specialised experts within our fields. But it’s actually our diversity of ideas we’re most proud of, which is why we continuously work on strengthening an inclusive culture where diverse teams thrive.

Our organisation is flat with an open-door policy. We expect you to care. About your work. About your own and your colleagues’ collective successes. And about the difference we make at Danske Commodities. Together with our parent company Equinor, we have the vision and strength to accelerate the energy transition and make an impact. Like no other.

In summer 2025, we'll be moving to our brand-new headquarters in Aarhus. Our future home, Akson, will be located in Sydhavnskvarteret – a vibrant district where business meets culture. On top of being in this urban oasis, we’ll enjoy state-of-the-art facilities – including our own barista coffee shop, modern fitness facilities and breathtaking views that will make every day at the office even sweeter. We can't wait.

Title: Junior Data Analyst til Applied Knowledge & AI
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Er du passioneret omkring dataanalyser og visualisering? Vil du være med til at bygge Power BI rapporter der skaber indsigt og beslutningsgrundlag for nogle af Danmarks største infrastruktur projekter og anlæg? Kan du agere bindeled mellem det datatekniske og det forretningsmæssige? Så vil vi meget gerne høre fra dig!

Om stillingen

I Sund & Bælt søger vi en studentermedhjælper med erfaring og interesse i dataanalyser og rapportering. Du vil få mulighed for at arbejde med datavisualisering, store mængder data, videreformidling af indsigter, og mulighed for at udvikle din forretningsforståelse i en afdeling hvor du er omringet af dygtige kollegaer.

Dine arbejdsopgaver


Processere og transformere data jf. forretningsregler
Udvikle Power BI rapporter og lave ændringer til eksisterende Power BI rapporter
Udvidelse af eksisterende semantiske modeller
Udvidelse og dannelse af measures i Power BI
Lave og præsentere dataanalyser
Udarbejde dokumentation
Ad hoc supportopgaver


Hvem er du

Vi Forestiller Os At Du


Har mod på at løfte opgaver selvstændigt
Er dygtig til data visualisering
Har kendskab til SQL og Python
Det er en fordel at du har kendskab til Power BI og DAX
Kan sætte dig ind i forretningsbehov
Kan videreformidle dataanalyser i et tilgængeligt sprog og format
Har lyst til at indgå i samarbejde med både tekniske- og forretningsorienterede kollegaer


Vi lægger vægt på din interesse og din lyst til at lære.

Din kommende arbejdsplads

Du bliver en del af afdelingen Applied Knowledge & AI i divisionen Digital. Afdelingen har ansvar for data, AI og knowledge management i Sund & Bælt.

Du får en arbejdsplads med god energi, god omgangstone, og fleksibel arbejdstid, da det er vigtigt for os, at privatliv og arbejdsliv fungerer godt – der er ligeledes gode muligheder for faglig og personlig udvikling.

Dit arbejdssted vil være i Vester Søgade i hjertet af København.

Lyder det som noget for dig?

Så vil vi meget gerne høre fra dig. Hvis du har spørgsmål omkring stillingen er du velkommen til at kontakte Mie Hvas på tlf. 21 80 59 52

Send din ansøgning, så vi har den senest den 11. juni 2025.

Vi ønsker at være en inkluderende arbejdsplads med plads til forskellighed. Vi opfordrer derfor alle til at søge uanset køn, alder, etnicitet, religion, seksualitet eller funktionsnedsættelse.

Om os

Sund & Bælt binder Danmark sammen, fremmer grønnere mobilitet og udvikler fremtidens digitale trafikløsninger. Vi bygger under hensyn til naturen og driver infrastruktur til gavn for borgere, erhvervsliv og samfund.

Vi er en organisation i rivende udvikling, og som statsejet aktieselskab arbejder vi altid langsigtet og helhedsorienteret.

Du kan læse meget mere om Sund & Bælt på vores hjemmeside: Om os (sundogbaelt.dk).

Title: Student Assistant, Performance Marketing & Data Analysis
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
KAYAK, part of Booking Holdings (NASDAQ: BKNG), is the world’s leading travel search engine. With billions of queries across our platforms, we help people find their perfect flight, stay, rental car and vacation package. We’re also transforming business travel with a new corporate travel solution, KAYAK for Business.

As an employee of KAYAK, you will be part of a travel company that operates a portfolio of global metasearch brands including momondo, Cheapflights and HotelsCombined, among others. From start-up to industry leader, innovation is in our DNA and every employee has an opportunity to make their mark. Our focus is on building the best travel search engine to make it easier for everyone to experience the world.

We are on the lookout for a driven, analytical Student Assistant - could that be you? If you enjoy working with data, dashboards, and performance metrics and have dipped your toes into leveraging AI tools to automate workflows - the please read on!

You’ll help our team optimize the performance of well-known travel brands - like momondo, Cheapflights, and KAYAK - by pulling, analyzing, and reporting on key marketing data while also exploring ways to streamline processes using AI-powered tools. This is an excellent opportunity to apply your data analysis skills in a real-world marketing environment. Working closely with leadership in Copenhagen and teams across the globe, you'll gain valuable experience in a dynamic and globally connected environment.

In this role, you will:



Extract, clean, and analyze performance marketing data from various platforms.
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to track key performance indicators.
Work extensively with Excel and Google Sheets (pivot tables, formulas, data manipulation).
Support the team with ad hoc data requests and campaign performance analysis.
Assist in A/B testing, capturing and analyzing data to improve campaign results.
Collaborate with performance marketing teams to improve reporting processes.
Document analysis methods and ensure data accuracy across reports.
The average workload is around 15 hours per week, but there’s a high level of flexibility, especially during exam periods.



Please apply if you have/are:



Currently pursuing a degree with at least one year remaining.
Strong analytical skills and experience with data analysis, reporting and visualization
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel or Google Sheets (pivot tables, formulas, and data processing required).
Experience with various AI tools for problem solving.
Excellent communication skills in English (written and verbal).
Strong attention to detail and ability to work with large datasets.
Experience with SQL or other database languages is a plus.
Organized, thorough, and eager to learn.
Enthusiastic, ethical, and a collaborative team player.



If you love working with data, dashboards, and performance insights, then join KAYAK to help shape the future of travel!

Benefits



Focus on mental health and well-being:

Company-paid therapy sessions through SpringHealth
Company-paid subscription to HeadSpace
No meeting Fridays

Focus on your career growth:

Access to thousands of on-demand e-learnings

Travel Discounts
Employee Resource Groups
Lunch provided five days per week & breakfast once a week
Professional espresso machine
Awesome office in the city centre of Copenhagen
Monthly social events, Thursday bars


Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

At KAYAK/momondo, we aspire to be a workplace that fosters inclusion and reflects the diverse communities we serve. Hiring people with different backgrounds and perspectives is critical to innovation and to how we deliver great experiences for our users, partners, and teams. We strive to be an open and welcoming environment so that no matter who you are, you can be yourself.

We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform job responsibilities, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation(s).

Title: Senior Data Analyst (Demand)
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Too Good To Go, we have an ambitious goal: to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together.

40% of all food produced in the world is wasted. And that has a huge impact on the health of our planet, with 10% of greenhouse gas emissions coming from food waste.

We’re more than an app: we are a certified B Corporation with a mission to empower everyone to take action against food waste, so alongside our marketplace app, we create educational tools, explore new business solutions - such as our Retail Technologies offering, and influence legislation to help reduce food waste.

We’re growing fast: Our community of 118 million registered users and 246,000 active partners across 19 countries, have together already prevented 443+ million meals from going to waste - avoiding over 1.198.000 tonnes of CO2e!

Your mission

We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst (Demand) to strengthen our use of data to inform our most business critical decisions. On a daily basis, you will be working with business leaders across Operations, Finance, and Marketing teams to inform how they measure success, how they use data to inform strategic decisions, and ensure they have the data visibility and tools they need to make progress on those strategies every day.

Your role


Design and deliver data products within the global operational excellence organization to unlock better operations workflows through automation and improved access to insights.
Generate new ideas for how to leverage the data we have to drive business performance
Provide data-driven guidance to business leaders on key strategic decisions
Elevate data literacy across the organisation, with an eye toward consistency, ease of understanding, and educating on the right way to use data in each function
Elevate the Global Analytics team by sharing best practices and learnings and offering ad-hoc guidance to other team members on their projects


Requirements


You have previous experience in an analytical role
You have a breadth of experience mapping business questions to data problems
You have a great understanding of Marketplace health metrics (LTV, CAC, Retention, ROI)
You are familiar with tracking of Marketing/Product initiatives and impact analysis
You are motivated by improving efficiency and effectiveness through automation
You are driven by the “why” behind the work that you do, always eager to ask an extra question to make sure you’re solving for the right thing
You have experience managing multiple projects
You are passionate about data literacy
You have a proactive mindset and work well in a team environment
You are strongly proficient in SQL
You are strongly proficient in at least one BI/Data Visualisation tool (Looker, Tableau, PowerBI, etc.)


Our values


We win together: Food waste is a big beast to fight. We believe in a #oneteam.
We raise the bar: We always push for more. We work smart, smash barriers and elevate one another.
We keep it simple: Our ambitions are bold but our solutions are simple.
We build a legacy: We’re proud of the change we’re driving.
We care: We always look out for each other. Caring is also about the way we do business. We do the right thing.


What We Have To Offer


An opportunity to work in a global social-impact company and certified B Corporation! where you can see a real and tangible impact in your role.
To be an integral part of our Data & Analytics team. We are eager for you to make an impact and contribute to the role of analytics across key decisions and our solution processes. Your insights are valuable, and we are here to listen.
Work-life balance is important to us! Focus on the job to be done, not the hours spent, there is no need for overtime.
We trust in our employees and encourage an autonomous environment that provides several opportunities for employees to contribute, develop and take ownership of their work in a way that works for them.
To be part of an international company, with over 1,300+ colleagues across 19 countries that are on the same important mission.
An informal environment, working alongside 190+ passionate people within Tech & Product
We celebrate our differences and our successes and have a strong values-driven team culture.
We work in a hybrid set-up and value in office work weekly.
We may be able to support you with a working visa in Copenhagen, please be prepared to discuss this topic further as your first stage interview.


How To Apply


We take recruitment very seriously, so please carefully read everything we have written above.
Please also check our website and international media in order to get a good overview of Too Good To Go.
Please submit your CV and Cover letter in English.
Please note that we only accept applications coming through our platform. No CV or Cover Letter will be accepted by email or LinkedIn direct messaging.


Job Ref

A Movement for Everyone

We want to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together. With that mission, it’s only natural that we want to build a diverse and inclusive team of highly capable individuals who are passionate about doing things in a better way. We strongly believe we all excel and are more creative when we’re allowed to be ourselves, and we’re committed to a culture where all of us belong.

We are an equal opportunity employer and all employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need. If you need reasonable accommodation at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.

Title: BI Reporting and Analytics Specialist BOLIA
Description:
At BOLIA, we are constantly evolving and have high ambitions for our IT solutions to create the best possible experiences for our customers, colleagues, and partners. We are heavily data-driven in our decision-making, and we have a growing need for outstanding BI reports and analyses across the entire business. This encompasses everything from store personnel to back-office functions, as well as BOLIA's management group.

About The Job

In short, we have a wealth of data at BOLIA, and we aim to utilize it even more effectively than we do today! To strengthen this effort, we are looking for a new colleague to act as BI Reporting and Analytics Specialist with a primary focus on the PowerBI platform. In this role, you will have a broad interface across all departments at BOLIA, and you will also collaborate with our many external partners in developing new reporting solutions.

Your tasks

The tasks in this role are numerous and varied. Examples include:


Drive and participate in the development of reporting solutions in PowerBI to enhance BOLIA's decision-making capabilities and foster a performance-driven culture.
Take ownership of BOLIA’s BI platform, with a primary focus on the front-end. This includes defining governance and best practice principles for BI in BOLIA.
Collaborate closely with your colleague responsible for backend BI tasks, who will establish the data foundation for your work, primarily by integrating it into our BI cube.
Participate in the ongoing project including taking our current on-prem BI platform to the next level using Microsoft Fabric, expanding our current reporting capabilities.
Provide second-level support for BI frontend-related tasks.
Manage vendors and follow up on deliveries from external partners who assist with BI work.
Participate in various business projects in collaboration with all departments at BOLIA.
Participate in the BI Center of Excellence in BOLIA to align on the BI efforts.


BOLIA and our IT solutions are undergoing rapid development, providing you with the opportunity to make a significant impact from day one by setting the agenda within the BI area, in collaboration with your colleagues. You will become a key figure at our headquarters, collaborating closely with many of your colleagues across all departments. Additionally, we will continue to engage external partners to assist with BI tasks, who will also serve as your professional sparring partners.

Your Qualifications

We value personality and practical experience far more than educational background, which can vary. The more of the following points you can check off, the better.


You are highly skilled at developing precise and advanced PowerBI reports, consistently delivering insightful and impactful data visualizations, with 3+ years of documented experience.
You are passionate about inspiring others and showcasing the potential of data and Business Intelligence to drive better decision-making across the organization.
You possess strong analytical skills to interpret complex data and provide actionable insights.
You have knowledge of DAX, Star Schema modeling, GIT, and the creation of custom visuals, which is considered an advantage.
You have excellent verbal and written communication skills to convey complex information clearly and concisely.
You have a high level of attention to detail to ensure accuracy and quality in your work.
You have a collaborative approach, working effectively with cross-functional teams to achieve common goals and drive organizational success.
You are eager to acquire new knowledge and stay updated on the latest trends in your field, such as AI and Microsoft Copilot for PowerBI.


BOLIA as a workplace


We are located in the heart of Aarhus, close to the train station, in what are arguably the most beautiful office spaces in Denmark!
We have a very active staff association that regularly organizes a variety of events, from parties to knitting clubs.
We have a young working environment with an amazing unity across all departments.
We are part of the Lars Larsen Group, which means that as an employee, you will receive a good staff discount in all Lars Larsen Group companies, including furniture, restaurants, and spa stays.
Our workday is flexible with possibilities for sometimes working from home.


Do you want to join our journey?

We conduct interviews on an ongoing basis, so we recommend sending your CV as soon as possible. If you have any questions about the position, please feel free to contact IT Business Performance Manager, Kasper Poulsen, at kpo@bolia.com.

All inquiries will be treated confidentially.

We look forward to hearing from you!
Show more

This encompasses everything from store personnel to back-office functions, as well as BOLIA's management group.

About The Job

In short, we have a wealth of data at BOLIA, and we aim to utilize it even more effectively than we do today! To strengthen this effort, we are looking for a new colleague to act as BI Reporting and Analytics Specialist with a primary focus on the PowerBI platform. In this role, you will have a broad interface across all departments at BOLIA, and you will also collaborate with our many external partners in developing new reporting solutions.

Your tasks

The tasks in this role are numerous and varied. Examples include:

  • Drive and participate in the development of reporting solutions in PowerBI to enhance BOLIA's decision-making capabilities and foster a performance-driven culture.
  • Take ownership of BOLIA’s BI platform, with a primary focus on the front-end. This includes defining governance and best practice principles for BI in BOLIA.
  • Collaborate closely with your colleague responsible for backend BI tasks, who will establish the data foundation for your work, primarily by integrating it into our BI cube.
  • Participate in the ongoing project including taking our current on-prem BI platform to the next level using Microsoft Fabric, expanding our current reporting capabilities.
  • Provide second-level support for BI frontend-related tasks.
  • Manage vendors and follow up on deliveries from external partners who assist with BI work.
  • Participate in various business projects in collaboration with all departments at BOLIA.
  • Participate in the BI Center of Excellence in BOLIA to align on the BI efforts.

BOLIA and our IT solutions are undergoing rapid development, providing you with the opportunity to make a significant impact from day one by setting the agenda within the BI area, in collaboration with your colleagues. You will become a key figure at our headquarters, collaborating closely with many of your colleagues across all departments. Additionally, we will continue to engage external partners to assist with BI tasks, who will also serve as your professional sparring partners.

Your Qualifications

We value personality and practical experience far more than educational background, which can vary. The more of the following points you can check off, the better.

  • You are highly skilled at developing precise and advanced PowerBI reports, consistently delivering insightful and impactful data visualizations, with 3+ years of documented experience.
  • You are passionate about inspiring others and showcasing the potential of data and Business Intelligence to drive better decision-making across the organization.
  • You possess strong analytical skills to interpret complex data and provide actionable insights.
  • You have knowledge of DAX, Star Schema modeling, GIT, and the creation of custom visuals, which is considered an advantage.
  • You have excellent verbal and written communication skills to convey complex information clearly and concisely.
  • You have a high level of attention to detail to ensure accuracy and quality in your work.
  • You have a collaborative approach, working effectively with cross-functional teams to achieve common goals and drive organizational success.
  • You are eager to acquire new knowledge and stay updated on the latest trends in your field, such as AI and Microsoft Copilot for PowerBI.

BOLIA as a workplace

  • We are located in the heart of Aarhus, close to the train station, in what are arguably the most beautiful office spaces in Denmark!
  • We have a very active staff association that regularly organizes a variety of events, from parties to knitting clubs.
  • We have a young working environment with an amazing unity across all departments.
  • We are part of the Lars Larsen Group, which means that as an employee, you will receive a good staff discount in all Lars Larsen Group companies, including furniture, restaurants, and spa stays.
  • Our workday is flexible with possibilities for sometimes working from home.

Do you want to join our journey?

We conduct interviews on an ongoing basis, so we recommend sending your CV as soon as possible. If you have any questions about the position, please feel free to contact IT Business Performance Manager, Kasper Poulsen, at kpo@bolia.com.

All inquiries will be treated confidentially.

We look forward to hearing from you!

Title: Data Analyst til Claims Analytics - barselsvikariat
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Gjensidige er et nordisk skadeforsikringsselskab, som er noteret på Oslo Børs. Vi har ca. 4.500 medarbejdere, heraf 1.100 i Danmark, og vi tilbyder skadeforsikring i Norge, Danmark og Sverige. I Norge tilbyder vi også pension og opsparing. Driftsindtægterne var 36 mia. NOK i 2023, mens forvaltningskapitalen udgjorde 148 mia. NOK.

Brænder du for analyse og data? Vil du bidrage til at gøre Gjensidige endnu mere indsigtsdrevet? Nu har du muligheden!

Gode grunde til at arbejde i Gjensidige

I Gjensidige har vi arbejdet for at sikre liv, sundhed og værdier i over 200 år. Vi har som ambition at være Nordens mest kundeorienterede skadeforsikringsselskab, og koncernens strategi er at være indsigt- og analysebaseret. Vi søger nu efter en engageret og dygtig Data Analytiker til et vikariat.

Division Skade skal levere markedets bedste kundeoplevelser, når skaden er sket. Vi har satset stort på ny teknologi og automatisering de sidste år, og har ambitiøse mål for fortsat effektivisering og teknologiudvikling. Teamet i Claims Analytics er helt centralt i dette arbejde. Afdelingen består af 7 dygtige medarbejdere, 4 i Norge og 3 i Danmark. Den ene data scientist i Danmark skal på barselsorlov i september 2025 og vi søger derfor en vikar for hende i denne periode. Vi arbejder sammen på tværs for at gøre Skade endnu mere analyse- og indsigtsdrevet, og udnytte nye muligheder. I rollen som Data Analyst kan du gøre en forskel i dette arbejde. Hos os vil du arbejde med spændende og udfordrende opgaver.

Din hverdag som Data Analyst i Claims Analytics vil blandt andet bestå af:


Bidrage til at opnå koncernens ambitiøse mål for at reducere erstatningsomkostninger, bæredygtige og effektive skadeprocesser samt markedets bedste kundeoplevelser drevet af AI, data og analytics
Udvikle gode styreværktøjer for skadeorganisationen
Overvåge, analysere og formidle indsigt knyttet til drift, erstatningsomkostninger og udvikling
Rapportering og prognoser



Vi forestiller os, at du har:


En relevant videregående uddannelse på kandidatniveau inden for f.eks. statistik, matematik, økonomi, IT eller lignende
Kendskab og erfaring med programmering og analyseværktøjer (for eksempel SAS/ SQL/ Python/ Power BI/ dbt /Databricks)
Det er en fordel hvis du har kendskab til forsikring, men det er ikke et krav
Omgængelig, trives med at formidle indsigt og kommunikerer godt på et skandinavisk sprog og engelsk (mundtligt og skriftligt)
Forretningsorienteret og relationsskabende både indenfor og udenfor teamet
Nysgerrig og kan lide at udforske potentialet i komplekse og store mængder data fra flere forskellige kilder
Gåpåmod og er vedholdende
Tager initiativ, kan lide et højt tempo, er selvmotiverende og samtidig en holdspiller



Hvad kan vi tilbyde

Du kommer til at arbejde tæt sammen med en samling af drevne, fagligt dygtige og søde kollegaer i både Danmark og Norge.

Gjensidige er et af Nordens største forsikringsselskaber, så der er mange muligheder for både faglig og personlig udvikling – på tværs af fag og landegrænser.

Du får gode vilkår herunder fordelagtige forsikringer og pensionsordning og - hvis vi selv skal sige det - et hav af gode kollegaer. Derudover får du en arbejdsplads placeret i København SV, i moderne omgivelser med nem adgang til offentlig transport og gode parkeringsmuligheder.

Du vil blive omfattet af forsikringsoverenskomsten.

Barselsvikariatet er på 9 måneder og med ønsket opstart d. 1. august 2025.

Er du interesseret?

Så send os din ansøgning og CV snarest muligt, da vi indkalder til samtaler løbende.

Vi opfordrer alle kandidater, uanset køn, alder, etnicitet, seksualitet og handicap til at søge stillinger i Gjensidige, da vi er en virksomhed, der ønsker at afspejle det mangfoldige samfund vi er en del af.

Ansættelsesleder Kontakter: Ariane,

(+47)97193475, ariane.grumstad@gjensidige.no

Ansøgningsfrist: 29/05/2025
Show more

Title: Insights & Measurement Lead - L'Oréal Nordic - Copenhagen
Description:
Become the architect of L'Oréal's data-driven future!

As the Insights & Measurement Lead, you are the driving force behind our consumer insights practice and collaborating across multiple divisions & functions to unlock the full potential of our data. This is a high-impact role where your expertise will shape key business decisions and drive growth across the organization.

What You'll Do

Champion Insights: Lead the charge in leveraging 1P data across all touchpoints, uncovering valuable insights into consumer lifetime value and database engagement. Connect the dots between 1P and 2P data to gain a 360° view of our consumers.

Drive Strategic Growth: Partner with the data teams and various divisions to develop data-driven strategies and action plans. Orchestrate multi-division acquisition campaigns and optimize for maximum impact.

Master Measurement: Standardize measurement practices, ensure KPI alignment, and champion a test-and-learn culture. Guide local teams in experimental design and analysis, ensuring robust results and actionable insights.

Guardian of Data Quality: Act as the key point of contact for data quality and privacy, collaborating closely with IT and DPO to ensure compliance and maintain the highest standards of data governance.

What You'll Bring

People Developer: A passion for fostering collaboration and strengthening the DDX community.

Strategic Thinker: An ability to translate data into actionable insights and drive business decisions.

Innovative Mindset: A curious and forward-thinking approach to consumer profiling and insight generation.

Integrator: Strong coordination skills to ensure alignment across multiple teams and stakeholders.

Entrepreneurial Spirit: A proactive and collaborative approach to problem-solving and driving innovation.

Proven Expertise: Solid experience in data-driven decision making, business acumen, data privacy, and performance measurement.

Ready to make an impact?

If you are a passionate data enthusiast with a drive to excel, we encourage you to apply.

We are looking for our new Insights & Measurement Lead to start as soon as possible. The employment is permanent. Applications are reviewed on a rolling basis, so do not wait to apply. We welcome everyone to apply no matter your gender, ethnicity, physical abilities, religion, or sexual orientation.

What’s in it for you?

From the start, you'll have great responsibility, challenges, and opportunities, including an individual career plan and coaching leadership. Enjoy extensive training, competitive benefits, modern offices, and a dynamic, international working environment with engaged and skilled colleagues. Our Nordic organization includes nearly 1000 employees across the four Nordic capitals.

Who are we?

Leading the world in beauty and beauty tech, we are over 90,000 employees across 150 countries with 37 international brands. In 2024, the Group generated €43.48 billion in sales. We deliver innovation and digital solutions, embracing entrepreneurship. For 115 years, we've devoted ourselves to fulfilling beauty aspirations worldwide. With 21 research centers globally and a dedicated team of over 4,000 scientists and 8,000 Digital talents, L’Oréal is focused on the future of beauty and becoming a Beauty Tech powerhouse.

Freedom to Go Beyond. That's the Beauty of L'Oréal.

Title: BI udvikler
Place: Kolding, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Er du en passioneret data-entusiast med en evne til at forvandle komplekse data til klare, handlingsorienterede indsigter?




Hos NCG søger de en erfaren og engageret BI Developer til at styrke deres Data Analytics team. Du vil blive en nøgleperson i at drive dere datadrevne beslutningsprocesser og hjælpe dem med at tage deres BI-løsninger til det næste niveau.




Mission

De står midt i en spændende digital transformation, hvor de bevæger sig mod en cloud-baseret eller hybrid infrastruktur. Du vil være med til at forme fremtiden og sikre, at ders data er grundlaget for vores succes.




Du bliver en del af et stærkt team, som har en god balance mellem drift og udvikling, hvor du får mulighed for at arbejde med både vedligehold og nye projekter.




Kerneopgaver

Din hverdag vil være fyldt med spændende udfordringer og varierede opgaver:

Du vil dykke ned i forretningens behov og omsætte dem til datadrevne løsninger i samarbejde med nøgleinteressenter.
Du vil være ansvarlig for udvikling og vedligeholdelse af dashboards og rapporter i Qlik Sense og Power BI.
Du vil udføre dybdegående analyser og identificere trends, mønstre og forretningskritiske indsigter, der kan drive beslutninger.
Du vil bidrage til udviklingen af KPI'er og datamodeller, der gør data let tilgængelige og anvendelige i hele organisationen.
Du vil spille en aktiv rolle i overgangen til en moderne cloud-baseret platform (Microsoft Azure/Fabric og Power BI).
Du vil supportere forretningen med træning og løbende forbedringer af BI-løsninger.
Du vil deltage i spændende projekter, hvor data er i centrum.




Kvalifikationer

Vi leder efter dig, der:

Har solid erfaring med udvikling og vedligeholdelse af BI-løsninger i Power BI og SQL.
Er dygtig til dataanalyse og fortolkning af komplekse datasæt.
Besidder stærke kommunikations- og samarbejdsevner.
Har en god forståelse for forretningsprocesser.
Kan arbejde selvstændigt og tage ansvar for dine opgaver.
Har erfaring med Qlik Sense og Azure/Fabric (eller er motiveret for at lære det).




Om Nic. Christiansen Gruppen

Nic. Christiansen Gruppen er en af Danmarks største bilkoncerner, der siden grundlæggelsen i 1967 har arbejdet med bilimport og -detailsalg samt finansiering og leasing af biler.




Den familieejede koncern har hovedsæde i Kolding og står i dag for den danske import af Hyundai, BYD, Omoda & Jaecoo, Ford, Land Rover og Jaguar. Herudover ejer koncernen de seks bilkæder Bayern AutoGroup, May & Olde, Stadac, Terminalen, ERA BILER og British MotorGroup samt værkstedskæden Skorstensgaard og leasing- og finansieringsselskabet NCG Finans.




Interesseret?

Så søg stillingen ved at klikke “ansøg”. Vi er på udkig efter medarbejdere, som kan starte snarest muligt, så tøv ikke med at sende os din ansøgning og dit CV. Har du nogen spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte konsulent Julius Hauge på mail julius.hauge@randstad.dk.




Denne proces håndteres af Randstad, og alle henvendelser bedes rettet hertil.




Om Randstad

Randstad er verdens største HR-udbyder og ‘partner for talent’. Vi giver lige muligheder til alle uanset baggrund og hjælper kandidater med at forblive relevante på et hastigt skiftende arbejdsmarked. Vi tror på et inkluderende arbejdsmarked, hvor alle kan være sig selv og føle sig velkomne.




Vores markedsindsigt og store kendskab til arbejdsmarkedet hjælper virksomheder med at opbygge en kvalificeret, mangfoldig og fleksibel arbejdsstyrke, og vi støtter mennesker og virksomheder i at nå deres fulde potentiale. Det er det, vi er her for, og det er det, der motiverer os hver dag.




Randstad DK er en del af den internationale Randstad Group. Vi formidler dagligt arbejde til over 600.000 mennesker verden over og er førende inden for rekruttering, karriererådgivning og fleksibel arbejdskraft i Danmark, med afdelinger i København, Aarhus, Aalborg og Kolding.

Show more

Title: Senior Specialist - Growth Analytics
Description:
Senior Specialist - Growth Analytics




About the Job

JOE & THE JUICE is entering a new phase of data-driven, scalable global growth. We are now looking for a sharp, strategic, and tech-savvy Senior Specialist - Growth Analytics to join our high-performing Growth team at our Global HQ in Copenhagen, supporting the growth journey of opening and operating +1,000 stores within the coming years.




Reporting directly to the Chief Growth Officer, Sebastian Vestergaard, you will play a central role in enabling decision-making, developing forecasting models, and driving AI integration across the business. This is a hands-on and highly visible position, giving you exposure to C-Level stakeholders and the opportunity to shape the analytical and strategic engine behind our international expansion.




Key Responsibilities

Build and maintain business-critical dashboards and forecasting models to support global expansion.
Establish performance and forecasting frameworks using tools like Snowflake and Power BI.
Automate reporting pipelines and deliver structured insights for leadership and Growth Committee reviews.
Act as the AI lead for the Growth team - identifying high-impact use cases and supporting implementation.
Translate strategic goals into measurable KPIs and ensure alignment with commercial objectives.
Champion data governance and help build the internal analytics infrastructure.
Provide decision support for real estate, budget planning, and cross-functional growth initiatives.
Collaborate with Real Estate, Finance, Legal, and Operations teams to drive performance and prioritization.
Guide junior analysts and contribute to building a high-performance team culture within Growth.




Key Qualifications

You have a Master’s degree in finance, business administration, or related fields
You have 4+ years of experience in analytics, consulting, strategy, or finance.
You’re highly proficient in Power BI, AI, Excel, and PowerPoint.
You have experience with Snowflake or similar cloud-based data platforms.
You can communicate complex insights clearly to both technical and commercial stakeholders.
You thrive in a fast-paced environment and enjoy working cross-functionally.
You are commercially sharp, curious, and energized by building new systems and tools.




The Benefits

We offer a benefits package that includes a paid pension plan, health insurance, parental leave, and additional vacation. Besides that, we provide some Joe-ified benefits:

Our global headquarter is located with great accessibility in the heart of Copenhagen and accommodates 160+ employees.
Our office facilities include a fully staffed JOE & THE JUICE bar, serving breakfast, daily lunch, juice, and barista coffee.
Our office features an ambient atmosphere with carefully curated music.
In Joe, we have a flat hierarchy where all opinions are valued, allowing plenty of room for input and improvement ideas.
Our monthly social calendar is packed with great activities such as running club, wine tasting, creative evenings, and Friday bars.
Fitness facilities filled with all the equipment you need to keep yourself healthy and fit, along with already accessible showers with complimentary towels and a steam room.




The Process

We are looking for a candidate to start as soon as possible.

We will only consider applications through Easy Apply and will conduct interviews on a rolling basis.




If you have any questions, please direct them to our Chief Growth Officer, Sebastian Vestergaard. Please note that we cannot guarantee a response to personal requests or messages.




Read how we handle your data during the recruitment process here: https://www.joejuice.com/policy/recruitment-privacy-notice

JOE & THE JUICE is entering a new phase of data-driven, scalable global growth. We are now looking for a sharp, strategic, and tech-savvy Senior Specialist - Growth Analytics to join our high-performing Growth team at our Global HQ in Copenhagen, supporting the growth journey of opening and operating +1,000 stores within the coming years.

Title: Performance Intelligence Consultant
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you passionate about turning complex data into powerful insights that influence decisions for global brands? Do you love uncovering patterns, experiment & testing theories, and translating numbers into actionable strategies? If so, we want to hear from you.

At VML MAP, we're looking for a Performance Intelligence Consultant who thrives at the intersection of data, strategy, and storytelling. You'll play a key role in helping our clients optimize performance across digital channels and drive real business results.

What will your day look like?

As Performance Intelligence Consultant, you'll be at the forefront of data-driven decision-making and play a vital role in understanding client priorities and objectives. With a foundational understanding of user experience and a strong grasp of data and analytical approaches, you'll be the bridge between data and strategy. Your daily activities will include conducting detailed data analysis to identify performance trends, designing and executing A/B tests and analyzing the results to provide optimization recommendations. You'll also be preparing and presenting performance reports, and your strong communication skills and storytelling abilities will ensure that actionable insights are delivered in an easily understood format, and in a way that motivates and provides a clear direction for various teams.

More Specifically, Your Tasks Include


Conduct detailed data analysis to identify performance trends and insights.
Prepare and present performance reports and translate the complex data into actionable insights to internal teams as well as our clients, with a focus on content, audience, and channels.
Maintain and update performance dashboards and analytics tools.
Collaborate with various teams to ensure data-driven decision-making.
Design, execute and analyze A/B tests and experiments to identify the most effective strategies and tactics.
Approach all tasks with curiosity, hunger and open-mindedness, constantly striving to uncover further insights from the available data and to understand the "why" behind the numbers.


Who are you going to work with?

You'll be part of our expanding Insights & Optimization team, reporting directly to the Performance Intelligence Lead. You'll work closely with data analysts, strategists, content experts, and client teams - acting as the vital link between technical data and business outcomes.

What do you bring to the table?

We're looking for curious minds with a strategic outlook and a passion for data. You're not just comfortable with numbers; you're adept at translating them into narratives that resonate with both technical and non-technical audiences, and you have a strong curiosity to discover the 'why' behind the data. Additionally, you are very collaboratively oriented, and you love working with cross-functional teams. Your expertise in detailed analysis and optimization will be instrumental in driving improvements and delivering actionable insights that enhance our daily tasks for clients.

In Addition, You Have


Experience analyzing campaign performance across digital channels and a strong understanding of marketing performance metrics such as open-rates, click through rates, conversions and journey data.
Experience with data visualizations tools such as Power BI and Tableau and strong knowledge of SQL for data manipulation and analysis.
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, including advanced functions and data manipulation.
Ability to translate complex data into understandable insights for non-technical audiences.
Skills in crafting compelling narratives from data insights.
Experience in presenting findings and recommendations to clients and/or Senior stakeholders.
Skills in managing expectations and building trust with clients and internal teams.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment with an open mind.
Curiosity, adaptability, and a proactive approach to problem-solving.
Strong understanding of A/B testing methodologies and tools, with hands-on experience in driving learning agendas and continuous optimization efforts.


A leader in personalized customer experiences

VML MAP is a world-leading Centre of Excellence that helps businesses humanize the relationship between the brand and the customer through hyper personalization at scale, marketing automation and CRM. With the brain of a consultancy, the heart of an agency and the power of technology and data, we work with some of the world's most admired brands to help them on their transformation journey to becoming truly customer-centric. Together, we are 1000 + technology specialists, data scientists, strategic thinkers, consultants, operations experts, and creative minds from 55+ nationalities.

A global network

We are part of the global VML network that encompasses more than 30,000 employees across 150+ offices in 60+ markets, each contributing to a culture that values connection, belonging, and the power of differences.

WPP (VML MAP) is an equal opportunity employer and considers applicants for all positions without discrimination or regard to characteristics. We are committed to fostering a culture of respect in which everyone feels they belong and has the same opportunities to progress in their careers.

For more information, please visit our website, and follow VML MAP on our social channels via Instagram, LinkedIn and X.

When you click "Apply now" below, your information is sent to VML MAP. To learn more about how we process your personal data during when you apply for a role with us, on how you can update your information or have the information removed please read our Privacy policy. California residents should read our California Recruitment Privacy Notice.

Title: Student Assistant, Media Analytics
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you have a sharp eye for detail and a love for data? Then we might need our help to ensure our media reporting is top-notch, accurate, and driving smart business decisions! If your educational journey is taking you through the world of data analytics and dashboard development, we’ve got the perfect role for you!

Join our Media Analytics Team as a Student Assistant and make a real impact on our business. This is more than just a student job – it's your chance to help tell the story of how our media efforts drive results and shape the future of Pandora. You’ll be at the heart of our reporting setup, ensuring senior management has the best insights at their fingertips, helping them make informed, strategic decisions.

Why this job rocks

As a Reporting Student Assistant, your role goes beyond crunching numbers. You’ll be helping to create dashboards that not only dazzle with their design but deliver insights that influence major business decisions. You’ll be our data detective, validating numbers, uncovering insights, and bringing clarity to complex data.

You’ll work closely with a friendly and collaborative team who value each other's ideas and contributions. And when we say team, we mean family! We love a good laugh and keep the vibe light while delivering top tier work that powers our business forward.

What You’ll Do


Data Quality Champion: Be the gatekeeper of our data, ensuring that all reports and dashboards are filled with accurate, validated information that stakeholders can trust.
Data Validation Detective: Dive into large datasets, perform rigorous quality checks, and troubleshoot any discrepancies to maintain a high standard of reporting accuracy.
Dashboard development Sidekick: Support in building visually stunning and user-friendly dashboards that turn data into actionable insights. Don’t worry if Power BI isn’t your forte yet – we’ll help you become an expert in no time.
Collaborative Problem-Solving: Participate in bi-weekly sprints to prioritize tasks and solve data-related challenges, working closely with a dynamic team of media professionals.
Ad-Hoc Reporting Magic: Support various reporting-related tasks as needed, helping the team deliver actionable insights on time.



What You’ll Bring To The Table


Curiosity and Quick Learning: You’re passionate about learning and enjoy digging into data, uncovering insights, and solving problems.
Experience with Big Data: You’re comfortable working with large datasets, identifying patterns, and ensuring that all details are accurate and meaningful.
Power BI Familiarity (Bonus): Experience with Power BI or other visualization tools is a plus, though the focus will be on ensuring data quality over building dashboards.
Data Savviness: An understanding of data pipelines and relationship tables (GCP or other cloud platforms) is a bonus but not required.
Media Know-How (Bonus): Familiarity with marketing and paid media is helpful, but not essential.
Relevant educational background: Preferably with a couple of year’s left before graduation



Your Personal Skills That Make a Difference


Self-Motivation: Proactively seek out opportunities to learn and grow within the team, contributing to both personal and business success.
Attention to Detail: Accuracy in data validation and reporting is key to ensuring that our dashboards provide reliable insights to drive business decisions.
Collaboration: Comfortable working with both internal and external teams, adapting to a variety of work styles and team dynamics.
Contributor: Likes to contribute to an informal and humorous working environment in your own capacity



Additional Information

This job is based in the PANDORA Global Office in Copenhagen, Denmark.

Start date: as soon as possible

Why you’ll love working at Pandora

Pandora is a company with a big heart and an even bigger ambition. We’re dedicated to making sure our people are happy, engaged, and thriving in their roles. You’ll be joining a vibrant global marketing team full of passionate, creative individuals who are the best at what they do. At Pandora, we believe in doing great work, but we also believe in having a great time doing it!

If you’re ready to take your data skills to the next level while having a blast with a fantastic team, we’d love to have you aboard!

Additional Information

This role is based in the Pandora Global Office in Copenhagen, Denmark and your working hours will be 20 per week on average (less around exams and more when possible and required).

 In order to apply for this position, you need to currently be a student enrolled in a Danish university.

 Did we get your attention?

We hope you got all your questions answered and feel confident applying for this position. If you would like to become a part of Pandora’s future, please do not hesitate to apply. We look forward to hearing from you!

 We process applications on a continuous basis, which is why we encourage you to send your application as soon as possible. You can also read more about Pandora on our corporate site www.pandoragroup.com.

 Icing on the cake

You will be working out of our beautiful Head Office in Copenhagen V, established in 2016 and designed to unite and inspire our teams. Besides our beautiful interior design we are also proud of our LEED Gold Certification for Energy and Environmental Design. This means that we use as few natural resources as possible and that we use them with respect. The result is a professional and dynamic space that is unique, comfortable and inspirational – and delivers a true Pandora experience to anyone who works here or comes to visit.

About Pandora

Pandora is the world's largest jewellery brand, specialising in the design, crafting and marketing of accessible luxury jewellery made from high-quality materials. Each piece is created to inspire self-expression, allowing people to share their stories and passions through meaningful jewellery. Pandora jewellery is sold in more than 100 countries through 6,800 points of sale, including more than 2,700 concept stores.

Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs 37,000 people worldwide and crafts its jewellery using only recycled silver and gold. Pandora is committed to leadership in sustainability and has set out to halve greenhouse gas emissions across its value chain by 2030. Pandora is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and generated revenue of DKK 31.7 billion (EUR 4.2 billion) in 2024.

Title: Business Intelligence Specialist
Place: Kongens Lyngby, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Business Intelligence Specialist, Lyngby



Full-time permanent



Hybrid



 



Do you want to be part of developing the BI tools that will provide insights, drive actions, and ultimately support the strategic direction of COWI? Can you convert data into compelling storytelling through visualisations - and do you have strong collaboration skills? Then this opportunity might be for you.



 



Create the solutions that will enable a better tomorrow



As a Business Intelligence Specialist, you will be part of the Business Intelligence and Insights team, and you will play an instrumental role in bringing our company data to strategic use. Our team develops BI-tools targeted at colleagues all across COWI - providing data-based insights and supporting actions to enable our long-term strategic ambitions as outlined in our strategy. We have an ambition to take the use of data to the next level.



 



You will report to the Head of Business Intelligence and Insights, Sofie Gade Sundin, and you will work in close cooperation with colleagues in the team as well as many stakeholders across COWI.



 



On a day-to-day basis, you will:



Work closely with cross-functional teams to gather and analyse business requirements for BI projects
Design, develop and maintain business intelligence (BI) solutions using Power BI
Stay updated on BI technologies to recommend improvements and best practices - and take active part in knowledge sharing across the team
Collaborate with teams to gather requirements and translate them into effective data visualizations
Ensure data accuracy and reliability in reports
Optimize Power BI performance and enhance user experience



 



Your Skills. Our Team. Together We Design the Future



The first step to success and growth in this role is that you understand that collaboration, co-creation and good communication pave the way for good and well-anchored solutions. Developing ties with others is something you do naturally by acting respectfully and delivering on your promises. And you never get set in your ways but keep exploring new insights and ways to improve.



 



In addition to the above, you will have:



Proficiency in Power BI: Minimum 3-4 years of hands-on experience in developing Power BI reports, including data preparation, data modeling, DAX expressions, Power Query, data visualization, and report optimization
Data Visualization and Dashboard Design: Experience in designing and developing engaging dashboards and reports
Data Modeling and Database: Strong understanding of data modeling concepts and database technologies (SQL)
Data Integration: Ability to work with different data sources and integrate them into Power BI
Stakeholder Collaboration: Communication skills to collaborate with stakeholders and understand their reporting needs
Data Management: Experience in extracting and managing data from different sources like SQL Server, Dataverse, Azure, SAP HANA, and SharePoint
Data-Driven Storytelling: Holistic approach to developing solutions with demonstrated creativity in crafting visually appealing and user-friendly dashboards and reports.
Language Skills: Proficiency in Danish and English, both spoken and written.



 



It will be a bonus if you can tick off one or more of the following:



Experience with Tabular Editor (Cube) and SQL
Experience with Microsoft ecosystem, incl. Fabric, Copilot, PowerApps, and Power Automate



 



A place to work and so much more



At COWI, we work together with our customers to shape a sustainable and liveable world. We do it by applying our knowledge and curiosity - and sometimes even our courage - to create the solutions the world needs today to enable a better tomorrow. That is why we say no to fossil-based projects and aspire to have 100 per cent of our revenue come from activities that move our customers towards sustainability.



 



We value differences and development and cultivate an environment of belonging and having fun. Because that is what brings out the best in you, at work and at home.



 



With offices primarily located in Scandinavia, the UK, North America, and India, we are currently 7,500 people who bring their expertise in engineering, architecture, energy, and environment into play.



 



What we also offer



Being part of the COWI community offers more than just a competitive salary. We take care of our people both professionally and personally. 



 



Some of our benefits include:



An engaging work environment with opportunities for professional growth
The opportunity to contribute significantly to sustainability and business development efforts
Flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance



 



Got more questions?



If you have any unanswered questions about the role or what we have to offer, please contact Priyanka, Global Talent Acquisition Specialist at prki@cowi.com, or Head of Business Intelligence and Insights, Sofie Gade Sundin at sgs@cowi.com.



 



Get to know us even better at our website, where you can learn more about our projects, our strategy, what we want to achieve and what life is like at COWI.



 



Before you apply



All you need to include in your application is your CV - no photo or application letter. At an interview, you can tell us everything we need to know about why you’re interested in joining COWI. As for the photo, we prefer to form our first impression in person rather than from a picture.



 



Diversity is fundamental to COWI, inclusion is key.



We are committed to creating a respectful and fair work environment where all employees have a sense of belonging and equitable opportunities to thrive and grow. We ensure that our leaders are role models for inclusive leadership by cultivating a culture where diverse perspectives and thoughts are seen as strengths. And we take diversity and inclusion into account in all relevant decisions and processes and when setting teams and fora. We do it because it is part of our values and because it is simply the right thing to do.



 







Show more

Our team develops BI-tools targeted at colleagues all across COWI - providing data-based insights and supporting actions to enable our long-term strategic ambitions as outlined in our strategy. We have an ambition to take the use of data to the next level.

 

You will report to the Head of Business Intelligence and Insights, Sofie Gade Sundin, and you will work in close cooperation with colleagues in the team as well as many stakeholders across COWI.

 

On a day-to-day basis, you will:

  • Work closely with cross-functional teams to gather and analyse business requirements for BI projects
  • Design, develop and maintain business intelligence (BI) solutions using Power BI
  • Stay updated on BI technologies to recommend improvements and best practices - and take active part in knowledge sharing across the team
  • Collaborate with teams to gather requirements and translate them into effective data visualizations
  • Ensure data accuracy and reliability in reports
  • Optimize Power BI performance and enhance user experience

 

Your Skills. Our Team. Together We Design the Future

The first step to success and growth in this role is that you understand that collaboration, co-creation and good communication pave the way for good and well-anchored solutions. Developing ties with others is something you do naturally by acting respectfully and delivering on your promises. And you never get set in your ways but keep exploring new insights and ways to improve.

 

In addition to the above, you will have:

  • Proficiency in Power BI: Minimum 3-4 years of hands-on experience in developing Power BI reports, including data preparation, data modeling, DAX expressions, Power Query, data visualization, and report optimization
  • Data Visualization and Dashboard Design: Experience in designing and developing engaging dashboards and reports
  • Data Modeling and Database: Strong understanding of data modeling concepts and database technologies (SQL)
  • Data Integration: Ability to work with different data sources and integrate them into Power BI
  • Stakeholder Collaboration: Communication skills to collaborate with stakeholders and understand their reporting needs
  • Data Management: Experience in extracting and managing data from different sources like SQL Server, Dataverse, Azure, SAP HANA, and SharePoint
  • Data-Driven Storytelling: Holistic approach to developing solutions with demonstrated creativity in crafting visually appealing and user-friendly dashboards and reports.
  • Language Skills: Proficiency in Danish and English, both spoken and written.

 

It will be a bonus if you can tick off one or more of the following:

  • Experience with Tabular Editor (Cube) and SQL
  • Experience with Microsoft ecosystem, incl. Fabric, Copilot, PowerApps, and Power Automate

 

A place to work and so much more

At COWI, we work together with our customers to shape a sustainable and liveable world. We do it by applying our knowledge and curiosity - and sometimes even our courage - to create the solutions the world needs today to enable a better tomorrow. That is why we say no to fossil-based projects and aspire to have 100 per cent of our revenue come from activities that move our customers towards sustainability.

 

We value differences and development and cultivate an environment of belonging and having fun. Because that is what brings out the best in you, at work and at home.

 

With offices primarily located in Scandinavia, the UK, North America, and India, we are currently 7,500 people who bring their expertise in engineering, architecture, energy, and environment into play.

 

What we also offer

Being part of the COWI community offers more than just a competitive salary. We take care of our people both professionally and personally. 

 

Some of our benefits include:

  • An engaging work environment with opportunities for professional growth
  • The opportunity to contribute significantly to sustainability and business development efforts
  • Flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance

 

Got more questions?

If you have any unanswered questions about the role or what we have to offer, please contact Priyanka, Global Talent Acquisition Specialist at prki@cowi.com, or Head of Business Intelligence and Insights, Sofie Gade Sundin at sgs@cowi.com.

 

Get to know us even better at our website, where you can learn more about our projects, our strategy, what we want to achieve and what life is like at COWI.

 

Before you apply

All you need to include in your application is your CV - no photo or application letter. At an interview, you can tell us everything we need to know about why you’re interested in joining COWI. As for the photo, we prefer to form our first impression in person rather than from a picture.

 

Diversity is fundamental to COWI, inclusion is key.

We are committed to creating a respectful and fair work environment where all employees have a sense of belonging and equitable opportunities to thrive and grow. We ensure that our leaders are role models for inclusive leadership by cultivating a culture where diverse perspectives and thoughts are seen as strengths. And we take diversity and inclusion into account in all relevant decisions and processes and when setting teams and fora. We do it because it is part of our values and because it is simply the right thing to do.

Title: Student Assistant in Business Intelligence Team
Place: Kvistgård, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are looking for a student assistant for our Business Intelligence team in Bavarian Nordic Global Operations.




Please note applications with lack of authenticity or excessive use of generic AI generated text (ChatGPT) will automatically be declined.




About the job

The position is to help elevate the business intelligence of the entire Global Operations by moving from descriptive to diagnostic analytics.

You will be talking with business leaders to understand what insights they need and building solutions to meet those needs.

We work with data from procurement, planning, warehouse, production, customer service, distribution, quality control, and many other teams.

All solutions will be built using Power BI.

 

Colleagues

You will be working closely with a 10-year experienced BI professional. It is a great opportunity to learn how a supply chain is managed and how you can add significant value to a large company.

You will also be working with two other student assistants.

 

Examples of tasks

• Collaborate with business leaders and the BI team

• Build Power BI solutions using DAX and design principles

• Teach end users how to use the solutions to gain maximum value

 

Preferred profile

• Interested in data analytics and Power BI

• Open, honest, and humble communicator

• Responsible and reliable personality

• Fluent in English

• Independent initiator and ambitious

 

Experience with Power BI or similar BI tools is a big plus, but not a requirement.

 

Culture

Communication in the team is informal, fun, and easygoing.

It is important to us that you are well supported, and you will be exposed to challenges so you can grow and learn.

It is possible to work remotely, but before you can do that, you must establish connections with your relevant stakeholders.

You’ll have influence over the projects and tasks you work on, allowing you to grow in the areas that interest you most — whether that is spatial data analysis, machine learning, project management, report design, or something else.

 

Salary and working hours

The salary is hourly and starts at a fixed level of 150 DKK but can be adjusted based on performance.

Working hours are flexible but aimed at 15–20 hours per week.

There is a possibility of transitioning into a full-time job after your studies if you perform well.




Applying

You must include a short text highlighting your motivation to work with business intelligence.

We are looking forward to hearing from you.

We invite applicants on an ongoing basis.

 

Questions

You are welcome to contact our BI lead, Jakob Paulsen, if you have any questions.

📧 jamp@bavarian-nordic.com

📞 +45 91 88 77 60

 

Show more

Title: Data Engineer (Copenhagen)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We're looking for a Data Engineer for our Copenhagen office

Hi there! Are you our new colleague at Dreaminfluence?

We’re looking for a skilled Data Engineer to join our R&D team and help shape the data infrastructure that powers data-driven decision-making across Dreaminfluence. In this role, you’ll play a key part in building and maintaining robust data pipelines, ensuring data quality, and scaling our internal data architecture to support the company’s continued growth and operational excellence.

You're a great match for Dreaminfluence if you're


Team-oriented – You believe the best work comes from collaboration, shared responsibility, and open communication.
Honest – You value transparency, give and receive constructive feedback openly, and speak your mind—even when it’s not the easy route.
Goal-driven – You work effectively in short delivery cycles, and you stay focused on both short-term deliverables and long-term outcomes.
Analytical – Data isn’t just your job—it’s your mindset. You make decisions based on insights, not assumptions.
You have strong business acumen – You understand how businesses work and align your decisions with broader company goals, considering impact on revenue, customer value, growth, and efficiency.
You thrive on taking full ownership of your work, feel empowered to make decisions, and proactively drive initiatives forward with independence and confidence
You care about building clean, scalable systems that make working with data easier for the whole company.
You love to get feedback and improve your craft, and you're not afraid to provide feedback to your colleagues so they can improve.


We’re a great fit for you if


You want to be part of a fast-moving SaaS start-up.
You thrive in a culture of ownership and flexibility.
You want to work onsite in our Copenhagen office alongside a talented, cross-functional R&D team.


About The Job

As a Data Engineer at Dreaminfluence, you’ll play a central role in shaping and scaling the data infrastructure that powers decision-making across the business. You’ll join our R&D team and work closely with stakeholders from multiple departments, including product, finance, marketing, and executive leadership, to ensure our data is clean, accessible, and actionable.

We already have a strong foundation in place, but we’re growing fast, and so are our data needs. That’s where you come in.

Your Primary Responsibilities Will Include


Designing and developing robust data pipelines to collect, clean, and transform raw data from multiple sources into high-quality datasets used across the company.
Building scalable ETL/ELT processes to support both real-time and batch data workflows, ensuring consistent data flow from ingestion to reporting.
Enhancing data discoverability and access by designing intuitive, well-documented data models that business users and analysts can trust and explore.
Improving the performance and scalability of our existing data infrastructure by optimizing queries, storage, and pipeline execution for large and growing datasets.
Driving best practices in data governance and quality, including monitoring, validation, and alerting for data anomalies or inconsistencies.


The perfect candidate also brings some of the following (nice to have, but not required):


Experience with statistics and/or machine learning
Familiarity with SaaS business KPIs
Prior experience with the HubSpot and Chargebee APIs


You’ll have the opportunity to significantly impact the way Dreaminfluence uses data, shaping internal reporting and enhancing product features.

Our Current Data Stack Includes


A Databricks-based data lake built on top of AWS
Python (Pandas, numpy, PySpark) for data processing, transformation, and scripting
SQL for data modeling and exploration


Hiring Process


Intro chat with our CTO, Morten Frank
In-depth personal interview
Personality test + walkthrough
Technical case + interview with our Data Scientist


What You Get


Full-time health-care insurance
5 weeks vacation + 5 additional holidays
Flexible company pension scheme
MacBook Pro (personal use allowed)
Daily free lunch at the office
A central role in a growing product-focused company


Excited? We’d love to hear from you. Join us in building the data backbone of modern influencer marketing.
Show more

  • Daily free lunch at the office

Excited? We’d love to hear from you. Join us in building the data backbone of modern influencer marketing.

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Kolding, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Hos NCG søger de en dygtig og dedikeret Data Engineer, der vil være med til at sikre, at deres data er robuste, pålidelige og skalerbare. Du vil få en central rolle i transitionen til en moderne cloud-baseret arkitektur og være med til at forme deres data setup fra bunden.




Forestil dig at arbejde i et miljø, hvor dine tekniske færdigheder og idéer virkelig gør en forskel.




Missionen

Deres mission er klar: Sikre stabilitet og udvikling på kort sigt, og designe og udvikle langsigtede løsninger, der kan understøtte deres vækst og ambitioner.




Du bliver en del af Data Engineering teamet, som har en god balance mellem drift og udvikling, hvor du får mulighed for at arbejde med både vedligehold og nye projekter.




Kerneopgaver

Dine arbejdsdage vil være fyldt med:

Design, udvikling og vedligeholdelse af datamodeller og sikring af høj kvalitet, dokumentation og skalerbarhed i data infrastrukturen.
Arbejde med og videreudvikling af den nuværende on-prem SQL Server-platform og sikre stabil drift.
En central rolle i overgangen til en fremtidig cloud-baseret arkitektur (Microsoft Azure eller Fabric) – herunder planlægning, opbygning og implementering.
Bidrag til migrering fra Qlik Sense til ny BI-front-end (Power BI).
Tæt samarbejde med BI-udviklere, IT og forretningen om at sikre adgang til valide, strukturerede data til analyser og rapportering.
Identifikation og implementering af tekniske forbedringer, der understøtter teamets leverancer og forretningens fremdrift.




Kvalifikationer

Vi søger dig, der:

Har solid erfaring med design, udvikling og vedligeholdelse af datamodeller og infrastruktur.
Har solid erfaring med SQL Server.
Har erfaring med cloud-baserede platforme (Azure/Fabric) – dette er et must.
Besidder stærke problemløsningsevner og teknisk ekspertise.
Kan arbejde selvstændigt og i team.
Har gode kommunikations- og samarbejdsevner.




Om Nic. Christiansen Gruppen

Nic. Christiansen Gruppen er en af Danmarks største bilkoncerner, der siden grundlæggelsen i 1967 har arbejdet med bilimport og -detailsalg samt finansiering og leasing af biler.




Den familieejede koncern har hovedsæde i Kolding og står i dag for den danske import af Hyundai, BYD, Omoda & Jaecoo, Ford, Land Rover og Jaguar. Herudover ejer koncernen de seks bilkæder Bayern AutoGroup, May & Olde, Stadac, Terminalen, ERA BILER og British MotorGroup samt værkstedskæden Skorstensgaard og leasing- og finansieringsselskabet NCG Finans.




Interesseret?

Så søg stillingen ved at klikke “ansøg”. Vi er på udkig efter medarbejdere, som kan starte snarest muligt, så tøv ikke med at sende os din ansøgning og dit CV. Har du nogen spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte konsulent Julius Hauge på mail julius.hauge@randstad.dk.




Denne proces håndteres af Randstad, og alle henvendelser bedes rettet hertil.




Om Randstad

Randstad er verdens største HR-udbyder og ‘partner for talent’. Vi giver lige muligheder til alle uanset baggrund og hjælper kandidater med at forblive relevante på et hastigt skiftende arbejdsmarked. Vi tror på et inkluderende arbejdsmarked, hvor alle kan være sig selv og føle sig velkomne.




Vores markedsindsigt og store kendskab til arbejdsmarkedet hjælper virksomheder med at opbygge en kvalificeret, mangfoldig og fleksibel arbejdsstyrke, og vi støtter mennesker og virksomheder i at nå deres fulde potentiale. Det er det, vi er her for, og det er det, der motiverer os hver dag.




Randstad DK er en del af den internationale Randstad Group. Vi formidler dagligt arbejde til over 600.000 mennesker verden over og er førende inden for rekruttering, karriererådgivning og fleksibel arbejdskraft i Danmark, med afdelinger i København, Aarhus, Aalborg og Kolding.

Show more
