Title: Analyst (Student Assistant), Global Project Management Office
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Copenhagen Infrastructure Service Company (CISC) - a service provider working exclusively for the global fund management company Copenhagen Infrastructure Partners (CIP), is currently looking for a Student Analyst to join Global Project Management Office team in our office in Copenhagen, Denmark.

The role
As a Student Assistant (internally called Analyst), you will have the exciting opportunity to apply your analytical skills in a real-world setting. You will collaborate with highly qualified and experienced professionals in our Global Project Management Office (PMO), while contributing to our successful project delivery.

In this role, you will be engaged in various project management and project delivery-related activities alongside your colleagues. Your key responsibilities will be to assist in developing of a potential implementation of a strategic portfolio management tool, including everything from stakeholder mapping, identifying key user groups, conducting market screening for potential vendors and preparing the business case for approval. In addition, you will be responsible for finding ways for easy tracking of key project milestones, data management, and presentation of these in a simple and automated manner. You will also perform various types of analyses using Excel and Power BI to support informed decision-making and assist with ad hoc tasks as needed together with the entire team.

Responsibilities will further consist of:

Support scoping, defining, and preparing business case for a strategic portfolio mgmt. tool
Collect and maintain data used to conduct portfolio overviews, tracking key decision gates and phases
Closely collaborate and support our team members within their areas of responsibility
Assistance with presentations and communication material


This part-time Analyst position requires approximately 15-20 hours per week, while you are enrolled at a university. We value flexibility, so your workload may vary, and we expect both you and the team to adjust accordingly. You will report directly to a team member, who will provide you with mentorship and guidance as you embark on this exciting journey with us.

You
We are looking for a candidate, either in the 1st year of a Master’s or in the last year of a Bachelor’s degree, who plans to pursue a relevant master’s degree in, for example (but not limited to) Project Management, General Management and Analytics (cand.merc.), Business, Engineering or Energy (MSc).

You are a responsible and motivated individual who is thriving in a highly dynamic, effective and innovative environment.

We look for the following in a candidate:

High academic performer with solid analytical skills
Thrives with taking initiative and ownership, while also demonstrating high attention to detail
Fluent in English, with advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office, particularly PowerPoint and Excel (experience with Power BI would be beneficial)
Cooperative colleague with solid written and verbal communication skills


Please, note that we don't have remote work opportunities, therefore only students residing in Denmark (or planning to move here for the Master's degree), will be considered.

The process
Please apply online as soon as possible as applications will be processed on an ongoing basis. For questions related to the role, please reach out to our Talent Acquisition team at talent@cisc.dk. We do not include CV's and Cover Letters sent by email.

As we continue to improve our candidate experience, diversity and avoid unconscious bias, please avoid having a photo in your CV. We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality for all applicants.

Please be aware that we will not accept speculative CV submissions for any of our roles from recruitment agencies, and any unsolicited candidate submissions will be exempt from any payment expectations and ownership.

CISC’s commitment to diversity and inclusion
CISC is committed to securing a diverse and inclusive work environment where everyone feels respected and heard. A diverse workforce allows CISC to achieve results through different approaches and solutions to task execution and problem solving. We want all our employees to have equal opportunities for personal growth and career opportunities regardless of age, gender, sexual orientation, disability, religion, nationality, and ethnicity.



---



Copenhagen Infrastructure Service Company

CISC is a service company working exclusively for Copenhagen Infrastructure Partners (CIP). CISC is owned by the funds managed by CIP with the purpose of delivering best-in-class services to the growing portfolio of renewable assets.

We engage in the energy transition through specialist services, project development and value creation with trusted third-party suppliers. Our core focus is conducting due-diligence, development, construction, and operations of renewable assets, and we deliver a range of services within technical, commercial, and financial management, compliance, tax, legal, transaction and ESG.

We provide global support and a local presence in our key markets, and our teams are continuously delivering and developing services that are tailored to our wide range of projects – from offshore and onshore wind, solar and battery energy storage systems, to advanced bioenergy assets. For more information, please visit cisc.dk.
Show more
HTML:
Copenhagen Infrastructure Service Company (CISC) - a service provider working exclusively for the global fund management company Copenhagen Infrastructure Partners (CIP), is currently looking for a Student Analyst to join Global Project Management Office team in our office in Copenhagen, Denmark.

The role
As a Student Assistant (internally called Analyst), you will have the exciting opportunity to apply your analytical skills in a real-world setting. You will collaborate with highly qualified and experienced professionals in our Global Project Management Office (PMO), while contributing to our successful project delivery.

In this role, you will be engaged in various project management and project delivery-related activities alongside your colleagues. Your key responsibilities will be to assist in developing of a potential implementation of a strategic portfolio management tool, including everything from stakeholder mapping, identifying key user groups, conducting market screening for potential vendors and preparing the business case for approval. In addition, you will be responsible for finding ways for easy tracking of key project milestones, data management, and presentation of these in a simple and automated manner. You will also perform various types of analyses using Excel and Power BI to support informed decision-making and assist with ad hoc tasks as needed together with the entire team.

Responsibilities will further consist of:
  • Support scoping, defining, and preparing business case for a strategic portfolio mgmt. tool
  • Collect and maintain data used to conduct portfolio overviews, tracking key decision gates and phases
  • Closely collaborate and support our team members within their areas of responsibility
  • Assistance with presentations and communication material

This part-time Analyst position requires approximately 15-20 hours per week, while you are enrolled at a university. We value flexibility, so your workload may vary, and we expect both you and the team to adjust accordingly. You will report directly to a team member, who will provide you with mentorship and guidance as you embark on this exciting journey with us.

You
We are looking for a candidate, either in the 1st year of a Master’s or in the last year of a Bachelor’s degree, who plans to pursue a relevant master’s degree in, for example (but not limited to) Project Management, General Management and Analytics (cand.merc.), Business, Engineering or Energy (MSc).

You are a responsible and motivated individual who is thriving in a highly dynamic, effective and innovative environment.

We look for the following in a candidate:
  • High academic performer with solid analytical skills
  • Thrives with taking initiative and ownership, while also demonstrating high attention to detail
  • Fluent in English, with advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office, particularly PowerPoint and Excel (experience with Power BI would be beneficial)
  • Cooperative colleague with solid written and verbal communication skills

Please, note that we don't have remote work opportunities, therefore only students residing in Denmark (or planning to move here for the Master's degree), will be considered.

The process
Please apply online as soon as possible as applications will be processed on an ongoing basis. For questions related to the role, please reach out to our Talent Acquisition team at talent@cisc.dk. We do not include CV's and Cover Letters sent by email.

As we continue to improve our candidate experience, diversity and avoid unconscious bias, please avoid having a photo in your CV. We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality for all applicants.

Please be aware that we will not accept speculative CV submissions for any of our roles from recruitment agencies, and any unsolicited candidate submissions will be exempt from any payment expectations and ownership.

CISC’s commitment to diversity and inclusion
CISC is committed to securing a diverse and inclusive work environment where everyone feels respected and heard. A diverse workforce allows CISC to achieve results through different approaches and solutions to task execution and problem solving. We want all our employees to have equal opportunities for personal growth and career opportunities regardless of age, gender, sexual orientation, disability, religion, nationality, and ethnicity.

---

Copenhagen Infrastructure Service Company

CISC is a service company working exclusively for Copenhagen Infrastructure Partners (CIP). CISC is owned by the funds managed by CIP with the purpose of delivering best-in-class services to the growing portfolio of renewable assets.

We engage in the energy transition through specialist services, project development and value creation with trusted third-party suppliers. Our core focus is conducting due-diligence, development, construction, and operations of renewable assets, and we deliver a range of services within technical, commercial, and financial management, compliance, tax, legal, transaction and ESG.

We provide global support and a local presence in our key markets, and our teams are continuously delivering and developing services that are tailored to our wide range of projects – from offshore and onshore wind, solar and battery energy storage systems, to advanced bioenergy assets. For more information, please visit cisc.dk.

Title: Lead Business Intelligence Specialist, Data & Analytics
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
CIP Fund Solutions - a platform delivery company working exclusively for the global fund management company Copenhagen Infrastructure Partners (CIP), is currently looking for a Lead Business Intelligence (BI) Specialist to join our office in Copenhagen, Denmark.

CIP Fund Solutions provides scalable and integrated business services, complex fund management and investments solutions with the aim of advancing CIP’s investment products and channels – and supporting the continuous value creation across the CIP platform.

The role
As our new Lead BI Specialist in our Data & Analytics team, you’ll join a team of ambitious professionals. The Data & Analytics team is responsible for delivering scalable digital solutions and advisory to the business with the intention of enabling growth across the CIP platforms. The team is comprised of a set of specialists focusing on master data management, data engineering, and business intelligence.

You will be the technical lead on Power BI, in a growing BI team. In this role, you will ensure the team adheres to best practices and delivers high-quality BI solutions.

You will be responsible for the Power BI platform, ensuring that usage of the platform follows best practices as a subject matter expert. You will manage larger BI projects, develop new dashboards, as well as maintain existing dashboards as needed. Additionally, you will work closely with other departments to ensure BI solutions align with business goals and effectively communicate insights to stakeholders.

You will also be expected to stay updated with the latest features of Power BI and Microsoft Fabric, continuously improving the BI solutions to meet the evolving needs of the business.

Responsibilities will further consist of:

Creation of new and maintenance of existing BI solutions such as dashboards and semantic data models
Refinement and estimation of new BI projects and solutions in collaboration with stakeholders
Management of consultants for externally staffed BI projects, ensuring alignment with internal standards and practices
Ensuring that the future BI setup is maintainable and scalable by implementing best practices in data architecture and governance
Staying updated on new features being released for Fabric and Power BI, and evaluating their potential impact on current and future projects
Design and implement self-service guidelines and governance with the aim of enabling citizen developers
Training and supervision of business units who wish to develop BI solutions together with the D&A team, providing guidance and support to ensure adherence to best practices
Maintain high visual standards and ensure uniformity across new BI products, contributing to a cohesive user experience
Design and implement efficient reporting solutions that enhance data accessibility and usability for informed decision-making


You
We are looking for candidates who have completed their master’s degree and have several years of full-time experience in a similar position, using Power BI and preferably Microsoft Fabric.

We expect you to possess a curious and outgoing mindset that allows you to educate yourself about the business and thoroughly understand its needs. This will enable you to develop appropriate and effective solutions tailored to those needs. With a solid understanding of data structures and modeling, you can design and implement efficient reporting solutions that enhance data accessibility and usability for informed decision-making.

We look for the following in a candidate

Self-igniting and customer-centric: You have a proactive attitude and a keen focus on understanding and meeting customer needs.
Close attention to detail and a high level of accuracy: You are meticulous and ensure precision in your work.
Comprehensive analytical and problem-solving skills: You possess strong analytical abilities and can effectively troubleshoot and solve complex problems.
Fluency in English, both verbal and written, as well as excellent communication skills: You can communicate clearly and effectively with various stakeholders.
Willingness to work in an international, efficient, and highly varied environment: You thrive in a dynamic and diverse setting, collaborating with teams across different regions.


The process
Please apply online as soon as possible as applications will be processed on an ongoing basis. For questions related to the role, please reach out to our Talent Acquisition team at talent@cisc.dk. We do not include CV's and Cover Letters sent by email.

As we continue to improve our candidate experience, diversity and avoid unconscious bias, please avoid having a photo in your CV. We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality for all applicants.

Please be aware that we will not accept speculative CV submissions for any of our roles from recruitment agencies, and any unsolicited candidate submissions will be exempt from any payment expectations and ownership.

CISC’s commitment to diversity and inclusion
CISC is committed to securing a diverse and inclusive work environment where everyone feels respected and heard. A diverse workforce allows CISC to achieve results through different approaches and solutions to task execution and problem solving. We want all our employees to have equal opportunities for personal growth and career opportunities regardless of age, gender, sexual orientation, disability, religion, nationality, and ethnicity.



---



Copenhagen Infrastructure Service Company

CISC is a service company working exclusively for Copenhagen Infrastructure Partners (CIP). CISC is owned by the funds managed by CIP with the purpose of delivering best-in-class services to the growing portfolio of renewable assets.

We engage in the energy transition through specialist services, project development and value creation with trusted third-party suppliers. Our core focus is conducting due-diligence, development, construction, and operations of renewable assets, and we deliver a range of services within technical, commercial, and financial management, compliance, tax, legal, transaction and ESG.

We provide global support and a local presence in our key markets, and our teams are continuously delivering and developing services that are tailored to our wide range of projects – from offshore and onshore wind, solar and battery energy storage systems, to advanced bioenergy assets. For more information, please visit cisc.dk.

Title: Graduate Data Scientist
Place: Vester Hassing, North Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
The Company

Veovo is a market leader in Airport Smart Technology. With a global footprint of customers and capabilities that cover Airport Operations, Revenue management and Passenger Flow. Some of the world’s largest airports rely on Veovo.  Focused on driving airport performance, our solutions enable airports to handle more aircraft and more passengers, with less delays and less queues. Our platforms are built on a modern tech stack, often delivered from the cloud as SaaS and leveraging intelligence to enable our customer to “go brilliantly”.

Our clients span continents, but all share one thing in common~ they’re big names in airport excellence, with even bigger digital goals. With offices in the UK, Poland, Denmark, New Zealand and the US, Veovo offers a world of opportunity

At Veovo we strive to deliver predictable collaborative solutions that are the platform of great airports. At Veovo we strive to deliver predictable collaborative solutions that are the platform of great airports.

The Opportunity

We focus on solutions in the analysis of queue and movement patterns as well as capacity forecasts. Our product, is cloud-based system that collects and analyzes data via proprietary (Bluetooth / WiFi) sensors, as well as third-party data sources such as camera, radar, infrared counters, coils, boarding cards, calendars, etc.

The solution primarily helps airports to forecast passenger appearance, optimize staff resources, reduce queue and travel times, and improve the experience for the passengers. In addition, we also create solutions for road traffic, railway stations, ports, ski resorts and amusement parks, with similar work and end-results.

Are you ready to be part of the team that brings our brilliant solutions "live" around the world?

The size of our installations are growing rapidly, and we are therefore seeking a skilled analytical person, who can help implement our solutions to help airports predict passenger arrival and flow. The implementation covers requirements, design, and calibration of the system. The calibration is carried out in-house via the setup of our filtering engine.

The Specifics


Identify valuable data sources and automate collection processes
Undertake preprocessing of structured and unstructured data
Analyze large amounts of information to discover trends and patterns
Build predictive models and machine-learning algorithms
Combine models through ensemble modeling
Present information using data visualization techniques
Propose solutions and strategies to business challenges
Collaborate with engineering and product development teams


What We Are Looking For


Knowledge of R, SQL and Python; familiarity with Scala, Java or C++ is an asset
BSc/BA in Computer Science, Engineering or relevant field
Analytical mind and business acumen
Experience in data mining
Problem-solving aptitude
Excellent communication and presentation skills


What We Offer In Return


A job in a growing industry.
Employment immediately or by agreement.
An exciting position in a company with good working conditions with an open, direct and informal tone
A company where ideas are accelerated into action, and everyone can play a part in the development.
Excellent opportunities for personal and professional development through independent work assignments.
Workplace~ Hækken 2, Vester Hassing, 9310 Vodskov
37 hours working week

Title: Data Scientist til Danica
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Er du passioneret for at skabe værdi gennem data? Kan du omsætte komplekse data til klar indsigt? Er du dygtig til at facilitere krav og forstå behovene fra forskellige interessenter? Hvis ja, så har vi den perfekte stilling til dig som Data Scientist i vores Business Data & Analytics team hos Danica.

Vi søger kompetencer indenfor SQL, Alteryx, Python og Tableau

Vi søger dig der har solide kompetencer inden for SQL, Alteryx, Python, og Tableau. Du har erfaring med dataanalyse og data visualisering, og du trives med at samarbejde på tværs af forskellige faggrupper og stakeholdere.

Dine primære ansvarsområder vil være at:


Levere værdifuld indsigt til både forretning og ledelse.
Identificere nye datakilder og muligheder for at optimere vores dataanalyse og -visualisering.
Samarbejde med kollegaer i teamet og på tværs af organisationen for at sikre, at vores data er pålidelige, relevante og anvendelige.
Drive datavisualiseringsprojekter på tværs af organisationen.


Vi leder efter en person med følgende kvalifikationer:


Interesse for kodning og en stærk baggrund i dataanalyseværktøjer såsom SQL og Alteryx
Erfaring med datavisualiseringsværktøjer, som f.eks.Tableau, til at udarbejde visuelle rapporter og interaktive dashboards
En proaktiv tilgang til at identificere nye muligheder og udfordringer i vores data
Evnen til at kommunikere komplekse analyseresultater til ikke-tekniske kollegaer og stakeholdere
En positiv og samarbejdsorienteret tilgang til arbejdet


Vi tilbyder udfordringer, udvikling og fremtid

Hos Danica tilbyder vi en spændende og udfordrende stilling i et innovativt og dynamisk arbejdsmiljø, hvor du vil have mulighed for at udvikle dine kompetencer inden for dataanalyse og -visualisering.

Du vil blive en del af teamet Business Data & Analytics, som er en del af CFO-området. Teamets rolle er at understøtte forretning og ledelse med dataanalyser og –indsigter. I Danicas nye strategi, Forward 28, spiller data en central rolle, hvor teamet bidrager med levering af analyser og data til at sikre god kundeoplevelse og vækst gennem fortsat forbedring af processer og datadrevne beslutninger. Vores team har ansvaret for hele processen fra indsamling, transformering og analysering af data, til design af visuelle dashboards og formidle resultater og indsigter til vores stakeholders. Vi er kendetegnet ved en uformel, ligefrem, åben og ærlig omgangstone. Derudover har vi et højt fagligt niveau og fokus på vidensdeling. Vi samarbejder for at sikre gode løsninger for vores stakeholders og for at lære af hinanden. Vi holder til i Danica, som er i Danske Banks hovedsæde i Postbyen i København lige ved Hovedbanegården.

Spørgsmål

Hvis du har spørgsmål til stillingen, så kan du kontakte Janne Jensen, Head of Business Data & Analytics på mailadresse jannej@danicapension.dk eller telefon 61 71 82 83.

Vi afholder løbende samtaler, så send gerne dit motiverede CV hurtigst muligt.

Title: Senior Product Analyst
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Too Good To Go, we have an ambitious goal: to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together.

40% of all food produced in the world is wasted. And that has a huge impact on the health of our planet, with 10% of greenhouse gas emissions coming from food waste.

We’re more than an app: we are a certified B Corporation with a mission to empower everyone to take action against food waste, so alongside our marketplace app, we create educational tools, explore new business solutions - such as our Retail Technologies offering, and influence legislation to help reduce food waste.

We’re growing fast: Our community of 116 million registered users and 243,000 active partners across 19 countries, have together already prevented 431+ million meals from going to waste - avoiding over 1.165.000 tonnes of CO2e!

Your mission

At Too Good To Go we interact with our users and partners through Product Teams dedicated to our consumer apps and our partner platform. As a Senior Product Analyst, your mission is to provide analytical and product expertise to ensure that we are continuously delivering value to our Independent Partners and the business. You will analyse large volume data sets in order to deliver high-level insights and actionable recommendations, and work with prototyping new concepts and means of utilising data as a value-add.

The Role


Partner with the product manager to drive strategy based on insights from analyses and experiments
Conduct quantitative research to uncover opportunities and insights relevant for your product team
Setup, run and document experiments on features and ideas
Establish, and monitor common metrics that align with team goals and product strategy
Ensure features are tracked, tested and documented
Ensure that the product team understands and has access to the metrics and insights from your analysis.
Ensure all stakeholders, including those outside of your immediate team are well informed about relevant insights and experiments


Requirements


Proven experience in effectively communicating analytical findings, influencing decision-making processes with data-driven insights
Experience working with SQL and Python (or R)
Exposure to working with digital consumer facing products, ideally marketplaces or e-commerce platforms
Experience handling basic automations, calling API’s etc. in Python
Experience with event tracking in Amplitude, Mixpanel, Looker or similar is a plus
Sound knowledge of conducting experiments and forming hypotheses
Technical curiosity - we want you to be comfortable asking questions - we encourage a mindset to ‘dig deeper’
Full professional proficiency in English
Established background in a data related product role, we are ready to welcome candidates that may not be currently holding a Senior position


Our values


We win together: Food waste is a big beast to fight. We can do it if we win together as Waste Warriors with no ego. We believe in a #oneteam.
We raise the bar: We always push for more. We work smart, smash barriers and elevate one another.
We keep it simple: Our ambitions are bold but our solutions are simple.
We build a legacy: We’re proud of the change we’re driving.
We care: We always look out for each other. Caring is also about the way we do business. We do the right thing.


What We Have To Offer


An opportunity to work in a global social-impact company and certified B Corporation! where you can see a real and tangible impact in your role.
To be an integral part of our Data & Analytics team. We are eager for you to make an impact and contribute to the role of analytics across key decisions and our solution processes. Your insights are valuable, and we are here to listen.
Work-life balance is important to us! Focus on the job to be done, not the hours spent, there is no need for overtime.
We trust in our employees and encourage an autonomous environment that provides several opportunities for employees to contribute, develop and take ownership of their work in a way that works for them.
To be part of an international company, with over 1,300+ colleagues across 19 countries that are on the same important mission.
An informal environment, working alongside 190+ passionate people within Tech & Product
We celebrate our differences and our successes and have a strong values-driven team culture.
We work in a hybrid set-up and value in office work weekly.
We may be able to support you with a working visa in Copenhagen, please be prepared to discuss this topic further as your first stage interview.


How To Apply


We take recruitment very seriously, so please carefully read everything we have written above. Please also check our website and international media in order to get a good overview of Too Good To Go.
Submit your CV and Cover letter in English.
Please note that we only accept applications coming through our platform. No CV or Cover Letter will be accepted by email or LinkedIn direct messaging.


Job Ref

A Movement for Everyone

We want to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together. With that mission, it’s only natural that we want to build a diverse and inclusive team of highly capable individuals who are passionate about doing things in a better way. We strongly believe we all excel and are more creative when we’re allowed to be ourselves, and we’re committed to a culture where all of us belong.

We are an equal opportunity employer and all employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need. If you need reasonable accommodation at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.


Show more
HTML:
At Too Good To Go, we have an ambitious goal: to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together.

40% of all food produced in the world is wasted. And that has a huge impact on the health of our planet, with 10% of greenhouse gas emissions coming from food waste.

We’re more than an app: we are a certified B Corporation with a mission to empower everyone to take action against food waste, so alongside our marketplace app, we create educational tools, explore new business solutions - such as our Retail Technologies offering, and influence legislation to help reduce food waste.

We’re growing fast: Our community of 116 million registered users and 243,000 active partners across 19 countries, have together already prevented 431+ million meals from going to waste - avoiding over 1.165.000 tonnes of CO2e!

Your mission

At Too Good To Go we interact with our users and partners through Product Teams dedicated to our consumer apps and our partner platform. As a Senior Product Analyst, your mission is to provide analytical and product expertise to ensure that we are continuously delivering value to our Independent Partners and the business. You will analyse large volume data sets in order to deliver high-level insights and actionable recommendations, and work with prototyping new concepts and means of utilising data as a value-add.

The Role

  • Partner with the product manager to drive strategy based on insights from analyses and experiments
  • Conduct quantitative research to uncover opportunities and insights relevant for your product team
  • Setup, run and document experiments on features and ideas
  • Establish, and monitor common metrics that align with team goals and product strategy
  • Ensure features are tracked, tested and documented
  • Ensure that the product team understands and has access to the metrics and insights from your analysis.
  • Ensure all stakeholders, including those outside of your immediate team are well informed about relevant insights and experiments

Requirements

  • Proven experience in effectively communicating analytical findings, influencing decision-making processes with data-driven insights
  • Experience working with SQL and Python (or R)
  • Exposure to working with digital consumer facing products, ideally marketplaces or e-commerce platforms
  • Experience handling basic automations, calling API’s etc. in Python
  • Experience with event tracking in Amplitude, Mixpanel, Looker or similar is a plus
  • Sound knowledge of conducting experiments and forming hypotheses
  • Technical curiosity - we want you to be comfortable asking questions - we encourage a mindset to ‘dig deeper’
  • Full professional proficiency in English
  • Established background in a data related product role, we are ready to welcome candidates that may not be currently holding a Senior position

Our values

  • We win together: Food waste is a big beast to fight. We can do it if we win together as Waste Warriors with no ego. We believe in a #oneteam.
  • We raise the bar: We always push for more. We work smart, smash barriers and elevate one another.
  • We keep it simple: Our ambitions are bold but our solutions are simple.
  • We build a legacy: We’re proud of the change we’re driving.
  • We care: We always look out for each other. Caring is also about the way we do business. We do the right thing.

What We Have To Offer

  • An opportunity to work in a global social-impact company and certified B Corporation! where you can see a real and tangible impact in your role.
  • To be an integral part of our Data & Analytics team. We are eager for you to make an impact and contribute to the role of analytics across key decisions and our solution processes. Your insights are valuable, and we are here to listen.
  • Work-life balance is important to us! Focus on the job to be done, not the hours spent, there is no need for overtime.
  • We trust in our employees and encourage an autonomous environment that provides several opportunities for employees to contribute, develop and take ownership of their work in a way that works for them.
  • To be part of an international company, with over 1,300+ colleagues across 19 countries that are on the same important mission.
  • An informal environment, working alongside 190+ passionate people within Tech & Product
  • We celebrate our differences and our successes and have a strong values-driven team culture.
  • We work in a hybrid set-up and value in office work weekly.
  • We may be able to support you with a working visa in Copenhagen, please be prepared to discuss this topic further as your first stage interview.

How To Apply

  • We take recruitment very seriously, so please carefully read everything we have written above. Please also check our website and international media in order to get a good overview of Too Good To Go.
  • Submit your CV and Cover letter in English.
  • Please note that we only accept applications coming through our platform. No CV or Cover Letter will be accepted by email or LinkedIn direct messaging.

Job Ref

A Movement for Everyone

We want to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together. With that mission, it’s only natural that we want to build a diverse and inclusive team of highly capable individuals who are passionate about doing things in a better way. We strongly believe we all excel and are more creative when we’re allowed to be ourselves, and we’re committed to a culture where all of us belong.

We are an equal opportunity employer and all employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need. If you need reasonable accommodation at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.

Title: Junior Consultant med flair for data til Salgsorganisationen
Description:
Vil du være med til at optimere og skabe forandring inden for ét af vores vigtigste nøgletal i vores butikker? Brænder du for at skabe overblik og analysere større dataset – og kan du formidle det på en overskuelig måde? Så er du måske den Junior Consultant, vi søger til Salgsorganisationen!




Stillingen som Junior Consultant er for dig, som motiveres af analytiske opgaver og optimering af processer, som er med til at gøre hverdagen lettere for vores kolleger i butikkerne.




Få en vigtig rolle i en central afdeling

Salgsorganisationen er bindeleddet mellem vores butikker og hovedkontoret. Afdelingens overordnede mål er at støtte kollegerne i vores butikker ved at sikre enkle og effektive arbejdsgange. Det gør vi gennem udvikling og implementering af koncepter, der standardiserer og optimerer processer og arbejdsrutiner i butikkerne.




Vores fornemste opgave er at servicere vores butikker bedst muligt. Vi sætter derfor en ære i at forstå den praktiske butiksdrift, hvilket du også vil få indsigt i med indarbejdning i to af vores butikker i en periode på 4-6 uger. På den måde får du et godt indblik i vores kerneforretning.




Om jobbet

Du vil sammen med dine kolleger indsamle og behandle data, som herefter skal analyseres og bearbejdes. Herefter vil du præsentere dine anbefalinger til optimeringer
Bidrage til tværfagligt samarbejde på tværs af IT, Controlling og regionale salgsafdelinger – du skal kunne agere både som fagspecialist og slutbruger, der ved ”hvad” og ikke kun ”hvordan”
Arbejde i forskellige interne og eksterne systemer og behandle data herfra
Udarbejdelse af diverse nøgletalsoversigter
Opfølgning på processer fra butiksdriften og optimeringer hertil
Forberede og analysere data, der skal synliggøre evt. problemstillinger og optimeringer
Ad hoc-opgaver




Om dig

Du er øvet bruger af Google Sheets eller Excel (macro, automatisering, Power-BI og lignede mester du også allerede)
Du evner at omsætte store datasæt i et brugbart og overskueligt overblik – og formidle det på en forståelige måde
Du kan selvstændigt udlede konklusioner fra data og på sigt komme med forslag til løsninger (når processer og organisation kendes)
Du stræber hele tiden efter at optimere og videreudvikle eksisterende løsninger – og/eller finde på nye
Du har et stort servicegen, der kommer til udtryk i din kommunikation og evne til at skabe relationer
Du kan bevare overblikket og følge op, når det er nødvendigt
Du har en relevant uddannelse og gerne krydret med erfaring fra detail – du må gerne være nyuddannet
Du har et godt sprogligt niveau for engelsk – tysk er en fordel




Vi tilbyder

Et uformelt arbejdsmiljø med faglig sparring, motiverede kolleger og humor
En arbejdsdag med spændende og alsidige opgaver, som du har mulighed for at præge og udvikle
Målrettet oplæring i alle processer samt mentorordning, så du har de bedste forudsætninger for at lykkes i jobbet
Grænseløse karrieremuligheder og faglige udfordringer
Mulighed for sundhedspakke
Rabatordning hos flere udbydere af rejser, shopping, kultur mm.




Hovedkontor i hjertet af Aarhus

Du vil have din daglige gang på vores store og innovative hovedkontor på Godsbanen i Aarhus.




På vores hovedkontor, får du som medarbejder adgang til:

Gratis fitnesscenter
In-house massageordning
Sund kantineordning med mulighed for morgenmad, frokost og nem aftensmad (take-away) – alt samen medminimum 30 % økologi.




Du får derudover også mulighed for at deltage i sociale aktiviteter som f.eks. morgenyoga på tagterrassen, løbeklub, familiedag og fredagsbarer.




Ansøgningsfrist d. 25. maj

Vi behandler løbende indkomne ansøgninger, så send gerne ansøgning og CV hurtigst muligt.




I rekrutteringsprocessen kan du forvente: screening, telefoninterview, jobsamtaler, case og kognitiv test.




Tiltrædelse er hurtigst muligt efter aftale.




Har du spørgsmål?

Ved spørgsmål til jobbet eller rekrutteringsprocessen kan du kontakte den ansvarlige Recruiter, Ida Marie, på +45 60 34 03 08 på hverdage mellem kl. 9.00-15.00 eller ved at sende en mail til jobilidlhq@lidl.dk.




Vi ser frem til at modtage dit motiverede CV!

Show more

  • Gratis fitnesscenter
  • In-house massageordning
  • Sund kantineordning med mulighed for morgenmad, frokost og nem aftensmad (take-away) – alt samen medminimum 30 % økologi.


Du får derudover også mulighed for at deltage i sociale aktiviteter som f.eks. morgenyoga på tagterrassen, løbeklub, familiedag og fredagsbarer.

I rekrutteringsprocessen kan du forvente: screening, telefoninterview, jobsamtaler, case og kognitiv test.


Tiltrædelse er hurtigst muligt efter aftale.


Har du spørgsmål?

Ved spørgsmål til jobbet eller rekrutteringsprocessen kan du kontakte den ansvarlige Recruiter, Ida Marie, på +45 60 34 03 08 på hverdage mellem kl. 9.00-15.00 eller ved at sende en mail til jobilidlhq@lidl.dk.


Vi ser frem til at modtage dit motiverede CV!

Title: Sustainability & operations analyst (m/f/d) (internship) - July 2025
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Responsibly 🌍🌱




Responsibly is a sustainability tech start-up with the vision of making every purchase in the world responsible.




We're founded by two serial entrepreneurs with previous successes such as Dixa and Ofload, and have received pre-seed funding from some of Europe’s top VCs and angels. We're now building a top-tier team to tackle this big thing called climate, and have fun while we're doing it 🤘.




Let’s change the world together 🎯




There’s no bigger problem out there than the changing climate, and procurement represents a big part of the solution - when purchase decisions are made on the background of responsible data, such as CO2 footprint, suppliers have a huge incentive to change.




However, procurement is becoming overloaded with complexity and struggle getting data in the first place. Different frameworks, different data sources, different coverage, and an overloaded supplier making it difficult to make purchase decisions to improve the sustainability of your supply chain.




At Responsibly, we're solving this issue by using ai to power your sustainability due dilligence and automatically understand how sustainable every supplier is.


Tasks


What you’ll be doing 🙌

We're looking for an intern to join our ESG operations team. That means you'll get deep experience with ESG data, ai and automation. You'll be:





Analyzing supplier sustainability data collected through our automation engines and flagged for review


Working on our ai and automation agenda to ensure every supplier can run through a fully automated due dilligence journey - that means diving deep on ai technologies and operational processes.


Quality assuring the data in the Responsibly platform to ensure we're representing the sustainability profile of the supplier as best as possible.


Supporting our Data Operations team with day-to-day tasks and long-term strategic milestones





You may also be supporting our ESG expertise team, which could include:





Interpret various social & environmental impact certificates and assessment scores according to our proprietary scoring methodology


Identify new sources for responsible sourcing data by assessing various supplier websites



Requirements


About you 😎





You have some practical experience through an internship/business study activity in analytical environments, where you’ve had to navigate and make sense of complex problems


You want to build a career in sustainability and ai


You are a strong problem solver with excellent structure, and love analyzing data


You take a high degree of ownership in your work and are ready to attack unfamiliar problems with enthusiasm and a bias for action!


It's a bonus if you have a good understanding of the sustainability space and are familiar with different sustainability frameworks and initiatives.


It's a bonus if you have some basic knowledge and understanding of SQL and databases


You thrive in a fast-moving environment and love being through into the deep-end


You're passionate about your work and ambitious


English is our working language, hence excellent skills are a must



Benefits


Your benefits 🤩





Awesome office and culture with amazing lunch right on Island's Brygge


We love to build an awesome culture and community in our office, but we also offer flexibility when you need it.


Lots of fun, such as our annual company events or Friday bars





Still need to be convinced? 🤔





It’s the opportunity to join an early-stage tech & social impact startup on an incredible journey. You’ll have the independence and space to release your creativity.


You'll become a vital member of the team, and your efforts will have a direct impact on Responsibly’s success.


You’ll be part of a dynamic company with enthusiastic and highly talented teammates from various backgrounds and countries – always ready to share knowledge, support, and a beer! Successes are always shared together


We have fun and we make an impact - life is about more than work!





The internship is full-time (40 hrs/week), paid, and ideally for 6 months. The location is Copenhagen, and a European work permit is required.




PLEASE NOTE: Starting period is ideally July 2025.




Please clarify in your application the following points:





For how many months are you available for an internship?


When is your earliest starting date?





We encourage you to apply even if you don't fulfill all requirements, as we're looking for driven and passionate individuals who are willing to learn and grow. We look forward to reading your application! 🤓

Show more

We encourage you to apply even if you don't fulfill all requirements, as we're looking for driven and passionate individuals who are willing to learn and grow. We look forward to reading your application! 🤓

Title: Data Analyst to NCC Purchasing Development & Digitalization
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you ready to turn data into powerful decisions that shape the future of purchasing?

We’re looking for a driven and curious Data Analyst to join our Purchasing Development & Digitalization team at NCC! In this role, you’ll transform data into actionable insights that directly impact project success, supplier performance, and strategic direction.

Purchasing is a top priority at NCC, playing a vital role in winning and delivering profitable projects. As part of our Nordic function, you’ll support and challenge the organization with data-informed perspectives, enabling smart decisions and continuous development.

We are building for the future – come join us.

The construction industry is undergoing a digital transformation, and NCC is leading the way. With innovation, analytics, and collaboration at our core, we are reimagining purchasing to become more strategic, connected, and insights-driven. You’ll be part of a team shaping how we use data to unlock value, improve supplier collaboration, and strengthen our business.

The Role And Key Responsibilities

In this role, you contribute directly to our mission of paving the way for business-leading purchasing capabilities. Through your ability to turn data into actionable insights, you empower our purchasing network to make smarter, faster, and more strategic decisions. Your expertise in Power BI helps define and drive future best practices, while your collaborative mindset supports a culture of continuous improvement, transparency, and innovation across the organization.

As a Data Analyst, You Will


Build reporting solutions: Create compelling visualizations and reports that communicate complex data in a clear and engaging manner with actionable insights in mind
Develop scalable BI structures: Contribute to building and refining processes and structures—particularly around Power BI and Fabric—to support scalable, efficient, and robust self-service BI across the organization
Empower Teams: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to foster a data-informed culture, providing training and support in Power BI to enhance their analytical skills
Advanced Data Analysis: Utilize advanced analytics techniques and data modelling to extract meaningful insights from our data and contribute to data-informed decision-making.


About Purchasing At NCC

NCC Purchasing is a network of professionals across the Nordics. We handle everything from project purchasing and supplier base development to strategic sourcing and category management. Collaboration between our teams is key to delivering successful customer projects. You will join the Purchasing Development & Digitalization unit, which focuses on creating industry-leading purchasing capabilities.

Your Experience And Background

Education


Degree in Business Analytics, Information Systems, Industrial Engineering, Economics, or Business Administration with a strong analytical component.
Additional training or certification in Power BI, data visualization, or data literacy is a strong plus.


Experience


Proven experience in Power BI development, including both front-end visualizations and data modeling (semantic models)
Track record of turning data into actionable insights that support business decisions
Experience working in cross-functional teams with diverse stakeholders
Experience supporting others in data literacy and analytics, through training, guidance, or collaboration
Experience working with AI-supported tools or low-code/no-code platforms (e.g., Power Platform, Microsoft Fabric, or similar) to automate workflows or scale analytics solutions
Familiarity with procurement KPIs and value delivery through data is a plus
Background in the construction industry and/or procurement is a plus
Language skills: You are fluent in one of the Nordic languages and in English.


Ready to take the next step?

If you're excited about leveraging data to shape the future of purchasing and drive meaningful transformation, we’d love to hear from you. Join us on our journey to unlock the full potential of data, digitalization, and collaboration in the construction industry. Your passion and insights will make a real difference—apply now and help us build what's next.

Additional Information

You will be based at one of NCC’s major offices in the Nordics. Frequent travel is required. However, we do apply a flexible way of working and strive to collaborate digitally as much as possible. In accordance with NCC:s safety culture we conduct background checks on final candidates. 

NCC Offers

NCCstrives to be anappealing employer, providing a work environment where employees cangrow and experience well-being. We offer a wide range of employee benefits. NCC has collective agreements for all employees, providing a solid foundation of security and clear guidelines so that you know what applies to your employment. We also offer excellent opportunities for continued development and a broad range of further education options, allowing for a long career within the company.

Contact and application

Please register your application and CV in English below. Selection is ongoing, so please apply as soon as possible but no later than June 8. For further information on this position, please contact Emma Papakosta, Head of Purchasing Development and Digitalization, +46705541030, or Karin Österman de Wall, HR Recruitment Specialist, +46790787210.

We look forward to receiving your application! 

Build with us - together with the best colleagues in the industry!

At NCC, we are driven to continue developing, whether it's our construction projects or our personal expertise. Every day, we drive the industry's most exciting and complex construction projects forward in close cooperation between our employees, partners and customers. With us, you are a significant employee who contributes to the landmarks that define our cities and communities. Here, our employees take an active role in a corporate culture based on stable values and behaviors for a safe and secure workplace. Our collective expertise and diverse backgrounds make a difference.

NCC - one of the leading companies in the Nordics

We kindly but firmly decline contact with recruiters and sellers of advertising or staffing solutions. 
Show more

Are you ready to turn data into powerful decisions that shape the future of purchasing?

We’re looking for a driven and curious Data Analyst to join our Purchasing Development & Digitalization team at NCC! In this role, you’ll transform data into actionable insights that directly impact project success, supplier performance, and strategic direction.

Purchasing is a top priority at NCC, playing a vital role in winning and delivering profitable projects. As part of our Nordic function, you’ll support and challenge the organization with data-informed perspectives, enabling smart decisions and continuous development.

We are building for the future – come join us.

The construction industry is undergoing a digital transformation, and NCC is leading the way. With innovation, analytics, and collaboration at our core, we are reimagining purchasing to become more strategic, connected, and insights-driven. You’ll be part of a team shaping how we use data to unlock value, improve supplier collaboration, and strengthen our business.

The Role And Key Responsibilities

In this role, you contribute directly to our mission of paving the way for business-leading purchasing capabilities. Through your ability to turn data into actionable insights, you empower our purchasing network to make smarter, faster, and more strategic decisions. Your expertise in Power BI helps define and drive future best practices, while your collaborative mindset supports a culture of continuous improvement, transparency, and innovation across the organization.

As a Data Analyst, You Will

  • Build reporting solutions: Create compelling visualizations and reports that communicate complex data in a clear and engaging manner with actionable insights in mind
  • Develop scalable BI structures: Contribute to building and refining processes and structures—particularly around Power BI and Fabric—to support scalable, efficient, and robust self-service BI across the organization
  • Empower Teams: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to foster a data-informed culture, providing training and support in Power BI to enhance their analytical skills
  • Advanced Data Analysis: Utilize advanced analytics techniques and data modelling to extract meaningful insights from our data and contribute to data-informed decision-making.

About Purchasing At NCC

NCC Purchasing is a network of professionals across the Nordics. We handle everything from project purchasing and supplier base development to strategic sourcing and category management. Collaboration between our teams is key to delivering successful customer projects. You will join the Purchasing Development & Digitalization unit, which focuses on creating industry-leading purchasing capabilities.

Your Experience And Background

Education

  • Degree in Business Analytics, Information Systems, Industrial Engineering, Economics, or Business Administration with a strong analytical component.
  • Additional training or certification in Power BI, data visualization, or data literacy is a strong plus.

Experience

  • Proven experience in Power BI development, including both front-end visualizations and data modeling (semantic models)
  • Track record of turning data into actionable insights that support business decisions
  • Experience working in cross-functional teams with diverse stakeholders
  • Experience supporting others in data literacy and analytics, through training, guidance, or collaboration
  • Experience working with AI-supported tools or low-code/no-code platforms (e.g., Power Platform, Microsoft Fabric, or similar) to automate workflows or scale analytics solutions
  • Familiarity with procurement KPIs and value delivery through data is a plus
  • Background in the construction industry and/or procurement is a plus
  • Language skills: You are fluent in one of the Nordic languages and in English.

Ready to take the next step?

If you're excited about leveraging data to shape the future of purchasing and drive meaningful transformation, we’d love to hear from you. Join us on our journey to unlock the full potential of data, digitalization, and collaboration in the construction industry. Your passion and insights will make a real difference—apply now and help us build what's next.

Additional Information

You will be based at one of NCC’s major offices in the Nordics. Frequent travel is required. However, we do apply a flexible way of working and strive to collaborate digitally as much as possible. In accordance with NCC:s safety culture we conduct background checks on final candidates. 

NCC Offers

NCCstrives to be anappealing employer, providing a work environment where employees cangrow and experience well-being. We offer a wide range of employee benefits. NCC has collective agreements for all employees, providing a solid foundation of security and clear guidelines so that you know what applies to your employment. We also offer excellent opportunities for continued development and a broad range of further education options, allowing for a long career within the company.

Contact and application

Please register your application and CV in English below. Selection is ongoing, so please apply as soon as possible but no later than June 8. For further information on this position, please contact Emma Papakosta, Head of Purchasing Development and Digitalization, +46705541030, or Karin Österman de Wall, HR Recruitment Specialist, +46790787210.

We look forward to receiving your application! 

Build with us - together with the best colleagues in the industry!

At NCC, we are driven to continue developing, whether it's our construction projects or our personal expertise. Every day, we drive the industry's most exciting and complex construction projects forward in close cooperation between our employees, partners and customers. With us, you are a significant employee who contributes to the landmarks that define our cities and communities. Here, our employees take an active role in a corporate culture based on stable values and behaviors for a safe and secure workplace. Our collective expertise and diverse backgrounds make a difference.

NCC - one of the leading companies in the Nordics

We kindly but firmly decline contact with recruiters and sellers of advertising or staffing solutions.

Title: Data Engineer (Student Assistant)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At GAN, we are looking for an analytical Student Assistant who thrives at analyzing diverse structured data sets and building robust data transformation processes.




As our new Data Engineer Student Assistant, you will be:

Working on a cross-functional team of highly skilled and dedicated people to deliver solutions and services to our enterprise customers. Primarily performing and streamlining complex data onboarding tasks.
In collaboration with both the customer and the GAN Customer Success Team (Implementation and Support), designing and building the data transformation processes needed to ingest the customer’s compliance data into the GAN platform. This is sensitive data - data that matters, so attention to detail and high integrity are absolutely critical.




Requirements

Currently studying for a relevant Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree.
Experience in setting up data transformation pipelines. Python and database experience is a must. Having worked with REST API (over HTTPS) is an advantage.
Experience in processing large volumes of structured data.
A combination of attention to detail and pragmatism.
Good communication and collaboration skills.

Additionally, you may have the opportunity to work on:

The analysis and reporting side of data, helping us deliver value to customers through actionable insights. Building and executing analysis of individual customer data sets. Specifically working with PostgreSQL and AWS QuickSight.
The infrastructure setup we have with AWS, assisting our DevOps team with trying out new configurations and components to evolve or streamline our systems, or our ways of working with these.




What we offer

Competitive salary.
Excellent growth opportunities.
Flexible working hours, hybrid work set-up.
Contribute to a truly important cause - building an ethical and compliant business space around the globe.
A real impact on the company’s growth and evolution.
Great office space and central location in the heart of Copenhagen near Kongens Have.
Social activities: workout sessions, book clubs, movie nights, DHL runs, Friday bars, office parties, and much, much more.
Amazing lunch, free soft drinks, fruit, snacks, and great coffee.




About us

Founded by a Danish human rights activist in 2004, today GAN is a global company with a highly diverse team spanning a wide range of both professional and cultural backgrounds - from compliance lawyers and researchers to technology experts, designers, and developers- across our offices in NYC, Copenhagen, and London.




GAN’s unique setup within the compliance software industry and its extraordinary team helped GAN revolutionize the compliance space and raise venture capital from leading firms such as Apax and Aquiline Capital Partners.




GAN’s completely integrated and intuitive platform is trusted by many of the world’s leading brands, such as Live Nation, Rolls-Royce, and Barrick, to help them better manage their compliance activities all in one place. Read more at www.ganintegrity.com.




GAN Integrity is committed to fostering, cultivating, and preserving a culture of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We believe that every employee has the right to work in a positive, collaborative atmosphere that promotes equal opportunities and prohibits discriminatory practices.




By submitting your application, you agree that GAN Integrity may collect your personal data for recruiting and related purposes. GAN Integrity's Candidate Privacy Notice

explains what personal information GAN Integrity may process, where GAN Integrity may process your personal information, its purposes for processing your personal information, and the rights you can exercise over GAN Integrity's use of your personal information.




We are conducting interviews on an ongoing basis; therefore, we encourage you to send your application as soon as possible.

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Hos Knowit Data, Analytics & AI leder vi efter vores næste kollega – én som minder lidt om Victor, vi lige har ansat: Skarp, glad, kundeminded med nogle års erfaring på bagen. En, der ikke nødvendigvis har alle svarene, men som brænder for at finde dem.

💡 Hvad går jobbet ud på?

Som Data Engineer bliver du en nøglespiller i vores projekter, hvor vi hjælper vores kunder med at skabe fremtidens dataplatforme, analytics-pipelines og AI-løsninger – ofte fra bunden. Du kommer til at arbejde med moderne teknologier og frameworks i cloudmiljøer og få mulighed for at præge både arkitektur og implementering.

Vi arbejder med kunder på tværs af brancher og teknologier – og vi leder efter dig, der gerne vil være tæt på kunden og gøre en forskel.

🧠 Du kommer til at arbejde med…


Design og udvikling af moderne datapipelines og cloudinfrastruktur (GCP, Azure eller AWS)
Infrastructure-as-Code (Terraform) og CI/CD-principper
Python, SQL og distribuerede systemer
Integrationer med eksterne datakilder og eksponering via APIs
Et hold af dygtige kolleger, som gerne deler viden, sparrer og hjælper



🙌 Hvem er du?


Du har 3-5 års erfaring som Data Engineer, Software Developer eller lignende
Du har arbejdet med cloudplatforme og ETL/ELT-processer
Du er stærk i Python og har erfaring med databaser som PostgreSQL eller BigQuery
Du er måske specialist i Azure, AWS eller GCP – og du er ikke bange for at arbejde med forskellige hyperscalere
Du er nysgerrig, løsningsorienteret og har lyst til at udvikle dig
Du kan kommunikere klart og konstruktivt – både med kolleger og kunder



🎯 Det her får du hos os


En hverdag med højt til loftet, flad struktur og højt engagement
Tid og rum til læring – vi prioriterer opkvalificering og vidensdeling
Projekter, hvor du arbejder med den nyeste teknologi og reelle udfordringer
Et team, der hepper på hinanden – fagligt og menneskeligt
Et kontor i hjertet af København og fleksible rammer for dit arbejde



📣 Klar til næste skridt?

Send os dit CV eller et par ord om dig selv. Vi glæder os til at høre, hvem du er – og hvad du brænder for.

Har du spørgsmål, så tag fat i Mads Bengtson på mads.bengtson@knowit.dk eller 51 39 31 55 – vi tager gerne en uformel snak over en kop kaffe.

Knowit is a consultancy firm that helps companies and people succeed in the digital transformation. Every day, millions of people use the solutions we have created. With 3,900 employees mainly in the Nordic countries, but also in operations in Germany and Poland, we work with clients and partners to develop innovative solutions that contribute to a sustainable and humane society.
Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
I Københavns Lufthavn (CPH) arbejder vi hver dag for at skabe den bedst mulige oplevelse for vores passagerer – og her spiller data en stadig mere og mere afgørende rolle. Som vores nye Senior Data Analyst bliver du en del af et team, hvor dine analyser og visualiseringer er med til at forbedre alt fra ventetider i paskontrollen til rengøringskvalitet og driftsoptimering.

Her er kort vej fra analyse til handling, og du vil opleve, at dine indsigter bliver brugt – både i det daglige og i den strategiske udvikling af lufthavnen. Vi arbejder tæt sammen med kolleger på tværs af organisationen, og du vil hurtigt opleve, at dine resultater skaber reel værdi, konkrete beslutninger og forbedringer.

Om at være Senior Data Analyst

Som Senior Data Analyst i CPH har du en hverdag, hvor du både arbejder selvstændigt og i tæt samarbejde med kolleger fra hele organisationen. Du er med til at sikre, at vi har de rette data, de rigtige analyser og de mest relevante indsigter – og at de bliver formidlet, så de kan bruges optimalt.

Vi ser frem til, at du bidrager med at:


Udvikle Power BI-rapporter og analyser, der understøtter driften – f.eks. med indsigter i alt fra rengøringskvalitet til ventetider i paskontrollen
Analysere og fortolke data for at identificere mønstre, tendenser og afvigelser
Omsætte data til handlingsorienterede forretningsindsigter, der styrker beslutningsgrundlaget
Samarbejde tæt med forretningsenheder for at afdække behov og definere meningsfulde og målbare KPI’er


Du har fornøjelsen af et tæt samarbejde med kolleger i Security, Digital, Airside Operations, Bagage, Politiet og ground handler, og du er en vigtig sparringspartner i arbejdet med at skabe datadrevne løsninger, der gør en forskel her i Nordens største lufthavn.

Hvordan du lykkes i jobbet

Hos os trives du med - og nyder måske endda - at arbejde med data, der har direkte effekt. Du motiveres af at analysere komplekse datasæt og formidle dem klart og visuelt gennem Power BI med fokus på storytelling og forretningsværdi. Du arbejder desuden godt i et dynamisk miljø, hvor tempoet til tider er højt, og hvor dine indsigter hurtigt bliver omsat til handling.

Du lykkes på den korte bane, når du har opbygget stærke relationer til både kolleger og samarbejdspartnere og har fået en god forståelse for deres behov. Du har sat dig ind i vores datakilder og bruger din viden til at finde konkrete forbedringsmuligheder, der optimerer vores løsninger og processer.

På den længere bane lykkes du, når du tager ansvar for hele den analytiske proces – fra datakvalitet og modellering til formidling og implementering. Du bidrager til at skabe ensartede og standardiserede Power BI-rapporter, der bygger på “one truth”-konceptet og understøtter en fælles forståelse på tværs af organisationen.

Vi håber, at din faglige bagage indeholder:


Solid erfaring med Power BI og SQL
Minimum 3 års erfaring fra en lignende rolle
En relevant uddannelsesbaggrund – fx inden for matematik, økonomi eller ingeniørfag


Om afdelingen

Vi er et team med forskellige faglige baggrunde, men med en fælles passion for data. Vores forskellige kompetencer supplerer hinanden og gør samarbejdet både stærkt og inspirerende – vi bruger netop vores forskelligheder til at skabe indsigt og værdi.

Vi er fire kollegaer og en leder, der glæder os til at byde dig velkommen og lære dig at kende – både fagligt og socialt.

Om Ali, din nye leder

Som leder prioriterer jeg frihed i opgaveløsningen, da jeg mener, at høj faglighed og frihed i opgaveløsningen komplementerer hinanden og skaber de bedste resultater. Med det sagt står jeg selvfølgelig altid til rådighed med sparring eller råd om en opgave – og det gør teamet også.

Jeg går meget op i personlig og faglig vækst, hvor der er plads til at prøve nye tilgange og lære undervejs. Det er derfor også vigtigt for mig, at vi har fokustid hver dag til fordybelse, samt at vi hver 3. uge bruger 1 time til læring og/eller optimering af eksisterende leverancer.

Om os | Hvad tilbyder vi

Du bliver en del af en helt særlig atmosfære og en organisation, der hver dag arbejder engageret for, at vores passagerer får den bedste rejseoplevelse.

Udover frokostbuffet, pension og IT-udstyr tilbyder vi:


Frihed til planlægning af dine opgaver – det betyder for eksempel, at du har mulighed for at arbejde hjemmefra efter aftale med din leder
Fri parkering, cykelservice (i arbejdstiden), bilrengøring og gode rabataftaler
Fysioterapi og træningslokale, yoga, rådgivning fra træner mv.
Sundhedssikring – børn er dækket automatisk
Individuelle udviklingssamtaler.


Om ansøgningen | Stig ombord på dit nye job

Vi ser frem til at læse din ansøgning, så send den gerne snarest muligt og senest den 15. juni.

Vi modtager kun ansøgninger via vores rekrutteringssystem og ikke pr. mail.

Har du spørgsmål til jobbet inden da, kan du kontakte Ali Agha Javed, Senior Manager Analytics på ali.agha.javed@cph.dk eller 53 65 03 26.

Det er en forudsætning for ansættelse, at du kan blive politigodkendt, ligesom du skal kunne opretholde politigodkendelsen gennem hele din ansættelse.

Derudover er det en forudsætning for at arbejde i Københavns Lufthavne, at du begår dig komfortabelt på dansk- både skriftligt og mundtligt.
Show more

  • Frihed til planlægning af dine opgaver – det betyder for eksempel, at du har mulighed for at arbejde hjemmefra efter aftale med din leder
  • Fri parkering, cykelservice (i arbejdstiden), bilrengøring og gode rabataftaler
  • Fysioterapi og træningslokale, yoga, rådgivning fra træner mv.
  • Sundhedssikring – børn er dækket automatisk
  • Individuelle udviklingssamtaler.

Om ansøgningen | Stig ombord på dit nye job

Vi ser frem til at læse din ansøgning, så send den gerne snarest muligt og senest den 15. juni.

Vi modtager kun ansøgninger via vores rekrutteringssystem og ikke pr. mail.

Har du spørgsmål til jobbet inden da, kan du kontakte Ali Agha Javed, Senior Manager Analytics på ali.agha.javed@cph.dk eller 53 65 03 26.

Det er en forudsætning for ansættelse, at du kan blive politigodkendt, ligesom du skal kunne opretholde politigodkendelsen gennem hele din ansættelse.

Derudover er det en forudsætning for at arbejde i Københavns Lufthavne, at du begår dig komfortabelt på dansk- både skriftligt og mundtligt.

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Group

Global Operations >>> Technology >>> Data & Insights

Reports To

Head of Data & Insights

LOCATION:

Hybrid/Remote (Based in country with STG Offices}

Position Summary

Do you want to make a real impact — not just write code, but build something that matters?

As a Data Engineer, you’ll help fuel global transformation; your work will bring clarity to chaos, connecting scattered data into a single source of truth that powers our next generation planning platform, o9.

If you’re driven by purpose, hungry to grow, and excited to see your work make a visible difference, this is where you belong.

As a Data Engineer, you will build and improve data pipelines for the o9 planning tool, ensuring clean, governed, and ready-to-use data from various sources. You’ll also contribute to broader platform development, supporting our data warehouse and other analytics initiatives.

You’ll be part of a global company on a bold data-driven transformation — shifting from gutfeel to insight, from silos to clarity. Your work will help shape how we plan, decide, and act at every level. This isn’t just about building pipelines; it’s about building trust in data, unlocking scale, and enabling smarter decisions across the business. You’ll play a real part in turning data into a true driver of change — and that change starts with you.

Key Responsibilities


Developing and maintaining data pipelines that deliver refined, high-quality data to our o9 planning platform
Consolidating and transforming data from multiple internal and external systems for planning and analytics use
Supporting and enhancing our data warehouse infrastructure , ensuring consistency and reliability of source data
Applying data validation rules , quality checks, and governance standards throughout the pipeline
Implementing and maintaining monitoring , alerting, and documentation to ensure system transparency and stability
Collaborating with team members and stakeholders to continuously improve workflows, tools, and technical practices


Who We Are Looking For

A hands-on builder who thrives in a structured but evolving environment, that enjoys making things work — not just once, but reliably, and at scale.

You take pride in delivering clean, maintainable pipelines and are comfortable following guidance, standards, and best practices set by more senior engineers.

You’re curious, eager to learn, and ready to grow your craft by working on real-world data challenges with business impact.

Key Skills & Experience


Solid experience developing data pipelines using modern tools and frameworks
Proficiency in T-SQL and scripting languages like Python or PowerShell
Hands-on familiarity with cloud platforms (Azure, AWS, or GCP)
Understanding data integration and transformation across varied source systems
Basic knowledge of data governance, quality, and security principles
A team-oriented mindset with a willingness to collaborate and ask questions
Attention to detail and a structured, quality-focused approach to building pipelines
Clear communicator who can explain what you're doing and why
Adaptable to changing priorities and tools in a dynamic environment
Proactive learner who seeks out feedback and improvement opportunities


Supplementary Skills & Experience


Experience working with SAP S/4HANA data structures
Hands-on experience with o9 Solutions or similar planning platforms
Exposure to planning-related use cases like forecasting, supply chain, or finance
Familiarity with data warehouse architecture and data modeling concepts
Interest in automation, CI/CD pipelines, or infrastructure-as-code for data


OUR VALUES


A focused mission: enable smarter planning through trusted data
Real impact on business operations, not just behind-the-scenes work
A collaborative, learning-focused team environment
Modern tools, a cloud-first stack, and a platform that’s always improving
Flexibility in how and where you work — remote, hybrid, or onsite
Show more
