Title: Senior Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Lead & Shape the Future of Marketing Analytics at Lunar!

At Lunar we are democratizing the power of money and changing the way we all bank, pay, and invest. Since starting in Aarhus in 2015, we've grown rapidly and are now a major player in the Nordics, with offices in Copenhagen, Aarhus and Stockholm 🚀




So who are we? Are we a tech company or a bank? Well, we're both, breaking free from the usual categories. Here, tech isn't just a cool add-on; it's the core of how we do things. With our own banking license, we go head-to-head with traditional banks. What sets us apart is the mix of tech and financial services, giving us the power to shake up a dusty industry that's ready for a change.




As we continue our journey to becoming the best everyday bank in the Nordics, we are looking for a Senior Marketing Data Analyst to lead and develop our marketing analytics function. This is a pivotal role where you will take full ownership of our marketing data strategy, driving advanced analytics and automation to optimize marketing ROI and scale our growth across the Nordics.




Be in the Driver’s Seat

As our new Senior Marketing Data Analyst, you won’t just be working with data—you will be shaping and evolving the way we leverage data across marketing. You will set the vision for how we use analytics to fuel our marketing efforts, establish best practices, and build a function that delivers high-impact insights and measurable business outcomes.




You’ll be based in Copenhagen, embedded within our Audience and Acquisition team, reporting to Sally Armstrong. The team currently comprises 5 amazing individuals focused on leveraging data-driven insights to fuel customer acquisition and engagement within the broader Marketing function, led by Manuel Douchez. But you’ll be the one steering the marketing analytics ship - driving strategy, developing methodologies, and making sure data is at the heart of every decision we make.




What Will You Do?

Set and drive the strategy for marketing analytics, defining how we measure and optimize marketing effectiveness.
Establish and implement best practices for data analysis, reporting, and visualization, ensuring marketing performance is continuously improved.
Lead and innovate in advanced attribution modeling, leveraging machine learning, MMM (Marketing Mix Modeling), and Bayesian techniques to optimize marketing investments.
Develop and champion best-in-class marketing measurement methodologies, ensuring data integrity and actionable insights.
Take ownership of incrementality testing and media experimentation to enhance ROI and inform strategic decision-making.
Collaborate cross-functionally with data teams in Commercial, Product, and Finance to ensure alignment in methodologies, shared learnings, and commercial impact.
Act as the key strategic partner for marketing leadership, providing data-driven recommendations that shape our marketing approach.
Automate marketing analytics processes, leveraging AI and cutting-edge tools to enhance efficiency and insight generation.
Serve as the go-to expert for marketing data, ensuring all marketing initiatives align with broader business intelligence efforts.




Curious About the Lunar Culture? 💚

Everything at Lunar centers around our core - to challenge. It’s infused into our four values and guides us in how to work together, lead projects, and lead people to reach our mission. Our values aren't just words on a page - they're what make us who we are and shape the vibe of our culture. And trust me, we’re all about the vibe. For a longer read about our culture, click here.

Is This You? Let’s Find Out!




We’re looking for someone who is eager to take ownership, build something incredible, and truly shape the future of marketing analytics at Lunar. If this sounds like you, we want to hear from you!

Proven experience in a marketing data analytics or business intelligence role, ideally with a strong commercial focus.
Expertise in advanced attribution models, including MMM, machine learning, Bayesian techniques, and media mix modeling.
Proficiency in Python, SQL, and data visualization tools.
Experience with Looker, Funnel.io, dbt, AWS, Redshift, Airflow, Git, or similar technologies.
Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights and executive-level reporting.
A passion for automation, AI-driven analytics, and streamlining marketing data processes.
Experience working cross-functionally, ensuring data-driven marketing decisions are aligned with commercial goals.
Excellent collaboration and communication skills, with the ability to influence stakeholders at all levels.
Experience in high-volume, complex data environments such as fintech, banking, or large-scale consumer technology companies.




Are You Ready to Build the Future?

Apply now and let’s explore how you can take Lunar’s marketing analytics to the next level!

While you hold on tight for us to get back to you, curious to see what we’re up to? Follow us on LinkedIn for business announcements and releases 📢, check out our Instagram for an inside scoop on what it’s like to work here 📸, and visit our blog for the latest tech and product insights! 📱🫰




Depending on the regulations in the country you will be employed, we will ask to see or obtain information about your criminal record.

Title: (Associate) IT Officer and Business Analyst - based at our Luxembourg
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
This position is based at our Luxembourg headquarters and requires regular office presence. The EIB offers you the opportunity to live and work in a truly international and multi-cultural environment. We also offer relocation support.

The EIB, the European Union's bank, is seeking to recruit for its Legal Directorate (JU) – Coordination Division (COORD) – at its headquarters in Luxembourg, an (Associate) IT Officer and Business Analyst* - This is a full time position at grade 4/5 for which the EIB offers a permanent contract.


internal benchmark (Associate) Officer Business Support for IT Applications


Panel interviews are forseen as of March 2025.

Purpose

This role is based in the Coordination Division of the Legal Directorate. As an (Associate) IT Officer and Business Analyst, you will work in coordination with a Senior Legal Engineering and Innovation Officer to: (i) co-ordinate the prospecting of new applications suitable for the Legal Directorate, (ii) ensure maintenance, assistance, development and deployment of IT applications for the Legal Directorate, (iii) liaise with stakeholders in the Legal Directorate to ensure close alignment with business needs, and (iv) contribute to successful IT project delivery and change management. You will also contribute to the development and maintenance of the Legal Directorate’s intranet presence and to compliance with the Bank’s data governance and data quality frameworks.

Operating Network

You will report to and work under the supervision of the Head of Division of JU Coordination. You will work closely with the senior management team of the Legal Directorate, JU divisions and various other counterparts. You will cooperate with central IT Services with other Data Officers and with external consultants.

Accountabilities


Contribute to the development and deployment of new IT applications in the Legal Directorate to ensure broad-based, timely and efficient take up of new technologies
Provide support to internal clients concerning existing IT applications used by the Legal Directorate
Develop, deploy and provide ongoing support for the intranet presence of the Legal Directorate
Find new use cases for existing or new IT applications, taking into account the needs of the Legal Directorate relative to the overall IT environment of the Bank
Perform the role of JU Data Officer by: (i) taking the lead in matters related to compliance with EIBG’s data governance, data management and data quality framework, (ii) identifying and remedying data governance issues adversely affecting the functioning of the Legal Directorate; and (iii) participating in meetings of the Information Governance Steering Committee and analogous bodies to represent the interests of the Legal Directorate
Contribute to streamlining of JU internal processes and map, standardize, control, and automate legal workflows, documents, templates, and electronic records
Provide change management support to IT, Legal Tech & Innovation projects in the Legal Directorate


Qualifications


University degree, preferably in Business Administration, Computer Science/Engineering and / or in another area relevant to the job
At least 3 years of relevant professional experience in a role related to IT engineering and/or innovation
Familiarity with the SDLC (software development lifecycle), ideally at the EIBG or other relevant organization, is required
Business analysis and change management experience would be a strong asset
Knowledge of all or most of the following: Microsoft Sharepoint online, Business Object, Microsoft 365, OpenText Livelink, Smart-IT is required
Excellent organisational skills and ability to prioritise and meet deadlines, with strong result and customer orientation
Understanding of the EIB ’s mission, organisation and activities
Excellent knowledge of English and/or French (*) with a good command of the other. Knowledge of other EU languages would be an advantage


Competencies

Find out more about EIB core competencies here

To find out more about our eligibility criteria click here

(*) Unless stated explicitly as a required qualification, a good command of French is not a pre-requisite for hire. As both English and French are however official working languages of the EIB, proficiency in both languages is a pre-requisite for your future career development. Any language clause in your contract must be fulfilled in order for you to be eligible for a promotion (either via the annual appraisal cycle or via an internal selection process). Proficiency is understood to mean the attainment of level 5 of the Inter Institutional language courses, corresponding to B1.2 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFRL). The Bank offers appropriate training support.

We hire and value talent with unique characteristics, creating a work environment where they can be themselves. We believe that Diversity, Equity and Inclusion makes us a performing and innovative organisation. We encourage all suitably qualified and eligible candidates to apply regardless of their gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation, disability or neurodiversity.

We strongly invite applicants with a disability, neurodivergent profile or chronic condition to request reasonable accommodations at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact the EIB Recruitment team Jobs@eib.org who will ensure that your request is handled.

By applying for this position, you acknowledge the importance of maintaining the security and integrity of the Information of the EIB Group. In case of selection for the position you agree to comply with all measures (policies, controls, document classification and management) implemented by the EIB Group to prevent unauthorised disclosure of any information or any damage to the EIB Group reputation.

Deadline for applications: This is an open campaign to consecutively fill open positions. The campaign will remain open until position is filled. Applications will be reviewed in order of receipt.

Title: Analyst
Description:
Analyst til H&B Analytics




H&B Analytics er et subbrand til H&B | Hildebrandt & Brandi og derfor en stærk kombination af startup og etableret virksomhed. Teamet deler kontorfaciliteter med H&B, og du vil derfor få din daglige gang i et dynamisk miljø med inspirerende kolleger og sjove samtaler ved frokostbordet. Vi er lige nu 7 personer på Aarhus-kontoret, og har ansat vores første erfarne konsulent i København – derfor leder vi nu efter den helt rigtige studentermedhjælper til at være med i opbygningen af en Analytics-afdeling i København. Du vil derfor få din daglige gang på H&B’s kontor i København.




Hvem er vi, og hvad tilbyder vi dig?

Hos H&B Analytics er vores primære opgave at løse projekter for og sammen med management konsulenterne i H&B. Her leverer vi komplekse analyser ifm. strategiske projekter for H&B samt undersøgelsesdesign, ad-hoc-analyser og ikke mindst indsigt baseret på en bred vifte af analytiske metoder.

Det er essentielt, at vi ikke bare leverer resultater – vi sætter en ære i at levere handlingsorienterede indsigter baseret på solide analyser og stærk forretningsforståelse. Vores klienter er typisk store, ambitiøse virksomheder, og vi arbejder i langvarige samarbejder, hvor vi engagerer os i klienternes virkelighed både personligt og fagligt for at matche deres behov og situation.

Som en del af H&B Analytics-teamet skal du:

Samarbejde med H&B-konsulenter på projekter, hvor dine analysekapabiliteter sættes i spil
Bidrage på en række forskellige kvantitative analyser
Bidrage med kvalitetssikring på projekter
Bidrage på AI-projekter
Bidrage i udviklingen af salgsoplæg og materiale

Du bliver en del af et team, hvor vi arbejder tæt sammen og løfter opgaver i flok.

Vi er et team, som får energi af at lave fede analyser sammen, alt imens der er et vedholdende fokus på udvikling, bidrag og trivsel.




Hvem er du, og hvad søger vi i dig?

Som den ideelle kandidat har du følgende kvalifikationer:

Er som minimum på 4. semester (bachelor) på en relevant videregående uddannelse (fx HA, Økonomi, Data Science, Ingeniør eller lignende), hvor du har leveret topresultater
Erfaring med/interesse for kodning (Python, R eller lign.)
Lyst til at gøre en forskel gennem stærke analyser og handlingsorienterede indsigter som vores klienter kan handle på
Sans for grundighed, struktur og kvalitet – og evnen til at bringe disse kompetencer i spil for at sikre kvalitet i leverancerne
Mulighed for at arbejde mellem 8-20 timer per uge
Indgående kendskab til MS Excel og PowerPoint
Være flydende på både dansk og engelsk

Vi forventer ikke, at du lever op til alle ovenstående – men du skal have lyst til at læne dig ind i alle punkterne, så du undervejs i din stilling hos os kommer til at tjekke alle bokse af.

Foruden dine faglige kompetencer søger vi i lige så høj grad en kollega, der er positiv, samarbejdsvillig, fleksibel og fyldt med god energi. Vi vækster og bygger op, så du skal have interesse i at være med til at udvikle H&B Analytics i København.




Vi håber at finde din ansøgning i bunken

Du søger jobbet ved at uploade et fyldestgørende CV, en motiveret ansøgning, karakterudskrifter og andre relevante dokumenter via linket nedenfor.

Ansøgningsfristen er tirsdag den 2. juni 2025 med opstart d. 11. august 2025 eller efter aftale.

Rekrutteringsprocessen består af to samtaler, og vi kalder til samtale løbende.




Du kan læse mere om os på hildebrandtbrandi.com/hb-analytics/, men har du opfølgende spørgsmål til stillingen eller til os som virksomhed, er du velkommen til at kontakte:

Recruitment & Culture Consultant Josephine Haslund Henriksen på jhh@hildebrandtbrandi.com eller +45 2829 3728
Senior Analytics Manager Anders Schriver Strand på as@hildebrandtbrandi.com eller +45 2636 3942




Show more
HTML:
Analyst til H&B Analytics


H&B Analytics er et subbrand til H&B | Hildebrandt & Brandi og derfor en stærk kombination af startup og etableret virksomhed. Teamet deler kontorfaciliteter med H&B, og du vil derfor få din daglige gang i et dynamisk miljø med inspirerende kolleger og sjove samtaler ved frokostbordet. Vi er lige nu 7 personer på Aarhus-kontoret, og har ansat vores første erfarne konsulent i København – derfor leder vi nu efter den helt rigtige studentermedhjælper til at være med i opbygningen af en Analytics-afdeling i København. Du vil derfor få din daglige gang på H&B’s kontor i København.


Hvem er vi, og hvad tilbyder vi dig?

Hos H&B Analytics er vores primære opgave at løse projekter for og sammen med management konsulenterne i H&B. Her leverer vi komplekse analyser ifm. strategiske projekter for H&B samt undersøgelsesdesign, ad-hoc-analyser og ikke mindst indsigt baseret på en bred vifte af analytiske metoder.

Det er essentielt, at vi ikke bare leverer resultater – vi sætter en ære i at levere handlingsorienterede indsigter baseret på solide analyser og stærk forretningsforståelse. Vores klienter er typisk store, ambitiøse virksomheder, og vi arbejder i langvarige samarbejder, hvor vi engagerer os i klienternes virkelighed både personligt og fagligt for at matche deres behov og situation.

Som en del af H&B Analytics-teamet skal du:

  • Samarbejde med H&B-konsulenter på projekter, hvor dine analysekapabiliteter sættes i spil
  • Bidrage på en række forskellige kvantitative analyser
  • Bidrage med kvalitetssikring på projekter
  • Bidrage på AI-projekter
  • Bidrage i udviklingen af salgsoplæg og materiale

Du bliver en del af et team, hvor vi arbejder tæt sammen og løfter opgaver i flok.

Vi er et team, som får energi af at lave fede analyser sammen, alt imens der er et vedholdende fokus på udvikling, bidrag og trivsel.


Hvem er du, og hvad søger vi i dig?

Som den ideelle kandidat har du følgende kvalifikationer:

  • Er som minimum på 4. semester (bachelor) på en relevant videregående uddannelse (fx HA, Økonomi, Data Science, Ingeniør eller lignende), hvor du har leveret topresultater
  • Erfaring med/interesse for kodning (Python, R eller lign.)
  • Lyst til at gøre en forskel gennem stærke analyser og handlingsorienterede indsigter som vores klienter kan handle på
  • Sans for grundighed, struktur og kvalitet – og evnen til at bringe disse kompetencer i spil for at sikre kvalitet i leverancerne
  • Mulighed for at arbejde mellem 8-20 timer per uge
  • Indgående kendskab til MS Excel og PowerPoint
  • Være flydende på både dansk og engelsk

Vi forventer ikke, at du lever op til alle ovenstående – men du skal have lyst til at læne dig ind i alle punkterne, så du undervejs i din stilling hos os kommer til at tjekke alle bokse af.

Foruden dine faglige kompetencer søger vi i lige så høj grad en kollega, der er positiv, samarbejdsvillig, fleksibel og fyldt med god energi. Vi vækster og bygger op, så du skal have interesse i at være med til at udvikle H&B Analytics i København.


Vi håber at finde din ansøgning i bunken

Du søger jobbet ved at uploade et fyldestgørende CV, en motiveret ansøgning, karakterudskrifter og andre relevante dokumenter via linket nedenfor.

Ansøgningsfristen er tirsdag den 2. juni 2025 med opstart d. 11. august 2025 eller efter aftale.

Rekrutteringsprocessen består af to samtaler, og vi kalder til samtale løbende.


Du kan læse mere om os på hildebrandtbrandi.com/hb-analytics/, men har du opfølgende spørgsmål til stillingen eller til os som virksomhed, er du velkommen til at kontakte:

  • Recruitment & Culture Consultant Josephine Haslund Henriksen på jhh@hildebrandtbrandi.com eller +45 2829 3728
  • Senior Analytics Manager Anders Schriver Strand på as@hildebrandtbrandi.com eller +45 2636 3942

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Vil du være en del af et team, hvor humøret er højt og ambitionerne store? Hos NORRIQ søger vi nemlig to nye kollegaer til vores Data & AI-team på lokationerne i enten Aalborg eller Valby – kom og vær med til at skabe spændende, digitale løsninger i et stærkt IT-konsulenthus 🚀




Som Data Engineer i Data & AI bliver du en del af et stærkt sammentømret hold, som er et af markedets stærkeste teams inden for Data Platform-løsninger. Sammen har vi masser af erfaring med at udvikle og implementere de bedste løsninger til vores kunder. Hos os finder du et arbejdsmiljø, hvor der er fokus på faglig og personlig udvikling. I teamet vil du opleve et miljø med masser af sparring, grin og opbakning, så du får de bedste forudsætninger for at lykkes i rollen 👏




Dine arbejdsopgaver vil være, men ikke udelukkende indeholde:

Udvikling af data-løsninger: Omsætte kundernes behov til datadrevne indsigter ved hjælp af den nyeste Microsoft-teknologi, såsom Power BI, Fabric og Azure. Du vil designe og skabe dashboards, rapporter og datamodeller, der giver kunderne klarhed og nye perspektiver på deres forretning 💪
Vedligeholdelse og optimering af eksisterende systemer: Sørge for værdifuld og effektiv drift af vores kunders løsninger ved at tilsikre, at vores eksisterende kunders løsninger fortsat kører problemfrit og udvikler sig i takt med deres behov 📈
Tværfagligt samarbejde: Her vil du have en udførende rolle, hvor du har hænderne dybt i maskinrummet med mange forskellige kunder, opgaver og nye teknologier. Du vil aldrig stå alene med kunderne, men arbejde tæt sammen med kollegaer på tværs af fagområder for at sikre en dyb forståelse af kundernes behov og levere optimale, skræddersyede løsninger 🤝




Vi forestiller os, du kommer med:

Måske du er nogle år inde i din data karriere? Måske du nærmere anskuer dig som senior? Det vigtigste er at du har god erfaring inden for dataanalyse og systemudvikling, og at du er klar til at bidrage med din viden i vores team 👩‍💻
God erfaring med DAX, opbygning af semantiske modeller i Power BI og så er du selvfølgelig en haj til SQL 🦈
Kendskab til Azure DataFactory Piplines og/eller SQL Server Integration Services, samt en god forståelse for Git og CI/CD-processer i Azure DevOps 🧠





Men hvorfor skal du søge:

Vækstambitioner: I Data & AI er ambitionerne for fremtiden store – og en ny æra venter forude. Vi arbejder ikke kun med de nyeste teknologier; vores ambition er at være på forkant med fremtidens teknologier og konstant udforske ny viden, der kan forme morgendagens løsninger. Her har vi særligt arbejdet med AI for øje, og hvordan NORRIQ i højere grad kan tilbyde AI-løsninger til vores kunder 🤖. Vækst står også højt på dagsordenen i vores Data & AI-team. Vores vision er at fordoble antallet af medarbejdere inden for en kort årrække. Samtidig med at vi også kigger ind i større og mere komplekse projekter 👏
Din udvikling: I vores team stræber vi efter at blive dygtigere – både individuelt og som team. Her er der fokus på, at du kan blive ved med at udvikle din faglighed, bl.a. gennem relevante certificeringer, intern vidensdeling og sparring, samt at du kan få lov til at dykke ned i dine faglige interesser og den nyeste teknologi – så du/vi altid er på forkant med markedets udvikling 👩‍💻
Fleksibilitet: Hos NORRIQ får du en unik mulighed for ikke bare at have traditionel fleksibilitet ift. hjemmearbejde, samt indflydelse på hvordan du tilrettelægger din arbejdsdag, arbejdssted og din tid 🙋‍♀️. Her kan du være med til at forme dit eget job, tage ansvar og ejerskab, når du i samarbejde med dine kolleger i teamet skaber synlige succeser for kunderne. I stillingen som Data Engineer i Data & AI vægter din mening højt, og du har afgørende betydning for NORRIQ’s fremtidige udvikling 🙌






Har vi fanget din interesse?

Vi har gjort det nemt og hurtigt for dig at søge en stilling hos NORRIQ. Derfor beder vi hverken om motiverede ansøgninger eller sætter dig til at udfylde lange spørgeskemaer. Så send dit CV allerede i dag. Du kan søge jobbet gennem formularen nederst på siden👇👇👇

Show more

Har vi fanget din interesse?

Vi har gjort det nemt og hurtigt for dig at søge en stilling hos NORRIQ. Derfor beder vi hverken om motiverede ansøgninger eller sætter dig til at udfylde lange spørgeskemaer. Så send dit CV allerede i dag. Du kan søge jobbet gennem formularen nederst på siden👇👇👇

Title: Senior Product Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Veo is a global leader in AI-based sports camera technology. Our innovative, fully automatic camera solution enables sports teams to record matches and training sessions without a camera operator. We’re democratizing the world of sports by granting video analysis for teams on all levels—a privilege that used to be only for the few. More than 40,000 clubs in 90+ countries record their games every week.

But what truly sets us apart? Our people. We’re a diverse group of innovative thinkers, creators, and problem-solvers who believe in delivering an incredible product—and having fun while doing it.

The Opportunity

We're looking for a Senior Product Analyst to join our Product Analytics Team - a team focused on instrumenting and using data to enable better product decisions and opportunities.

You’ll be bringing your perspectives and recommendations on our business and customers to help drive better decisions for our product, and communicate and influence teams and stakeholders through close collaboration.

Veo is in a foundational stage in how we approach building a shared understanding of metrics, baselines and drivers, and so you will play a key role in ensuring proper instrumentation and tracking, as well as ensuring that teams have common metrics which best align with goals and are build with an eye towards reusability.

What You'll Do


Common Metrics & KPIs: Define, implement, and maintain the metrics that align with product goals - ensuring they’re reusable, well-documented, and widely understood across teams
Quantitative Research & Insights: Conduct deep-dive analyses and experiments to verify product opportunities, making data-driven recommendations that inform our roadmap
Instrumentation & Event Tracking: Oversee proper tracking for product features. Validate, test, and document analytics events to ensure accurate and consistent data collection
Cross-Functional Alignment: Ensure all relevant teams—product, marketing, engineering, etc. - have access to meaningful insights that guide decision-making and align with our business objectives




What You Could Bring


5+ years of professional experience in a data analytics role, ideally within SaaS, sports technology, or other analytics-driven products
Proven ability to handle ad-hoc requests, manage stakeholder expectations, and deliver actionable insights
Solid experience with setting up event tracking and instrumenting features (we use Segment)
Strong experience based knowledge in SQL and Python (or similar language)
Acumen on product intuition
Experience with BigQuery, Looker, Amplitude, Segment or similar tools
Track record of translating complex analyses into actionable recommendations
Experience setting up and running experiments
Full professional proficiency in English




Our Copenhagen office mirrors our innovative technology – with an indoor ball court, rooftop terrace, and well-equipped gym. We have created a facility that supports connecting disciplines across the business, facilitates creative thinking, and gives the space to engage with colleagues, our global partners, and the entire Veo community.

Values we hold at Veo:

Dare - We take initiative, stay curious, and challenge the status quo in our work.

Own it - We drive impact by identifying opportunities, taking responsibility, and confidently executing.

Level up - We embrace growth, continuously learning and shaping our skills.

Play as a team - We collaborate across a diverse organization, leveraging shared insights for stronger outcomes.

Customer Centric - We deliver value by having close partnerships and a deep understanding of our customers (internally and externally)

We value diversity and inclusion and welcome applicants from all backgrounds, even if your experience doesn’t completely match every qualification listed. What matters most is your creativity, potential, and ability to contribute meaningfully.
Show more

Title: Graduate Program - Innovation Impact -R&D Data Scientist Chemistry (d/f/m)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About the Innovation Impact Program Our 18-month Graduate Program starts on October 1st, 2025, at our Henkel Adhesive Technologies Innovation Center in Düsseldorf. You will be part of an exciting development journey, where you will receive a permanent contract from day one, relocation support, and hands-on experience across various innovative technologies. Upon completion, you will have the opportunity to transition into global roles within Henkel’s innovation network.

What You´ll Do


Partner with product developers and application engineers as part of our R&D team in Düsseldorf, Germany to understand technologies, data collection processes, and challenges driving the digital transformation within R&D
Design and conduct data analysis projects to identify trends and patterns in formulation data sets, and build and deploy machine learning models to predict formulation performance, stability, and quality
Collaborate closely with R&D colleagues to translate data insights into new formulations, product development decisions, and application processes - optimizing R&D workflows
Develop and maintain data visualization dashboards to effectively communicate insights to technical and business stakeholders
Leverage your digital skillset to drive awareness and application of data-based decision-making and digital tools across R&D
Support the digital transformation of R&D by implementing data-driven workflows for process development and knowledge management


What makes you a good fit


You have recently completed, or are about to complete, a Master’s or Ph.D. that combines a strong foundation in Chemistry, Engineering, or Materials Science with Data Science, Physics, Computer Science, or a related analytical field—for example, a Bachelor’s in a natural science and a digitally focused Master's, or interdisciplinary studies that enable you to understand both lab-based R&D and data-driven approaches
You bring first hands-on experience with data analysis and modeling in scientific or engineering contexts, and have a strong grasp of statistical methods and machine learning algorithms (e.g., regression, classification)
You are proficient in data tools such as Python or R, DoE software like Minitab or JMP, and data visualization platforms (e.g., Excel, Power BI, Tableau); experience with IoT, finite element analysis (FEA), and computational fluid dynamics (CFD) is a plus
You are interested in working in a laboratory environment, motivated to learn about formulations, product development, and R&D workflows, and keen to apply your skills in a hands-on setting
You enjoy collaborating with non-digital colleagues, and can confidently explain digital tools and data concepts in a simple, practical way to support their daily work
You are interested in growing your career in Henkel’s global Innovation network, with relocation as one possible path after the program.
Proficiency in English is essential, as you will work in an international environment


Ready to take the next step in your career? Visit our program landing page for full details and apply today.

Some perks of joining Henkel

At Henkel, we come from a broad range of backgrounds, perspectives, and life experiences. We believe the uniqueness of all our employees is the power in us. Become part of the team and bring your uniqueness to us! We welcome all applications across different genders, origins, cultures, religions, sexual orientations, generations and disabilities. If there are any specific accommodations or adjustments you require for the interview process or your on-site appointment, please inform us, and we'll do our best to accommodate your requests.
Show more

Title: Deltidsanalytiker
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Deltidsanalytiker til innovativ ejendomsudviklings- og investeringsvirksomhed

 

Lokation: Kronprinsessegade 26, 1304 København K

Omfang: Deltid, fleksibelt ift. studie

Ansøgningsfrist: 20. juni 2025

 

Vil du være en del af et ambitiøst team med store visioner og stærke kompetencer inden for ejendomsudvikling og investering? Genre søger en struktureret og nysgerrig deltidsanalytiker til at bidrage med investerings- og dataanalyser, markedsresearch og udarbejdelse af beslutningsoplæg på tværs af projekter og forretningsområder.

 

Om Genre

Genre er en uvildig operationel partner med speciale i ejendomsudvikling og investeringsstyring.




Vi tilbyder end-to-end ydelser gennem hele ejendommens livscyklus – fra investering til udvikling, finansiering, byggeri, drift og frasalg. Vi skaber bæredygtige og rentable projekter med høj arkitektonisk værdi og lang levetid, understøttet af kerneværdier som integritet, innovation, bæredygtighed og ensrettede interesser med vores samarbejdspartnere i form af PE-fonde, pensionskasser og family offices.




Virksomheden blev grundlagt i 2024 af brancheeksperter med mere end 50 års samlet erfaring inden for finansielle, juridiske og tekniske discipliner. Vores mission er at levere ejendomsudvikling og investeringsstyring på markedets højeste niveau.




Genre har primær fokus på Storkøbenhavn og regionale vækstbyer og positionerer sig som en nøglespiller i udviklingen af fremtidens ejendomme.




Se mere på www.genre.dk




Dine opgaver

Som deltidsanalytiker bliver du en integreret del af teamet og vil bl.a. arbejde med:

Udarbejdelse af investering- og dataanalyser
Markedsresearch
Udarbejdelse af beslutningsoplæg
Udarbejdelse og vedligeholdelse af finansielle modeller
Understøttelse af due diligence-processer
Assistere med dokumentation og rapportering til ledelsen
Løbende ad hoc-opgaver relateret til investering, udvikling, drift og frasalg af ejendomsprojekter




Din profil

Vi forestiller os, at du:

Er kandidatstuderende (eller starter på kandidatuddannelse efter sommerferien), f.eks. Copenhagen Business School (CBS) inden for økonomi, finansiering og regnskab eller IT og information, eller Københavns Universitet (KU) inden for økonomi
Har skarpe analytiske evner og flair for tal, data og præsentationer
Er struktureret, selvkørende og kvalitetsbevidst
Har interesse for ejendomsmarkedet og/eller investeringer
Behersker Excel og PowerPoint på højt niveau
Kommunikerer klart – både skriftligt og mundtligt, på dansk og engelsk




Hvad vi tilbyder

Et læringsrigt og ambitiøst miljø med højt til loftet
Tæt sparring med ledelsesteamet og mulighed for at præge egne opgaver
Erfaring med konkrete investerings- og udviklingsprojekter
Fleksibel arbejdstid tilpasset dit studie
En central placering i hjertet af København




Sådan søger du

Send din ansøgning og CV til info@genre.dk senest 20. juni 2025.

Har du spørgsmål, er du velkommen til at kontakte Bent Bjerg-Bjerring, CEO via e-mail bbb@genre.dk eller via telefon +45 2537 7464.

Show more

Title: Intern AI & Management Consulting (Value Engineering) - Nordics
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We're Celonis, the global leader in Process Mining technology and one of the world's fastest-growing SaaS firms. We believe there is a massive opportunity to unlock productivity by placing data and intelligence at the core of business processes - and for that, we need you to join us.

The Team:

As an Intern AI & Management Consulting you join our Value Engineering team to focus on driving and closing opportunities by identifying and selling the value Celonis can bring to customers. Our Value Engineers (VE) are the trusted advisor for customers and work on the intersection of technology and business. Value Engineers partner with sales and customers to create compelling solutions to critical business problems.

The Role:

Value Engineers are the trusted advisors for our prospects and customers that bring together Product, Technology and Process Know-how to solve our prospects’ and customers’ most pressing challenges You will gain experience in executing proof of value projects and take part in technical discussions with stakeholders. By creating customer-based business cases, you support the strategic business development activities for the Nordics market.

The work you’ll do:


Support the Value Engineering team in uncovering customer business challenges by assisting in research, data analysis, and preparation for customer discovery sessions.
Contribute to showcasing the Celonis value proposition, especially around AI and Process Intelligence, by helping prepare pitch materials, demo content, and internal documentation.
Assist in prototyping and exploring AI-driven solutions by working alongside experienced team members on tasks such as data preparation, basic model exploration (traditional ML and LLM-based), and documenting findings.Analyze data from our customers to increase transparency in business processes
Understand the pain points of our customers and translate them to what the Celonis Process Intelligence Graph offers
Quantify the business and financial potential of the Celonis Process Intelligence Graph and prepare management ready presentations
Present findings together with your team in front of customers’ C-level and decision makers


The qualifications you need:


Student of industrial engineering, business informatics, data science or a comparable program
Strong communicational skills and interest in interacting with potential customers
Experience in consulting and highly interested in Data Analytics
Knowledge in SQL or related database query languages
Analytical mindset and the ability to work in a structured manner and quickly comprehend new topics
Effective communicator and fluent in English. Nordic languages like Swedish, Danish, Norwegian, Finnish are a plus.


What Celonis Can Offer You:


Pioneer Innovation: Work with the leading, award-winning process mining technology, shaping the future of business.
Accelerate Your Growth: Benefit from clear career paths, internal mobility, a dedicated learning program, and mentorship opportunities.
Receive Exceptional Benefits: Including generous PTO, hybrid working options, company equity (RSUs), comprehensive benefits, extensive parental leave, dedicated volunteer days, and much more.
Prioritize Your Well-being: Access to resources such as gym subsidies, counseling, and well-being programs.
Connect and Belong: Find community and support through dedicated inclusion and belonging programs.
Make Meaningful Impact: Be part of a company driven by strong values that guide everything we do: Live for Customer Value, The Best Team Wins, We Own It, and Earth Is Our Future.
Collaborate Globally: Join a dynamic, international team of talented individuals.
Empowered Environment: Contribute your ideas in an open culture with autonomous teams.


About Us:

Celonis makes processes work for people, companies and the planet. The Celonis Process Intelligence Platform uses industry-leading process mining and AI technology and augments it with business context to give customers a living digital twin of their business operation. It’s system-agnostic and without bias, and provides everyone with a common language for understanding and improving businesses. Celonis enables its customers to continuously realize significant value across the top, bottom, and green line. Celonis is headquartered in Munich, Germany, and New York City, USA, with more than 20 offices worldwide.

Get familiar with the Celonis Process Intelligence Platform by watching this video.

Celonis Inclusion Statement:

At Celonis, we believe our people make us who we are and that “The Best Team Wins”. We know that the best teams are made up of people who bring different perspectives to the table. And when everyone feels included, able to speak up and knows their voice is heard - that's when creativity and innovation happen.

Your Privacy:

Any information you submit to Celonis as part of your application will be processed in accordance with Celonis’ Accessibility and Candidate Notices

By submitting this application, you confirm that you agree to the storing and processing of your personal data by Celonis as described in our Privacy Notice for the Application and Hiring Process.

Please be aware of common job offer scams, impersonators and frauds. Learn more here.
Show more

Title: Graduate Developer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
I am working with an exciting research consultancy looking for a Graduate Developer!




They are a forward-thinking company focused on revolutionizing the way biological data is analysed and shared, offering cutting-edge solutions to the research community. As they expand, they are looking for talented professionals to help build innovative software platforms that will drive scientific progress.










The Role




As the company continues to grow, they're looking to bring on a Graduate Developer to join their close-knit team of 10.




This is an ideal opportunity for someone who is due to graduate this summer and has a solid foundation in React and Next.js, whether through university projects, internships, or personal work. You'll work closely with backend developers to build and integrate new features and contribute to exciting client-driven projects from day one.




If you're passionate about development and eager to learn in a fast-paced, supportive environment, this is an amazing opportunity to start your career.




You will be working mostly on site in their Copenhagen office.




Benefits

Salary between 40K – 55K DKK per month
25 Days holiday
Paid lunch at the company office







If this role could be for you drop me an email at gabby.bergonzi@amicusjobs.co.uk

Title: Performance Intelligence Consultant
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you passionate about turning complex data into powerful insights that influence decisions for global brands? Do you love uncovering patterns, experiment & testing theories, and translating numbers into actionable strategies? If so, we want to hear from you.

At VML MAP, we're looking for a Performance Intelligence Consultant who thrives at the intersection of data, strategy, and storytelling. You'll play a key role in helping our clients optimize performance across digital channels and drive real business results.

What will your day look like?

As Performance Intelligence Consultant, you'll be at the forefront of data-driven decision-making and play a vital role in understanding client priorities and objectives. With a foundational understanding of user experience and a strong grasp of data and analytical approaches, you'll be the bridge between data and strategy. Your daily activities will include conducting detailed data analysis to identify performance trends, designing and executing A/B tests and analyzing the results to provide optimization recommendations. You'll also be preparing and presenting performance reports, and your strong communication skills and storytelling abilities will ensure that actionable insights are delivered in an easily understood format, and in a way that motivates and provides a clear direction for various teams.

More Specifically, Your Tasks Include


Conduct detailed data analysis to identify performance trends and insights.
Prepare and present performance reports and translate the complex data into actionable insights to internal teams as well as our clients, with a focus on content, audience, and channels.
Maintain and update performance dashboards and analytics tools.
Collaborate with various teams to ensure data-driven decision-making.
Design, execute and analyze A/B tests and experiments to identify the most effective strategies and tactics.
Approach all tasks with curiosity, hunger and open-mindedness, constantly striving to uncover further insights from the available data and to understand the "why" behind the numbers.


Who are you going to work with?

You'll be part of our expanding Insights & Optimization team, reporting directly to the Performance Intelligence Lead. You'll work closely with data analysts, strategists, content experts, and client teams - acting as the vital link between technical data and business outcomes.

What do you bring to the table?

We're looking for curious minds with a strategic outlook and a passion for data. You're not just comfortable with numbers; you're adept at translating them into narratives that resonate with both technical and non-technical audiences, and you have a strong curiosity to discover the 'why' behind the data. Additionally, you are very collaboratively oriented, and you love working with cross-functional teams. Your expertise in detailed analysis and optimization will be instrumental in driving improvements and delivering actionable insights that enhance our daily tasks for clients.

In Addition, You Have


Experience analyzing campaign performance across digital channels and a strong understanding of marketing performance metrics such as open-rates, click through rates, conversions and journey data.
Experience with data visualizations tools such as Power BI and Tableau and strong knowledge of SQL for data manipulation and analysis.
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, including advanced functions and data manipulation.
Ability to translate complex data into understandable insights for non-technical audiences.
Skills in crafting compelling narratives from data insights.
Experience in presenting findings and recommendations to clients and/or Senior stakeholders.
Skills in managing expectations and building trust with clients and internal teams.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment with an open mind.
Curiosity, adaptability, and a proactive approach to problem-solving.
Strong understanding of A/B testing methodologies and tools, with hands-on experience in driving learning agendas and continuous optimization efforts.


A leader in personalized customer experiences

VML MAP is a world-leading Centre of Excellence that helps businesses humanize the relationship between the brand and the customer through hyper personalization at scale, marketing automation and CRM. With the brain of a consultancy, the heart of an agency and the power of technology and data, we work with some of the world's most admired brands to help them on their transformation journey to becoming truly customer-centric. Together, we are 1000 + technology specialists, data scientists, strategic thinkers, consultants, operations experts, and creative minds from 55+ nationalities.

A global network

We are part of the global VML network that encompasses more than 30,000 employees across 150+ offices in 60+ markets, each contributing to a culture that values connection, belonging, and the power of differences.

WPP (VML MAP) is an equal opportunity employer and considers applicants for all positions without discrimination or regard to characteristics. We are committed to fostering a culture of respect in which everyone feels they belong and has the same opportunities to progress in their careers.

For more information, please visit our website, and follow VML MAP on our social channels via Instagram, LinkedIn and X.

When you click "Apply now" below, your information is sent to VML MAP. To learn more about how we process your personal data during when you apply for a role with us, on how you can update your information or have the information removed please read our Privacy policy. California residents should read our California Recruitment Privacy Notice.

Title: Student Assistant, Media Analytics
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you have a sharp eye for detail and a love for data? Then we might need our help to ensure our media reporting is top-notch, accurate, and driving smart business decisions! If your educational journey is taking you through the world of data analytics and dashboard development, we’ve got the perfect role for you!

Join our Media Analytics Team as a Student Assistant and make a real impact on our business. This is more than just a student job – it's your chance to help tell the story of how our media efforts drive results and shape the future of Pandora. You’ll be at the heart of our reporting setup, ensuring senior management has the best insights at their fingertips, helping them make informed, strategic decisions.

Why this job rocks

As a Reporting Student Assistant, your role goes beyond crunching numbers. You’ll be helping to create dashboards that not only dazzle with their design but deliver insights that influence major business decisions. You’ll be our data detective, validating numbers, uncovering insights, and bringing clarity to complex data.

You’ll work closely with a friendly and collaborative team who value each other's ideas and contributions. And when we say team, we mean family! We love a good laugh and keep the vibe light while delivering top tier work that powers our business forward.

What You’ll Do


Data Quality Champion: Be the gatekeeper of our data, ensuring that all reports and dashboards are filled with accurate, validated information that stakeholders can trust.
Data Validation Detective: Dive into large datasets, perform rigorous quality checks, and troubleshoot any discrepancies to maintain a high standard of reporting accuracy.
Dashboard development Sidekick: Support in building visually stunning and user-friendly dashboards that turn data into actionable insights. Don’t worry if Power BI isn’t your forte yet – we’ll help you become an expert in no time.
Collaborative Problem-Solving: Participate in bi-weekly sprints to prioritize tasks and solve data-related challenges, working closely with a dynamic team of media professionals.
Ad-Hoc Reporting Magic: Support various reporting-related tasks as needed, helping the team deliver actionable insights on time.



What You’ll Bring To The Table


Curiosity and Quick Learning: You’re passionate about learning and enjoy digging into data, uncovering insights, and solving problems.
Experience with Big Data: You’re comfortable working with large datasets, identifying patterns, and ensuring that all details are accurate and meaningful.
Power BI Familiarity (Bonus): Experience with Power BI or other visualization tools is a plus, though the focus will be on ensuring data quality over building dashboards.
Data Savviness: An understanding of data pipelines and relationship tables (GCP or other cloud platforms) is a bonus but not required.
Media Know-How (Bonus): Familiarity with marketing and paid media is helpful, but not essential.
Relevant educational background: Preferably with a couple of year’s left before graduation



Your Personal Skills That Make a Difference


Self-Motivation: Proactively seek out opportunities to learn and grow within the team, contributing to both personal and business success.
Attention to Detail: Accuracy in data validation and reporting is key to ensuring that our dashboards provide reliable insights to drive business decisions.
Collaboration: Comfortable working with both internal and external teams, adapting to a variety of work styles and team dynamics.
Contributor: Likes to contribute to an informal and humorous working environment in your own capacity



Additional Information

This job is based in the PANDORA Global Office in Copenhagen, Denmark.

Start date: as soon as possible

Why you’ll love working at Pandora

Pandora is a company with a big heart and an even bigger ambition. We’re dedicated to making sure our people are happy, engaged, and thriving in their roles. You’ll be joining a vibrant global marketing team full of passionate, creative individuals who are the best at what they do. At Pandora, we believe in doing great work, but we also believe in having a great time doing it!

If you’re ready to take your data skills to the next level while having a blast with a fantastic team, we’d love to have you aboard!

Additional Information

This role is based in the Pandora Global Office in Copenhagen, Denmark and your working hours will be 20 per week on average (less around exams and more when possible and required).

 In order to apply for this position, you need to currently be a student enrolled in a Danish university.

 Did we get your attention?

We hope you got all your questions answered and feel confident applying for this position. If you would like to become a part of Pandora’s future, please do not hesitate to apply. We look forward to hearing from you!

 We process applications on a continuous basis, which is why we encourage you to send your application as soon as possible. You can also read more about Pandora on our corporate site www.pandoragroup.com.

 Icing on the cake

You will be working out of our beautiful Head Office in Copenhagen V, established in 2016 and designed to unite and inspire our teams. Besides our beautiful interior design we are also proud of our LEED Gold Certification for Energy and Environmental Design. This means that we use as few natural resources as possible and that we use them with respect. The result is a professional and dynamic space that is unique, comfortable and inspirational – and delivers a true Pandora experience to anyone who works here or comes to visit.

About Pandora

Pandora is the world's largest jewellery brand, specialising in the design, crafting and marketing of accessible luxury jewellery made from high-quality materials. Each piece is created to inspire self-expression, allowing people to share their stories and passions through meaningful jewellery. Pandora jewellery is sold in more than 100 countries through 6,800 points of sale, including more than 2,700 concept stores.

Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs 37,000 people worldwide and crafts its jewellery using only recycled silver and gold. Pandora is committed to leadership in sustainability and has set out to halve greenhouse gas emissions across its value chain by 2030. Pandora is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and generated revenue of DKK 31.7 billion (EUR 4.2 billion) in 2024.
Show more
HTML:
Do you have a sharp eye for detail and a love for data? Then we might need our help to ensure our media reporting is top-notch, accurate, and driving smart business decisions! If your educational journey is taking you through the world of data analytics and dashboard development, we’ve got the perfect role for you!

Join our Media Analytics Team as a Student Assistant and make a real impact on our business. This is more than just a student job – it's your chance to help tell the story of how our media efforts drive results and shape the future of Pandora. You’ll be at the heart of our reporting setup, ensuring senior management has the best insights at their fingertips, helping them make informed, strategic decisions.

Why this job rocks

As a Reporting Student Assistant, your role goes beyond crunching numbers. You’ll be helping to create dashboards that not only dazzle with their design but deliver insights that influence major business decisions. You’ll be our data detective, validating numbers, uncovering insights, and bringing clarity to complex data.

You’ll work closely with a friendly and collaborative team who value each other's ideas and contributions. And when we say team, we mean family! We love a good laugh and keep the vibe light while delivering top tier work that powers our business forward.

What You’ll Do

  • Data Quality Champion: Be the gatekeeper of our data, ensuring that all reports and dashboards are filled with accurate, validated information that stakeholders can trust.
  • Data Validation Detective: Dive into large datasets, perform rigorous quality checks, and troubleshoot any discrepancies to maintain a high standard of reporting accuracy.
  • Dashboard development Sidekick: Support in building visually stunning and user-friendly dashboards that turn data into actionable insights. Don’t worry if Power BI isn’t your forte yet – we’ll help you become an expert in no time.
  • Collaborative Problem-Solving: Participate in bi-weekly sprints to prioritize tasks and solve data-related challenges, working closely with a dynamic team of media professionals.
  • Ad-Hoc Reporting Magic: Support various reporting-related tasks as needed, helping the team deliver actionable insights on time.


What You’ll Bring To The Table

  • Curiosity and Quick Learning: You’re passionate about learning and enjoy digging into data, uncovering insights, and solving problems.
  • Experience with Big Data: You’re comfortable working with large datasets, identifying patterns, and ensuring that all details are accurate and meaningful.
  • Power BI Familiarity (Bonus): Experience with Power BI or other visualization tools is a plus, though the focus will be on ensuring data quality over building dashboards.
  • Data Savviness: An understanding of data pipelines and relationship tables (GCP or other cloud platforms) is a bonus but not required.
  • Media Know-How (Bonus): Familiarity with marketing and paid media is helpful, but not essential.
  • Relevant educational background: Preferably with a couple of year’s left before graduation


Your Personal Skills That Make a Difference

  • Self-Motivation: Proactively seek out opportunities to learn and grow within the team, contributing to both personal and business success.
  • Attention to Detail: Accuracy in data validation and reporting is key to ensuring that our dashboards provide reliable insights to drive business decisions.
  • Collaboration: Comfortable working with both internal and external teams, adapting to a variety of work styles and team dynamics.
  • Contributor: Likes to contribute to an informal and humorous working environment in your own capacity


Additional Information

This job is based in the PANDORA Global Office in Copenhagen, Denmark.

Start date: as soon as possible

Why you’ll love working at Pandora

Pandora is a company with a big heart and an even bigger ambition. We’re dedicated to making sure our people are happy, engaged, and thriving in their roles. You’ll be joining a vibrant global marketing team full of passionate, creative individuals who are the best at what they do. At Pandora, we believe in doing great work, but we also believe in having a great time doing it!

If you’re ready to take your data skills to the next level while having a blast with a fantastic team, we’d love to have you aboard!

Additional Information

This role is based in the Pandora Global Office in Copenhagen, Denmark and your working hours will be 20 per week on average (less around exams and more when possible and required).

 In order to apply for this position, you need to currently be a student enrolled in a Danish university.

 Did we get your attention?

We hope you got all your questions answered and feel confident applying for this position. If you would like to become a part of Pandora’s future, please do not hesitate to apply. We look forward to hearing from you!

 We process applications on a continuous basis, which is why we encourage you to send your application as soon as possible. You can also read more about Pandora on our corporate site www.pandoragroup.com.

 Icing on the cake

You will be working out of our beautiful Head Office in Copenhagen V, established in 2016 and designed to unite and inspire our teams. Besides our beautiful interior design we are also proud of our LEED Gold Certification for Energy and Environmental Design. This means that we use as few natural resources as possible and that we use them with respect. The result is a professional and dynamic space that is unique, comfortable and inspirational – and delivers a true Pandora experience to anyone who works here or comes to visit.

About Pandora

Pandora is the world's largest jewellery brand, specialising in the design, crafting and marketing of accessible luxury jewellery made from high-quality materials. Each piece is created to inspire self-expression, allowing people to share their stories and passions through meaningful jewellery. Pandora jewellery is sold in more than 100 countries through 6,800 points of sale, including more than 2,700 concept stores.

Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs 37,000 people worldwide and crafts its jewellery using only recycled silver and gold. Pandora is committed to leadership in sustainability and has set out to halve greenhouse gas emissions across its value chain by 2030. Pandora is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and generated revenue of DKK 31.7 billion (EUR 4.2 billion) in 2024.

Title: Performance Intelligence Consultant
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you passionate about turning complex data into powerful insights that influence decisions for global brands? Do you love uncovering patterns, experiment & testing theories, and translating numbers into actionable strategies? If so, we want to hear from you.

At VML MAP, we’re looking for a Performance Intelligence Consultant who thrives at the intersection of data, strategy, and storytelling. You'll play a key role in helping our clients optimize performance across digital channels and drive real business results.

What will your day look like?

As Performance Intelligence Consultant, you'll be at the forefront of data-driven decision-making and play a vital role in understanding client priorities and objectives. With a foundational understanding of user experience and a strong grasp of data and analytical approaches, you’ll be the bridge between data and strategy. Your daily activities will include conducting detailed data analysis to identify performance trends, designing and executing A/B tests and analyzing the results to provide optimization recommendations. You’ll also be preparing and presenting performance reports, and your strong communication skills and storytelling abilities will ensure that actionable insights are delivered in an easily understood format, and in a way that motivates and provides a clear direction for various teams.

More Specifically, Your Tasks Include


Conduct detailed data analysis to identify performance trends and insights.
Prepare and present performance reports and translate the complex data into actionable insights to internal teams as well as our clients, with a focus on content, audience, and channels.
Maintain and update performance dashboards and analytics tools.
Collaborate with various teams to ensure data-driven decision-making.
Design, execute and analyze A/B tests and experiments to identify the most effective strategies and tactics.
Approach all tasks with curiosity, hunger and open-mindedness, constantly striving to uncover further insights from the available data and to understand the “why” behind the numbers.


Who are you going to work with?

You'll be part of our expanding Insights & Optimization team, reporting directly to the Performance Intelligence Lead. You’ll work closely with data analysts, strategists, content experts, and client teams - acting as the vital link between technical data and business outcomes.

What do you bring to the table?

We're looking for curious minds with a strategic outlook and a passion for data. You're not just comfortable with numbers; you're adept at translating them into narratives that resonate with both technical and non-technical audiences, and you have a strong curiosity to discover the ‘why’ behind the data. Additionally, you are very collaboratively oriented, and you love working with cross-functional teams. Your expertise in detailed analysis and optimization will be instrumental in driving improvements and delivering actionable insights that enhance our daily tasks for clients.

In Addition, You Have


Experience analyzing campaign performance across digital channels and a strong understanding of marketing performance metrics such as open-rates, click through rates, conversions and journey data.
Experience with data visualizations tools such as Power BI and Tableau and strong knowledge of SQL for data manipulation and analysis.
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, including advanced functions and data manipulation.
Ability to translate complex data into understandable insights for non-technical audiences.
Skills in crafting compelling narratives from data insights.
Experience in presenting findings and recommendations to clients and/or Senior stakeholders.
Skills in managing expectations and building trust with clients and internal teams.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment with an open mind.
Curiosity, adaptability, and a proactive approach to problem-solving.
Strong understanding of A/B testing methodologies and tools, with hands-on experience in driving learning agendas and continuous optimization efforts.


A leader in personalized customer experiences

VML MAP is a world-leading Centre of Excellence that helps businesses humanize the relationship between the brand and the customer through hyper personalization at scale, marketing automation and CRM. With the brain of a consultancy, the heart of an agency and the power of technology and data, we work with some of the world's most admired brands to help them on their transformation journey to becoming truly customer-centric. Together, we are 1000 + technology specialists, data scientists, strategic thinkers, consultants, operations experts, and creative minds from 55+ nationalities.

A global network

We are part of the global VML network that encompasses more than 30,000 employees across 150+ offices in 60+ markets, each contributing to a culture that values connection, belonging, and the power of differences.

WPP (VML MAP) is an equal opportunity employer and considers applicants for all positions without discrimination or regard to characteristics. We are committed to fostering a culture of respect in which everyone feels they belong and has the same opportunities to progress in their careers.

For more information, please visit our website, and follow VML MAP on our social channels via Instagram, LinkedIn and X.

When you click “Apply now” below, your information is sent to VML MAP. To learn more about how we process your personal data during when you apply for a role with us, on how you can update your information or have the information removed please read our Privacy policy. California residents should read our California Recruitment Privacy Notice.

Title: Business Intelligence Specialist
Place: Kongens Lyngby, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Business Intelligence Specialist, Lyngby



Full-time permanent



Hybrid



 



Do you want to be part of developing the BI tools that will provide insights, drive actions, and ultimately support the strategic direction of COWI? Can you convert data into compelling storytelling through visualisations - and do you have strong collaboration skills? Then this opportunity might be for you.



 



Create the solutions that will enable a better tomorrow



As a Business Intelligence Specialist, you will be part of the Business Intelligence and Insights team, and you will play an instrumental role in bringing our company data to strategic use. Our team develops BI-tools targeted at colleagues all across COWI - providing data-based insights and supporting actions to enable our long-term strategic ambitions as outlined in our strategy. We have an ambition to take the use of data to the next level.



 



You will report to the Head of Business Intelligence and Insights, Sofie Gade Sundin, and you will work in close cooperation with colleagues in the team as well as many stakeholders across COWI.



 



On a day-to-day basis, you will:



Work closely with cross-functional teams to gather and analyse business requirements for BI projects
Design, develop and maintain business intelligence (BI) solutions using Power BI
Stay updated on BI technologies to recommend improvements and best practices - and take active part in knowledge sharing across the team
Collaborate with teams to gather requirements and translate them into effective data visualizations
Ensure data accuracy and reliability in reports
Optimize Power BI performance and enhance user experience



 



Your Skills. Our Team. Together We Design the Future



The first step to success and growth in this role is that you understand that collaboration, co-creation and good communication pave the way for good and well-anchored solutions. Developing ties with others is something you do naturally by acting respectfully and delivering on your promises. And you never get set in your ways but keep exploring new insights and ways to improve.



 



In addition to the above, you will have:



Proficiency in Power BI: Minimum 3-4 years of hands-on experience in developing Power BI reports, including data preparation, data modeling, DAX expressions, Power Query, data visualization, and report optimization
Data Visualization and Dashboard Design: Experience in designing and developing engaging dashboards and reports
Data Modeling and Database: Strong understanding of data modeling concepts and database technologies (SQL)
Data Integration: Ability to work with different data sources and integrate them into Power BI
Stakeholder Collaboration: Communication skills to collaborate with stakeholders and understand their reporting needs
Data Management: Experience in extracting and managing data from different sources like SQL Server, Dataverse, Azure, SAP HANA, and SharePoint
Data-Driven Storytelling: Holistic approach to developing solutions with demonstrated creativity in crafting visually appealing and user-friendly dashboards and reports.
Language Skills: Proficiency in Danish and English, both spoken and written.



 



It will be a bonus if you can tick off one or more of the following:



Experience with Tabular Editor (Cube) and SQL
Experience with Microsoft ecosystem, incl. Fabric, Copilot, PowerApps, and Power Automate



 



A place to work and so much more



At COWI, we work together with our customers to shape a sustainable and liveable world. We do it by applying our knowledge and curiosity - and sometimes even our courage - to create the solutions the world needs today to enable a better tomorrow. That is why we say no to fossil-based projects and aspire to have 100 per cent of our revenue come from activities that move our customers towards sustainability.



 



We value differences and development and cultivate an environment of belonging and having fun. Because that is what brings out the best in you, at work and at home.



 



With offices primarily located in Scandinavia, the UK, North America, and India, we are currently 7,500 people who bring their expertise in engineering, architecture, energy, and environment into play.



 



What we also offer



Being part of the COWI community offers more than just a competitive salary. We take care of our people both professionally and personally. 



 



Some of our benefits include:



An engaging work environment with opportunities for professional growth
The opportunity to contribute significantly to sustainability and business development efforts
Flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance



 



Got more questions?



If you have any unanswered questions about the role or what we have to offer, please contact Priyanka, Global Talent Acquisition Specialist at prki@cowi.com, or Head of Business Intelligence and Insights, Sofie Gade Sundin at sgs@cowi.com.



 



Get to know us even better at our website, where you can learn more about our projects, our strategy, what we want to achieve and what life is like at COWI.



 



Before you apply



All you need to include in your application is your CV - no photo or application letter. At an interview, you can tell us everything we need to know about why you’re interested in joining COWI. As for the photo, we prefer to form our first impression in person rather than from a picture.



 



Diversity is fundamental to COWI, inclusion is key.



We are committed to creating a respectful and fair work environment where all employees have a sense of belonging and equitable opportunities to thrive and grow. We ensure that our leaders are role models for inclusive leadership by cultivating a culture where diverse perspectives and thoughts are seen as strengths. And we take diversity and inclusion into account in all relevant decisions and processes and when setting teams and fora. We do it because it is part of our values and because it is simply the right thing to do.

Some of our benefits include:

  • An engaging work environment with opportunities for professional growth

  • Flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance

 

Got more questions?

If you have any unanswered questions about the role or what we have to offer, please contact Priyanka, Global Talent Acquisition Specialist at prki@cowi.com, or Head of Business Intelligence and Insights, Sofie Gade Sundin at sgs@cowi.com.

 

Get to know us even better at our website, where you can learn more about our projects, our strategy, what we want to achieve and what life is like at COWI.

All you need to include in your application is your CV - no photo or application letter. At an interview, you can tell us everything we need to know about why you’re interested in joining COWI. As for the photo, we prefer to form our first impression in person rather than from a picture.

 

Diversity is fundamental to COWI, inclusion is key.

We are committed to creating a respectful and fair work environment where all employees have a sense of belonging and equitable opportunities to thrive and grow. We ensure that our leaders are role models for inclusive leadership by cultivating a culture where diverse perspectives and thoughts are seen as strengths. And we take diversity and inclusion into account in all relevant decisions and processes and when setting teams and fora. We do it because it is part of our values and because it is simply the right thing to do.

Title: Student Assistant in Business Intelligence Team
Place: Kvistgård, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are looking for a student assistant for our Business Intelligence team in Bavarian Nordic Global Operations.




Please note applications with lack of authenticity or excessive use of generic AI generated text (ChatGPT) will automatically be declined.




About the job

The position is to help elevate the business intelligence of the entire Global Operations by moving from descriptive to diagnostic analytics.

You will be talking with business leaders to understand what insights they need and building solutions to meet those needs.

We work with data from procurement, planning, warehouse, production, customer service, distribution, quality control, and many other teams.

All solutions will be built using Power BI.

 

Colleagues

You will be working closely with a 10-year experienced BI professional. It is a great opportunity to learn how a supply chain is managed and how you can add significant value to a large company.

You will also be working with two other student assistants.

 

Examples of tasks

• Collaborate with business leaders and the BI team

• Build Power BI solutions using DAX and design principles

• Teach end users how to use the solutions to gain maximum value

 

Preferred profile

• Interested in data analytics and Power BI

• Open, honest, and humble communicator

• Responsible and reliable personality

• Fluent in English

• Independent initiator and ambitious

 

Experience with Power BI or similar BI tools is a big plus, but not a requirement.

 

Culture

Communication in the team is informal, fun, and easygoing.

It is important to us that you are well supported, and you will be exposed to challenges so you can grow and learn.

It is possible to work remotely, but before you can do that, you must establish connections with your relevant stakeholders.

You’ll have influence over the projects and tasks you work on, allowing you to grow in the areas that interest you most — whether that is spatial data analysis, machine learning, project management, report design, or something else.

 

Salary and working hours

The salary is hourly and starts at a fixed level of 150 DKK but can be adjusted based on performance.

Working hours are flexible but aimed at 15–20 hours per week.

There is a possibility of transitioning into a full-time job after your studies if you perform well.




Applying

You must include a short text highlighting your motivation to work with business intelligence.

We are looking forward to hearing from you.

We invite applicants on an ongoing basis.

 

Questions

You are welcome to contact our BI lead, Jakob Paulsen, if you have any questions.

📧 jamp@bavarian-nordic.com

📞 +45 91 88 77 60

 

Show more
