There is a possibility of transitioning into a full-time job after your studies if you perform well.


Applying

You must include a short text highlighting your motivation to work with business intelligence.

We are looking forward to hearing from you.

We invite applicants on an ongoing basis.

 

Questions

You are welcome to contact our BI lead, Jakob Paulsen, if you have any questions.

📧 jamp@bavarian-nordic.com

📞 +45 91 88 77 60

Title: Data Engineer (Copenhagen)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We're looking for a Data Engineer for our Copenhagen office

Hi there! Are you our new colleague at Dreaminfluence?

We’re looking for a skilled Data Engineer to join our R&D team and help shape the data infrastructure that powers data-driven decision-making across Dreaminfluence. In this role, you’ll play a key part in building and maintaining robust data pipelines, ensuring data quality, and scaling our internal data architecture to support the company’s continued growth and operational excellence.

You're a great match for Dreaminfluence if you're


Team-oriented – You believe the best work comes from collaboration, shared responsibility, and open communication.
Honest – You value transparency, give and receive constructive feedback openly, and speak your mind—even when it’s not the easy route.
Goal-driven – You work effectively in short delivery cycles, and you stay focused on both short-term deliverables and long-term outcomes.
Analytical – Data isn’t just your job—it’s your mindset. You make decisions based on insights, not assumptions.
You have strong business acumen – You understand how businesses work and align your decisions with broader company goals, considering impact on revenue, customer value, growth, and efficiency.
You thrive on taking full ownership of your work, feel empowered to make decisions, and proactively drive initiatives forward with independence and confidence
You care about building clean, scalable systems that make working with data easier for the whole company.
You love to get feedback and improve your craft, and you're not afraid to provide feedback to your colleagues so they can improve.


We’re a great fit for you if


You want to be part of a fast-moving SaaS start-up.
You thrive in a culture of ownership and flexibility.
You want to work onsite in our Copenhagen office alongside a talented, cross-functional R&D team.


About The Job

As a Data Engineer at Dreaminfluence, you’ll play a central role in shaping and scaling the data infrastructure that powers decision-making across the business. You’ll join our R&D team and work closely with stakeholders from multiple departments, including product, finance, marketing, and executive leadership, to ensure our data is clean, accessible, and actionable.

We already have a strong foundation in place, but we’re growing fast, and so are our data needs. That’s where you come in.

Your Primary Responsibilities Will Include


Designing and developing robust data pipelines to collect, clean, and transform raw data from multiple sources into high-quality datasets used across the company.
Building scalable ETL/ELT processes to support both real-time and batch data workflows, ensuring consistent data flow from ingestion to reporting.
Enhancing data discoverability and access by designing intuitive, well-documented data models that business users and analysts can trust and explore.
Improving the performance and scalability of our existing data infrastructure by optimizing queries, storage, and pipeline execution for large and growing datasets.
Driving best practices in data governance and quality, including monitoring, validation, and alerting for data anomalies or inconsistencies.


The perfect candidate also brings some of the following (nice to have, but not required):


Experience with statistics and/or machine learning
Familiarity with SaaS business KPIs
Prior experience with the HubSpot and Chargebee APIs


You’ll have the opportunity to significantly impact the way Dreaminfluence uses data, shaping internal reporting and enhancing product features.

Our Current Data Stack Includes


A Databricks-based data lake built on top of AWS
Python (Pandas, numpy, PySpark) for data processing, transformation, and scripting
SQL for data modeling and exploration


Hiring Process


Intro chat with our CTO, Morten Frank
In-depth personal interview
Personality test + walkthrough
Technical case + interview with our Data Scientist


What You Get


Full-time health-care insurance
5 weeks vacation + 5 additional holidays
Flexible company pension scheme
MacBook Pro (personal use allowed)
Daily free lunch at the office
A central role in a growing product-focused company


Excited? We’d love to hear from you. Join us in building the data backbone of modern influencer marketing.
Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Kolding, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Hos NCG søger de en dygtig og dedikeret Data Engineer, der vil være med til at sikre, at deres data er robuste, pålidelige og skalerbare. Du vil få en central rolle i transitionen til en moderne cloud-baseret arkitektur og være med til at forme deres data setup fra bunden.




Forestil dig at arbejde i et miljø, hvor dine tekniske færdigheder og idéer virkelig gør en forskel.




Missionen

Deres mission er klar: Sikre stabilitet og udvikling på kort sigt, og designe og udvikle langsigtede løsninger, der kan understøtte deres vækst og ambitioner.




Du bliver en del af Data Engineering teamet, som har en god balance mellem drift og udvikling, hvor du får mulighed for at arbejde med både vedligehold og nye projekter.




Kerneopgaver

Dine arbejdsdage vil være fyldt med:

Design, udvikling og vedligeholdelse af datamodeller og sikring af høj kvalitet, dokumentation og skalerbarhed i data infrastrukturen.
Arbejde med og videreudvikling af den nuværende on-prem SQL Server-platform og sikre stabil drift.
En central rolle i overgangen til en fremtidig cloud-baseret arkitektur (Microsoft Azure eller Fabric) – herunder planlægning, opbygning og implementering.
Bidrag til migrering fra Qlik Sense til ny BI-front-end (Power BI).
Tæt samarbejde med BI-udviklere, IT og forretningen om at sikre adgang til valide, strukturerede data til analyser og rapportering.
Identifikation og implementering af tekniske forbedringer, der understøtter teamets leverancer og forretningens fremdrift.




Kvalifikationer

Vi søger dig, der:

Har solid erfaring med design, udvikling og vedligeholdelse af datamodeller og infrastruktur.
Har solid erfaring med SQL Server.
Har erfaring med cloud-baserede platforme (Azure/Fabric) – dette er et must.
Besidder stærke problemløsningsevner og teknisk ekspertise.
Kan arbejde selvstændigt og i team.
Har gode kommunikations- og samarbejdsevner.




Om Nic. Christiansen Gruppen

Nic. Christiansen Gruppen er en af Danmarks største bilkoncerner, der siden grundlæggelsen i 1967 har arbejdet med bilimport og -detailsalg samt finansiering og leasing af biler.




Den familieejede koncern har hovedsæde i Kolding og står i dag for den danske import af Hyundai, BYD, Omoda & Jaecoo, Ford, Land Rover og Jaguar. Herudover ejer koncernen de seks bilkæder Bayern AutoGroup, May & Olde, Stadac, Terminalen, ERA BILER og British MotorGroup samt værkstedskæden Skorstensgaard og leasing- og finansieringsselskabet NCG Finans.




Interesseret?

Så søg stillingen ved at klikke “ansøg”. Vi er på udkig efter medarbejdere, som kan starte snarest muligt, så tøv ikke med at sende os din ansøgning og dit CV. Har du nogen spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte konsulent Julius Hauge på mail julius.hauge@randstad.dk.




Denne proces håndteres af Randstad, og alle henvendelser bedes rettet hertil.




Om Randstad

Randstad er verdens største HR-udbyder og ‘partner for talent’. Vi giver lige muligheder til alle uanset baggrund og hjælper kandidater med at forblive relevante på et hastigt skiftende arbejdsmarked. Vi tror på et inkluderende arbejdsmarked, hvor alle kan være sig selv og føle sig velkomne.




Vores markedsindsigt og store kendskab til arbejdsmarkedet hjælper virksomheder med at opbygge en kvalificeret, mangfoldig og fleksibel arbejdsstyrke, og vi støtter mennesker og virksomheder i at nå deres fulde potentiale. Det er det, vi er her for, og det er det, der motiverer os hver dag.




Randstad DK er en del af den internationale Randstad Group. Vi formidler dagligt arbejde til over 600.000 mennesker verden over og er førende inden for rekruttering, karriererådgivning og fleksibel arbejdskraft i Danmark, med afdelinger i København, Aarhus, Aalborg og Kolding.

Show more

Title: Analyst (Student Assistant), Global Project Management Office
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Copenhagen Infrastructure Service Company (CISC) - a service provider working exclusively for the global fund management company Copenhagen Infrastructure Partners (CIP), is currently looking for a Student Analyst to join Global Project Management Office team in our office in Copenhagen, Denmark.

The role
As a Student Assistant (internally called Analyst), you will have the exciting opportunity to apply your analytical skills in a real-world setting. You will collaborate with highly qualified and experienced professionals in our Global Project Management Office (PMO), while contributing to our successful project delivery.

In this role, you will be engaged in various project management and project delivery-related activities alongside your colleagues. Your key responsibilities will be to assist in developing of a potential implementation of a strategic portfolio management tool, including everything from stakeholder mapping, identifying key user groups, conducting market screening for potential vendors and preparing the business case for approval. In addition, you will be responsible for finding ways for easy tracking of key project milestones, data management, and presentation of these in a simple and automated manner. You will also perform various types of analyses using Excel and Power BI to support informed decision-making and assist with ad hoc tasks as needed together with the entire team.

Responsibilities will further consist of:

Support scoping, defining, and preparing business case for a strategic portfolio mgmt. tool
Collect and maintain data used to conduct portfolio overviews, tracking key decision gates and phases
Closely collaborate and support our team members within their areas of responsibility
Assistance with presentations and communication material


This part-time Analyst position requires approximately 15-20 hours per week, while you are enrolled at a university. We value flexibility, so your workload may vary, and we expect both you and the team to adjust accordingly. You will report directly to a team member, who will provide you with mentorship and guidance as you embark on this exciting journey with us.

You
We are looking for a candidate, either in the 1st year of a Master’s or in the last year of a Bachelor’s degree, who plans to pursue a relevant master’s degree in, for example (but not limited to) Project Management, General Management and Analytics (cand.merc.), Business, Engineering or Energy (MSc).

You are a responsible and motivated individual who is thriving in a highly dynamic, effective and innovative environment.

We look for the following in a candidate:

High academic performer with solid analytical skills
Thrives with taking initiative and ownership, while also demonstrating high attention to detail
Fluent in English, with advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office, particularly PowerPoint and Excel (experience with Power BI would be beneficial)
Cooperative colleague with solid written and verbal communication skills


Please, note that we don't have remote work opportunities, therefore only students residing in Denmark (or planning to move here for the Master's degree), will be considered.

The process
Please apply online as soon as possible as applications will be processed on an ongoing basis. For questions related to the role, please reach out to our Talent Acquisition team at talent@cisc.dk. We do not include CV's and Cover Letters sent by email.

As we continue to improve our candidate experience, diversity and avoid unconscious bias, please avoid having a photo in your CV. We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality for all applicants.

Please be aware that we will not accept speculative CV submissions for any of our roles from recruitment agencies, and any unsolicited candidate submissions will be exempt from any payment expectations and ownership.

CISC’s commitment to diversity and inclusion
CISC is committed to securing a diverse and inclusive work environment where everyone feels respected and heard. A diverse workforce allows CISC to achieve results through different approaches and solutions to task execution and problem solving. We want all our employees to have equal opportunities for personal growth and career opportunities regardless of age, gender, sexual orientation, disability, religion, nationality, and ethnicity.



---



Copenhagen Infrastructure Service Company

CISC is a service company working exclusively for Copenhagen Infrastructure Partners (CIP). CISC is owned by the funds managed by CIP with the purpose of delivering best-in-class services to the growing portfolio of renewable assets.

We engage in the energy transition through specialist services, project development and value creation with trusted third-party suppliers. Our core focus is conducting due-diligence, development, construction, and operations of renewable assets, and we deliver a range of services within technical, commercial, and financial management, compliance, tax, legal, transaction and ESG.

We provide global support and a local presence in our key markets, and our teams are continuously delivering and developing services that are tailored to our wide range of projects – from offshore and onshore wind, solar and battery energy storage systems, to advanced bioenergy assets. For more information, please visit cisc.dk.
Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Azure Data Engineer




Som Data Engineer hos cVation bygger du dataplatforme, datawarehouses og MLOps løsninger i skyen for vores kunder. Vi bruger teknologier som Databricks, Fabric, Spark, Azure Machine Learning, Data Factory og Azure Synapse. Vi søger profiler med erfaring inden for enten MLOps, datawarehouses eller dataplatforme, som vil bygge innovative dataløsninger.




cVation er et dansk udviklings- og konsulenthus, som bygger avancerede cloudløsninger på Azure med afsæt i markedets hurtigste og mest agile metoder. cVation blev stiftet i 2014, har modtaget tre Børsen Gazeller og vundet Microsofts Partner Award for App Innovation tre år i træk. Vi arbejder dedikeret med agile arbejdsmetoder, DevOps og Test Driven Development. Vi sætter en ære i at levere software af den højeste kvalitet, og tager desuden principperne fra DevOps og software engineering med i vores dataprojekter, hvilket betyder, at tests, Infrastructure as Code og automatisering er i fokus.




Hvilken rolle får du?




Du kommer til at arbejde på et af vores dataprojekter med et projektteam bestående af arkitekter, software udviklere og DevOps specialister. Du vil have fuldt fokus på ét projekt og være tilknyttet ét team ad gangen.




Din rolle bliver at




rådgive om og bygge datawarehouse/dataplatformsløsninger i skyen
rådgive om og bygge løsninger indenfor MLOps
bidrage til design og implementering af den optimale Azure infrastruktur
sikre, at alt opsætning og provisionering sker som infrastructure as code, fx. Terraform
fuldautomatiseret overvågning og skalering af løsninger




Hvad forventer vi af dig?




Du har en videregående uddannelse i software engineering, human centered AI el lign. fra DTU, ITU eller KU samt erfaring i data engineering
Du har enten fullstack MLOps erfaring, kan skrive Python og har lyst til data engineering-delen - eller måske kommer du i stedet med erfaring i at bygge datawarehouse og dataplatforme.
Du vil gerne arbejde med de nyeste teknologier i Azure
Du har erfaring med - og vil gerne blive klogere på - flere af følgende teknologier: Data Factory - Databricks - Fabric - Spark - Azure Synapse - Azure Machine Learning - MLflow - Data Warehouse - Data platform - Python - Azure DevOps, Powershell, Azure CLI, ARM templates, YAML, Bicep, Terraform, Git
Du vil gerne indgå i et agilt setup, hvor krav og retning hurtigt kan ændres, men hvor medbestemmelse og frihed er i højsædet
Du er flydende i skrift og tale på dansk og engelsk, og trives med at have den daglige kontakt med kunden
Du har evnen til at omsætte kundebehov til handling




Det vil være en fordel, hvis:

Du er vant til at arbejde som konsulent i et udviklingsteam i tæt samarbejde med arkitekter og software udviklere




Som person er du selvstændig, ansvarsbevidst, initiativrig, eksekverende og serviceminded. Du er drevet af at lære nyt og vild med at holde dig ajour med de nyeste metoder og teknologier. Du er engageret og motiveret i alt hvad du foretager dig. Hvis du også er glad for at sparre med dygtige kollegaer og trives med at løfte i flok, vil du passe perfekt ind hos os.




Hvad tilbyder vi?




Du kommer til at indgå i vores voksende team, hvor høj faglighed, innovation og arbejdsglæde er i højsæde. Det høje faglige niveau blandt dine kollegaer giver en unik mulighed for at arbejde med de bedste, og vi tager din faglige udvikling alvorligt. Vi har en flad organisation med et minimum af administration, hvor ledelsens døre altid er åbne, og der er god plads til både bordfodbold, fredagsbar, frokost på kajen og et aktivt liv udenfor arbejdstid. Flere gange om året afholder vi hackathons, hvor vi i teams dykker ned i præcis de emner, som udviklerne finder interessante. En del af vores kultur er også, at vi gerne ser alle komme med input til hvordan vi kan optimere, udvikle og forbedre cVation.




Hvorfor vælge os som din nye arbejdsplads?




Vores fundament er løsninger bygget på Microsoft Azure Cloud. Alle vores medarbejdere mestrer cloud-native udvikling og DevOps. Vi arbejder i projekter og engagerer os hands-on i fælles teams med vores kunder for at sikre kvalitet og effektiv videndeling.




Vi er passionerede omkring at hjælpe vores kunder med at få det maksimale ud af cloudteknologien. For os er cloud ikke blot infrastruktur eller et nyt datacenter i skyen. Teknologien giver virksomheder mulighed for at skabe væsentligt mere værdi og arbejde med agilitet og innovation på en helt ny måde.




Vi har været med fra starten, da cloud blev udviklet og tilgængeligt. Vi tilbyder således vores årelange erfaring og dybe cloud ekspertise samt en værktøjskasse med alle vores best practices i form af accelerationsplatformen CADD. Den dækker over gennemprøvede værktøjer, rammeværk, effektive udviklingsmetoder og færdige automatiseringskomponenter. Alt dette for at sikre, at projekter kommer hurtigt og sikkert fra start.




Du vil blive en del af en virksomhed, som tror på, at alle har betydning, og at det skal være sjovt at gå på arbejde hver dag. Du vil få kollegaer, der er interesseret i at lære og har ønske om at blive de bedste til det, de gør. Vi tilbyder derfor gode muligheder for at udvikle dig.




Interesseret?




Klik på Easy Apply knappen, hvis du vil arbejde med de nyeste teknologier. Vi behandler din ansøgning fortroligt og arrangerer løbende interviews.




Har du spørgsmål til jobbet, eller vil du høre mere om cVation, er du meget velkommen til at kontakte:




Maiken Pelby, Head of People & Culture, T/ 42612828, map@cvation.com




Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig!

Show more
HTML:
Azure Data Engineer


Som Data Engineer hos cVation bygger du dataplatforme, datawarehouses og MLOps løsninger i skyen for vores kunder. Vi bruger teknologier som Databricks, Fabric, Spark, Azure Machine Learning, Data Factory og Azure Synapse. Vi søger profiler med erfaring inden for enten MLOps, datawarehouses eller dataplatforme, som vil bygge innovative dataløsninger.


cVation er et dansk udviklings- og konsulenthus, som bygger avancerede cloudløsninger på Azure med afsæt i markedets hurtigste og mest agile metoder. cVation blev stiftet i 2014, har modtaget tre Børsen Gazeller og vundet Microsofts Partner Award for App Innovation tre år i træk. Vi arbejder dedikeret med agile arbejdsmetoder, DevOps og Test Driven Development. Vi sætter en ære i at levere software af den højeste kvalitet, og tager desuden principperne fra DevOps og software engineering med i vores dataprojekter, hvilket betyder, at tests, Infrastructure as Code og automatisering er i fokus.


Hvilken rolle får du?


Du kommer til at arbejde på et af vores dataprojekter med et projektteam bestående af arkitekter, software udviklere og DevOps specialister. Du vil have fuldt fokus på ét projekt og være tilknyttet ét team ad gangen.


Din rolle bliver at


  • rådgive om og bygge datawarehouse/dataplatformsløsninger i skyen
  • rådgive om og bygge løsninger indenfor MLOps
  • bidrage til design og implementering af den optimale Azure infrastruktur
  • sikre, at alt opsætning og provisionering sker som infrastructure as code, fx. Terraform
  • fuldautomatiseret overvågning og skalering af løsninger


Hvad forventer vi af dig?


  • Du har en videregående uddannelse i software engineering, human centered AI el lign. fra DTU, ITU eller KU samt erfaring i data engineering
  • Du har enten fullstack MLOps erfaring, kan skrive Python og har lyst til data engineering-delen - eller måske kommer du i stedet med erfaring i at bygge datawarehouse og dataplatforme.
  • Du vil gerne arbejde med de nyeste teknologier i Azure
  • Du har erfaring med - og vil gerne blive klogere på - flere af følgende teknologier: Data Factory - Databricks - Fabric - Spark - Azure Synapse - Azure Machine Learning - MLflow - Data Warehouse - Data platform - Python - Azure DevOps, Powershell, Azure CLI, ARM templates, YAML, Bicep, Terraform, Git
  • Du vil gerne indgå i et agilt setup, hvor krav og retning hurtigt kan ændres, men hvor medbestemmelse og frihed er i højsædet
  • Du er flydende i skrift og tale på dansk og engelsk, og trives med at have den daglige kontakt med kunden
  • Du har evnen til at omsætte kundebehov til handling


Det vil være en fordel, hvis:

  • Du er vant til at arbejde som konsulent i et udviklingsteam i tæt samarbejde med arkitekter og software udviklere


Som person er du selvstændig, ansvarsbevidst, initiativrig, eksekverende og serviceminded. Du er drevet af at lære nyt og vild med at holde dig ajour med de nyeste metoder og teknologier. Du er engageret og motiveret i alt hvad du foretager dig. Hvis du også er glad for at sparre med dygtige kollegaer og trives med at løfte i flok, vil du passe perfekt ind hos os.


Hvad tilbyder vi?


Du kommer til at indgå i vores voksende team, hvor høj faglighed, innovation og arbejdsglæde er i højsæde. Det høje faglige niveau blandt dine kollegaer giver en unik mulighed for at arbejde med de bedste, og vi tager din faglige udvikling alvorligt. Vi har en flad organisation med et minimum af administration, hvor ledelsens døre altid er åbne, og der er god plads til både bordfodbold, fredagsbar, frokost på kajen og et aktivt liv udenfor arbejdstid. Flere gange om året afholder vi hackathons, hvor vi i teams dykker ned i præcis de emner, som udviklerne finder interessante. En del af vores kultur er også, at vi gerne ser alle komme med input til hvordan vi kan optimere, udvikle og forbedre cVation.


Hvorfor vælge os som din nye arbejdsplads?


Vores fundament er løsninger bygget på Microsoft Azure Cloud. Alle vores medarbejdere mestrer cloud-native udvikling og DevOps. Vi arbejder i projekter og engagerer os hands-on i fælles teams med vores kunder for at sikre kvalitet og effektiv videndeling.


Vi er passionerede omkring at hjælpe vores kunder med at få det maksimale ud af cloudteknologien. For os er cloud ikke blot infrastruktur eller et nyt datacenter i skyen. Teknologien giver virksomheder mulighed for at skabe væsentligt mere værdi og arbejde med agilitet og innovation på en helt ny måde.


Vi har været med fra starten, da cloud blev udviklet og tilgængeligt. Den dækker over gennemprøvede værktøjer, rammeværk, effektive udviklingsmetoder og færdige automatiseringskomponenter. Alt dette for at sikre, at projekter kommer hurtigt og sikkert fra start.


Du vil blive en del af en virksomhed, som tror på, at alle har betydning, og at det skal være sjovt at gå på arbejde hver dag. Du vil få kollegaer, der er interesseret i at lære og har ønske om at blive de bedste til det, de gør. Vi tilbyder derfor gode muligheder for at udvikle dig.


Interesseret?


Klik på Easy Apply knappen, hvis du vil arbejde med de nyeste teknologier. Vi behandler din ansøgning fortroligt og arrangerer løbende interviews.

Title: Lead Business Intelligence Specialist, Data & Analytics
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
CIP Fund Solutions - a platform delivery company working exclusively for the global fund management company Copenhagen Infrastructure Partners (CIP), is currently looking for a Lead Business Intelligence (BI) Specialist to join our office in Copenhagen, Denmark.

CIP Fund Solutions provides scalable and integrated business services, complex fund management and investments solutions with the aim of advancing CIP’s investment products and channels – and supporting the continuous value creation across the CIP platform.

The role
As our new Lead BI Specialist in our Data & Analytics team, you’ll join a team of ambitious professionals. The Data & Analytics team is responsible for delivering scalable digital solutions and advisory to the business with the intention of enabling growth across the CIP platforms. The team is comprised of a set of specialists focusing on master data management, data engineering, and business intelligence.

You will be the technical lead on Power BI, in a growing BI team. In this role, you will ensure the team adheres to best practices and delivers high-quality BI solutions.

You will be responsible for the Power BI platform, ensuring that usage of the platform follows best practices as a subject matter expert. You will manage larger BI projects, develop new dashboards, as well as maintain existing dashboards as needed. Additionally, you will work closely with other departments to ensure BI solutions align with business goals and effectively communicate insights to stakeholders.

You will also be expected to stay updated with the latest features of Power BI and Microsoft Fabric, continuously improving the BI solutions to meet the evolving needs of the business.

Responsibilities will further consist of:

Creation of new and maintenance of existing BI solutions such as dashboards and semantic data models
Refinement and estimation of new BI projects and solutions in collaboration with stakeholders
Management of consultants for externally staffed BI projects, ensuring alignment with internal standards and practices
Ensuring that the future BI setup is maintainable and scalable by implementing best practices in data architecture and governance
Staying updated on new features being released for Fabric and Power BI, and evaluating their potential impact on current and future projects
Design and implement self-service guidelines and governance with the aim of enabling citizen developers
Training and supervision of business units who wish to develop BI solutions together with the D&A team, providing guidance and support to ensure adherence to best practices
Maintain high visual standards and ensure uniformity across new BI products, contributing to a cohesive user experience
Design and implement efficient reporting solutions that enhance data accessibility and usability for informed decision-making


You
We are looking for candidates who have completed their master’s degree and have several years of full-time experience in a similar position, using Power BI and preferably Microsoft Fabric.

We expect you to possess a curious and outgoing mindset that allows you to educate yourself about the business and thoroughly understand its needs. This will enable you to develop appropriate and effective solutions tailored to those needs. With a solid understanding of data structures and modeling, you can design and implement efficient reporting solutions that enhance data accessibility and usability for informed decision-making.

We look for the following in a candidate

Self-igniting and customer-centric: You have a proactive attitude and a keen focus on understanding and meeting customer needs.
Close attention to detail and a high level of accuracy: You are meticulous and ensure precision in your work.
Comprehensive analytical and problem-solving skills: You possess strong analytical abilities and can effectively troubleshoot and solve complex problems.
Fluency in English, both verbal and written, as well as excellent communication skills: You can communicate clearly and effectively with various stakeholders.
Willingness to work in an international, efficient, and highly varied environment: You thrive in a dynamic and diverse setting, collaborating with teams across different regions.


The process
Please apply online as soon as possible as applications will be processed on an ongoing basis. For questions related to the role, please reach out to our Talent Acquisition team at talent@cisc.dk. We do not include CV's and Cover Letters sent by email.

As we continue to improve our candidate experience, diversity and avoid unconscious bias, please avoid having a photo in your CV. We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality for all applicants.

Please be aware that we will not accept speculative CV submissions for any of our roles from recruitment agencies, and any unsolicited candidate submissions will be exempt from any payment expectations and ownership.

CISC’s commitment to diversity and inclusion
CISC is committed to securing a diverse and inclusive work environment where everyone feels respected and heard. A diverse workforce allows CISC to achieve results through different approaches and solutions to task execution and problem solving. We want all our employees to have equal opportunities for personal growth and career opportunities regardless of age, gender, sexual orientation, disability, religion, nationality, and ethnicity.



---



Copenhagen Infrastructure Service Company

CISC is a service company working exclusively for Copenhagen Infrastructure Partners (CIP). CISC is owned by the funds managed by CIP with the purpose of delivering best-in-class services to the growing portfolio of renewable assets.

We engage in the energy transition through specialist services, project development and value creation with trusted third-party suppliers. Our core focus is conducting due-diligence, development, construction, and operations of renewable assets, and we deliver a range of services within technical, commercial, and financial management, compliance, tax, legal, transaction and ESG.

We provide global support and a local presence in our key markets, and our teams are continuously delivering and developing services that are tailored to our wide range of projects – from offshore and onshore wind, solar and battery energy storage systems, to advanced bioenergy assets. For more information, please visit cisc.dk.
Show more

Our core focus is conducting due-diligence, development, construction, and operations of renewable assets, and we deliver a range of services within technical, commercial, and financial management, compliance, tax, legal, transaction and ESG.

We provide global support and a local presence in our key markets, and our teams are continuously delivering and developing services that are tailored to our wide range of projects – from offshore and onshore wind, solar and battery energy storage systems, to advanced bioenergy assets. Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Role

At Deliveroo we have an outstanding data science organisation, with a mission to enable the highest quality human and machine decision-making. We work throughout the company - in product, business and platform teams - using analysis, experimentation, causal inference and machine learning techniques. We are uniquely placed to use data to help make better decisions and improve data literacy across Deliveroo.

We are looking for a Data Analyst that is passionate about metrics and telling the stories behind the data. We have several roles open across different teams (grocery, loyalty, restaurants). Data Analysts at Deliveroo report into our data science management team.

You will be a professional in insights storytelling, communication and visualisation and know how to create action from metrics. Crafting effective intelligent benchmarks, understanding performance, caring about data quality, enabling automation and creating phenomenal visualisations and stories are things that drive you.

What You'll Be Doing


Work closely with commercial stakeholders to create value and business impact through better data availability, visualisation and analysis
Discover, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns in complex datasets to perform ad-hoc analyses and deliver insights to the executive team and senior management
Understand key drivers of the business and provide data driven guidance on key levers
Identify and specify data needs and quality requirements and work closely with Analytics Engineers to ensure data is available, accurate and corresponds to the business needs
Consolidate and distribute best analytical practices from different teams and countries


Requirements


Experience identifying the root cause of problems, assessing risks/impacts and determining and implementing effective solutions.
A good understanding of querying in SQL and understanding of database structure - you'll be expected to be able to extract the data you need for your analysis.
Compelling story-telling skills, and an eye for powerful visualisations - you'll need to translate your findings for all levels of stakeholder (business and technical)
Good knowledge of Excel/GSheets - depending on the task, there is a good chance that this is where some of your exploratory analysis will take place. Being comfortable with pivot tables and functions will be essential.
Developer experience with a data visualisation tool (Looker, Tableau, Periscope)


Why Deliveroo

Our mission is to transform the way you shop and eat, bringing the neighbourhood to your door by connecting consumers, restaurants, shops and riders. . We are transforming the way the world eats and shops by making access to food and products more convenient and enjoyable. We give people the opportunity to buy what they want, as they want it, when and where they want it.

We are a technology-driven company at the forefront of the most rapidly expanding industry in the world. We are still a small team, making a very large impact, looking to answer some of the most interesting questions out there. We move fast, value autonomy and ownership, and we are always looking for new ideas.

Workplace & Benefits

At Deliveroo we know that people are the heart of the business and we prioritise their welfare. Benefits differ by country, but we offer many benefits in areas including healthcare, well-being, parental leave, pensions, and generous annual leave allowances, including time off to support a charitable cause of your choice. Benefits are country-specific, please ask your recruiter for more information. This role in a Hybrid position.

Diversity

At Deliveroo, we believe a great workplace is one that represents the world we live in and how beautifully diverse it can be. That means we have no judgement when it comes to any one of the things that make you who you are - your gender, race, sexuality, religion or a secret aversion to coriander. All you need is a passion for (most) food and a desire to be part of one of the fastest-growing businesses in a rapidly growing industry.

We are committed to diversity, equity and inclusion in all aspects of our hiring process. We recognise that some candidates may require adjustments to apply for a position or fairly participate in the interview process. If you require any adjustments, please don't hesitate to let us know. We will make every effort to provide the necessary adjustments to ensure you have an equitable opportunity to succeed.

Please click here to view our candidate privacy policy.
Show more

Title: Insight Analyst UK
Description:
Company Description

We’re ASOS, the online retailer for fashion lovers all around the world.

We exist to give our customers the confidence to be whoever they want to be, and that goes for our people too. At ASOS, you’re free to be your true self without judgement, and channel your creativity into a platform used by millions.

But how are we showing up? We’re proud members of Inclusive Companies, are Disability Confident Committed and have signed the Business in the Community Race at Work Charter and we placed 8th in the Inclusive Top 50 Companies Employer list.

Everyone needs some help showing up as their best self. Let our Talent team know if you need any adjustments throughout the process in whatever way works best for you.

Job Description

We're looking for a strategic, commercially-minded Insight Analyst to drive ASOS’ business in the UK through uncovering high value insights about our customers, their behaviours and preferences, leveraging data to understand key drivers of business performance and profitability, and continually measuring the impact of initiatives to steer investment decisions.

You'll be flexing your analytical skills to uncover actionable insights spanning a range of functions, working and collaborating directly with senior stakeholders. The ideal candidate will be innately curious, have a strong business acumen, a robust technical toolkit and a passion for fashion.

This is a high impact role where your insights will directly influence and contribute to ASOS' success. You're not just in the driver's seat; you're the engine propelling us towards achieving our growth ambition. If you're the kind of analytical powerhouse who enjoys cracking tough problems and crafting ingenious solutions, this is where you belong.

The Details


Combine market, customer, marketing and assortment insights to drive a holistic picture of performance, proactively communicating key trends and opportunities to senior leadership
Complete exploratory data analysis and statistical modelling (e.g., regression analysis, clustering techniques) to propose innovative solutions on topics such as customer and product segmentations to help determine high impact actions and strategies
Dive deep into customer data to gain a profound understanding of our audience, and use these insights to drive improvements in our marketing strategy, experience & offering
Identify trends in performance, investigate drivers, and present findings to diverse stakeholders, articulating the “so what” by translating insights into strategic, actionable recommendations
Develop methodologies to measure the impact of initiatives and tests across our site, marketing, price/promo, product assortment, delivery proposition, and other areas affecting our customer journey and operations
Develop key metrics and dashboards to monitor business health, measure success and support strategic initiatives
Identify business growth opportunities based on customer insights and market trends
Independently plan and prioritise work based on market strategy and priorities



Qualifications

About You


Previous experience working in Data Analytics/Insights
A data enthusiast who enjoys immersing yourself in data to solve business problems and present compelling stories that drive change
Experience in mining and analysing large data sets, with proficiency in using data and statistical analysis tools to query datasets and drive end-to-end complete analysis that helps accelerate the business
Experience using data to create compelling stories that communicate key messages across the organisation and to influence various levels of management decision making
Commercial mindset, with a strong understanding of how data insights can drive business impact and profitability
An obsession with the customer and ability to analyse trends and data through the customer lens
A collaborate approach and ability to operate as an analytical thought partner who can translate business questions into data analysis visions to execute
Strong communication skills, comfortable presenting data to groups of stakeholders in a way that is effective and concise
The ability to break down complex problems into smaller ones
An interest in the 20-something customer and fashion industry
E-commerce work experience (desirable)
Strong background / education in a quantitative or business discipline (desirable)



Additional Information

BeneFITS’


Employee discount (hello ASOS discount!)
ASOS Develops (personal development opportunities across the business)
Employee sample sales
Access to a huge range of LinkedIn learning materials
25 days paid annual leave + an extra celebration day for a special moment
Discretionary bonus scheme
Private medical care scheme
Flexible benefits allowance - which you can choose to take as extra cash, or use towards other benefits
Show more

We exist to give our customers the confidence to be whoever they want to be, and that goes for our people too. At ASOS, you’re free to be your true self without judgement, and channel your creativity into a platform used by millions.

But how are we showing up? We’re proud members of Inclusive Companies, are Disability Confident Committed and have signed the Business in the Community Race at Work Charter and we placed 8th in the Inclusive Top 50 Companies Employer list.

Everyone needs some help showing up as their best self. Let our Talent team know if you need any adjustments throughout the process in whatever way works best for you.

Job Description

We're looking for a strategic, commercially-minded Insight Analyst to drive ASOS’ business in the UK through uncovering high value insights about our customers, their behaviours and preferences, leveraging data to understand key drivers of business performance and profitability, and continually measuring the impact of initiatives to steer investment decisions.

You'll be flexing your analytical skills to uncover actionable insights spanning a range of functions, working and collaborating directly with senior stakeholders. The ideal candidate will be innately curious, have a strong business acumen, a robust technical toolkit and a passion for fashion.

This is a high impact role where your insights will directly influence and contribute to ASOS' success. You're not just in the driver's seat; you're the engine propelling us towards achieving our growth ambition. If you're the kind of analytical powerhouse who enjoys cracking tough problems and crafting ingenious solutions, this is where you belong.

The Details

  • Combine market, customer, marketing and assortment insights to drive a holistic picture of performance, proactively communicating key trends and opportunities to senior leadership
  • Complete exploratory data analysis and statistical modelling (e.g., regression analysis, clustering techniques) to propose innovative solutions on topics such as customer and product segmentations to help determine high impact actions and strategies
  • Dive deep into customer data to gain a profound understanding of our audience, and use these insights to drive improvements in our marketing strategy, experience & offering
  • Identify trends in performance, investigate drivers, and present findings to diverse stakeholders, articulating the “so what” by translating insights into strategic, actionable recommendations
  • Develop methodologies to measure the impact of initiatives and tests across our site, marketing, price/promo, product assortment, delivery proposition, and other areas affecting our customer journey and operations
  • Develop key metrics and dashboards to monitor business health, measure success and support strategic initiatives
  • Identify business growth opportunities based on customer insights and market trends
  • Independently plan and prioritise work based on market strategy and priorities


Qualifications

About You

  • Previous experience working in Data Analytics/Insights
  • A data enthusiast who enjoys immersing yourself in data to solve business problems and present compelling stories that drive change
  • Experience in mining and analysing large data sets, with proficiency in using data and statistical analysis tools to query datasets and drive end-to-end complete analysis that helps accelerate the business
  • Experience using data to create compelling stories that communicate key messages across the organisation and to influence various levels of management decision making
  • Commercial mindset, with a strong understanding of how data insights can drive business impact and profitability
  • An obsession with the customer and ability to analyse trends and data through the customer lens
  • A collaborate approach and ability to operate as an analytical thought partner who can translate business questions into data analysis visions to execute
  • Strong communication skills, comfortable presenting data to groups of stakeholders in a way that is effective and concise
  • The ability to break down complex problems into smaller ones
  • An interest in the 20-something customer and fashion industry
  • E-commerce work experience (desirable)
  • Strong background / education in a quantitative or business discipline (desirable)


Additional Information

BeneFITS’

  • Employee discount (hello ASOS discount!)
  • ASOS Develops (personal development opportunities across the business)
  • Employee sample sales
  • Access to a huge range of LinkedIn learning materials
  • 25 days paid annual leave + an extra celebration day for a special moment
  • Discretionary bonus scheme
  • Private medical care scheme
  • Flexible benefits allowance - which you can choose to take as extra cash, or use towards other benefits

Title: Insights Analyst
Description:
We are looking for an Insights Analyst to join our Digital team at Harrods. This role will sit within the Loyalty & CRM Insights team, led by the Senior Loyalty & CRM Insights Manager.

About The Role

As the Insights Analyst you will use your creativity and initiative to help internal clients to bring customer insight and relevance to their communications and promotions, and to truly understand what we can learn about the customer using analysis and evaluation. This role will sit within the Loyalty & CRM Insights team, led by the Senior Loyalty & CRM Insights Manager

You will:


Work with stakeholders across CRM and Loyalty to support in designing reporting, campaign planning, and making suggestions on how we can improve on current campaigns.
Responsible for bringing project work together and developing new ways of looking into our campaigns
Responsible for determining short term performance, tracking KPIs, longer term projects, and working with a variety of stakeholders
Measuring impact versus control groups, A/B tests, and determining and explaining uplift where possible


About You

The successful candidate will have good knowledge of Excel, PowerPoint and SQL, and preferably experience of using Google Analytics too, ideally you will have a background in Statistics, Mathematics, Science or Marketing. We are also looking for someone who has the ability to translate insights from a complex analysis into easy to read insights for a technical and a non-technical audience

You will also;


Previous Stakeholder management skills
Experience using customer or consumer data
Some understanding of targeted and personalised Loyalty and/or CRM activity/ Marketing
Keen attention to detail
Passion for utilising data


About Us

As the world’s leading luxury retail emporium, we craft magic, memorable experiences for our customers and support our talented teams to become the best ambassadors for our global brand. We set the highest standards and reward the remarkable people who help us maintain them

Our Promise to You

Help us make the impossible possible for our customers and we’ll do something remarkable for you. As well as offering a friendly environment to inspire your best work, we provide abundant opportunities and support to build an exceptional career across the varied specialisms of our business. 

Uniquely You

At Harrods we believe the personality and authenticity of our people sets us apart. We celebrate and invite applications from all cultures, backgrounds, tastes, and experiences and are proud of our culture where people from all walks of life can grow and thrive. What makes you unique makes us exceptional.

While our job adverts outline the ideal qualities, skills, and prior experience for the role, we believe in the potential for growth and value individual strengths. If you do not meet every desired criteria but feel you have the skills and experience to thrive in this role coupled with an alignment with our values, we would encourage you to apply.

If you want to know more about our people and our culture, search #TogetherHarrods on LinkedIn, Facebook or follow us on Instagram @togetherharrods

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
🚀 We're hiring: Data Analytics Engineer

📍 London (Hybrid – 3 days in office) | 💰 + Bonus + 12% Flex Benefits




I'm working with a global fintech scale-up on a mission to reimagine how people trade and invest. With hundreds of thousands of users worldwide and a strong presence across 18 countries, we’re looking for someone who can help harness the power of data to fuel smarter marketing decisions.




This is a high-impact role for someone who loves owning the full analytics engineering process from tracking and modelling through to dashboarding and strategic insight.

🧠 What you'll be doing:

Designing and maintaining data pipelines for marketing data sources
Building and optimising models for marketing analytics and attribution
Creating tracking frameworks and event schemas for performance marketing
Developing self-serve dashboards and reporting systems
Supporting campaign analysis, marketing performance reviews and ad hoc insights
Ensuring data quality, accessibility and governance with the help of our data engineering team

🛠️ What we’re looking for:

Experience in analytics engineering, BI, or a related role
Strong SQL and data modelling skills
Hands-on with modern BI tools like Looker or Tableau
Understanding of ETL processes and marketing data flows
Familiarity with attribution models and marketing metrics
Experience working with version control and modern data stack tech

🎁 What’s in it for you?

Competitive salary + performance-based bonus
12% flexible benefits package
Generous pension and private medical insurance
Career development support incl. access to LinkedIn Learning
Two volunteering days + your birthday off
Matched giving for fundraising
Regular socials, special interest groups and employee networks




👉 Apply now and help us scale smarter!

Show more

Description:
About

Our client is a dynamic and ambitious insurance company based in the heart of Manchester, and they're on the lookout for a talented Data Analyst to help them drive data-led decisions as they scale. If you're passionate about transforming raw data into actionable insights and thrive in a collaborative, small-team environment - they'd love to meet you.

5 days on site | £40,000 per year

What You'll Do

Collect, clean, and analyse internal data to uncover trends and business insights Develop dashboards and reports for various teams to support strategic decisions Work closely with Operations, Underwriting, and Finance, supporting key initiatives Identify opportunities for business improvements through data analysis Present findings clearly and effectively to stakeholders at all levels

3+ years of experience in a data analyst or similar role Strong skills in Excel, SQL, Python and data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI) Working independently, using own initiative to deliver valuable outcomes Excellent attention to detail and a curious, problem-solving mindset Experience in insurance or financial services is a plus, but not essential Willingness to compliment a small, dedicate team by performing roles outside the scope of a Data Analyst If you're interested, please apply below!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst (Hybrid - London)

📍 Location: London (Hybrid – 2-3 days onsite per week)

💰 Day Rate: £350–£450 per day (outside IR35)

📧 Apply: eamaglo@pg-rec.com




Are you a detail-driven Data Analyst with a passion for uncovering insights and driving decision-making through data?




We’re currently seeking an experienced Data Analyst to join a dynamic team in London. This role is ideal for someone who thrives in a hybrid working environment and enjoys collaborating across departments to deliver data-driven solutions.




🔍 Key Responsibilities:

Gather, process, and analyze large data sets to identify trends and insights.
Create clear, compelling dashboards and reports using tools like Power BI, Tableau, or Looker.
Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand data needs and translate them into actionable analysis.
Support data quality initiatives and ensure integrity across systems.
Use SQL, Excel, and scripting tools (Python/R) for deep data analysis.




✅ Requirements:

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Proficiency in SQL and at least one data visualization tool.
Experience with data modeling and working with large-scale data sets.
Comfortable working in a hybrid setup (London-based).
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.




🎯 Contract Details:

Start Date: ASAP
Duration: 6 months (with extension likely)
Day Rate: £350–£450 (Outside IR35)
Location: Central London (Hybrid working)

If you’re ready to bring data to life and help shape business decisions with your analytical expertise, we want to hear from you!




📧 To apply, send your CV to eamaglo@pg-rec.com

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst (Real Estate)




Team: Operations

Role: Permanent, Full-time

Location: London (North)

Salary: Competitive + Performance Bonus + Benefits

WFH: Hybrid working model




About the Role:




Fantastic opportunity for a Data Analyst to join the Operations function of a leading UK-based Asset Manager. In the role, you will work closely with the Operations Manager on day-to-day activities, including enhancing system capabilities and assisting with several new group projects.




Key Responsibilities:




Apply programming skills to develop and maintain automation scripts using PowerShell or similar languages. Provide documentation and training on these scripts to ensure efficient and secure operations.
Document all processes and maintain detailed records of system configurations and changes.
Coordinate systems development, including planning, designing, executing, documenting and monitoring every aspect of a project.
Assist the department manager in ensuring key projects are delivered within a planned time frame.
Providing accurate reports to various internal departments and external professional advisers as required.
Reconciling, identifying and correcting data discrepancies on our in-house database.
Identify areas of inefficiency and collaborate with team members to design and implement new processes. Ensure these improvements align with company standards and monitor their effectiveness.
Analyse current workflows to identify opportunities for automation, using appropriate software tools to reduce manual tasks.
Test and optimise automated processes to maintain accuracy and reliability.
Stay updated on technological advancements, assess their potential impact, and support integrating new solutions. Coordinate with IT and other departments to ensure seamless implementation and enhanced system capabilities.
Manage and develop website content and appearance.
Responsible for the support and maintenance of the database, including data integrity, security and optimisation.




Person Specification:




Degree or similar qualification.
Strong working knowledge of Python, SQL or another programming language intermediate or above level.
At least 2 years of work experience in a similar role.
Demonstrable experience with database management and process automation.
Able to show accuracy and speed when entering data into a database, and copying from written and oral sources.
Familiarity with the latest technology trends and products.
Able to communicate effectively, help provide accurate information.







Our ambition is simple – to do our best for our people, clients and communities.

We are determined to make a positive difference at work and beyond - this starts with hiring the best talent without consideration of race, religion, colour, national origin, age, gender, sexual orientation, marital status or disability.

Title: Data Analyst, Category Development
Description:
At Gopuff, we’re not just delivering convenience—we’re redefining how the world shops. Since pioneering instant needs in 2013, we’ve empowered millions of customers across the U.S. and U.K. to reclaim their time through seamless, fast, and reliable delivery. Behind this transformative journey is our tech-first mindset, relentless obsession with customer experience and operational excellence.

We’re looking for an exceptional Lead Data Analyst to shape the future of quick commerce.

This is not just a job—it’s a mission. As a Lead Data Analyst in the Category Development team, you will support the rapid growth of our business by analysing our huge datasets to uncover insights that drive improvements across our category & supply chain performance.

You’ll partner with cross-functional teams, challenge the status quo, and make high-impact recommendations. With your mastery of SQL, Python and advanced analytics, you won’t just support decisions—you’ll lead them.

We believe great work happens through collaboration, not competition. You foster a culture of curiosity, respect, and shared success, ensuring data is a tool for empowerment, not gatekeeping. No room for arrogance—just a commitment to helping others and making an impact together.

If you’re a high-performer who thrives in fast-paced, high-impact environments, this is your chance to build, innovate, and leave a lasting mark on one of the most disruptive industries in the world.

Are you ready to shape the future of commerce? Let’s go. 🚀

You Will:


Develop innovative measurement and analytical approaches that build our understanding of performance and customers, embedding these learnings into the Category & In-Stock team's day-to-day decision making.
Answer complex business questions through detailed quantitative analysis and experimentation, extracting meaningful and actionable insights.
Influence both strategic and tactical decision-making in our EU Leadership and Category Management teams through strong communication, and by proactively identifying opportunities for improvement.
Build the necessary models and tools to inform our pricing strategies, helping Category Managers maintain a competitive position versus our competitors while maximising margin opportunity.
Provide clear insight into the value and success of different buying policies we have built into our Stock Ordering Tool to ensure we are hitting the target levels of Waste and Availability.
Partner with our Customer Insights team, supporting them with their customer and competitor research projects and helping to embed learnings into the Category teams.
Partner with our MFC Operations team to ensure that inventory compliance reporting & capacity tooling are providing In-Stock team with correct insights they can use to adjust their buying decisions.
Proactively build and nurture a culture of data-driven decision making through coaching & supporting teams to increase their data literacy and confidence.


You Have:


3-5 years of experience in analytics or data science - preferably in fields related to grocery, trading, supply chain.
A strong understanding of statistical analysis and experiment design.
Expert skills in SQL / Python, able to write structured and efficient queries on large data sets.
Experience with dbt is a strong plus
Development experience with BI platforms such as Looker, Tableau, Power BI.
Experience with Looker and LookML in particular is strongly preferred.
A strong and confident communication style, with good knowledge of data visualization and storytelling.
A high degree of curiosity, comfortable gathering and analyzing large amounts of data across a variety of business dimensions.


Benefits:


Company RSU’s (Company Shares)
Private Medical + Dental cover
Annual performance appraisal and bonus
Employee Discount + FAM membership
Career growth opportunities


Company Summary & EEOC Statement:

At Gopuff, we know that life can be unpredictable. Sometimes you forget the milk at the store, run out of pet food for Fido, or just really need ice cream at 11 pm. We get it—stuff happens. But that’s where we come in, delivering all your wants and needs in just minutes.

And now, we’re assembling a team of motivated people to help us drive forward that vision to bring a new age of convenience and predictability to an unpredictable world.

Like what you’re hearing? Then join us on Team Blue.

Gopuff is an equal employment opportunity employer, committed to an inclusive workplace where we do not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, gender, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital or familial status, age, ancestry, disability, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. We believe in diversity and encourage any qualified individual to apply.
Show more

Behind this transformative journey is our tech-first mindset, relentless obsession with customer experience and operational excellence.

We’re looking for an exceptional Lead Data Analyst to shape the future of quick commerce.

This is not just a job—it’s a mission. As a Lead Data Analyst in the Category Development team, you will support the rapid growth of our business by analysing our huge datasets to uncover insights that drive improvements across our category & supply chain performance.

You’ll partner with cross-functional teams, challenge the status quo, and make high-impact recommendations. With your mastery of SQL, Python and advanced analytics, you won’t just support decisions—you’ll lead them.

We believe great work happens through collaboration, not competition. You foster a culture of curiosity, respect, and shared success, ensuring data is a tool for empowerment, not gatekeeping. No room for arrogance—just a commitment to helping others and making an impact together.

If you’re a high-performer who thrives in fast-paced, high-impact environments, this is your chance to build, innovate, and leave a lasting mark on one of the most disruptive industries in the world.

Are you ready to shape the future of commerce? Let’s go. 🚀

You Will:

  • Develop innovative measurement and analytical approaches that build our understanding of performance and customers, embedding these learnings into the Category & In-Stock team's day-to-day decision making.
  • Answer complex business questions through detailed quantitative analysis and experimentation, extracting meaningful and actionable insights.
  • Influence both strategic and tactical decision-making in our EU Leadership and Category Management teams through strong communication, and by proactively identifying opportunities for improvement.
  • Build the necessary models and tools to inform our pricing strategies, helping Category Managers maintain a competitive position versus our competitors while maximising margin opportunity.
  • Provide clear insight into the value and success of different buying policies we have built into our Stock Ordering Tool to ensure we are hitting the target levels of Waste and Availability.
  • Partner with our Customer Insights team, supporting them with their customer and competitor research projects and helping to embed learnings into the Category teams.
  • Partner with our MFC Operations team to ensure that inventory compliance reporting & capacity tooling are providing In-Stock team with correct insights they can use to adjust their buying decisions.
  • Proactively build and nurture a culture of data-driven decision making through coaching & supporting teams to increase their data literacy and confidence.

You Have:

  • 3-5 years of experience in analytics or data science - preferably in fields related to grocery, trading, supply chain.
  • A strong understanding of statistical analysis and experiment design.
  • Expert skills in SQL / Python, able to write structured and efficient queries on large data sets.
  • Experience with dbt is a strong plus
  • Development experience with BI platforms such as Looker, Tableau, Power BI.
  • Experience with Looker and LookML in particular is strongly preferred.
  • A strong and confident communication style, with good knowledge of data visualization and storytelling.
  • A high degree of curiosity, comfortable gathering and analyzing large amounts of data across a variety of business dimensions.

Benefits:

  • Company RSU’s (Company Shares)
  • Private Medical + Dental cover
  • Annual performance appraisal and bonus
  • Employee Discount + FAM membership
  • Career growth opportunities

Company Summary & EEOC Statement:

At Gopuff, we know that life can be unpredictable. Sometimes you forget the milk at the store, run out of pet food for Fido, or just really need ice cream at 11 pm. We get it—stuff happens. But that’s where we come in, delivering all your wants and needs in just minutes.

And now, we’re assembling a team of motivated people to help us drive forward that vision to bring a new age of convenience and predictability to an unpredictable world.

Like what you’re hearing? Then join us on Team Blue.

Gopuff is an equal employment opportunity employer, committed to an inclusive workplace where we do not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, gender, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital or familial status, age, ancestry, disability, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. We believe in diversity and encourage any qualified individual to apply.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

50-60k

Hybrid Work




We are partnered with a high-growth SaaS organisation in the Energy sector who are growing their in-house data analyst team.




They are seeking a business-oriented Data Analyst to join the Transformation Management Office. This role is focused on using data to drive informed business decisions and support key transformation initiatives, including a major integration programme.




This is a great opportunity for someone who enjoys using data to solve real business problems and wants to play a meaningful role in organisational change.




Key Responsibilities:

Analyse and interpret data to support strategic decision-making and process improvement
Deliver insights related to a large-scale business integration project
Work closely with stakeholders across various business units
Develop and present clear, actionable reports using Power BI or Python
Contribute to the success of the Shared Services transformation workstream




Requirements:

Proficiency in Python or Power BI
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to communicate complex information in a business-friendly way
Experience working in transformation or change programmes is an advantage













Regretfully, due to a high volume of applicants, we are only able to reply to those who are successful.




Equal Opportunities:




We are committed to promoting equality of opportunity for all employees and job applicants. In line with the Equality Act 2010, we strive to create and maintain a working environment in which everyone is able to make the best use of their skills, free from discrimination or harassment, and in which all decisions are based on merit. No person is subjected to any less favourable treatment on any discriminatory grounds on the basis of age, disability, gender reassignment, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy and maternity, race, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst

Location: Edinburgh (3 days on-site)

Salary: £30,000 – 40,000 D.O.E




Join a leading financial services company based in the heart of Edinburgh. We are committed to delivering innovative solutions and exceptional service to our clients. Our team is passionate about leveraging data to drive strategic decisions and enhance our offerings.

Job Description: We are seeking a talented and motivated Data Analyst to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong analytical background, excellent problem-solving skills, and the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights. As a Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in supporting our business objectives through data-driven analysis and reporting.




Key Responsibilities:

Collect, analyse, and interpret large datasets to identify trends and patterns.
Develop and maintain data models, dashboards, and reports.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data needs and provide insights.
Perform data validation and ensure data integrity.
Support the development of data-driven strategies to improve business performance.
Present findings and recommendations to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.




Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role.
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as SQL, Python, R, and Excel.
Experience with data visualisation tools like Tableau or Power BI.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.




Benefits:

Competitive salary and performance-based bonuses.
Comprehensive health and wellness benefits.
Opportunities for professional development and career growth.
Collaborative and inclusive work environment.
Flexible working hours and remote work options.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are currently working with a leading private equity-backed music rights investor that is seeking a Data Analyst to join their growing team. This role will be critical in helping our client become more data-informed across all departments. You will be responsible for translating business needs into data-driven solutions. The team builds, owns, and maintains proprietary data systems that support the full data lifecycle.




Responsibilities:




Collaborate with all teams to understand and support their data needs
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports
Write efficient and complex SQL queries
Build out and enhance analytical functionality
Work with non-technical stakeholders and data infrastructure teams to recommend enhancements and new features
Identify new opportunities and continuously improve data processes




To be successful in this role, you will have:




A minimum of 2 years of relevant experience.
Proficiency in SQL and database design concepts
Proven experience with business intelligence tools, preferably Tableau or similar
Ability to translate complex data concepts into actionable insights
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills
A proactive mindset and a passion for solving problems using data
Experience in the music or entertainment industry (preferred)
Knowledge of scripting languages such as Python (beneficial)




This is an exciting opportunity to join a leader in their field, with significant growth projected over the coming years. Please reach out if you are interested in a confidential discussion.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
CRM Data Analyst

Edinburgh (2 days a week on site)

Day rate - £400 - £450

Must have previous Higher Education experience




Looking to speak with CRM Data Analysts to support the effective use of the Salesforce platform and enhance data driven decision making across the university.

You must have proven experience managing CRM systems (especially Salesforce), developing dashboards and reports, and delivering user support and training.

You will extract and analyse data to provide actionable insights and contribute to CRM configuration and workflow automation.

Proficiency in Excel, Power BI, or Tableau, along with a strong understanding of data protection and governance, is essential.

Description:

Salary: £40,000–£43,500

Location: Near Epsom, Surrey (own transport helpful)

Working model: Hybrid (3 days in office)

Contract: Permanent, ASAP start

Employer: TLP (seconded to Toyota GB)

Benefits: Generous benefits package (Performance related bonus, Pension, access to their car scheme, Birthday voucher, Cycle Scheme, discounted onsite gym membership, subsidised Café and Canteen, 25 days holiday + all bank holidays)

Turn data into insights to boost sales and vehicle value
Work across teams to inform decisions through data

Build Power BI dashboards
Analyse trends and performance

Collaborate on digital analytics models

Help resolve data-related issues

Power BI and Google Analytics expertise

Organised and proactive approach




Desirable:

Automotive or sales background
Microsoft/Azure certifications

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data & AI / Innovation Analyst

London based (hybrid)

Circa £60,000-£80,000 plus bonus & benefits

Insurance experience essential

SQL, PYTHON, AGILE, WATERFALL, POWERBI, AI

I am looking for an experienced Data / Ai analyst to join my client, a leading insurer based in the City. As a Data and Innovation Analyst, you will work closely with cross-functional teams to assist with data extraction, enhanced submission centre, and data science experiments, as well as experiment with autonomous agents and assist with Power BI reports.

Role responsibilities-

Data extraction and analysis
Stakeholder communication and engagement
Power BI reporting
Project management support
Enhanced submission centre & Slip centre

Experience required-

Experience in developing PowerBI reports and dashboards (2+ years)
Experience writing complex SQL queries (2+ years)
Experience with Python (2+ years)
Experience in the insurance industry
Experience with R, LLM’s and autonomous agents preferred
Experience in both Agile and Waterfall methodologies

If you think you look a good match for this position, please send your CV for immediate consideration
