Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst – Andover/Hybrid – c£40,000




Are you a pragmatic, delivery focused Data Analyst, with expertise in Power BI? Do you take pride in delivery high quality, data rich reports? We are partnered with an industry leading organisation, who are growing their Data function.




In this role you will focus on supporting the operational side of the business. You will identify inefficiencies, improve business processes and enable better decision making through insightful data reporting. You will work closely with both the Ops and Finance teams, to automate key processes, improve data accuracy and support the financial planning and performance management.




You will be skilled in Power BI, or another visualisation tool like Tableau or Looker Studio. You will also have a good knowledge and understanding in querying SQL databases. You will be working with people who prioritise accuracy and efficiency, so having a delivery first mindset would be great for this role.




KEY RESONSIBILITIES

Create and maintain performance dashboards and operational reports using Power BI.
Analyse operational data to identify process inefficiencies, service delays, and areas for improvement.
Collaborate with Finance to automate regular reporting processes, including cost analysis and budgeting tools.
Develop data models and KPIs that reflect operational efficiency, service quality, and cost control.
Query relational databases to extract and transform operational and financial data for analysis.
Support data-led decision-making across Operations and Finance teams through detailed, actionable insights.




This is a fantastic opportunity to join a growing company who actively encourage training and development of their staff.




This is a hybrid role with a requirement to be onsite 2 to 3 days a week.




PLEASE APPLY FOR IMMEDIATE CONSIDERATION

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Reward & People Data Analyst

Location: Central London (close to Tottenham Court Road)

Salary: Up to £60,000 + Generous Bonus

Industry: Global Investment & Advisory Group




Are you a data-driven professional with a passion for reward, analytics, and compensation strategy? A leading global investment and advisory group is looking for a Reward & People Data Analyst to join their dynamic HR team in the heart of London.




About the Role

In this pivotal role, you’ll be instrumental in shaping and enhancing the firm’s reward structures and supporting the annual compensation cycle. You will work closely with senior HR stakeholders, providing data-led insights and technical support to inform decision-making and ensure the business continues to attract, retain, and reward top talent.




Key Responsibilities

Support the design and delivery of annual compensation reviews, including collation and analysis of internal and external compensation data
Provide analytical support for reward-related projects, policies, and processes
Partner with payroll and HR operations teams to ensure accurate and timely employee compensation in line with local practices
Maintain and develop dashboards and reports to support reward and workforce analytics using Excel and Power BI
Interpret complex data sets to provide clear, actionable insights for HR and business leaders
Ensure data accuracy and integrity across all people-related systems and reporting processes




What We’re Looking For

Strong background in HR data analytics or reward/compensation roles
Exceptional Excel skills; experience using Power BI is highly desirable
Comfortable working with large, complex data sets
Detail-oriented with strong problem-solving capabilities
A collaborative mindset and the ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Experience working within financial or professional services environments is a plus




What’s on Offer

Salary up to £60,000 (DOE)
Generous performance-related bonus
Opportunity to work within a respected, global organisation
Collaborative and high-performing team culture
Hybrid working environment




Interested?

If you're looking to take the next step in your reward analytics career and join a business where your insights will shape strategic outcomes, we’d love to hear from you.

Description:
My leading Telco client are looking for a talented and motivated Sales Performance and Business Insights Analyst to support their growing Business Operations function. The team are high performing and work with a smile on their face. A brilliant opportunity.

Previously worked as a Data Analyst, Performance Analyst, Insight Analyst or similar.
Strong SQL and Excel experience
Experience with Power BI
Good Analytical mindset
Excellent communication skills

Title: Graduate Data Analyst
Description:
Our Emerging Talent Programme at Enstar is designed to build a great foundation in data analytics and machine learning within the insurance industry. It combines technical training, real-world business exposure, and structured development to support a successful transition from education to career. Over two years, participants will take part in tailored learning opportunities, rotational placements, and mentoring to develop critical thinking, data proficiency, and cross-functional awareness.




About the Role




This position sits within the Data Office. The team supports data-driven decision making across the organisation and contributes to developing ethical, responsible artificial intelligence capabilities




Responsibilities




Conducting statistical analysis and applying machine learning techniques to insurance and financial data
Supporting data preparation and transformation for analytical purposes
Developing, testing, and refining predictive models
Presenting insights to stakeholders and translating analytical outputs into business context
Collaborating with engineers and analysts across departments
Contributing to projects related to responsible AI, governance, and compliance







Qualifications




Candidates should have or be expecting to achieve a degree in a subject area such as Data Science, Machine Learning, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or another quantitative field.




Required Skills




Familiarity with supervised and unsupervised learning (e.g. regression, classification, clustering)
Basic experience in Python, R, or SQL, and familiarity with libraries such as Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, or PyTorch
Experience with data visualisation tools such as Power BI or Tableau
Awareness of data privacy, responsible AI, and ethical technology practices
Ability to convey technical ideas clearly and work collaboratively







Preferred Skills




Our graduates follow a structured development framework that includes:

Formal training aligned to a professional qualification
Technical and behavioural skills workshops
Real business assignments and rotations
Regular feedback and access to mentoring from experienced professionals




Pay range and compensation package




We offer a comprehensive package to support wellbeing, financial planning, and professional development. Benefits include:




10% employer pension contribution
£700 annual wellness reimbursement
Private medical and dental insurance
Health screening and wellbeing support
Cycle to Work scheme and electric vehicle lease
‍Employee Assistance Programme
Volunteering days and inclusive events




🌍 Equal Opportunity Statement




Enstar is committed to creating an inclusive, respectful, and accessible workplace. We support candidates from all backgrounds and provide support and adjustments throughout the recruitment process. Applicants who require accommodations are encouraged to let us know at any stage. Enstar is an equal opportunity employer. We believe diversity of thought and experience strengthens decision-making and performance.




Recruitment Process




📝 Online application
🎥 Online assessment and recorded interview
💻 Virtual assessment centre

Title: CRM & Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
The Straumann Group is a globally leading provider in the field of aesthetic dentistry. We combine experience, scientific evidence, and innovation with passion and are committed to uncompromising quality to offer dental professionals and patients worldwide the best possible solutions. As a pioneer and market leader in dental implantology, we have consistently expanded our product portfolio in recent years. Today, we are active in all areas of aesthetic dentistry, ranging from tooth preservation, regeneration, restoration, orthodontics with transparent aligner trays to tooth loss.

As part of our Commercial Excellence team in the Northern European Hub (NEH), we are looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst who is passionate about turning data into insight, data architecture, and process optimisation.

This role offers a unique combination of responsibilities across CRM, data quality, AI-driven innovation, and market intelligence. You’ll also be hands-on with Salesforce, supporting both users and platform development. If you're data-minded, driven, and eager to learn, this is a great opportunity to develop within a forward-thinking team supporting multiple geographies and business units.

Key Responsibilities

CRM Management & Commercial Analytics


Support the day-to-day operation, development and optimisation of our CRM systems including Salesforce and Pitcher platforms.
Actively participate with our Global/Regional teams in testing new features and assisting with platform improvements.
Provide hands-on support to end users and contribute to capability-building initiatives and user training.
Analyse and share data to drive understanding of platform adoption and utilization (internal and external), customer experience and engagement, and campaign effectiveness.
Identify behavioural trends and patterns to support go-to-market strategy.


Data Quality & Integrity


Ensure CRM data landscape across SAP CRM and Salesforce is accurate, consistent, and complete.
Run data quality checks, provide visibility and monitoring tools, and support data cleansing initiatives.
Collaborate with business users to drive data ownership and governance best practices.


Business Intelligence & Reporting


Design and deliver reporting and dashboards using Power BI and Salesforce Analytics (CRMA).
Analyse commercial and operational data to generate actionable insights.


AI & Digital Tools


Leverage AI-based solutions (e.g. predictive analytics, automated insights, anomaly detection) to improve performance tracking, decision-making and process optimisation.
Explore opportunities to automate routine reports and processes.
Stay informed on emerging tools and help integrate them into our BI/CRM ecosystem.


Market Intelligence & Strategy Support


Collect and analyse data on market trends, competitors, and customer needs.
Support development of internal market insight packs and dashboards.
Assist in strategic reviews, commercial planning cycles and GTM using internal and external data.


Who You Are


Driven, analytical, data-curious, and enthusiastic about learning and problem-solving.
A strong communicator who can explain data insights to various audiences.
Passionate about data, business intelligence, and digital transformation.
Bachelor’s degree in business, data & tech, or a related field.
Ability to work in a dynamic, fast-paced environment and adapt to changing priorities.


Preferred


Experience with CRM systems in business, preferably: Salesforce, SAP CRM, Power BI, Alteryx or similar tools.
Previous experience in a data/analyst/sales operation’s role.
Exposure to and experience with AI tools, data modelling, and automation technologies.


What You’ll Gain


A dynamic learning and development journey with plenty of growth opportunities.
Involvement in shaping the future of Straumann’s commercial data, strategy and digital platform optimisation.
Hands-on experience, training and development with leading platforms like Salesforce, Pitcher, PowerBI and Alteryx.
Involvement in globally led initiatives, and exposure to stakeholders across our northern hub countries and business units.


All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or disability.

The Straumann Group is a globally leading provider in the field of aesthetic dentistry. We combine experience, scientific evidence, and innovation with passion and are committed to uncompromising quality to offer dental professionals and patients worldwide the best possible solutions. As a pioneer and market leader in dental implantology, we have consistently expanded our product portfolio in recent years. Today, we are active in all areas of aesthetic dentistry, ranging from tooth preservation, regeneration, restoration, orthodontics with transparent aligner trays to tooth loss.

As part of our Commercial Excellence team in the Northern European Hub (NEH), we are looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst who is passionate about turning data into insight, data architecture, and process optimisation.

This role offers a unique combination of responsibilities across CRM, data quality, AI-driven innovation, and market intelligence. You’ll also be hands-on with Salesforce, supporting both users and platform development. If you're data-minded, driven, and eager to learn, this is a great opportunity to develop within a forward-thinking team supporting multiple geographies and business units.

Key Responsibilities

CRM Management & Commercial Analytics

  • Support the day-to-day operation, development and optimisation of our CRM systems including Salesforce and Pitcher platforms.
  • Actively participate with our Global/Regional teams in testing new features and assisting with platform improvements.
  • Provide hands-on support to end users and contribute to capability-building initiatives and user training.
  • Analyse and share data to drive understanding of platform adoption and utilization (internal and external), customer experience and engagement, and campaign effectiveness.
  • Identify behavioural trends and patterns to support go-to-market strategy.

Data Quality & Integrity

  • Ensure CRM data landscape across SAP CRM and Salesforce is accurate, consistent, and complete.
  • Run data quality checks, provide visibility and monitoring tools, and support data cleansing initiatives.
  • Collaborate with business users to drive data ownership and governance best practices.

Business Intelligence & Reporting

  • Design and deliver reporting and dashboards using Power BI and Salesforce Analytics (CRMA).
  • Analyse commercial and operational data to generate actionable insights.

AI & Digital Tools

  • Leverage AI-based solutions (e.g. predictive analytics, automated insights, anomaly detection) to improve performance tracking, decision-making and process optimisation.
  • Explore opportunities to automate routine reports and processes.
  • Stay informed on emerging tools and help integrate them into our BI/CRM ecosystem.

Market Intelligence & Strategy Support

  • Collect and analyse data on market trends, competitors, and customer needs.
  • Support development of internal market insight packs and dashboards.
  • Assist in strategic reviews, commercial planning cycles and GTM using internal and external data.

Who You Are

  • Driven, analytical, data-curious, and enthusiastic about learning and problem-solving.
  • A strong communicator who can explain data insights to various audiences.
  • Passionate about data, business intelligence, and digital transformation.
  • Bachelor’s degree in business, data & tech, or a related field.
  • Ability to work in a dynamic, fast-paced environment and adapt to changing priorities.

Preferred

  • Experience with CRM systems in business, preferably: Salesforce, SAP CRM, Power BI, Alteryx or similar tools.
  • Previous experience in a data/analyst/sales operation’s role.
  • Exposure to and experience with AI tools, data modelling, and automation technologies.

What You’ll Gain

  • A dynamic learning and development journey with plenty of growth opportunities.
  • Involvement in shaping the future of Straumann’s commercial data, strategy and digital platform optimisation.
  • Hands-on experience, training and development with leading platforms like Salesforce, Pitcher, PowerBI and Alteryx.
  • Involvement in globally led initiatives, and exposure to stakeholders across our northern hub countries and business units.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or disability.

17622

Title: Data Analyst - AI Trainer
Description:
We are looking for a data analyst to join our team to train AI models. You will measure the progress of these AI chatbots, evaluate their logic, and solve problems to improve the quality of each model.

Find out more about the daily tasks, overall responsibilities, and required experience for this opportunity by scrolling down now.

In this role you will need to hold an expert level of mathematical reasoning- a completed or in progress Masters/PhD is preferred but not required. Other related fields include, but are not limited to: Data Science, Applied Math and/or Computer Science.

Benefits


This is a full-time or part-time REMOTE position
You’ll be able to choose which projects you want to work on
You can work on your own schedule
Projects are paid hourly starting at $40+ USD per hour, with bonuses on high-quality and high-volume work


Responsibilities


Give AI chatbots diverse and complex mathematics problems and evaluate their outputs
Evaluate the quality produced by AI models for correctness and performance


Qualifications


Fluency in English (native or bilingual level)
Detail-oriented
Proficient in data science, arithmetic, algebra, geometry, calculus, probability, statistics, and inductive/ deductive reasoning
A current, in progress, or completed Masters and/or PhD is preferred but not required


Note: Payment is made via PayPal. We will never ask for any money from you. PayPal will handle any currency conversions from USD. This job is only available to those in the US, UK, Canada, Australia, or New Zealand. Those located outside of these countries will not see work or assessments available on our site at this time.

#INDUKMA

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: From £29.81 per hour

Work Location: Remote

Title: Data Processor - Entry Level
Description:
Data Analyst

SOCOTEC UK is a market leader in environmental monitoring, testing, and compliance services. With over 30 years of experience, our Flow & Water Quality Monitoring division supports clients across the UK — ranging from blue-chip consultancies to major water companies — in reducing environmental risk and enhancing the quality of natural water environments.

As part of a globally trusted brand in infrastructure, environmental, and compliance solutions, we are passionate about innovation, sustainability, and delivering excellence to our customers.

The Role

We are recruiting for a Data Analyst to join our Flow & Water Quality Monitoring team. This role is essential in delivering accurate environmental data gathered from field-deployed flow monitors across the UK. These monitors capture water depth, velocity, and rainfall data, which are used to assess the performance of wastewater networks and river quality.

This is a hybrid role based in Leeds, with flexibility to work from home, client sites, or our office, depending on operational needs.

Key Responsibilities


Edit and analyse environmental data from flow monitoring and water quality systems
Identify patterns and anomalies in water flow, rainfall, and river data
Update and record equipment status, ensuring optimum data quality and performance
Communicate findings clearly with both internal teams and external clients
Deliver reports and support project stakeholders with accurate data-driven insights


Role Requirements


Strong attention to detail and data accuracy
Ability to manage multiple projects in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment
Excellent communication skills and a customer-focused mindset
Self-motivated with the ability to work independently and collaboratively
Proficient in Microsoft Office (Excel and Word), email, and web-based reporting tools
Ideally holds a degree in a relevant subject (e.g., Geography, Environmental Science, Hydrology) and/or industry experience (not essential – full training provided)
Must have the right to work in the UK


Why Join SOCOTEC?


Salary is £26,208PA with skill-based uplifts
25 days holiday + bank holidays
Company pension scheme
Employee perks & discount schemes
Structured training and career progression
Supportive and friendly team culture
Opportunities to contribute to environmental sustainability


This is a hybrid role primarily connected to our Leeds office. You’ll have the flexibility to work from home, client offices, or our Leeds base depending on your workload and meeting schedules. While regular travel to the office is required, daily attendance is not expected. Ideally, candidates should be within reasonable commuting distance to foster collaboration with on-site teams.

Building a safer and more sustainable world is the core mission we set out to achieve at SOCOTEC, it is at the heart of everything that we do. We are committed to acting as a key player in society, investing in innovative solutions to ensure social and environmental concerns are at the forefront of all of our business operations.

Title: Business Systems Analyst
Description:
🚀 We’re Hiring: Business Systems Analyst | Leeds (Hybrid)




Join our global team and help shape the systems that power our international operations.







💸Benefits & Perks




£40k–£55k base salary
Hybrid working – 3 days from home
Limitless paid training and certifications
Central Leeds office with on-site parking
8% employer pension contribution







What You’ll Be Doing




Act as the key as proxy between business and technical teams
Communicate with stakeholders to gather and clarify requirements
Analyse existing processes, identify gaps, and recommend improvements
Translate business needs into clear documentation, including user stories, workflows, and specifications
Support delivery teams throughout the development lifecycle to ensure solutions align with business goals







What We’re Looking For




Proven experience as a Business Systems Analyst in Agile environments
Strong understanding of end-to-end business processes and how systems support them
Confident communicator, skilled in stakeholder engagement at all levels
Comfortable working with cross-functional teams across global regions and time zones
Experience with tools like SQL or Power BI




🌍 Why Join Us?




You’ll be part of a collaborative, agile team driving digital transformation at scale. With global impact (Tech for good)







📩 Ready to make your move?




Apply now or drop us a message - we’re reviewing applications daily.

Title: Work from Home in United Kingdom
Description:
Ready to ditch the traditional 9-5 grind? If you are an English speaker living in United Kingdom join our community as a Media Search Analyst, set your own flexible schedule and complete engaging tasks with an innovative web-based evaluation tool!




What You’ll Do As A Media Search Analyst:

Assess diverse media categories: music, books, podcasts, videos, and more.
Evaluate app store content, ensuring search result accuracy and relevance.
Utilize your cultural knowledge and market expertise to validate query intent.




Why Join the AI Community?

Be part of the global and diverse TELUS Digital AI Community with 1M+ global contributors.
Support machine learning for world-leading brands with no prior professional experience.
Make use of your communication and analytical skills and enjoy extra income with great flexibility!




Basic Requirement and Assessment:

Full Professional Proficiency in English and being a resident on United Kingdom for the past year, aware of local media and trends.
Having an email address associated with an Apple ID and experience and know-how of Apple products.
Complete ID verification at your convenience within a specific timeframe and pass an open book qualification exam with guidelines provided.




Join us today and help revolutionize digital media content!

Title: Supply Chain Master Data Analyst
Description:
McDermott Laboratories Limited

At VIATRIS, we see healthcare not as it is but as it should be. We act courageously and are uniquely positioned to be a source of stability in a world of evolving healthcare needs.

Viatris empowers people worldwide to live healthier at every stage of life.

We do so via:

Access – Providing high quality trusted medicines regardless of geography or circumstance;

Leadership – Advancing sustainable operations and innovative solutions to improve patient health; and

Partnership – Leveraging our collective expertise to connect people to products and services.

Our global portfolio includes best-in-class, iconic brand-name products as well as global key brands; generics, including branded and complex generics; and other offerings across a wide range of therapeutic areas. We are committed to helping create healthier communities worldwide through education, outreach and better access to treatment.

For those driven to live their lives with purpose, Viatris helps employees realise their full potential by creating a collaborative culture that fosters courage and resilience. Viatris is more than just a place to work. This is a place to make a difference in the world.

The Role & What You Will Be Doing

Every day, we rise to the challenge to make a difference and here’s how the Supply Chain Master Data Analyst role will make an impact:


Support day-to-day master data management activities across a virtual global organization.
Oversee and coordinate the master data component of product flow changes.
Serve as functional expert for global supply chain master data.
Support the definition and implementation of robust business processes relating to the creation and maintenance of key master data objects spanning multiple functions, business units, geographies and systems.
Support data quality improvement initiatives with Global Supply Chain Management while partnering with the Data Quality Management team to develop relevant data quality KPIs, scorecards and reports.
Update and develop documentation and procedures with a focus on operational efficiencies through data quality and process standardization.
Developing continuous improvement mindset by constantly striving for ways to strengthen “end to end” process perspective for complex global supply chain processes.
Facilitate New Product Introductions by providing expertise and functional support as it relates to SAP material master setup, workflow management and issue escalation.
Support supply chain data workstreams within SAP roll-out projects (data cleansing, migration, user training, etc.).



About Your Skills & Experience

For this role, we’re looking for a candidate who has an effective combination of the following qualifications, skills and experiences:


Bachelor's degree in Sciences, Engineering, Information Technology or Commercial discipline.
Proven experience in the pharmaceutical/biologics/fine chemicals/FMCG industry, preferably in a supply chain, purchasing or data management related role.
Passion for managing information as a corporate resource, recognizing the business value of data.
Ability to work well with people at various levels and with different cultural backgrounds, cope with ambiguity and implement structure and clarity.
Demonstrated proficiency using MS Office programs (Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Visio).
Prior experience with SAP master data (MM, PTP, OTC), SQL or other reporting tools and advanced planning systems (e.g. APO, RapidResponse, JDE, etc.).



At Viatris, we are dedicated to building a truly diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t fully align with every requirement, we still encourage you to apply. You may just be the right candidate for this or other roles.

Why Viatris?

At Viatris, we offer competitive salaries, benefits and an inclusive environment where you can use your experiences, perspectives and skills to help make an impact on the lives of others. You will also have the opportunity to access excellent career progression opportunities and work-life balance initiatives.

Diversity & Inclusion at Viatris

At Viatris, diversity and inclusion are essential to our mission. The diversity we foster in all aspects of our business can be one of our greatest strengths in redefining healthcare not as it is, but as it should be. If you would like to know more about what diversity, equity and inclusion means to us, please visit https://www.viatris.com/en/Careers/Diversity-and-Inclusion

Sustainability at Viatris

Corporate social responsibility is fundamental to the Viatris mission. We work to advance responsible and sustainable operations and leverage our collective expertise to empower people to live healthier at every stage of life, recognizing that our actions affect the stakeholders and communities we serve. To learn more about our efforts, please visit https://www.viatris.com/en/about-us/corporate-responsibility

At Viatris, we offer competitive salaries, benefits and an inclusive environment where you can use your experiences, perspectives and skills to help make an impact on the lives of others.

Viatris is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Title: Analytics Business Partner
Description:
About

Analytics Business Partner

Competitive Salary + Benefits

Castleford - Hybrid

Days Only (Mon-Fri

gap technical are proud to be representing this global manufacturing business in their search for a Analytics Business Partner to work at their facility based near Castleford

Performance Objectives

You will define and implement robust analytical solutions to support data-driven decision-making across the business You will be partnering with business leaders to understand key business questions and objectives, providing insights and suggestions for improvement. You will develop and deliver intuitive, high-quality data visualization platforms for users, enabling self-service access to data, information, and insights. You will serve as the bridge between business stakeholders and offshore teams, translating business requirements into actionable tasks for the delivery team. You will work with offshore teams to manage the development of visualization tools, ensuring alignment with business needs and project timelines. You will support the continued rollout of new data and insight platforms, ensuring that UK leverages an optimal and cost-effective platform landscape. You will drive best practices in data visualization and analytics, encouraging their adoption across various user groups within business You will be partnering with the Commercial Excellence and Business Excellence teams to support UK's strategy execution and business improvement agenda through data-driven insights.Person Specification

Experienced in managing projects or leading initiatives, including coordinating with off-shore teams or external partners Able to deliver project timelines and requirements, ensuring transparency and clear communication with stakeholders Able to proactively identify business opportunities and challenges, using data to provide actionable recommendations Educated to degree level in a related field such as Data Science, Business Analytics, Information Systems, or another quantitative discipline would be an advantage Able to effectively partner with cross-functional teams, including local and off-shore groups, to align on objectives and deliver solutions Familiar with CRM (such as Veeva or Salesforce) and ERP systems, as well as experience working with analytics platforms that support self-service capabilities Proven experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or analytics roles within a commercial setting, ideally in the pharmaceutical or healthcare industry Demonstrated ability to translate business questions into data solutions, leveraging analytics to support decision-making Hands-on experience with data visualization and analytics platforms such as Qlik, Tableau, Power BI, or other relevant tools A track record of building, managing, and optimizing interactive dashboards and visualizations that drive business insights Knowledge of SQL, data warehousing, and ETL processes for data integration and preparation Understanding of commercial business functions, ideally within the pharmaceutical or healthcare industry, to connect data insights with business objectivesApply

Please send your CV via the Apply now option on the website

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Aiimi is seeking a Data Scientist to join our Aiimi Services division for an exciting project, collaborating directly with one of our clients.

At Aiimi, we're at the forefront of leveraging data-driven solutions to drive business growth and innovation. As a Data Scientist, you'll be at the heart of our mission, working alongside a talented team of professionals to tackle real-world challenges and drive actionable results for our client. This is a client-facing role with an expectation to be on-site in Bradford 2-3 days per week.


A Day in the Life of a Data Scientist:


Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify opportunities for leveraging data to drive business solutions
Collect, clean, and pre-process large datasets from various sources
Apply statistical analysis and machine learning techniques to extract meaningful insights and patterns
Develop predictive models and algorithms to support decision-making processes
Communicate findings and recommendations effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders



Requirements


Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or related fields
Good understanding of Azure, Databricks, SQL, Python and Power BI
Familiarity with data manipulation and visualisation tools
Knowledge of machine learning algorithms and techniques
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Effective communication and collaboration abilities



Benefits


Competitive starting salary
25 Days holiday (excluding bank holidays) - increasing by a day every 2 years
Flexible working
Promote training and personal development
Bi-annual company retreats

Title: Data Centre / Business Analyst (Energy Tracking)
Description:
Job Title: Data Centre / Business Analyst (Energy Tracking)

Location: Barnsley / Sheffield

Duration: 5-6 months Contract

Rate: £300 per day - PAYE Via Umbrella Only

Start Date: ASAP

About The Role

We are seeking a detail-oriented Data Centre / Business Analyst to support its Tech Net Zero Programme, focusing on energy tracking and optimisation across data centre operations. This role is critical in modelling energy usage, validating savings, and supporting the bank's sustainability goals.

Key Responsibilities


Develop and maintain energy consumption models for data centre operations.
Conduct quantitative analysis to forecast energy usage and identify efficiency opportunities.
Validate energy savings from implemented initiatives and report on performance metrics.
Collaborate with engineering, facilities, and sustainability teams to gather and analyse energy-related data.
Document processes, assumptions, and findings using Confluence and Visio.
Prepare detailed reports and dashboards in Excel to support decision-making and regulatory reporting.
Support the development of business cases for energy efficiency investments.


Required Skills & Experience


Strong background in energy modelling, data analysis, or sustainability analytics.
Proficiency in Excel for data manipulation, modelling, and visualisation.
Experience with Confluence and Visio for documentation and process mapping.
Ability to interpret technical data and translate it into actionable insights.
Excellent attention to detail and problem-solving skills.
Strong communication and stakeholder engagement abilities.


Desirable


Experience working in data centre environments or with facilities management teams.
Familiarity with energy efficiency standards or Net Zero frameworks.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Analytics/Data Engineer




📍 Location: Leeds – 2 days per week in the office

💰 Salary: Up to £80,000 per annum + Benefits




🚀 Help Build a Brand-New Data Function from the Ground Up

We’re working with a fast-growing, tech-enabled business that’s leading the way in its sector – and now they’re kicking off a huge transformation in how they use data.

This is your chance to join at the very beginning of a newly formed data team, helping to revamp and modernise how data is collected, processed, and used to drive smarter decisions across marketing, operations, and beyond.




As the first Data Engineer on the team, you'll be instrumental in designing the foundation of this transformation – working directly with senior stakeholders and technical leads to create scalable, future-proof data infrastructure.




🔍 What You’ll Be Doing

Building and maintaining data pipelines and architecture (Snowflake).
Connecting multiple data sources (Google Ads, Meta, Hubspot, etc.) into a centralised warehouse.
Supporting marketing and commercial teams with clean, actionable data.
Developing dashboards and reports that provide real business value.
Leading projects that make an immediate and measurable impact.
Helping define best practices and setting the tone for a growing data function.




🧠 What We’re Looking For

Experience designing and building data solutions using Snowflake or a similar cloud-based platform.
Strong SQL skills and experience in ETL/ELT pipelines.
Comfort working with digital marketing data and KPIs (CAC, LTV, conversion rates).
Familiarity with integrating data from platforms like Hubspot, Google Ads, Meta, etc.
Experience with BI/dashboarding tools and visualisation.
A pragmatic, problem-solving mindset with strong communication skills.

Nice to have:

Experience with dbt or Airflow, Python/R for analysis, or knowledge of A/B testing and marketing attribution.




🌟 Why This Role?

Greenfield opportunity – shape the tools, structure, and standards from day one.
High-impact – your work will directly influence strategic decisions.
Visibility – work closely with technical and commercial leadership.
Growth – as the team expands, your role and influence will grow too.
Purpose – help a mission-led business make smarter, more sustainable choices through better data.




💬 The Hiring Process

Intro Call – A short chat with me to make sure it’s the right fit for both sides.
Technical Interview – Meet the Lead Data Engineer to talk through the stack and your experience.
Final Interview – Speak with the senior leadership team to align on vision and impact.
Offer & Onboarding – We’ll get everything lined up to make your start smooth and successful.




📩 Interested or have questions? Contact Sam Stocks at SamStocks@SpectrumIT.co.uk or call 02380 765 304.

Title: Decision Science Analyst
Description:
DECISION SCIENCE ANALYST

£32,000 - £40,000

LEEDS




A well-established financial services organisation is hiring a Decision Science Analyst to support the development of predictive models across strategy, pricing, litigation, and forecasting. This is a hands-on analytics role, ideal for someone looking to apply statistical and machine learning techniques in a structured, data-driven environment.




THE COMPANY

A nationally recognised organisation with a reputation for using data to drive smarter decision-making and improve customer outcomes. With a strong presence in the UK and a focus on innovation, the company invests heavily in analytics, technology, and people. Known for its collaborative culture and progressive approach, it offers the chance to work on meaningful projects that shape key business decisions.




THE ROLE

As a Decision Science Analyst, your day-to-day responsibilities include but are not limited to:

Building predictive models using machine learning methods to improve forecasting and performance across key areas
Presenting findings and translating complex analysis into actionable insights for senior stakeholders
Identifying opportunities where data and analytics can drive better business outcomes
Supporting strategy development through the delivery of robust, scalable analytical tools
Collaborating with analysts to share best practices and enhance the team’s modelling capabilities




SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

Experience developing credit risk models using logistic regression or similar
Knowledge of machine learning approaches such as random forest and clustering
Proficient in Python
Educated to at least university level with a STEM degree




THE BENEFITS

£32,000+ base salary
Discretionary annual bonus
3% flexible benefits allowance
Life assurance
Access to wellbeing programme




HOW TO APPLY

Please register your interest by sending your CV to Dominic through the ‘Apply’ link

Show more
